Headlines: Israel to use anti-terror tech to counter coronavirus 'invisible enemy'
Description: Israel plans to use anti-terrorism tracking technology and a partial shutdown of its economy to minimize the risk of coronavirus transmission, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Saturday.

Headlines: U.S. Supreme Court to review scope of investor protection laws
Description: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday agreed to hear an appeal by a New York investment banker banned from the industry by the Securities and Exchange Commission in a case that could limit  the scope of those who can be held liable under laws protecting investors from securities fraud.

Headlines: Walgreens to close about 200 stores in United States
Description: Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc  said on Tuesday it plans to close about 200 U.S. stores and expects to record related pre-tax charges of between $1.9 billion and $2.4 billion.

Headlines: Germany's car watchdog sets Audi ultimatum to remove illegal diesel software: report
Description: Germany's motor vehicle authority (KBA) has told Volkswagen's premium brand Audi that it faces penalties for its failure to remove illegal software from diesel cars that can manipulate emissions levels, the Bild am Sonntag (BamS) newspaper reported.

Headlines: China says U.S. should tell airlines to change websites in Taiwan row
Description: China said on Friday that the United States should tell its airlines to change their websites to refer to self-ruled Taiwan as Chinese territory, after the United States said China had rejected requests for talks on the matter.

Headlines: Sulzer gets second license unblocking assets frozen by U.S. sanctions
Description: Swiss pump-maker Sulzer , which was last week freed from U.S. sanctions related to its Russian investor Viktor Vekselberg, said its business was "fully back to normal" after it received a second license fully unblocking its assets.

Headlines: Boeing technicians in South Carolina to vote on unionization: WSJ
Description: Some Boeing Co  workers at the planemaker' s factory in South Carolina will vote on union representation later this month, the Wall Street Journal reported https://on.wsj.com/2xav6Px on Monday, citing U.S. labor regulators.

Headlines: Trade-sensitive stocks on ropes as uncertainty weighs
Description: A week of worsening fears on Wall Street leading up to Washington's increase on tariffs on Chinese goods has taken a toll on stocks that rely heavily on global trade.

Headlines: Mattel disappoints with second-quarter results, announces job cuts
Description: Mattel Inc's  quarterly sales missed analysts' estimates on Wednesday, weighed down by the absence of a big movie tie-in in the quarter, while the liquidation of key customer Toys 'R' Us continued to hurt the U.S. toy maker.

Headlines: White House's Navarro says 'three strikes you're out' for ZTE
Description: Chinese technology company ZTE Corp will be "shut down" in the United States if it engages in one more bad activity, White House trade adviser Peter Navarro warned on Sunday.

Headlines: Homeland Security unveils new cyber security strategy amid threats
Description: The U.S. Department of Homeland Security on Tuesday unveiled a new national strategy for addressing the growing number of cyber security risks as it works to assess them and reduce vulnerabilities.

Headlines: Los Angeles union, joined by 'Pandemic Pig,' demands meatpacking plant closure
Description: The union representing workers at a meatpacking plant near Los Angeles where at least 153 employees have come down with COVID-19 called on Thursday for the plant's immediate closure, saying measures to control the outbreak were not working.

Headlines: Microsoft expands program for women returning to work
Description: Microsoft Corp  is expanding a program designed to increase its hiring of women seeking to rejoin the workforce, following a rash of complaints about sexual harassment and gender discrimination at the world's largest software company.

Headlines: OPEC has shown it can reach deal despite splits: Iran oil minister
Description: Iranian Oil Minister Bijan Zanganeh praised OPEC on Saturday for what he said was the producer group's ability to reach agreement despite intense internal political differences.

Headlines: U.S. companies adapt to 'endless' China tariffs
Description: U.S. manufacturers are accelerating their shift out of China, coming to terms with a new reality: the Trump administration's tariffs will not go away any time soon.

Headlines: Carrefour takes on French rivals in e-commerce with Google tie-up
Description: France's largest food retailer Carrefour  is teaming up with Google  to boost its online shopping business on its home turf, where rivals are also launching e-commerce offensives.

Headlines: U.S. stock futures fall after Saudi oil attacks
Description: U.S. stock futures fell 0.3% percent when trading resumed on Sunday, a day after attacks on Saudi oil facilities that risk disrupting global energy supplies.

Headlines: Investors query funding costs at a private Tesla
Description: Several Tesla Inc  shareholders have told Reuters they are concerned that the electric car maker will have to pay more to fund its growth if it becomes a private company and loses the ability to sell new shares to stock market investors.

Headlines: Oil crash pummels stocks and bond yields; dollar rises
Description: Stock markets around the world fell on Tuesday, as a collapse in oil prices brought on by oversupply and a shortage of storage further exposed the depth of economic damage from the coronavirus outbreak and sent investors looking for shelter.

Headlines: Thyssenkrupp to refine strategy only after new CEO is named, board tells workers
Description: Thyssenkrupp  will embark upon a planned refinement of its strategy only after a new chief executive is named, the company's management board wrote to employees on Friday.

Headlines: Barkindo confident OPEC+ can achieve oil market stability
Description: OPEC Secretary-General Mohammad Barkindo said on Monday he is confident that OPEC+ members will succeed in balancing oil production to guarantee market stability, Kuwait state news agency (KUNA) quoted him as saying.

Headlines: Judge asks Samsung heir to be humble at bribery trial
Description: A South Korean judge overseeing Samsung Group heir Jay Y. Lee's bribery trial told him on Friday to "humbly accept" whatever the outcome of the trial, which could result in a tougher sentence for the conglomerate's de-facto leader.

Headlines: Britain's Tesco pledges to end all-white board
Description: The chairman of Tesco , Britain's biggest retailer, on Friday pledged to end the all-white make-up of its board of directors.

Headlines: Stella McCartney to buy brand in full from Kering
Description: Kering and fashion label Stella McCartney said on Wednesday they had agreed to end their 17 year partnership, as the British designer behind the brand buys the 50 percent owned by the French luxury goods group.

Headlines: China, U.S. agree to hold more trade talks: Vice Premier Liu He
Description: China and the United States have agreed to hold more trade talks in Beijing, Vice Premier Liu He told Chinese state media in the United States on Friday, following a round of discussions in Washington which he described as "honest" and "constructive".

Headlines: Outgoing Credit Suisse manager Khan mulling offers: source
Description: Credit Suisse's  outgoing head of International Wealth Management Iqbal Khan is mulling several concrete offers from Swiss and international banks, a source familiar with Khan's thinking told Reuters on Tuesday.

Headlines: Coke eyes cannabis-infused drink market
Description: Coca-Cola Co  is closely watching the fast-growing marijuana drinks market for a possible entry that would expand the world's largest soft drink maker's ambitions further away from sugary sodas.

Headlines: Judge grants Amazon motion for pause in Microsoft's Pentagon contract work
Description: A U.S. judge on Thursday granted Amazon.com Inc's request to temporarily halt the U.S. Department of Defense and Microsoft Corp from moving forward on an up-to-$10 billion cloud computing deal that Amazon says reflected undue influence by President Donald Trump.

Headlines: Exclusive: Denmark's Nord Stream 2 route request could cause eight-month delay, cost 660 million euros - operator
Description: A Russian-led gas pipeline project across the Baltic Sea to Europe could be delayed by up to eight months and cost an extra 660 million euros ($740 million) due to hurdles in securing the necessary permits from Denmark, the pipeline operator has said.

Headlines: Renault ready to be part of a European batteries project: chairman
Description: Renault  is ready to be part of a European batteries project provided it makes economic sense to do so, the French carmaker's chairman said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Big Four told to ring fence auditing in Britain by June 2024
Description: PwC, Deloitte, KPMG and EY should ring fence auditing in Britain as a separate business by June 2024, their regulator said on Monday in one of the most sweeping changes to the sector globally to improve audit quality.

Headlines: U.S. to pay farmers up to $16 billion for trade war losses, South to benefit
Description: The U.S. government will pay American farmers hurt by the trade war with China between $15 and $150 per acre in an aid package totaling $16 billion, officials said on Thursday, with farmers in the South poised to see higher rates than in the Midwest.

Headlines: Few tears shed by French workers after Macron's Alstom dream is blocked
Description: After four decades on the production line at French trainmaker Alstom, Claude Gemino had little sympathy for Emmanuel Macron when Brussels scotched the French president's hopes of creating a European rail champion.

Headlines: Wall St. to open sharply lower as virus fears shut down California (March 5)
Description: (This March 5 story corrects Reuters instrument code for 10-year U.S. Treasury in paragraph 14 to "US10YT=RR", from "US10YR=RR")

Headlines: South Korea's latest big export: Jobless college graduates
Description: Cho Min-kyong boasts an engineering degree from one of South Korea's top universities, a school design award and a near-perfect score in her English proficiency test.

Headlines: Zuckerberg's snub of UK parliament 'astonishing' says lawmaker
Description: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg's decision not to answer questions from British lawmakers about a scandal over the firm's data is "astonishing", the parliamentary committee chief who invited him to attend said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Trump says trade talks with Canada going well
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday that trade talks with Canada were going well and that Ottawa very much wanted to make a deal.

Headlines: Graphic: U.S. banks enjoy benefits of a growing economy, lower taxes
Description: The U.S. banking industry is enjoying the benefits of a growing economy and lower taxes, if the double-digit profit growth posted by three major lenders on Friday is any indication.

Headlines: Volkswagen set to hire four banks for truck unit IPO: sources
Description: Volkswagen  is close to hiring Citigroup , Deutsche Bank , Goldman Sachs  and JP Morgan  to help with the potential stock market listing of its truck unit Traton, two people familiar with the matter told Reuters on Monday.

Headlines: Facebook faces small but symbolic UK fine over data protection breaches
Description: Britain's information regulator slapped Facebook with a small but symbolic fine for breaches of data protection law after millions of users' data was improperly accessed by consultancy Cambridge Analytica.

Headlines: Murdoch seeks permission to merge UK's Times and Sunday Times
Description: Rupert Murdoch's London-based newspapers The Times and Sunday Times have asked the British government for permission to share resources across both titles, a move that is barred under rules imposed when the media mogul bought both newspapers in 1981.

Headlines: U.S. aims to restart China trade talks, will not accept conditions on tariff use
Description: The United States hopes to re-launch trade talks with China after President Donald Trump and President Xi Jinping meet in Japan on Saturday, but Washington will not accept any conditions around the U.S. use of tariffs in the dispute, a senior administration official said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Airbnb's Belinda Johnson to step down as COO, join board
Description: Airbnb said on Friday Belinda Johnson will step down as chief operating officer in March and join the home rental company's board.

Headlines: Aston Martin posts deep quarterly loss as pandemic slams brakes on sales
Description: Aston Martin  posted a deep first-quarter loss after sales dropped by nearly a third due to the impact of the coronavirus crisis, though the luxury car maker said production of a crucial sport utility vehicle was on track.

Headlines: Germany's Osram urges investors to accept $4.8 billion AMS offer
Description: Osram  advised shareholders to accept a 4.3 billion euro ($4.8 billion) bid from AMS  on Monday, bringing the Austrian sensor specialist a step closer to taking over the bigger German lighting group.

Headlines: Vaccine makers face biggest medical manufacturing challenge in history
Description: Developing a COVID-19 vaccine in record time will be tough. Producing enough to end the pandemic will be the biggest medical manufacturing feat in history.

Headlines: Dish founder Ergen says he asked for senator's help on T-Mobile/Sprint
Description: Dish Network Corp Chairman Charlie Ergen testified on Wednesday that the Justice Department's antitrust chief advised him on June 10 to ask a senator to speak to the Federal Communications Commission about approving a key piece of the merger of wireless carriers T-Mobile and Sprint.

Headlines: Easier for China to face tariffs than bend to U.S. pressure
Description: China will acknowledge concessions made in any trade deal with the United States for the sake of stabilizing shaky relations, but is unlikely to yield to demands it alter its economic model even if faced with continued tariffs, many trade experts believe.

Headlines: Exclusive: Facing crackdown in Canada, drugmakers offered billions in price cuts
Description: Canadian pharmaceutical industry lobby groups, in an effort to head off a planned crackdown on prescription drug prices, offered to give up C$8.6 billion ($6.6 billion) in revenue over 10 years, freeze prices or reduce the cost of treating rare diseases, according to interviews and documents seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Italian PM welcomes Fiat Chrysler merger with PSA, says jobs crucial
Description: Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte welcomed the planned merger of Fiat Chrysler with its French rival PSA in an newspaper interview on Thursday, but said protecting jobs would be a top priority.

Headlines: Electric pickup, batteries included in GM's $7 billion pledge
Description: An all-electric pickup truck and an advanced battery system will be part of the $7 billion that General Motors Co has pledged to invest in the United States as parts of contract talks with the United Auto Workers.

Headlines: Graphic: America's economy and wages are cooling but not its female workforce
Description: Data released on Friday showed a return to strong job growth in the United States, allaying some fears the U.S. economy is on a short path to recession. But the data also reinforced the view that economic growth is slowing.

Headlines: Freenet still rejects Sunrise deal despite Liberty Global offer
Description: Freenet  still opposes Sunrise's  6.3 billion Swiss franc ($6.32 billion) deal to buy Liberty Global's  Swiss business, despite a new offer from the American seller to take part in the acquisition.

Headlines: Thyssenkrupp to propose Merz as chairwoman as year of turmoil ends
Description: Thyssenkrupp  will propose as chairwoman Martina Merz, whose background includes roles at Volvo , Bosch [ROBG.UL] and Lufthansa , the German company said, as it prepares to spin off its capital goods units.

Headlines: U.S., Canada and Mexico sign agreement - again - to replace NAFTA
Description: Top officials from Canada, Mexico and the United States signed a fresh overhaul of a quarter-century-old trade pact on Tuesday that aims to improve enforcement of worker rights and hold down prices for biologic drugs by eliminating a patent provision.

Headlines: Germany's beleaguered Wirecard to proceed with business after insolvency
Description: Wirecard, the German scandal-hit payments company,  said on Saturday it would proceed with business activities after filing for insolvency and expects a provisional administrator to be appointed by judicial authorities shortly.

Headlines: Eve-of-Davos survey shows people place trust in companies over governments
Description: People around the world place much more trust in their companies than their political leaders, according to a major survey that suggests a mood of uncertainty and pessimism on the eve of the World Economic Forum in Davos.

Headlines: Trump says he had to 'take China on,' regardless of short-term impact on U.S. economy
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday he had to confront China over trade even if it caused short-term harm to the U.S. economy because Beijing had been cheating Washington for decades.

Headlines: Germany bans Wirecard 'shorting' as prosecutors probe FT journalist
Description: Germany's financial watchdog has banned "short" selling of Wirecard shares due to volatility in the payments firm's stock following reports in the Financial Times which are now the subject of an investigation by German authorities.

Headlines: U.S. House passes $500 billion coronavirus bill in latest relief package
Description: The U.S. House of Representatives overwhelmingly approved a $484 billion coronavirus relief bill on Thursday, funding small businesses and hospitals and pushing the total spending response to the crisis to an unprecedented near $3 trillion.

Headlines: Brazil appeals judge lifts temporary arrest of former billionaire Eike Batista
Description: A Brazilian appeals court judge ordered on Saturday the release of Eike Batista, the mining and oil magnate who was once Brazil's richest man, revoking a temporary prison order that would expire on Monday.

Headlines: U.S. labor board judge rejects McDonald's bid to settle franchisees' case
Description: A judge with a U.S. labor agency on Tuesday rejected McDonald's Corp's  proposed settlement of a major case on whether the fast-food company is accountable for alleged labor law violations by franchisees across the country.

Headlines: China's Xiaomi raises $4.72 billion after pricing HK IPO at bottom of range: sources
Description: HONG KONG (Reuters/IFR) - China's Xiaomi Corp  priced its Hong Kong initial public offering (IPO) at the bottom of an indicative range, raising $4.72 billion in the world's biggest tech float in four years, people close to the transaction said on Friday.

Headlines: Britain's Sainsbury's warns of $623 million coronavirus hit to profit
Description: British supermarket group Sainsbury's  warned the impact of the coronavirus pandemic on current year profit could be over 500 million pounds ($623 million) and said decisions on paying dividends to shareholders would be deferred.

Headlines: Exclusive: Saudi Arabia's PIF eyes stake in U.S. movie studio Legendary - sources
Description: Saudi Arabia's sovereign wealth fund PIF is exploring the acquisition of up to a $700 million stake in Legendary Entertainment, the U.S. movie studio behind films such as "Jurassic World" and "Interstellar", according to people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: A California cafe reopens with a payroll loan, but the future unclear
Description: Chris and Amy Hillyard opened their Oakland, California restaurant late last month for the first time since mid-March, thanks in large part to a government loan aimed at tiding over small firms during the worst of the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: EU's Vestager vows to continue tax fight after Apple setback
Description: EU antitrust chief Margrethe Vestager vowed on Wednesday to continue her fight against tax measures used by multinationals despite a setback dealt by Europe's second-top court, which earlier scrapped her 13 billion euro tax order to Apple.

Headlines: Indonesia readying measures to stabilize financial markets - finance minister
Description: Indonesia Finance Minister Sri Mulyani Indrawati said on Tuesday that authorities are prepared to use all measures they implemented during the 2008 global financial crisis to stabilize financial markets.

Headlines: Detroit's near future based on SUVs, not EVs, production plans show
Description: General Motors Co  and Ford Motor Co  have widely touted their commitment to emission-free electric cars, but their production plans show a growing reliance on ever-larger gas-powered vehicles.

Headlines: T-Mobile, Sprint lobby regulators to win U.S. approval for tie-up
Description: Senior executives at T-Mobile US Inc and Sprint Corp made the case to U.S. officials in Washington last week that they should approve a planned tie-up between the two wireless companies, arguing a combined firm would have incentives to "aggressively lower prices."

Headlines: Express Scripts covers Amgen, Lilly migraine drugs, excludes Teva
Description: Express Scripts Holding Co, one of the largest U.S. prescription benefits managers, will cover new migraine drugs from Eli Lilly and Amgen Inc, but exclude a rival medication from Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd after price negotiations with all three manufacturers.

Headlines: Former United Auto Workers official gets 15 months in labor corruption case
Description: A federal judge in Detroit on Monday sentenced the former United Auto Workers union vice president in charge of relations with Fiat Chrysler to 15 months in federal prison for misusing funds intended for worker training to pay for luxury travel, golf, liquor and parties for himself and other union officials.

Headlines: Exclusive: Biofuels company proposes to buy fire-damaged Philadelphia refinery
Description: A biofuels producer said on Thursday it is proposing to acquire the fire-damaged Philadelphia Energy Solutions refinery and convert it to make renewable diesel and jet fuels.

Headlines: EU justice chief says will boost data transfers tool after court setback
Description: The European Commission will closely study a top EU court ruling striking down an EU-U.S. data transfer pact and consider how to boost such transfers with its U.S. counterpart, EU Justice Chief Didier Reynders said on Thursday.

Headlines: Factbox: Tariff wars - duties imposed by Trump and U.S. trading partners
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump has rattled the world trade order by imposing unilateral tariffs to combat what he calls unfair trade practices by China, the European Union and other major trading partners of the United States.

Headlines: Lyft's stock slide casts long shadow on Uber's IPO
Description: Uber Technologies Inc may face a cooler reception from investors than expected when it prices its initial public offering next month since smaller U.S. ride-hailing rival Lyft Inc's aggressive stock launch and subsequent fall.

Headlines: Bayer set to close Monsanto takeover on Thursday: report
Description: Bayer's planned $62.5 billion takeover of seeds maker Monsanto is set to close on Thursday, Germany's Frankfurter Allgemeine Sonntags Zeitung reported.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco aims to buy Reliance stake, reports lower earnings
Description: Saudi Aramco is planning a multibillion dollar investment in India's Reliance Industries  as the energy giant diversifies its oil business, where weaker prices cut its first-half profit by 12%.

Headlines: IEA sees global oil supply tightening more quickly in 2019
Description: The global oil market could move into deficit sooner than expected thanks to OPEC's output agreement with Russia and to Canada's decision to cut supply, the International Energy Agency said on Thursday.

Headlines: Airlines appear to come up short in bid to win cash grants in rescue package
Description: A last-ditch effort by the chief executives of major U.S. airlines to try to win cash grants to weather the coronavirus crisis looked to be unsuccessful, four congressional aides and airline officials said late Saturday.

Headlines: Oil up 1 percent as market focuses on supply risks
Description: Oil prices rose 1 percent on Tuesday, as fighting in Libya and falling Venezuelan and Iranian exports raised concerns over tightening global supply, but uncertainty surrounding an OPEC-led production cut limited gains.

Headlines: Daimler: Mercedes sells more than 600 Maybach models a month in China
Description: Daimler's China chief said sales rose 3 percent in the first quarter, defying an overall downturn in demand in the world's biggest car market, thanks to robust demand for ultra luxury vehicles like the Mercedes S-Class Maybach.

Headlines: China to push medical factories to resume, expand production
Description: The Chinese government will push medical products factories to resume or expand production, state television said on Tuesday after a meeting chaired by Premier Li Keqiang on the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Mexico will seek deal with Canada if NAFTA talks fail: Lopez Obrador
Description: Mexico's incoming government will pursue a bilateral deal with Canada if talks to overhaul the North American Free Trade Agreement falter, Mexican president-elect Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said on Friday.

Headlines: The half a trillion dollar British money transfusion that may not be enough
Description: It took Lucio and Meera Santoro 35 years to build up their London design company and just a week to watch it fall apart.

Headlines: Sweet seats and candy canes: Inside Fiat Chrysler's Toledo turnaround
Description: Lots of workplaces have a hot seat. At the Jeep assembly plant in Toledo, Ohio, there is a "sweet seat."

Headlines: Police search offices of Deutsche Bank board members
Description: Police have searched the offices of all the members of Deutsche Bank's  board as part of an investigation into money laundering allegations linked to the Panama Papers, a source told Reuters on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. weekly jobless claims blow past six million as coronavirus lockdowns spread
Description: The number of Americans filing claims for unemployment benefits shot to a record high of more than 6 million last week as more jurisdictions enforced stay-at-home measures to curb the coronavirus pandemic, which economists say has pushed the economy into recession.

Headlines: Airbus A380: from European dream to white elephant
Description: Loved by passengers, feared by accountants, the world's largest airliner has run out of runway after Airbus decided to close A380 production after 12 years in service due to weak sales.

Headlines: Campbell, Third Point battle heats up, no concessions on the table
Description: Activist investor Daniel Loeb and Campbell Soup Co  hardened their positions in the battle over the soup maker's future on Thursday as the hedge fund manager tried to woo retail shareholders and the company's interim chief executive told Reuters that Loeb had left no room for compromise.

Headlines: Shell open to carmaker partners in EV charging expansion
Description: Shell is open to partnerships with carmakers to expand electric vehicle (EV) charging beyond its petrol stations, one of the oil major's executives said on Friday.

Headlines: Walmart faces major India test over unit Flipkart's legal spat with startup
Description: An Indian startup's legal challenge against a Walmart unit claiming losses caused by sharp discounting of its products is winning support from other online sellers, in what is shaping as a key test of how the giant retailer operates in the country.

Headlines: Dow posts biggest one-day drop since October as recession fears take hold
Description: Wall Street sold off sharply on Wednesday as recession fears gripped the market after the U.S. Treasury yield curve temporarily inverted for the first time in 12 years.

Headlines: Amazon's gloomy holiday forecast misses estimates, shares fall 7%
Description: Amazon.com Inc on Thursday forecast revenue and profit for the holiday quarter below expectations, as it faces fierce competition and rising costs from its plan to speed up delivery times globally.

Headlines: German cartel office to take Facebook case to High Court
Description: The German cartel office will appeal a regional court's decision to suspend restrictions it had imposed on Facebook's   data collection practices to the Federal Court of Justice, Germany's highest court.

Headlines: Tesla begins sales of cheapest yet Model 3 car variant in China
Description: U.S. electric vehicle (EV) maker Tesla Inc on Friday said it has started taking orders in China for a lower-priced version of its Model 3 car, as it seeks to expand its lineup and boost sales in the world's biggest EV market.

Headlines: White House adviser says China-U.S. trade deal still possible
Description: White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Tuesday that U.S. President Donald Trump will have a dinner meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping at the upcoming G20 gathering in Argentina and also held open the possibility that the two countries would reach a trade deal.

Headlines: Exxon, New York prosecutors face off in climate change fraud trial
Description: A lawyer for New York's attorney general on Tuesday told a state judge Exxon Mobil Corp  used two sets of books to hide the true cost of climate change regulations from investors, while an attorney for the oil major assailed the claims as false and politically motivated.

Headlines: Germany says EU should revise, delay digital tax plan
Description: Germany's Finance Minister Olaf Scholz said on Tuesday the European Commission should revise its plan for a EU-wide tax on large digital companies and stressed the new levy should be applied only if there is no global deal by the summer of 2020.

Headlines: Higher dose of Gilead-Galapagos drug meets ulcerative colitis study goals
Description: Gilead Sciences Inc  and partner Galapagos NV  said on Wednesday only a higher dose of their experimental drug filgotinib showed greater effectiveness than placebo in a pivotal study testing it in ulcerative colitis patients.

Headlines: What you need to know about the coronavirus right now
Description: Here's what you need to know about the coronavirus right now:

Headlines: 'W-shaped' recovery may be too optimistic, Fed's Powell suggests
Description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell has sketched out an altogether bumpier ride for the U.S. economy than many are predicting - one that sees business activity stop and start for months to come, until an effective treatment or vaccine for the novel coronavirus can be found.

Headlines: Uber to focus on core rides, delivery business as it cuts 23% of workforce
Description: Uber Technologies Inc  will concentrate on its core businesses in ride-hailing and food delivery and cut 23% of its workforce in an attempt to become profitable despite the coronavirus pandemic, Chief Executive Officer Dara Khosrowshahi said in an email to employees on Monday.

Headlines: Many verified Twitter accounts able to post again after hacking
Description: Twitter  users with verified accounts started to be able to send tweets again at around 8:30 pm EDT, after the company had silenced some of its highest-profile users in response to an hours-long security incident.

Headlines: U.S. Fed revives commercial paper facility to boost lending
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve said on Tuesday it would reinstate a funding facility used during the 2008 financial crisis to get credit directly to businesses and households as fears over a liquidity crunch due to the coronavirus have grown in recent days.

Headlines: Insurer Anthem profit beats estimates on lower patient costs
Description: Anthem Inc  reported a better-than-expected profit on Wednesday, driven by higher premiums and lower patient medical costs even as fewer people enrolled in its insurance plans.

Headlines: City Council aims to make New York first U.S. city to cap Uber, others
Description: New York City is moving toward becoming the first major U.S. municipality to cap ride-sharing services, sparking a tsunami of protest on Friday from Uber [UBER.UL] and others, which warned that those living in far-flung neighborhoods will suffer most.

Headlines: New U.S. threat of sanctions are bad for global economy - Le Maire
Description: New tariff threats by the United States on certain French products are bad for the global economy, and France is counting upon the solidarity of its European partners as it looks to challenge the move, the French finance minister said.

Headlines: U.S. says tool chests from China, Vietnam are being dumped in U.S. market
Description: The U.S. Commerce Department said on Thursday it had determined that tool chests and cabinets made in China and Vietnam were being dumped in the U.S. market, and announced prospective import duties on the products ranging up to 327 percent.

Headlines: Take Five: World stocks' 2020 rollercoaster ride rumbles on
Description: World stocks have been on a rollercoaster ride in the first half of 2020. Having slumped 35% from Feb. 20 to March 23, they are now within 10% of February's record highs thanks to lashings of fiscal stimulus, interest rates slashed to 0% or below in most major economies, and massive amounts of QE. Borrowing costs for high-grade U.S. companies have in fact fallen below January levels.

Headlines: Sri Lanka imposes curfew as South Asia steps up coronavirus battle
Description: Sri Lanka imposed a nationwide weekend curfew on Friday as South Asian countries escalated efforts to check the spread of coronavirus across the densely populated region of 1.9 billion people.

Headlines: White House handling of U.S.-Japan trade deal angers Democrats
Description: House Democrats on Wednesday blasted the Trump administration for not consulting sufficiently with Congress while negotiating a mini trade deal with Japan, failing to provide details about it and refusing to testify at a congressional hearing.

Headlines: Walmart may launch IPO for Flipkart in as early as four years
Description: Walmart Inc  said on Saturday in a filing with a U.S. regulator that it may take India's Flipkart public in as early as four years, detailing for the first time a potential listing timeline for Walmart's largest-ever acquisition.

Headlines: USTR Lighthizer denies he said China tariffs on hold
Description: U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer did not tell business executives that another round of tariffs on Chinese imports is on hold, a USTR spokesperson said on Thursday, denying a report in the Financial Times.

Headlines: Citgo Petroleum to dismiss workers in Aruba over U.S. sanctions: prime minister
Description: A Citgo Petroleum Corp refining unit in Aruba plans to dismiss workers following sanctions imposed by the United States on Venezuela's state-run PDVSA, the parent company of the U.S. refining firm, the island's prime minister said on Friday.

Headlines: Barclays activist Bramson renews call to join the board
Description: Activist Edward Bramson on Monday made a renewed plea for Barclays' investors to give him a seat on the bank's board, as the war of words between his Sherborne Investors fund and the lender's management ratchets up.

Headlines: Korean Air chairman steps down as CEO of budget affiliate Jin Air
Description: Korean Air Lines  Chairman Cho Yang-ho has stepped down from his post of co-chief executive at budget affiliate Jin Air , amid growing pressure on the members of the airline giant's controlling family to stay away from management.

Headlines: Carmaker Bentley to suspend production for four weeks over coronavirus
Description: Bentley will stop car production at its British factory from the end of Friday for four weeks over the coronavirus outbreak, one of the final automakers in Britain to announce such plans.

Headlines: Exclusive: Nissan expands Ghosn probe to include Renault alliance - sources
Description: Nissan's investigation into alleged misconduct by Chairman Carlos Ghosn is expanding to include Renault-Nissan finances, sources told Reuters - in a further sign that Nissan may seek to loosen its French parent's hold on their global carmaking alliance.

Headlines: Nvidia full-year sales outlook tops analyst views; shares rise
Description: Chip maker Nvidia Corp on Thursday forecast sales for its current fiscal year that topped Wall Street expectations, sending its shares up 8 percent in late trading.

Headlines: China central bank signals more policy measures to support virus-ravaged economy
Description: China's central bank said on Sunday it will step up counter-cyclical adjustments to support the economy and make monetary policy more flexible to fend off financial risks.

Headlines: Air France-KLM loss gives first taste of coronavirus impact
Description: Two weeks of coronavirus shutdown were enough to hit Air France-KLM  with an 815 million-euro ($880 million) first-quarter operating loss, the airline group said on Thursday - predicting demand could take "several years" to recover.

Headlines: China to extend preferential taxes for integrated circuit firms
Description: China will extend preferential taxes for producers of integrated circuits and software companies, the cabinet said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Tesla rolls out insurance in California
Description: Tesla Inc  said on Wednesday it was launching an insurance service designed to give drivers in California, its biggest market, lower rates because of safety features on its electric vehicles.

Headlines: China's iron ore imports rise in July despite pollution curbs
Description: China's iron ore imports rebounded in July, customs data showed on Wednesday, buoyed by record steel production and strong margins as official measures to cut pollution curb the output of cheaper products from small mills.

Headlines: Wirecard debt that facilitated SoftBank investment put up for auction
Description: Convertible bonds that were part of a complex transaction that allowed Japan's SoftBank Group  to buy a stake in now-collapsed payments company Wirecard and then de-risk the transaction have been put up for sale in an auction.

Headlines: As Fed reiterates rate pause, forecasts likely to be blown off course
Description: Friday's booming U.S. jobs report should give the Federal Reserve all it needs to stick to its plan not to cut interest rates further in the near future, so when U.S. central bankers meet this week, most of the focus will be on their outlook for next year and beyond.

Headlines: Wall Street retreats from record on trade cloudiness
Description: U.S. stocks fell on Thursday as conflicting tones surrounding a possible trade deal between the United States and China eclipsed strong earnings reports from Apple and Facebook.

Headlines: Internet users help Charter beat revenue estimates
Description: Charter Communications Inc topped quarterly revenue  estimates on Thursday, as the cable operator attracted more customers for its internet services, offsetting a drop in video subscribers.

Headlines: Fed holds off on permanent lending tool as policymakers mull details
Description: The Federal Reserve will hold off deciding whether to introduce a permanent lending facility aimed at staving off the money market ructions seen earlier this fall even as a growing number of policymakers warm to the idea, several sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Boeing omitted safeguards on 737 MAX that were used on military jet: WSJ
Description: Boeing Co  engineers working on the 737 MAX passenger plane's flight-control system omitted safeguards included in an earlier version of the system used on a military tanker jet, The Wall Street Journal reported on Sunday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Nasdaq goes bear as momentum plays run out of gas
Description: Investors are finding out that it is not all puppies and unicorns when it comes to momentum plays, in a painful lesson as the Nasdaq tumbles to the edge of a bear market.

Headlines: FCC considers ending merger ban among broadcast networks
Description: The Federal Communications Commission on Wednesday voted to open a new review of U.S. media ownership rules and seek comments on whether the government should end a prohibition on mergers among the four largest broadcast networks.

Headlines: Citi sees stronger China wealthy client base in 2019 despite economy slowing
Description: Citigroup expects its China wealth management client base to grow faster in 2019 than last year, at more than 30 percent, the bank's country chief said, despite the world's second-largest economy slowing and feeling the pain of a trade war.

Headlines: Hyundai targets EV sales of over half a million by 2025, posts disappointing third-quarter
Description: South Korea's Hyundai Motor pledged to boost sales of electric vehicles (EV) to over half a million by 2025 as part of a bid to focus on new technologies and catch up with rivals, but some analysts saw the target as conservative and warned of the costs.

Headlines: Factbox: International tax faces biggest shake-up in decades under OECD plan
Description: The Organisation for Economic Cooperation (OECD) has proposed overhauling rules for taxing cross-border corporate income to bring them into line with the digital age.

Headlines: U.S. trade groups urge China to increase purchases of U.S. goods, services
Description: The U.S. Chamber of Commerce and over 40 trade associations on Monday urged top American and Chinese officials to redouble efforts to implement a Phase 1 trade agreement signed by the world's two largest economies in January despite pandemic-related strains.

Headlines: Coronavirus relief deal for U.S. small businesses may come Monday, Trump says
Description: U.S. Democrats and Republicans are near agreement on extra money to help small businesses hurt by the coronavirus pandemic and could seal a deal as early as Monday, President Donald Trump said on Sunday.

Headlines: Russian fund CEO says Saudi economic drive important for world
Description: Saudi Arabia's economic transformation plan is important for the world, the chief executive of the Russian sovereign wealth fund Russian Direct Investment Fund (RDIF) said on Tuesday.

Headlines: China's industrial profits shrink most since late 2011 as economy cools
Description: China's industrial firms posted their worst slump in profits  since late 2011 in the first two months of this year, data showed on Wednesday, as increasing strains on the economy in the face of slowing demand at home and abroad took a toll on businesses.

Headlines: Pence says U.S. to maintain 'strong stand' on TikTok
Description: U.S. Vice President Mike Pence said on Tuesday the United States would "continue to take a strong stand" regarding Chinese entities that threaten U.S. security, including potentially the social media app TikTok.

Headlines: Samsonite's shares set to rise 7.8 percent as CEO steps down
Description: Shares of Samsonite International  were set to rise 7.8 percent in resumed trade on Friday after it said it had replaced its chief executive following a short-seller attack that caused the firm's shares to plunge.

Headlines: 'Demand destruction' - analysts race to lower outlooks for oil
Description: Traders and analysts are struggling to revise down their forecasts for oil demand fast enough, as government lockdowns to contain the coronavirus outbreak have rapidly cut fuel consumption.

Headlines: Exclusive: S&P Global cuts top sovereign analysts as part of broader cull
Description: The world's biggest credit ratings agency S&P Global has cut more than five of its most senior sovereign analysts as part of a broader reduction of in excess of 100 staff, a source told Reuters.

Headlines: Global stocks climb as currency war fears ease
Description: World stock markets inched higher on Tuesday, propelled by solid gains on Wall Street, after China's central bank stepped in to stabilize the yuan, soothing fears that a protracted trade spat between the United States and China would spill over into a currency war.

Headlines: G20 agriculture ministers had 'frank discussion' about protectionism: Germany
Description: The G20 agriculture ministers gathered in Buenos Aires this weekend had a "frank discussion" about the fact that they do not want unilateral protectionist measures, German Agriculture Minister Julia Klockner told reporters on Saturday.

Headlines: Glenview backs Cigna-Express Scripts deal after Icahn criticism
Description: Hedge fund Glenview Capital Management on Thursday backed health insurer Cigna Corp's  deal to buy pharmacy benefit manager Express Scripts  in the face of stiff opposition from activist investor Carl Icahn ahead of a shareholder vote.

Headlines: Oil rebounds from steep sell-off as OPEC, partners discuss supply cut
Description: Oil rose about 1 percent on Wednesday, recouping some of the previous session's heavy sell-off, on growing prospects that the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries and allied producers would cut output at a meeting next month to prop up prices.

Headlines: Global airlines chief warns on spiraling delays to Boeing 737 MAX
Description: Airlines face significant problems if the return to service of the Boeing 737 MAX drags on for months longer, the head of the International Air Transport Association said on Wednesday.

Headlines: UBS boss Ermotti fears Europe's banks 'too small to survive'
Description: UBS Group  Chief Executive Sergio Ermotti on Wednesday said banking consolidation, especially in Europe, is unavoidable in coming years as institutions must achieve critical mass to remain competitive.

Headlines: Exclusive: Google appears to have leveraged Android dominance - India watchdog
Description: Google  appears to have misused its dominant position in India and reduced the ability of device manufacturers to opt for alternate versions of its Android mobile operating system, Indian officials found before ordering a wider probe in an antitrust case.

Headlines: Papa John's gives upbeat full-year forecast after rocky 2018, shares rise
Description: Papa John's International Inc forecast better-than-feared North American same-store sales on Tuesday, as the U.S. pizza chain's investments on rebranding following its months-long spat with founder John Schnatter pay off.

Headlines: Exclusive: NYC Transit stops Bombardier deliveries until problems fixed
Description: New York City Transit will stop taking new train car deliveries from Bombardier Inc  until it fixes existing cars, as the Canadian aerospace and transportation company faces pressure to improve performance at its rail unit, its largest division by revenues.

Headlines: IBM announces new hiring in France as CEOs meet Macron
Description: IBM  announced new recruitment in France before a meeting between President Emmanuel Macron and the bosses of IBM and Microsoft .

Headlines: Wall Street jumps as Powell hints interest rate hikes may taper off
Description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell boosted U.S. stock markets on Wednesday when he said the policy rate is now "just below" estimates of a level that neither brakes nor boosts a healthy economy, comments that many took as signaling the Fed's three-year tightening cycle is drawing to a close.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco restructures non-oil assets ahead of IPO: sources
Description: Saudi Aramco has created a subsidiary to house its multibillion-dollar pension fund and could spin off its aviation division, sources said, as it restructures some assets not related to oil and gas ahead of its planned initial public offering (IPO).

Headlines: Court strikes down ruling forcing Volkswagen to pay Czech customers damages: report
Description: The Prague City Court ruled on Thursday to invalidate an order for Volkswagen  to pay Czech customers more than 500 million crowns ($21.27 million) in damages for the Dieselgate affair, news website www.idnes.cz reported.

Headlines: Toyota, Honda plan to attack costs to free up cash for new tech
Description: Two top Japanese automakers said they planned to tighten their belts in the years ahead to free up cash to develop electric cars and ride-sharing services, underscoring the hard task ahead as traditional automakers face a rapidly changing industry.

Headlines: Wells Fargo in process of refunding customers for add-on products: WSJ
Description: Wells Fargo & Co  is in the process of refunding millions of dollars to customers for adding services to their accounts without their full understanding, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday, citing sources.

Headlines: Societe Generale ready to pay up to $1 billion to end U.S. probes: Bloomberg
Description: French bank Societe Generale SA  is nearing a deal to pay up to $1 billion to resolve two U.S. investigations, Bloomberg reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Trade jitters and tech woes weigh on S&P, Nasdaq
Description: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq declined on Thursday as the possibility of more U.S. tariffs on Chinese imports loomed, while tech stocks stumbled, led by chipmakers and concerns about increased regulation of social media companies.

Headlines: Lazard axes 200 jobs after business review
Description: Investment bank Lazard  has axed about 200 employees after a review of its business, Chief Financial Officer Evan Russo said on Thursday.

Headlines: Fares show declines as airlines brace for tough recovery: Skytra
Description: Air fares have fallen as much as 30% since the start of the year in North America and Europe, according to the first of a new series of industry data, while stabilising on a smaller decline in Asia where some coronavirus lockdowns are being eased.

Headlines: China's Tencent Music reports passive stake in Warner Music
Description: China's Tencent Music Entertainment Group on Friday reported a 5.2% passive stake in Class A shares of Warner Music Group Corp, about a week after the world's third-largest recording label's debut on the Nasdaq.

Headlines: Fish, financial services to be part of final EU-Britain trade deal: EU Commission head
Description: An agreement on fisheries, financial services, trade in goods and energy all have to be agreed before the European Union can sign a deal regulating its post-Brexit future relationship with Britain, the head of the European Commission said on Monday.

Headlines: Flybe in talks with Virgin Atlantic for possible sale
Description: Flybe Group Plc  is in talks for a possible sale to Virgin Atlantic Airways Ltd, the British regional airline said on Friday, as it grapples with falling demand, higher fuel costs and a weak British pound.

Headlines: Surprise U.S. unemployment rate drop leaves out blacks, Asians
Description: The U.S. unemployment rate dropped unexpectedly in May, but not all workers benefited equally as joblessness among African Americans and Asians rose, signaling some minorities face a longer recovery as the economy slowly rebounds from the coronavirus shutdowns.

Headlines: Qualcomm to appeal record South Korean anti-trust fine
Description: Qualcomm  said it would appeal a South Korean court decision on Wednesday to uphold a record $873 million fine against the U.S. chip giant for unfair business practices related to patent licensing and modem chip sales.

Headlines: S&P 500 bull market now arguably the oldest ever
Description: The S&P 500's  bull market turned 3,453 days old on Wednesday, making it the longest such streak in history, according to some investors' definition.

Headlines: U.S. government advises workers on staving off creditors amid shutdown
Description: As a partial shutdown of the U.S. government stretched into its sixth day, the agency that oversees the federal workforce offered advice on staving off creditors to the estimated 800,000 employees who could be affected by a lapse in pay.

Headlines: Former Pemex boss arrives back in Mexico for graft trial, enters hospital
Description: A former boss of Mexico's state oil company Petroleos Mexicanos facing corruption charges that could envelop leaders of the last government was taken to a hospital early on Friday shortly after his overnight extradition to Mexico from Spain.

Headlines: EU throws new rule book at Google, tech giants in competition search
Description: Exasperated by its failure to loosen Google's market grip, despite more than $8 billion in fines, the European Union is lining up new rules to level the playing field for rivals.

Headlines: Brazil's Bolsonaro uses Davos speech to appeal to big business
Description: Brazil's new right-wing President Jair Bolsonaro threw out the welcome mat for big business and foreign investors on Tuesday, telling a summit of CEOs in Davos that his government would make the country one of the top 50 in which to do business.

Headlines: Airbnb says profitable for two straight years amid IPO talks
Description: Home-renting company Airbnb Inc said on Tuesday it was profitable on an adjusted basis for the second year in a row,  ahead of a widely anticipated initial public offering this year.

Headlines: China's BYD recalls cars with Takata airbag inflators: state media
Description: Chinese electric vehicle maker BYD Co Ltd  has announced a recall of over 10,000 cars equipped with accident-prone Takata airbag inflators, state news agency Xinhua reported on Sunday.

Headlines: Vegan burger maker Beyond Meat raises price range in upsized IPO
Description: (This April 30 story corrects first paragraph to say company will debut on Thursday, not Wednesday.)

Headlines: Asian business confidence wallows near three-year low on trade worries: Thomson Reuters/INSEAD
Description: A very cautious optimism remains among Asian companies in the fourth quarter as they wait to see whether there will be any breakthrough in a trade dispute between the United States and China, a Thomson Reuters/INSEAD survey showed.

Headlines: Tesla upgrades Model S, X cars, brings backs cheaper variants
Description: Tesla Inc, struggling with delay in delivery of its higher-priced Model S and X luxury cars, said on Tuesday it will bring back lower-priced options for those cars and roll out upgrades to improve their driving range and re-charging speed.

Headlines: Ex-Nissan boss Ghosn to ask for monitored visit with spouse: lawyer
Description: Lawyers for Carlos Ghosn will ask a Japanese court to allow the former Nissan Motor boss one monitored visit with his wife after the Supreme Court upheld curbs on contact with his spouse while he is on bail, his legal team said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. second-quarter productivity growth unrevised at 2.9 percent
Description: U.S. worker productivity rose at its fastest pace in more than three years in the second quarter, as previously reported, but the trend in productivity growth remained moderate.

Headlines: Pompeo tells Germany: Use Huawei and lose access to our data
Description: The United States raised the pressure on Western allies in a war of attrition over next-generation networks on Friday, saying countries that allow China's Huawei to build their telecoms infrastructure could be cut off from crucial intelligence data.

Headlines: Countering global protectionism, Pacific trade pact nears takeoff
Description: A landmark 11-country deal that will slash tariffs across much of the Asia-Pacific region will come into force at the end of December, New Zealand said on Wednesday, a rare bright spot for global commerce as the U.S.-China trade war intensifies.

Headlines: Coronavirus deaths in Italy overtake China as economic damage mounts
Description: The world's richest nations poured unprecedented aid into the  global economy on Thursday as coronavirus cases ballooned in the new epicentre Europe, with the number of deaths in Italy outstripping those in mainland China, where the virus originated.

Headlines: Factbox: Airlines suspend flights due to coronavirus outbreak
Description: Airlines have been suspending flights or modifying service in response to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Nissan to begin restart of U.S. auto plants on June 1
Description: Japanese automaker Nissan Motor Co  said Wednesday it plans to begin restarting its shuttered U.S. manufacturing operations beginning June 1.

Headlines: FAA to open proceeding on fatal Boeing crashes
Description: The Federal Aviation Administration said Wednesday it plans to open a proceeding into two fatal Boeing Co 737 MAX 8 plane crashes after it said data showed "some similarities" in the Lion Air and Ethiopian Airlines crashes.

Headlines: U.S. claims Regeneron paid kickbacks via charity to boost expensive drug
Description: The U.S. Justice Department on Wednesday sued Regeneron Pharmaceuticals Inc, accusing it of using a charity that helps cover Medicare patients' drug costs as a means to pay kickbacks for using its expensive macular degeneration drug Eylea.

Headlines: China says putting pressure on Beijing won't work amid trade war with U.S.
Description: China's foreign ministry on Friday said that putting pressure on Beijing over trade won't work, after a report that U.S. President Donald Trump is prepared to quickly ramp up a trade war between the two countries.

Headlines: FCA to face checks, sanctions on state-backed loan
Description: Fiat Chrysler  will file regular reports on its use of a multi-billion euro state-backed loan which Italy is set to approve soon and will face sanctions if it does not respect commitments attached to the package, the economy minister said.

Headlines: Exclusive: Newly obtained documents show Huawei role in shipping prohibited U.S. gear to Iran
Description: Chinas Huawei Technologies, which for years has denied violating American trade sanctions on Iran, produced internal company records in 2010 that show it was directly involved in sending prohibited U.S. computer equipment to Irans largest mobile-phone operator.

Headlines: New CEO declares Volkswagen on right path despite profit hit
Description: Volkswagen's  first-quarter operating profit fell on Thursday, but optimism over its new chief executive, the carmaker's financial health and lower provisions for the diesel emissions scandal lifted its shares.

Headlines: Airbnb holds meeting with bankers to extend $1 billion debt facility: source
Description: Airbnb Inc on Wednesday held a phone meeting with bankers to discuss extending an existing $1 billion debt facility as the home rental start-up grapples with a slowdown due to the coronavirus, a source who participated in the meeting said.

Headlines: Papa John's founder says successor not right fit for CEO
Description: John Schnatter, the founder and largest shareholder of Papa John's International Inc , said on Thursday that Steve Ritchie, who rose from a $6-per-hour employee to CEO with Schnatter's backing, should not be leading the company.

Headlines: Honeywell eyes supplier shift to avoid tariff hit
Description: (This version of the July 20 story corrects paragraph 1 to say company will increase the use of supply chain sources from non-China countries, not start sourcing from countries other than China)

Headlines: Global share listings dragged to three-year low by European shortage
Description: Global share listings hit their lowest level in three years in the first half of the year, with a slowdown in Europe counteracting a stronger U.S. showing where tech giants Uber and Pinterest made their debuts.

Headlines: EA sees full-year revenue above estimates as home-sheltering boosts gaming
Description: Video game publisher Electronic Arts Inc forecast full-year adjusted revenue above Wall Street estimates on Tuesday, riding on the broader surge in videogame sales as people shelter at home due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Canada foreign minister briefing PM for second time in a day on NAFTA
Description: Canadian Foreign Minister Chrystia Freeland was briefing Prime Minister Justin Trudeau for the second time in a few hours on talks to update NAFTA and will speak to reporters later on Wednesday, a government official said.

Headlines: U.S. warns European allies not to use Chinese gear for 5G networks
Description: The United States sees the European Union as its top priority in a global effort to convince allies not to buy Huawei equipment for next-generation mobile networks, a U.S. State Department Official said on Tuesday.

Headlines: United Airlines profit rises with higher fares
Description: United Airlines  said on Tuesday quarterly profit rose, as higher fares helped offset the costs of fuel and a rash of winter storms.

Headlines: New U.S. FAA rules on airplane seat size may not create more leg room
Description: A bill that will regulate minimum seat size on U.S. passenger airplanes for the first time is unlikely to lead to more leg or elbow room for cramped flyers, airline consultants said.

Headlines: Microsoft debuts free tier in competitive workplace chat app market
Description: Microsoft Corp on Thursday introduced a free tier of its workplace collaboration software Teams to better compete against rival Slack Technologies Inc in a market analysts view as a main battleground in the world of enterprise software.

Headlines: Dutch superyacht builders propelled by rising economic tide
Description: With three lounges, three dining rooms, an open-air jacuzzi, a bar and six luxury cabins, the 50-metre "Aster" is one of Dutch shipyard Heesen's more modest superyachts.

Headlines: Highlights: Key quotes from the Reuters interview with Trump
Description: Here are highlights from the Reuters interview with U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Canada housing agency pushes for better income checks to catch fraud
Description: Canada's housing agency has asked the country's tax authority to take a "more direct and formal role" verifying income claimed on mortgage applications, part of a two-year plan to tackle mortgage fraud, documents obtained by Reuters show.

Headlines: Boeing says 737 MAX software upgrade will be deployed in coming weeks
Description: Boeing Co said on Friday its software upgrade for the grounded 737 MAX jetliner will be rolled out in the coming weeks, and that its timeline for deploying the upgrade has not changed.

Headlines: Judge lets Facebook privacy class action proceed, calls company's views 'so wrong'
Description: A federal judge on Monday ordered Facebook Inc  to face most of a nationwide lawsuit seeking damages for letting third parties such as Cambridge Analytica access users' private data, calling the social media company's views on privacy "so wrong."

Headlines: Starbucks' China challenger Luckin raises $561 million in U.S. IPO
Description: Luckin Coffee Inc, the Chinese challenger to Starbucks Corp, on Thursday priced its U.S. initial public offering at the top end of its targeted range and sold more shares than planned in the biggest U.S. float by a Chinese firm this year.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. government seeks Facebook help to wiretap Messenger - sources
Description: The U.S. government is trying to force Facebook Inc  to break the encryption in its popular Messenger app so law enforcement may listen to a suspect's voice conversations in a criminal probe, three people briefed on the case said, resurrecting the issue of whether companies can be compelled to alter their products to enable surveillance.

Headlines: Versace takeover will bring jobs to Italy, its designer says
Description: Fashion house Versace did not receive any offers from Italian investors before selling to Michael Kors  but the deal with the U.S. fashion group will create jobs in Italy, creative director Donatella Versace told newspapers on Wednesday.

Headlines: French demands challenge FCA-Renault deal push
Description: Talks on Fiat Chrysler's proposed merger with Renault became mired in politics on Monday, as France sought more concessions to maintain government influence over the new carmaker's management and French assets, sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Employees worried about Valero response to virus cases at Texas refinery: sources
Description: Employees at Valero Energy Corp's Port Arthur, Texas, refinery expressed worries about the company's slow response to keep the coronavirus from spreading there after two workers tested positive, four people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Tesla's German factory gets off to an explosive start
Description: Seven U.S. bombs from World War Two have been found in the plot of land outside Berlin where electric car pioneer Tesla  wants to build its first European factory, local authorities said on Thursday.

Headlines: Lufthansa soars after top shareholder backs bailout
Description: Lufthansa  shares jumped as much as 20% on Thursday after its top shareholder dropped his objections to a 9 billion euro ($10 billion) government bailout for the German airline brought to the brink of collapse by the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: China says has begun implementing some retaliatory tariffs on U.S. goods
Description: China's Foreign Ministry said on Friday that Beijing has already begun implementing tariffs on some U.S. goods in retaliation for U.S. duties on $34 billion in Chinese imports, which took effect the same day.

Headlines: Data's the secret weapon for Rappi, SoftBank's big bet in Latin America
Description: "We're going to help you understand your missed opportunities," the boss of delivery app Rappi tells restaurants and food brands. "Why Wednesday is maybe not the best day for you, or why lunch is better than dinner."

Headlines: Wall St. ekes out gains as trade optimism pressured by defensive stocks
Description: Wall Street ended a choppy session slightly higher on Monday as weakness in defensive stocks offset optimism following U.S. President Donald Trump's conciliatory remarks toward China's ZTE Corp that calmed the waters of U.S.-China trade tensions.

Headlines: Avianca to pack more seats into planes as part of recovery plan, executive says
Description: Latin American airline Avianca  will look to increase the number of passengers it can fit into a plane without enlarging its fleet as part of its efforts to overcome ongoing financial problems, its chief executive said on Thursday.

Headlines: Airbus says to shed 15,000 jobs
Description: Airbus on Tuesday unveiled plans to shed around 15,000 jobs including 900 already earmarked in Germany, saying its future was at stake after the coronavirus pandemic rocked the air travel industry.

Headlines: New Fiat Chrysler boss transformed Jeep brand as company focuses on SUVs
Description: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV's  new chief executive Mike Manley, who has overseen the effort to turn Jeep into a global brand, now plans to carry out the parent company's strategy unveiled last month, the company said Saturday.

Headlines: Audi steps up production ahead of new pollution rules
Description: Audi has stepped up production ahead of a September deadline when it becomes harder to register vehicles as roadworthy, the German premium carmaker said on Friday.

Headlines: China's industrial profits shrink again in Dec. on weak prices, demand
Description: Earnings at China's industrial firms shrank for a second straight month in December, putting pressure on policymakers to support industries hurt by slowing prices and weak factory activity amid a protracted U.S.-Sino trade war.

Headlines: VW Trucks could pursue listing or issue debt: CEO
Description: Volkswagen  said it could list its trucks business as part of expansion plans for the division, Andreas Renschler, head of the trucks business said on Monday.

Headlines: Exclusive: India's NTPC snubs foreign emissions tech, shuts out GE, others from $2 billion orders
Description: Top Indian electricity generator NTPC has rejected the  emissions-cutting technology of GE and other foreign firms for its coal-fired plants, documents show, shutting them out of an estimated $2 billion in orders.

Headlines: Passenger sues Southwest Airlines over fatal engine explosion
Description: A lawsuit against Southwest Airlines Co has been filed by a passenger who was flying on last week's flight 1380, in which an engine exploded and one person was killed.

Headlines: Explainer: Oil ETPs - the perils of trading crude like a stock
Description: A historic plunge in oil prices in the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic has highlighted the risks of oil-focused exchange-traded products (ETPs).

Headlines: UK's Johnson tells Trump on Huawei that collaboration is needed to diversify market
Description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson told President Trump on Tuesday that countries should work together to break the dominance of a small number of companies after Britain granted Chinese firm Huawei [HWT.UL] a limited role in its 5G mobile network.

Headlines: U.S. lawmaker urges FAA, Boeing employees to disclose details on 737 MAX approval
Description: The chairman of U.S. House Transportation and Infrastructure Committee Peter DeFazio on Friday urged current or former Boeing Co and Federal Aviation Administration employees to come forward with any information about the government's aircraft certification program.

Headlines: JPMorgan awards research grants, deepening its AI push
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co has awarded 47 financial grants to university faculty and PhD students for artificial intelligence research, ramping up its efforts in the emerging technology, the bank plans to announce later on Monday.

Headlines: Concern and hope as AMS and Osram slide following failed takeover
Description: Shares in sensors specialist AMS and lighting group Osram fell on Monday on concerns AMS might revisit its $4.9 billion takeover bid which collapsed on Friday.

Headlines: Graphic: No Santa Rally? Trade fears threaten Wall Street's end of decade
Description: Wall Street's poor start to December has some investors bracing for a choppy end-of-year as fears about the U.S.-China trade war resurface.

Headlines: U.S. Supreme Court sides with BP unit to curtail Superfund site cleanup lawsuits
Description: The U.S. Supreme Court handed BP Plc unit Atlantic Richfield Co a victory on Monday, making it harder for Montana landowners to seek a more extensive cleanup of a hazardous waste site than the federal government had ordered.

Headlines: Huawei leads Asian domination of U.N. patent applications in 2018
Description: Chinese telecoms giant Huawei led the pack with Asia accounting for more than half of the international patent applications at the World Intellectual Property Organization (WIPO) last year, WIPO said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Sunrise plan to buy Liberty Global's UPC gets anti-trust green light
Description: The Swiss anti-trust authority has approved Sunrise Communications' 6.3 billion Swiss franc ($6.36 billion) takeover of Liberty Global's UPC business, setting up a showdown between the telecoms company and foes of the deal.

Headlines: Brent logs worst weekly loss in a year as China virus fears swell
Description: Crude prices sank more than 2% on Friday and Brent logged its biggest weekly decline in more than a year as concerns that a coronavirus will spread farther in China, the world's second-largest oil consumer, curbing travel and oil demand.

Headlines: No end in sight yet for Amazon shutdown in France
Description: Amazon  has no clarity yet on when its warehouses in France might reopen, the head of its French business said on Thursday, after the e-commerce giant clashed with unions over the measures taken to limit the risks of coronavirus contagion.

Headlines: Heard on the grapevine: How Pacific trade pact primes New Zealand wine for Japan buzz
Description: From sleepy New Zealand hillsides to sleek Tokyo dining scenes, a bottle of Hawke's Bay wine shipped to Japan traces an arc that exporters like Nigel Avery see as an avenue for multi-million dollar growth built on a free trade pact.

Headlines: Lachlan Murdoch to replace brother James as Fox CEO after Disney deal
Description: Twenty First Century Fox's  Chief Executive Officer James Murdoch will leave the company and be succeeded by brother Lachlan once the company sells off its TV and film assets to Walt Disney Co .

Headlines: Ad giant WPP pulls dividend, buyback and outlook as clients cut spending
Description: The world's biggest advertising company WPP  has pulled its dividend and share buyback and withdrawn its 2020 guidance after the coronavirus pandemic sparked the most uncertain time in its 35-year history.

Headlines: WeWork, former CEO Adam Neumann accused of pregnancy discrimination
Description: The former chief of staff to ousted WeWork CEO Adam Neumann has accused him and the company of discrimination, saying she feared for the health of her unborn baby because of Neumann's penchant for smoking marijuana on chartered planes.

Headlines: U.S. stimulus package is biggest ever, but may not be big enough
Description: The Federal Reserve has offered more than $3 trillion in loans and asset purchases in recent weeks to stop the U.S. financial system from seizing up, but it has not yet directly helped large swaths of the real economy: companies, municipalities and other borrowers with less than perfect credit.

Headlines: Wirecard investor DWS says has sold down position, considering legal action
Description: Asset manager DWS, the fund management arm of Deutsche Bank, said it has further sold down its position in embattled German technology company Wirecard and was considering legal action.

Headlines: Wall Street looks to earnings after strongest June in decades
Description: On the heels of the S&P 500's best June performance in more than six decades, investors are anxious to see whether earnings can justify further gains as the largest U.S. companies open their books in the coming weeks.

Headlines: E-scooters put Swedish start-up on road to positive cashflow
Description: Growing numbers of young people whizzing around Europe's big cities on electric scooters may represent a nightmare for some pedestrians and motorists, but for Swedish sharing start-up VOI they offer a path to positive cashflow.

Headlines: Honda's China sales likely to catch U.S. sales in two-three years: CEO
Description: Honda's sales in China are likely to catch up with its sales in the United States within two to three years and the firm would like them to eventually overtake U.S. sales, the company's chief executive said on Friday.

Headlines: Japan's Nidec to expand electric-car motor production outside China: Nikkei
Description: Nidec Corp  will add locations outside China to build motors for electric vehicles as the Japanese motor maker rethinks its supply strategy, the Nikkei business daily reported on Thursday.

Headlines: BMW dented by upfront expenditure for new car launches
Description: German carmaker BMW  will deepen cost cuts after higher development expenses contributed to a 27 percent drop in third-quarter operating profit, falling short of analyst expectations as currency effects also took a toll.

Headlines: Exclusive: Fed's Williams says new economic outlook necessary for rate hikes
Description: New York Fed President John Williams on Tuesday said he was comfortable with the level U.S. interest rates are at now and that he sees no need to raise them again unless economic growth or inflation shifts to an unexpectedly higher gear.

Headlines: Facebook's grim forecast: privacy push will erode profits for years
Description: Facebook Inc's shares lost as much as a quarter of their value on Wednesday after executives said that profit margins would plummet for several years due to the costs of improving privacy safeguards and slowing usage in the biggest advertising markets.

Headlines: Trump asks SEC to mull half-year corporate filings
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday he has asked the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission to study the impact of allowing companies to file reports with the financial regulator every six months instead of every quarter.

Headlines: Senate passes defense bill, battle looms with Trump over China's ZTE
Description: The U.S. Senate passed a $716 billion defense policy bill on Monday, backing President Donald Trump's call for a bigger, stronger military but setting up a potential battle with the White House over Chinese telecommunications firm ZTE Corp .

Headlines: Shell reviews deals involving ex-executive accused of bribery
Description: Royal Dutch Shell  has concluded that a Nigerian oilfield sale where it suspects an executive took bribes was not linked to a separate court case in which he and Shell face corruption charges over a $1.1 billion offshore acquisition.

Headlines: PG&E to float $31 billion restructuring plan: Bloomberg
Description: Power producer PG&E Corp will propose a $31 billion bankruptcy restructuring plan that will include two funds worth a total of $34 billion to cover past and future wildfire claims, Bloomberg reported https://twitter.com/scottdeveau/status/1142117995680030720 on Friday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Logitech in talks to acquire headphone maker Plantronics - sources
Description: Logitech International SA, a Swiss manufacturer of keyboards and webcams, is in discussions to acquire Plantronics Inc, a U.S. maker of Bluetooth earpieces and gaming headsets, people familiar with the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: Dunkin' drops 'Donuts' from name in shift to coffee
Description: Dunkin' Donuts said on Tuesday it plans to rebrand itself as "Dunkin'" as part of new CEO Dave Hoffman's plans to bring beverages and breakfast meals to the forefront of the restaurant chain's menu.

Headlines: Coronavirus impact is overwhelming, Spain's hotels association says
Description: Hotel bookings have fallen by as much as 40% in some areas of Spain, the country's hotel federation said and flagged an overwhelming impact for the eurozone's fourth largest economy as anxiety about the coronavirus outbreak takes hold.

Headlines: Ahead of election year, more Americans lack health insurance, incomes stall
Description: The share of Americans without health insurance rose for the first time in a decade last year and U.S. household income hardly budged, according to a government report on Tuesday that laid bare issues that could be central to the U.S. presidential election next year.

Headlines: PG&E shares surge 40 percent on report regulator wants to avoid bankruptcy from wildfire
Description: PG&E Corp shares soared 40 percent in after-hours trade on Thursday following a report that a regulatory official told investors the agency does not want the utility to go into bankruptcy should it be found responsible for this month's deadly wildfire in northern California.

Headlines: There are limits to boldly easing bank rules in coronavirus pandemic: BIS
Description: Easing bank rules is among the "bold and extraordinary" steps needed to beat the coronavirus, but it must be temporary and limited to avoid undermining financial stability after the epidemic has passed, central bankers said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Atlantia shares rise on hopes for truce with Italian government
Description: Atlantia  shares gained more than 6% on Tuesday as comments from a minister rekindled hopes that the infrastructure group could reach a compromise with the government over its lucrative motorway concession.
