Headlines: Volkswagen's emissions problems cost the carmaker 3.6 billion euros in 2018: source
Description: Volkswagen's effort to get its fleet of cars certified according to the new WLTP emissions standard have cost the carmaker up to 3.6 billion euros ($4.04 billion) in 2018, a source familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Trump presses Lockheed to keep open a Pennsylvania plant slated for closure
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday urged Lockheed Martin Corp to keep open its Sikorsky helicopter plant in Coatesville, Pennsylvania, a week after the weapons maker announced the planned closure of the facility.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs sees S&P 500 dividends declining 25% in 2020
Description: Goldman Sachs said on Monday it expects S&P 500 dividends to fall by 25% in 2020 as certain large dividend-paying industries are particularly vulnerable to the economic shock of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: U.S. Congress needs compromise to extend COVID-19 unemployment payments, Pelosi says
Description: Democratic House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said on Sunday she believes U.S. lawmakers can find a compromise on extending jobless benefits and unemployment insurance for Americans struggling amid coronavirus pandemic shutdowns.

Headlines: Huawei Technologies loses trade secrets case against U.S. chip designer
Description: A U.S. jury on Wednesday cleared California semiconductor designer CNEX Labs Inc of stealing trade secrets from Chinese electronics giant Huawei Technologies Co Ltd while awarding CNEX no damages on its own trade theft claims.

Headlines: Lawsuit claims Burger King's Impossible Whoppers are contaminated by meat
Description: Burger King was sued on Monday by a vegan customer who accused the fast-food chain of contaminating its meatless "Impossible" Whoppers by cooking them on the same grills as its traditional meat burgers.

Headlines: Harbour Energy says $10.8 billion offer for Santos is 'best and final'
Description: Harbour Energy said on Monday its latest takeover proposal of $10.8 billion for Australian gas producer Santos Ltd  was its "best and final" offer.

Headlines: Storm clouds gather over U.S. stocks as hopes of quick recovery fade
Description: A lightning-quick rally in U.S. equities is showing cracks, as investors face mounting evidence that the economy's coronavirus-fueled woes may be far longer-lasting than many had anticipated.

Headlines: Australia sues Facebook, alleges breach of user data
Description: The Australian privacy regulator filed a lawsuit against Facebook Inc , accusing the social media giant of sharing the personal details of more than 300,000 people with political consultant Cambridge Analytica without their knowledge.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs joins growing band of businesses snubbing Saudi conference
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc on Thursday joined the growing list of high-profile businesses snubbing a Saudi investment conference next week amid mounting pressure on Riyad over the disappearance of journalist Jamal Khashoggi.

Headlines: Hong Kong records fourth coronavirus-related death - hospital spokeswoman
Description: An 80-year old man became the fourth patient in Hong Kong to die due to the coronavirus, a Nethersole Eastern Hospital spokeswoman said on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. deficit could quadruple to $3.7 trillion in coronavirus crisis: CBO
Description: A nationwide business shutdown and surge in U.S. government spending will nearly quadruple the federal deficit to a record $3.7 trillion this fiscal year as the country combats the coronavirus pandemic, congressional forecasters said on Friday.

Headlines: UAW workers head for picket lines in first national strike against GM since 2007
Description: The United Auto Workers (UAW) went on strike at General Motors just after midnight Sunday and about 48,000 hourly workers at its facilities are headed for the picket lines in the morning, union officials said early Monday.

Headlines: U.S. inflation much softer in first quarter; puts spotlight on Fed
Description: U.S. inflation was much weaker than initially thought in the first quarter amid a sharp slowdown in domestic demand, which could cast doubts on the Federal Reserve's view that the benign price pressures were largely because of temporary factors.

Headlines: Malaysia Airlines says 737 MAX jet deliveries may be delayed, eyes turnaround
Description: Malaysia Airlines is looking at its order for 25 Boeing Co 737 MAX jets "very carefully" in light of the global grounding and plans for the first delivery in July 2020 could be delayed, the carrier's chief executive said on Monday.

Headlines: Factories faltered in June, trade truce fails to brighten outlook
Description: Factory activity shrank across much of Europe and Asia in June while growth in manufacturing cooled in the United States, keeping the world's policymakers under pressure to avert a recession amid a U.S.-China trade war.

Headlines: L'Oreal's Lancome beefs up stores as luxury cosmetics take off
Description: L'Oreal's  Lancome brand is planning to open a flagship store in China after launching its first major showcase in Paris this week, its chief executive said, as the company capitalizes on booming demand for high-end cosmetics.

Headlines: BlackRock becomes Authentic Brands' largest shareholder with $875 million stake
Description: BlackRock Inc's  new private equity fund Long Term Private Capital (LTPC) has completed its maiden investment, taking up an $875 million stake in Authentic Brands Group LLC, making it the largest investor in the U.S.-based entertainment company, the fund said on Sunday.

Headlines: As trade war drags on, new Bunge CEO looks to avoid 'stroke-of-the-pen' risk
Description: A year removed from a losing bet that the U.S.-China trade war would be promptly resolved, global grains trader Bunge Ltd  is facing an even more uncertain business environment, with a new chief executive who is determined not to get burned again.

Headlines: Global risk rally has a powerful ally: the weaker dollar
Description: Investors are betting a weaker U.S. dollar will further boost a rally that has seen stocks, emerging market currencies and other risky assets soar in recent weeks.

Headlines: China imposed tariffs on U.S. products to 'balance losses': state media
Description: China imposed tariffs on 128 U.S. products ranging from wine to oranges in order to "balance the losses" caused by U.S. duties and to protect China's national interests, according to a commentary on the front page of the official People's Daily.

Headlines: Minutes from Federal Reserve's June FOMC meeting
Description: U.S. central bankers discussed whether recession lurked around the corner and expressed concerns global trade tensions could hit an economy that by most measures looked strong, minutes of the Federal Reserve's last policy meeting on June 12-13 released on Thursday showed.

Headlines: Exclusive: China Everbright Group to restructure, pursue billion-dollar HK IPO - sources
Description: State-owned financial conglomerate China Everbright Group aims to restructure its sprawling business and pursue a billion dollar IPO next year in Hong Kong, three people with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters on Thursday.

Headlines: Seeking to avert higher tariffs, China dispatches top negotiator to U.S.
Description: Chinese Vice Premier Liu He will travel to Washington for two days of trade talks this week, China said on Tuesday, setting up a last-ditch bid for a deal that would avoid a sharp increase in tariffs on Chinese goods ordered by U.S. President Donald Trump.

Headlines: Renault-Nissan alliance, Google to partner on self-driving cars: Nikkei
Description: The Renault-Nissan-Mitsubishi alliance will tie up with Alphabet Inc's Google to develop autonomous taxis and other services using self-driving vehicles, the Nikkei reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. consumer confidence rises; COVID-19, unemployment shadow lingers
Description: U.S. consumer sentiment perked up in early June as households cheered the reopening of businesses and a surprise rebound in hiring, though they did not expect a significant improvement in the economy amid fears of a resurgence in COVID-19 infections.

Headlines: China's central bank adviser says U.S. tariffs seen cutting GDP growth by 0.2 percent points: Xinhua
Description: A China central bank adviser said the planned U.S. import tariffs on $50 billion worth of Chinese goods will cut China's growth by 0.2 percentage points but its overall impact will be limited, the official Xinhua news agency reported Friday.

Headlines: German industry warns U.S. auto tariffs not completely off table yet
Description: A top German industry group gave a cautious welcome to solutions proposed by U.S. President Donald Trump and European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker to avert a trade war, but warned that U.S. auto tariffs were not completely off the table yet.

Headlines: China forms task force to review design changes to Boeing 737 MAX
Description: China's aviation regulator said on Tuesday that it had set up a task force to review design changes to the Boeing Co 737 MAX that had been submitted by the planemaker after the fleet was grounded last month.

Headlines: Bayer cuts forecasts on Monsanto delay as lawsuits pile up
Description: Bayer cut its earnings forecast on Wednesday due to delays to its $63 billion takeover of Monsanto, and said sales of its consumer care products fell, hitting its shares, already reeling from a legal battle over the weed killer Roundup.

Headlines: Fujitsu to halve office space in three years citing 'new normal'
Description: Japan's Fujitsu Ltd  said on Monday it would halve its office space in three years as it rewrites the way employees work under a "new normal" amid the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Exclusive: Nasdaq cracks down on IPOs of small Chinese companies
Description: Nasdaq Inc  is cracking down on initial public offerings (IPOs) of small Chinese companies by tightening restrictions and slowing down their approval, according to regulatory filings, corporate executives and investment bankers.

Headlines: Shareholder lawsuit attacks Musk's pay, seeks to overhaul Tesla board
Description: Elon Musk's multi-billion dollar compensation package should be rescinded and the board of Tesla Inc should be overhauled to better protect investors in the electronic car company, according to a law suit filed by a shareholder on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. movie theater chains fear Justice Department review may hit profits
Description: U.S. movie theater chains fear that a Justice Department review of little-known mid-century rules may result in studios getting free rein to force them to show unpopular movies in exchange for getting blockbuster releases, threatening their profits.

Headlines: Amazon warehouses receive only vital supplies in U.S., Europe amid coronavirus
Description: Amazon.com Inc  will only receive vital supplies at its U.S. and UK and other European warehouses until April 5, its latest move to free up inventory space for medical and household goods in high demand as a result of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: EU court ruling on Starbucks, Fiat million euro tax orders on September 24
Description: Europe's second-highest court will rule on Sept. 24 whether Starbucks Corp  has to pay up to 30 million euros ($33 million) in Dutch back taxes and Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV  a similar amount to Luxembourg.

Headlines: Wall Street tumbles as trade war threatens U.S. economy
Description: Wall Street's main indexes suffered their sharpest one-day declines in nearly six weeks on Wednesday after employment and manufacturing data suggested that the U.S.-China trade war is taking an increasing toll on the U.S. economy.

Headlines: Top Trump official calls bankers, will convene 'Plunge Protection Team'
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's Treasury secretary called top U.S. bankers on Sunday amid an ongoing rout on Wall Street and made plans to convene a group of officials known as the "Plunge Protection Team."

Headlines: Trump administration announces $16 billion farm aid plan to offset trade war losses
Description: The Trump administration on Thursday unveiled a $16 billion farm aid package to offset losses from a 10-month trade war with China and said payment rates to farmers would be determined by where they farm rather than what crops they grow.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco cuts hundreds of jobs amid oil market downturn, sources say
Description: State oil giant Saudi Aramco  started laying off hundreds of employees this month, two sources familiar with the matter said, as global energy companies reduce their workforces in response to the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: France to absorb 35 billion euros rail operator SNCF debt: Les Echos
Description: The French government plans to absorb about 35 billion euros ($41.20 billion) of national railway operator SNCF's  debt burden of around 47 billion euros as part of planned reforms to SNCF, French business daily Les Echos said on Monday.

Headlines: U.S. touts EU trade truce, attention now turns to China
Description: The United States signaled on Thursday it is set to push ahead on trade talks with Canada and Mexico after agreeing to suspend hostilities over tariffs with Europe in a fragile deal that may clear the way for renewed pressure on China.

Headlines: U.S. banks to defend dividend payments in stress tests: FT
Description: U.S. banks are expected to defend their dividend payments when they submit their annual capital plans to the Federal Reserve on Monday for the upcoming stress tests, the Financial Times reported on Sunday, citing people familiar with the situation.

Headlines: U.S.-China trade agreement takes little pressure off Fed to cut rates
Description: A ceasefire in the U.S.-China trade war is doing little to relieve pressure on the Federal Reserve to stimulate the economy.

Headlines: Cambridge Analytica CEO claims influence on U.S. election, Facebook questioned
Description: (This March 20 story has been corrected to fix stock losses figure in third paragraph to "nearly $50 billion" from "$60 billion")

Headlines: The S&P 500 inches higher; Treasury yields dip after Powell remarks, jobs report
Description: The S&P 500 posted a nominal gain and Treasury yields edged lower on Friday, as remarks from Federal Reserve chief Jerome Powell firmed interest rate cut expectations and China announced an economic stimulus package, both of which helped offset weaker-than-expected U.S. jobs data.

Headlines: Malaysia PM says U.S. DOJ will help return money Goldman Sachs charged for 1MDB dealings
Description: Malaysia Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad said on Tuesday U.S. prosecutors had promised to help return money that Goldman Sachs  charged for its dealings with troubled Malaysian state fund 1MDB.

Headlines: Transport Canada sending team to assist with proposed software changes for 737 MAX
Description: Transport Canada said on Tuesday it would send a team to assist the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration in evaluating proposed design changes to update the software on Boeing's now grounded 737 MAX jet.

Headlines: Row over undelivered jets as Airbus threatens to sue airlines
Description: A stand-off over undelivered passenger jets is intensifying after Airbus  signalled it would sue airlines refusing  to honour contracts in the face of the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: IMF chief defends Powell after Trump slams 'crazy' Fed
Description: The head of the International Monetary Fund on Thursday defended  Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell one day after U.S. President Donald Trump criticized the American central bank, which has been raising U.S. interest rates, as "crazy."

Headlines: Adidas takes 12-10 lead over Nike in World Cup shirt deals
Description: Adidas  can declare itself the winner over arch rival Nike  in the upcoming soccer World Cup even before the first match kicks off as it is kitting out the most teams.

Headlines: Nestle's overhaul starts to pay off as growth accelerates
Description: Nestle put its Herta processed meats business on the block on Thursday, accelerating the food group's revamp as it reported an uptick in sales momentum for the first time in seven years.

Headlines: Japan's ANA orders passenger jets worth $4.3 billion in Asia push
Description: Japan's ANA Holdings Inc said on Tuesday it would order at least 38 planes worth $4.33 billion from Boeing Co and Airbus, and buy a stake in Philippines Airlines' parent PAL Holdings Inc to support its Asia growth strategy.

Headlines: Loeb's Third Point takes new approach in battle with Nestle
Description: For a year, billionaire hedge fund manager Daniel Loeb has watched quietly from afar as Nestle SA tries to energize its business. But his patience has worn thin and he has been telling associates and his own investors that time is now up for the world's No. 1 food company.

Headlines: Drugmakers Astellas, Amgen to pay $125 million in U.S. charity kickback probe
Description: Two drugmakers will pay nearly $125 million to resolve claims they used charities that help cover Medicare patients' out-of-pocket drug costs as a way to pay kickbacks aimed at encouraging the use of their high-priced medications, the U.S. Justice Department said on Thursday.

Headlines: Amazon workers in Germany to go on strike over coronavirus infections
Description: Workers at six Amazon sites in Germany will go on strike on Monday in protest over safety after some staff at logistics centres tested positive for coronavirus, labour union Verdi said.

Headlines: Enbridge to buy Spectra Energy for $3.3 billion
Description: Enbridge Inc, Canada's largest pipeline operator, said on Friday it would buy its U.S. master limited partnership Spectra Energy Partners for a sweetened deal of $3.3 billion.

Headlines: Airbus struggles to lift crisis-hit jet output
Description: Europe's Airbus  is grappling with labor and supply chain shortages and may only be able to restore aircraft production to some 10-20% of normal levels for now because of partial shutdowns, industry and union sources said.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco bets on oil supply to Europe, trading expansion
Description: Saudi Aramco aims to boost its oil supply to Europe by 300,000 barrels per day (bpd) within the next two years as it expands its trading operations there with an office opening this summer in London, a senior company executive said.

Headlines: House panel asks Boeing CEO to testify October 30 on 737 MAX
Description: The U.S. House Transportation and Infrastructure Committee formally asked Boeing  CEO Dennis Muilenburg on Tuesday to testify on the now grounded 737 MAX that has been involved in two deadly crashes since October 2018 that killed 346 people.

Headlines: U.S. labor market on solid ground; mid-Atlantic factories sputter
Description: The number of Americans filing applications for unemployment benefits dropped from a more than two-year high last week, pointing to sustained labor market strength that should continue to underpin consumer spending and the economy.

Headlines: Wall Street's 'fear gauge' marks record surge after stock sell-off
Description: An avalanche of selling in stocks on fears over the coronavirus outbreak took Wall Street's "fear gauge" to its highest level since the financial crisis on Thursday.

Headlines: Exclusive: BlackRock in talks to take over Cofense after U.S. security concerns - sources
Description: BlackRock Inc , an investor in Cofense Inc, is in advanced talks to take over the U.S. cyber security firm, after a U.S. national security panel asked buyout firm Pamplona Capital Management LLP to sell its stake, people familiar with the matter said on Sunday.

Headlines: Dell posts revenue jump ahead of voting on VMware offer
Description: Dell Technologies Inc  reported a 15 percent rise in quarterly revenue on Thursday, as businesses were forced to upgrade their systems running on older Windows technology and on strong performance by software maker VMware.

Headlines: Nissan CEO Saikawa to step down on September 16
Description: Nissan Motor Co's   embattled chief executive will step down on Sept. 16 and will be temporarily replaced by Chief Operating Officer Yasuhiro Yamauchi, the automaker's board chairman said on Monday.

Headlines: Berkshire Hathaway shareholders reject two proposals
Description: Berkshire Hathaway shareholders at annual meeting overwhelmingly reject shareholder proposal concerning methane emissions

Headlines: Facebook cancels developer conference as tech companies respond to virus
Description: Facebook Inc said on Thursday it would cancel its annual developer conference due to fears over the coronavirus, as growing concerns about the economic impact of the global outbreak drove Wall Street to tumble for a sixth straight day.

Headlines: Stocks buoyed by trade hopes, bond yields up with ECB on deck
Description: A gauge of global equity markets climbed on Wednesday on signs of gradual progress in the trade war between the United States and China, while bond yields rose as investors remained unconvinced what stimulus measures the European Central Bank will provide at its meeting on Thursday.

Headlines: Airbnb teams up with the IOC to provide Games accommodation
Description: Short-term home rental company Airbnb Inc has joined the ranks of leading sponsors of the Olympic Games with a nine year deal to help provide accommodation for the world's biggest sporting event and cut the cost for host cities.

Headlines: Explainer: China changes laws in trade war with U.S., enforcement a concern
Description: China has been changing laws to address U.S. concerns about fair treatment of foreign companies, but with some vague wording and persistent concerns about enforcement, it is unclear if this will leave Washington satisfied.

Headlines: 'Robo-adviser' Wealthfront launches cash account
Description: Wealthfront, one of the largest digital wealth management firms known as "robo-advisers", said on Thursday it is expanding its suite of financial products by introducing a cash account with a rate on deposits of 2.24 percent, significantly higher than the average U.S. rate.

Headlines: Powell: Fed will act 'as appropriate' in face of trade, other risks
Description: The Federal Reserve will respond "as appropriate" to the risks posed by a global trade war and other recent developments, Fed Chairman Jerome Powell said on Tuesday in remarks that seemed to open the door to the possibility of a rate cut.

Headlines: Sony surprises with record profit as image sensor demand offsets weak gaming
Description: Japan's Sony Corp  surprised the market by reporting on Tuesday a record first-quarter operating profit despite the slowing gaming business, as strong demand for multiple-lens camera systems for smartphones boosted sales of image sensors.

Headlines: StanChart suffers Asia private banker exits, boosts Mideast staff: sources
Description: Standard Chartered PLC has seen the departure of at least four senior Asia-based bankers from its private banking unit in recent months, three people with direct knowledge of the matter said, amid growing earnings pressure at the business.

Headlines: Lululemon holds back forecast on virus uncertainty as results beat
Description: Lululemon Athletica Inc  beat analysts' estimates for quarterly results on Thursday, lifted by strong holiday season demand, but the athletic apparel maker did not provide a full-year forecast as the coronavirus outbreak fuels uncertainty.

Headlines: Fed's Mester sees possible economic impact from coronavirus outbreak
Description: The coronavirus outbreak has muddied the outlook for the U.S. economy and could weigh on growth in the first half of this year, Cleveland Federal Reserve Bank President Loretta Mester said in London on Tuesday.

Headlines: Jaguar Land Rover to cut 10% of workforce at UK Halewood factory
Description: British carmaker Jaguar Land Rover (JLR)  said on Wednesday it will cut around 10% of the workforce at its northern English Halewood factory as it changes shift patterns to boost efficiency at the site.

Headlines: Alphabet still facing questions over data use in its Toronto smart city project proposal
Description: Alphabet's proposed "smart" city development in Toronto is facing fresh questions over the project's data-gathering technology from a panel advising the Canadian government-mandated body in charge of getting it built.

Headlines: Pompeo: 'No mixed messages' from U.S. on Huawei
Description: U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said on Tuesday the United States was not sending "mixed messages" on Huawei Technologies and he does not believe a U.S. blacklist of the Chinese telecommunications giant will block a trade deal with Beijing.

Headlines: Trumps tweet support for Goya Foods amid boycott campaign
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump and his daughter and adviser Ivanka Trump are rallying support for Goya Foods on Twitter, as social media pressure continues for boycotting the largest Hispanic-owned U.S. food company over its CEO's effusive praise for Trump.

Headlines: Google fails to disclose microphone in Nest Secure
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google said on Wednesday it had made an "error" in not disclosing that its Nest Secure home security system had a built-in microphone in its devices.

Headlines: Hapag-Lloyd says U.S. shipping probe closed, free of obligations
Description: Germany's Hapag-Lloyd is cleared of a U.S. Department of Justice probe into the practices of container shipping companies, with no charges brought, a spokesman said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Mexico suspends operations of Boeing 737 MAX jetliners
Description: Mexico's civil aviation authority on Wednesday temporarily suspended flights by Boeing Co's 737 MAX 8 and MAX 9 aircraft in and out of the country following an Ethiopian Airlines plane crash on Sunday that killed 157 people.

Headlines: Broadcom offers to scrap exclusivity deals to end EU antitrust probe
Description: U.S. chipmaker Broadcom has offered to scrap its exclusivity deals with TV and modem makers to end an EU antitrust investigation and stave off a possible hefty fine.

Headlines: MetLife names Khalaf CEO, Kandarian to retire
Description: MetLife Inc  on Tuesday named insider Michel Khalaf as its new chief executive officer to succeed Steven Kandarian, who held the position for eight years and helped the company ride through intense regulatory oversight in the wake of the financial crisis.

Headlines: U.S. services sector activity picks up; job openings at record high
Description: U.S. services sector activity accelerated in May, pointing to robust economic growth in the second quarter, but trade tariffs and a shortage of workers posed a threat to the outlook.

Headlines: Millions unemployed, homebuilding collapses as coronavirus ravages U.S. economy
Description: A record 22 million Americans have sought unemployment benefits over the past month, with millions more filing claims last week,  almost wiping out all the job gains since the Great Recession and underscoring the toll on the economy from extraordinary measures to control the novel coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Fed: Main Street program widened to diverse set of new companies
Description: The Federal Reserve expanded its Main Street lending program to be sure it captured larger firms that were still not big enough to tap public capital markets, the central bank said.

Headlines: Fed's Kaplan sees U.S. growth returning in second half, but consumers staying cautious
Description: The U.S. economy is headed for a return to growth in the second half of the year after a steep decline this quarter, Dallas Federal Reserve Bank President Robert Kaplan said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Sky shares leap as Comcast and Fox lock horns in bid battle
Description: Sky  shares leapt to an 18-year high on Thursday as investors bet a transatlantic battle for the European pay-TV group had further to run, after Comcast's $34 billion bid trumped an offer from Rupert Murdoch made just hours earlier.

Headlines: Study finds Uber's growth slows after year of scandal; Lyft benefits
Description: Uber Technologies Inc's growth has slowed as a series of scandals has allowed the ride-hailing company's chief U.S. competitor, Lyft Inc, to grab more market share, digital research firm eMarketer said in a report on Monday.

Headlines: French official says 'not aware' of new discussions on Renault, Fiat Chrysler alliance
Description: The head of French state holding APE said on Thursday he was "not aware" of any new discussions between Renault  and Fiat Chrysler  over a future alliance.

Headlines: Britain's Rolls-Royce to axe 9,000 jobs in air travel slump
Description: Rolls-Royce  plans to cut at least 9,000 jobs, or more than a sixth of its workforce, in the latest blows to the UK economy and aviation industry dealt by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Fiat-PSA merger is good news for the car industry - France's finance minister
Description: Fiat Chrysler (FCA)  and Peugeot maker PSA  merger is good news for France, Europe and also for the car industry, France's Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire told Reuters on Wednesday.

Headlines: China says first-half growth sets good foundation for hitting 2019 GDP target
Description: China's first-half economic growth of 6.3% was "hard-won" and laid a good foundation for achieving a full-year growth target of between 6% and 6.5%, a spokesman for the country's statistics bureau said on Monday.

Headlines: Samsung to shut mobile phone plant in China's Tianjin
Description: Samsung Electronics will cease operations at one of its mobile phone manufacturing plants in China, the company said, as its sales in the world's biggest smartphone market slumps amid rising competition from lower-cost local rivals.

Headlines: Alphabet board sued on allegations of sexual misconduct cover-up
Description: Two shareholder lawsuits filed this week accused the board of Google parent Alphabet Inc of playing a direct role in covering up sexual misconduct claims against two former executives over the last five years.

Headlines: Ex-Insys CEO to plead guilty to opioid kickback scheme
Description: The former chief executive of Insys Therapeutics Inc  has agreed to plead guilty to participating in a scheme to bribe doctors to prescribe a powerful opioid medication in order to boost its sales, U.S. prosecutors said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Tesla scouting sites for possible factory in Germany's NRW: Rheinische Post
Description: Electric carmaker Tesla  is scouting out locations for a possible factory in the German state of North Rhine-Westphalia (NRW), Germany's most populous state, daily Rheinische Post reported on Sunday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: U.S. disappointed by WTO decision allowing China to slap trade sanctions on U.S. goods
Description: The United States is disappointed by a World Trade Organization (WTO) decision that China may slap compensatory sanctions on U.S. imports worth $3.579 billion annually for the U.S. failure to remove anti-dumping duties, a U.S. official said on Friday.

Headlines: Fed's Powell: Too early to say how tariffs would affect U.S. economic outlook
Description: It is too early to say how the prospect of tariffs could impact the U.S. economic outlook, Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell said on Friday.

Headlines: Airbnb's new $1 billion investment comes at lower valuation: sources
Description: Airbnb Inc's new $1 billion investment from private equity firms Silver Lake and Sixth Street Partners has terms that imply a reduced valuation of the home rental company, people familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.

Headlines: IAC must face Tinder co-founder's $2 billion lawsuit: NY appeals court
Description: A New York state appeals court on Tuesday rejected IAC/InterActiveCorp's  bid to dismiss a $2 billion lawsuit by a group of Tinder founders, executives and early employees who said it undervalued the dating app to avoid paying them billions of dollars.

Headlines: WTO paves way for China to seek sanctions against U.S.
Description: The World Trade Organization (WTO) on Thursday adopted final findings against U.S. duties imposed on a range of Chinese imports, effectively giving Beijing a green light to seek compensatory sanctions.

Headlines: Struggling Nissan's China vehicle sales drop 80% in February
Description: Nissan Motor Co's  vehicle sales in China, its biggest market, dropped 80% in February as coronavirus concerns sapped demand, in another blow to the carmaker which is struggling to recover from a profit free fall.

Headlines: Factbox: Ford bets Mustang muscle can sell an electric SUV
Description: Ford Motor Co  has tried and failed to generate interest in utilitarian electric vehicles such as a battery-powered Focus compact car. Now, the company is using the high-performance image of its Mustang muscle cars to sell an electric SUV. Here are some details of the Mustang Mach E's design and performance.

Headlines: Oil rallies on faster output cuts to offset virus-induced falloff in demand
Description: Oil soared on Thursday, extending its rebound after major oil-producing nations said they would accelerate planned production cuts to combat the dramatic slump in demand due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: ABB's Voser battles headwinds as he pursues overhaul
Description: ABB  is pressing ahead with a review of its underperforming businesses and expects a turbulent 2019 amid a slowdown in some markets and China-U.S. trade tensions, Chairman and interim Chief Executive Peter Voser told Reuters.

Headlines: Brent at highest since March on U.S. stock draw, recovering demand
Description: Global benchmark Brent rose more than 1% on Thursday to its highest since March, supported by lower U.S. crude inventories, OPEC-led supply cuts and recovering demand as governments ease coronavirus restrictions on people's movements.

Headlines: Margin worries send Macy's shares tumbling after profit beat
Description: Macy's Inc  on Wednesday said its gross margins would shrink in the fall season as delivery expenses rise, overshadowing a quarterly sales and profit beat and sending shares down more than 13 percent.

Headlines: Lululemon hits record high on revamped stores
Description: Lululemon Athletica Inc's  shares hit a record high on Friday after the athletic apparel maker raised its full-year profit forecast as customers flocked to its revamped stores.

Headlines: SoftBank Group adds $14 billion to market value as shares soar on buyback, third-quarter profit
Description: SoftBank Group Corp shares jumped 17 percent on Thursday, adding $14 billion to the Japanese tech investment giant's market value, after it unveiled a record share buyback and a surge in quarterly operating profit.

Headlines: JAL forgoes earnings forecast, dividend amid coronavirus uncertainty
Description: Japan Airlines  on Thursday declined to release an annual earnings forecast or pay a shareholder dividend amid uncertainty over the future of air travel as the coronavirus pandemic saps demand for flights.

Headlines: Wells Fargo taps one-time Dimon protg Scharf to lead turnaround
Description: After a difficult, months-long search for a new chief executive, scandal-plagued Wells Fargo & Co  named as its next leader Charles Scharf, a one-time Jamie Dimon protg known on Wall Street as a detail-oriented number cruncher who excels in streamlining operations.

Headlines: Canada should ban Huawei from 5G networks, says former spy chief
Description: Canada should ban China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd from supplying equipment to Canadian 5G networks because the security risk is too great, a former spy chief said in an article published on Monday.

Headlines: Exxon's lawyer calls lawsuit a 'cruel joke' as climate change fraud trial ends
Description: Lawyers for New York state and Exxon Mobil Corp delivered closing arguments in a closely watched trial accusing the oil company of hiding from investors the true cost of addressing climate change.

Headlines: Exclusive: Neiman Marcus to file for bankruptcy as soon as this week - sources
Description: Neiman Marcus Group is preparing to seek bankruptcy protection as soon as this week, becoming the first major U.S. department store operator to succumb to the economic fallout from the coronavirus outbreak, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Exxon Mobil, India's ONGC sign expertise-sharing deal
Description: Global energy giant Exxon Mobil Corp  will offer its expertise and technology to India's biggest state-owned explorer Oil and Natural Gas Corp Ltd  to help develop its resources in offshore blocks, according to two sources directly privy to the development.

Headlines: French Finance Minister: Dutch move on Air France KLM was 'incomprehensible'
Description: The Dutch government's decision to increase its stake in Air France KLM was both "incomprehensible" and unexpected, said French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire on Wednesday.

Headlines: Boxing with giants: Italy's packing robots are not just cardboard cutouts
Description: (This June 28 story corrects Romaco's nationality to German, not Italian, in paragraph 17)

Headlines: WeWork's new chairman defends payouts to founder, says company will survive
Description: (This October 23 story corrects 16th paragraph to show that WeWork has sites in 123 cities, not countries.)

Headlines: BOJ maintains massive stimulus as Kuroda warns of growing risks
Description: The Bank of Japan cut its inflation forecasts on Wednesday but maintained its massive stimulus program, with Governor Haruhiko Kuroda warning of growing risks to the economy from trade protectionism and faltering global demand.

Headlines: AMS posts third-quarter revenue jump, sees strong demand from Apple, others
Description: Apple  supplier AMS  beat expectations with a 41% jump in third-quarter revenue on Tuesday and forecast further strong demand for its optical sensors from smartphone makers as it takes aim at a takeover of German lighting maker Osram .

Headlines: China's HNA in talks to sell Ingram Micro to Apollo Global: source
Description: HNA Group Co [HNAIRC.UL] is in talks to sell Ingram Micro Inc to private equity firm Apollo Global Management Llc , a source familiar with the matter said on Friday, as the Chinese conglomerate continues to scale back operations.

Headlines: Wall Street ekes out gains as Canada takes trade spotlight
Description: The S&P 500 and the Nasdaq edged up to record closing highs for the third consecutive session as investors struggled over whether to take profits following a rally on positive developments in trade disputes which have vexed the markets.

Headlines: Brazil will leave fate of Boeing-Embraer deal to next president
Description: Brazil will leave a decision on whether to approve the sale of a controlling stake in planemaker Embraer SA's  commercial jet business to Boeing Co  to the next government, Defense Minister Joaquim Silva e Luna told Reuters on Friday.

Headlines: Sprint names Andrew Davies CFO
Description: Sprint Corp  said on Friday it named Andrew Davies chief financial officer ahead of its pending merger with rival T-Mobile US Inc .

Headlines: Trump says auto tariff probe will be completed in three-four weeks
Description: President Donald Trump said on Friday his administration's investigation into whether to increase tariffs on cars from the European Union and other trading partners would be completed in three to four weeks.

Headlines: McDonald's, Starbucks limit dine-in service in U.S. to slow coronavirus
Description: McDonald's Corp  and Starbucks Corp  have decided to close dine-in areas at many U.S. stores and shifted to take-away and delivery services, even as major cities ordered restaurants and bars closed to stop spread of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Rooftop revolution: Coronavirus chill upends solar power industry
Description: The booming rooftop solar panel industry nosedived overnight when the coronavirus forced homeowners to rein in spending and keep their distance from would-be installers.

Headlines: BlackRock's Fink expects 'huge' rush into underinvested stock market
Description: The U.S. economy is speeding up again after a slowdown in recent months and cash could soon start rushing into stocks as most investors are underinvested in the markets globally, BlackRock Inc's Chief Executive Larry Fink said on Tuesday.

Headlines: EU Justice Commissioner held 'constructive' talks with Facebook's Sandberg
Description: European Union Justice Commissioner Vera Jourova said she had a "constructive and open discussion" with Facebook Chief Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg about the Cambridge Analytica scandal on Thursday.

Headlines: Iran insists on ramping up oil sales to stay in nuclear pact: sources
Description: Iran insists on exporting at least 1.5 million barrels per day (bpd) of oil, triple May's expected levels under U.S. sanctions, as a condition for staying in an international nuclear deal, sources with knowledge of Iran-EU talks said.

Headlines: Airbus says Zephyr test flight for UK Ministry of Defence was 'interrupted'
Description: Airbus SE said on Thursday that a test flight of its Zephyr surveillance and communications drone in Australia for the British Ministry of Defence was "interrupted" due to adverse weather conditions last month.

Headlines: Bayer chairman backs management's strategy: Handelsblatt
Description: Bayer's supervisory board fully supports the company's management regarding its strategy, including the acquisition of Monsanto, Chairman Werner Wenning told business daily Handelsblatt on Thursday.

Headlines: Abbott revenue misses as heart devices eclipse diabetes gains
Description: Abbott Laboratories  fell just short of Wall Street estimates for quarterly revenue on Wednesday, as weakness in the medical device maker's cardiovascular business overshadowed strong performance in its fast-growing diabetes care unit.

Headlines: House Speaker casts doubt on Congress acting to stop trade tariffs
Description: U.S. House Speaker Paul Ryan said on Thursday that while he does not support President Donald Trump's moves to impose tariffs on major U.S. trading partners' goods, he questioned the wisdom of Congress taking legislative action to stop such sanctions.

Headlines: U.S.-China trade war takes toll on global manufacturing
Description: Factory activity weakened across much of Europe and Asia in December as the U.S.-China trade war and a slowdown in demand hit production in many economies, offering little reason for optimism as the new year begins.

Headlines: Trump administration considers boost to biofuel mandates to ease farmer anger: sources
Description: The Trump administration is considering ramping up biofuel blending quotas in the coming years to assuage anger in the Farm Belt over its recent broad use of waivers for small refineries, but is not planning to rescind any of the exemptions it has granted so far, four sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Chinese firms' missing $6 billion tests regulators' resolve
Description: Cash is considered among the hardest assets for a company to fake, which is why the disappearance of a combined $6.1 billion from two Chinese companies has dumbfounded investors and forced regulators to take action.

Headlines: U.S. mattress business springs back from pandemic shutdown
Description: The U.S. mattress business has bounced back after months of shutdowns from the coronavirus pandemic kept customers away.

Headlines: NY Fed's Dudley says regulators should increase focus on bank executives
Description: Banks should adopt compensation plans that discourage excessive risk-taking and place greater onus on senior managers for wrongdoing, the outgoing head of the New York Federal Reserve said on Monday.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. FBI is leading an inquiry into the Twitter hack, sources say
Description: The U.S. Federal Bureau of Investigation is leading a federal inquiry into the Twitter hacking, two sources familiar with the situation said, after hackers seized control of accounts belonging to Joe Biden, Kim Kardashian and others in what appeared to be a bitcoin scam.

Headlines: Barclays sees Carrefour-Casino merger as possible, pushing up Casino shares
Description: Shares in French retailer Casino  rose around 2% on Tuesday after Barclays said in a note that a tie-up with larger rival Carrefour  could be a possibility "given the difficulties encountered by Casino's majority shareholder."

Headlines: China has imposed counter tariffs on U.S. goods: China Daily
Description: China has implemented additional tariffs on some import products from the United States immediately after new U.S. tariffs took effect on Friday, the official English language China Daily newspaper reported

Headlines: Marathon Petroleum warns of loss, up to $7.8 billion hit on oil rout
Description: Marathon Petroleum Corp , the largest U.S. oil refiner, warned on Wednesday of a first-quarter loss on a roughly $7.8 billion write-down from a sharp fall in fuel demand.

Headlines: Instant view: U.S. fed funds rate breaks above Fed's target range
Description: A key interest rates the Federal Reserve aims to influence to control monetary policy broke above the top-end of the central bank's target range for the first time since the global credit crisis more than a decade ago.

Headlines: Citigroup hires Loretta Ko to head financial institution group
Description: Citigroup  has hired Loretta Ko to return to the  investment bank and head its financial institutions group (FIG) for Hong Kong, the bank said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. regulator drops fine against Citi over fair-lending claims - sources
Description: A top U.S. bank regulator has decided not to fine Citigroup for discriminating against minority mortgage borrowers, dropping the public rebuke that some officials had sought, two people familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Fed officials flag possible further steps in Fed crisis response
Description: Federal Reserve officials are deliberating over next steps in their response to the fallout from the coronavirus epidemic, with some urging a broad debate about how the central bank might help small and medium-sized businesses, policymakers said on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. economy expected to slow, damaged by trade war: Reuters poll
Description: U.S. economic growth will slow steadily in coming quarters after touching a four-year high in April-June, according to a Reuters poll of economists, who expect President Donald Trump's trade war to inflict damage.

Headlines: Nestle aims to shed skin unit to focus on food, nutrition
Description: Nestle  put its skin health unit up for sale on Thursday, as the maker of Nescafe and Perrier water ditches underperforming businesses and fends off criticism from an activist investor demanding an overhaul.

Headlines: Bayer, J&J settle U.S. Xarelto litigation for $775 million
Description: Bayer AG and Johnson & Johnson have agreed to settle more than 25,000 U.S. lawsuits over their blockbuster blood thinner Xarelto for a total of $775 million, court documents on Monday showed.

Headlines: Canada kicks off USMCA ratification process, urges bi-partisan co-operation
Description: Canada's minority Liberal government kicked off the ratification process for a new continental trade pact on Monday and urged opposition lawmakers to formally approve the deal as quickly as possible.

Headlines: IMF Bentham proposes to fund class action against Australia's AMP
Description: Litigation financier IMF Bentham Ltd said on Monday that it plans to fund a class action against AMP Ltd, Australia's largest listed wealth manager.

Headlines: American Airlines, Qatar Airways sign strategic partnership, codeshare deal
Description: American Airlines Group Inc  said Tuesday it has signed a strategic partnership deal with Qatar Airways and is reviving its codeshare agreement.

Headlines: Factbox: Alphabet's 'Other bets' in focus as Google's Pichai takes helm
Description: Google Chief Executive Officer Sundar Pichai will replace Larry Page as CEO of parent Alphabet Inc, heralding a new chapter for the company that helped reshape the global tech industry under its co-founders Page and Sergey Brin.

Headlines: Ericsson to add 300 U.S. jobs as 5G demand picks up
Description: Mobile telecom equipment maker Ericsson  said on Friday it would add around 300 jobs in the United States to meet rising demand for next-generation 5G equipment.

Headlines: U.S. pilots union asks government to subsidize empty seats on planes
Description: A major U.S. pilots union said on Wednesday it has begun discussing with key lawmakers a plan for the government to purchase seats on each flight to prevent passengers from having to sit next to strangers.

Headlines: China's central bank adviser says U.S. tariffs could cut GDP growth by 0.3 percentage points
Description: Plans by Washington to hike tariffs on $200 billion of Chinese goods could cut China's growth by 0.3 percentage points but the strengthening economy has become more resilient to external shocks, a Chinese central bank adviser said on Friday.

Headlines: Google begins responding to Texas antitrust investigators' data demands
Description: Texas officials managing a sprawling investigation of the advertising practices at Alphabet Inc's  Google  have begun receiving data from the search and advertising giant after two previous probes bogged down in extended document fights.

Headlines: ASEAN summit in Vietnam postponed until end-June over coronavirus
Description: A summit of Southeast Asian and other international leaders scheduled in Vietnam early next month has been postponed until end-June due to worries about coronavirus, Vietnam's Ministry of Foreign Affairs said on Thursday.

Headlines: Oil surges 8 percent after steep slide; growth fears still weigh
Description: Oil surged on Wednesday, posting its strongest daily gain in more than two years in a partial rebound from steep losses that pushed crude benchmarks to lows not seen since 2017.

Headlines: A year after Myanmar madrassas shuttered, street prayer organisers face Ramadan in jail
Description: When Cho Nwe Soe went to a Yangon court last month with her husband, she expected he would be fined for organising prayers in the street without a permit last year, and that they could go back home to prepare for Ramadan - the Muslim holy month.

Headlines: Germany to grant rescue liquidity for carrier Condor: sources
Description: Germany has agreed in principle to support struggling carrier Condor with emergency liquidity after the owner of Poland's national airline LOT pulled out of a deal to buy the airline, two people close to the matter said on Monday.

Headlines: Analysts' View: Impact of the U.S. protests on financial markets
Description: National Guard troops have been deployed in 15 U.S. states and the U.S. capital after five nights of violence and destruction that began with peaceful protests over the death of a black man, George Floyd, in police custody.

Headlines: Hitachi debacle strengthens Franco-Chinese hand in UK nuclear
Description: Hitachi's decision to freeze its $28 billion nuclear power project in Britain strengthens the hand of France's EDF and its Chinese partner in talks with the government on how to finance new reactors.

Headlines: Number of coronavirus infections tops 100,000 globally: Reuters tally
Description: The number of people infected by the new coronavirus globally surpassed 100,000 on Friday, according to a Reuters tally based on statements from health ministries and government officials.

Headlines: Airbus hits record highs, 737 MAX buyers fall on latest Boeing news
Description: Airbus'  shares hit record highs on Wednesday, after U.S. arch rival Boeing  warned of further delay in returning its grounded 737 MAX airliner to service, while Boeing customers and suppliers fell on the news.

Headlines: Zoom hits political turbulence in Washington, Beijing; lobbyists ready
Description: Zoom Video Communications, whose remote meeting app made the obscure California company a hub for global communications during the coronavirus pandemic, now finds itself fighting political battles in Washington and Beijing.

Headlines: Trump, U.S. lawmakers meet to discuss 'problematic' measure on China's ZTE
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump and a group of Republicans from the Senate and House of Representatives met at the White House on Wednesday to discuss their disagreement over how to penalize Chinese telecommunications company ZTE Corp.

Headlines: Wall Street ends up slightly as Fed minutes support cautious stance
Description: U.S. stocks ended higher on Wednesday after minutes from the Federal Reserve's last meeting reaffirmed for investors that the U.S. central bank would be "patient" with respect to further interest rate hikes.

Headlines: Honeywell says China growth slowing, tariffs to squeeze margins
Description: Honeywell  said on Friday it was seeing slower growth in China and that trade tariffs would squeeze margins and potentially cost it "hundreds of millions" of dollars in 2019.

Headlines: Customer deposits need protection in no-deal Brexit: EU watchdog
Description: The EU bank watchdog has urged member states to protect customer deposits in branches of British banks in the European Union if Britain leaves the bloc this month with no deal.

Headlines: Fashion shift online picks up even as stores reopen
Description: Retailers selling fashion online are emerging as the winners of the coronavirus crisis as consumers are staying home even as stores start to reopen, results from major companies showed on Thursday.

Headlines: Ethiopian Airlines CEO says preliminary crash report 'may be this week or next'
Description: Ethiopian Airlines Chief Executive Officer Tewolde Gebremariam said on Monday he expected the preliminary release of a report into the March 10 crash of its Boeing 737 800 MAX "maybe this week or next week".

Headlines: U.S. expected to grant Huawei 90-day license extension Monday: sources
Description: The Trump administration is set to issue a 90-day extension of a license on Monday allowing U.S. companies to continue doing business with China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd [HWT.UL], two sources familiar with the deliberations said.

Headlines: China reiterates support for Hong Kong government on extradition law
Description: China's central government firmly supports the Hong Kong government in passing an extradition law allowing people to be sent to mainland China for trial, the foreign ministry reiterated on Wednesday.

Headlines: Rite Aid shakes up top management, to cut about 400 U.S. jobs
Description: Rite Aid Corp said on Tuesday its chief executive officer would exit as part of a revamp of its leadership, and that it would slash about 400 corporate positions.

Headlines: Michael Kors-owner Capri says no plans to raise prices despite higher tariff threat
Description: Michael Kors-owner Capri Holdings Ltd  has no plans to raise prices even if tariffs on Chinese imports go up to 25%, Chief Executive Officer John Idol said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. firms say China tariffs will raise costs, see few sourcing alternatives
Description: A wide range of U.S. companies told a hearing in Washington on Monday that they have few alternatives other than China for producing clothing, electronics and other consumer goods as the Trump administration prepares new tariffs on remaining U.S.-China trade.

Headlines: U.S. carmaker Ford, India's Mahindra to develop SUVs, electric vehicle
Description: U.S. carmaker Ford Motor Co  and India's Mahindra & Mahindra  said on Thursday they have signed an agreement to develop midsize and compact sports utility vehicles (SUV) and an electric vehicle, which Ford could also potentially sell in other markets outside India.

Headlines: In a Nike factory in Argentina's hinterland, the ghost of Macri's fall
Description: Rumors of layoffs started spreading among workers at a factory here in northeastern Argentina making Nike Inc  shoes the night before Cristian Fredy Aquino's scheduled shift.

Headlines: Peloton feels the burn as post-IPO results point to more losses
Description: Shares in exercise bike fitness startup Peloton Interactive  sank 7% on Tuesday as the newly listed firm forecast a loss for fiscal 2020 and said it was choosing to focus on growth over profit for now.

Headlines: JPMorgan gets busy in repo lending after regulatory nod: CFO
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co  is putting more cash into overnight lending markets and holding less for a rainy day, after discussing the matter with regulators, the bank's finance chief said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Fed's Harker sees 'at most' one rate hike in 2019
Description: A strong U.S. job market and near-target inflation will warrant "at most" one interest rate increase in 2019 and one in 2020, Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia President Patrick Harker said on Thursday.

Headlines: Airbus aims to triple commercial aircraft services revenue in next decade
Description: Airbus wants to triple the revenue it gets from commercial aircraft services to $10 billion a year in next decade from $3.2 billion in 2017, it said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Wall Street rebounds on hopes for U.S.-China talks on trade
Description: The main U.S. stock indices advanced more than 2 percent on Monday, helping recoup some of last week's losses, amid signs that the United States and China were willing to negotiate on tariffs eased concerns about a trade war between the two countries.

Headlines: Honda, Nissan furlough U.S. workers as auto demand plummets
Description: Honda Motor Co  and Nissan Motor Co  on Tuesday said they had furloughed thousands of workers at their U.S. operations as the coronavirus pandemic slashes demand for cars in the country.

Headlines: Property speculators hope for investment paradise in southwest China
Description: A bus came to a halt amid a tropical rainforest not far from China's border with Myanmar, dropping off about 30 investors on a property tour, some with children in tow.

Headlines: Mirae Asset says sued after deadline miss on $5.8 billion Anbang U.S. hotels deal
Description: South Korean asset manager Mirae Asset Global Investments has been sued over a $5.8 billion deal to buy 15 U.S. hotels from China's Anbang Insurance Group after missing a deadline for the deal's closing, a Mirae spokesman said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Hulu spends $1.43 billion to buy back AT&T stake, values streaming service at $15 billion
Description: Hulu has bought back wireless carrier AT&T Inc's stake in the U.S. entertainment streaming service for $1.43 billion, in a deal that values Hulu at $15 billion, the two companies said on Monday.

Headlines: Lufthansa: We'll use the next seven days to try to solve wage dispute
Description: Lufthansa  said on Wednesday it would use the next seven days to try to reach a solution in a wage dispute with employees after trade union UFO said it would announce strikes if the airline does not make concessions.

Headlines: Hong Kong's sky-high property prices prove resilient in face of protests
Description: While months of Hong Kong protests have scared away tourists, sent jitters across the financial centre and cast a dark cloud over the local economy, there's one thing residents of the city are confident they can bank on - sky-high property prices.

Headlines: Shire bid marks Takeda's latest - and biggest - push for global status
Description: Takeda Pharmaceutical Co Ltd's  $64 billion bid for London-listed rare disease specialist Shire Plc  bolsters its credentials as Japan's most outward facing drugs firm, a mould-breaking image that has been more than a decade in the making.

Headlines: Automated delivery cashes in on pandemic-driven demand
Description: The coronavirus crisis is accelerating a shift in the world of autonomous cars toward delivering packages instead of people, as big players open up a lead over startups in the race for funding.

Headlines: Mercedes reviews vans model portfolio as diesel debate hammers sales
Description: Daimler  is reviewing the product portfolio at its vans division, where sales have been hit hard by doubts about the cleanliness of diesel engined vehicles, Mercedes-Benz executive Marcus Breitschwerdt said on Tuesday.

Headlines: GM Korea's board delays decision on bankruptcy filing to Monday: sources
Description: The board of General Motors'  South Korean unit delayed its decision on filing for court-led rehabilitation proceedings to Monday, said two sources familiar with the situation.

Headlines: Wearable device Fitbit to shift production out of China from January
Description: Fitbit Inc  will manufacture all its trackers and smart watches outside China from January, the wearable device maker said on Wednesday, the latest U.S. company looking to insulate itself from tariffs.

Headlines: Benetton holding says dismayed by road probe, hints at action
Description: Edizione, the Benetton family holding company which has a controlling stake in Italian infrastructure group Atlantia , said at the weekend it was dismayed by revelations of alleged safety violations in its road operations.

Headlines: U.S. dollar drops, yields rise after Trump comments on Fed policy and tariffs
Description: The U.S. dollar weakened, long term Treasury yields rose and stocks closed mostly lower on Friday after President Donald Trump complained again about the greenback's strength and about Federal Reserve interest rate rises.

Headlines: Exclusive: Boeing bid for Embraer unit faces EU antitrust probe - sources
Description: Boeing is set to face an EU antitrust investigation of up to five months into its bid for a controlling stake in the commercial aircraft arm of Brazil's Embraer, people familiar with the matter said on Monday.

Headlines: Trump threatens Harley-Davidson over European production move
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump threatened Harley-Davidson Inc with higher taxes on Tuesday and said the motorcycle maker, which he previously hailed as a model of American manufacturing, would suffer from a public backlash if it went ahead with a plan to move production for European customers overseas.

Headlines: Nonprofits urge Johnson & Johnson to halt sales of Baby Powder globally
Description: More than 170 nonprofit groups on Wednesday called for Johnson & Johnson to stop selling its talc-based Johnsons Baby Powder world-wide, citing concerns that it contains cancer-causing asbestos, according to a statement from advocacy group Black Women for Wellness.

Headlines: Wall Street Week Ahead: Even if Fed cut is a given, Powell seen as wild card for stock market
Description: U.S. Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell will have to walk a fine line to avoid roiling the stock market next week, even if the central bank delivers on expectations and lowers interest rates for the first time in more than a decade.

Headlines: U.S. Treasury's Mnuchin to give briefing on cryptocurrency on Monday
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin will give a briefing on cryptocurrency at 2:00 pm ET (1800 GMT) on Monday from the White House briefing room, a White House official said.

Headlines: U.S., Canada confirm they have reached new trade deal with Mexico
Description: The United States and Canada on Sunday confirmed they had reached a deal on a "new, modernized trade agreement," which is designed to replace the 1994 NAFTA pact.

Headlines: EU could expand ban to poultry from Brazil's BRF - report
Description: The European Union is likely to expand a ban on poultry imports  processed by Brazil's BRF SA , the world's largest chicken exporter, according to a local newspaper report on Saturday.

Headlines: Nissan picks Sakamoto as board candidate after Seki's resignation
Description: Nissan Motor Co  has selected executive officer Hideyuki Sakamoto as a candidate for the board of directors, the company said on Friday, following the surprise resignation of vice-chief operating officer Jun Seki earlier this week.

Headlines: House Democrats see progress on U.S.-Mexico-Canada trade deal, passage possible this year
Description: U.S. House Democrats said on Thursday they ironed out some differences with the White House over a trade agreement with Canada and Mexico, and Congress could still vote on the deal - one of President Donald Trump's top priorities - this year.

Headlines: In China payment war, Walmart places bet on Tencent
Description: Walmart Inc has placed a bet on Tencent Holdings Ltd's mobile payment system, giving the tech giant a boost in its battle with Alibaba Group Holding Ltd for pole position in China's fast-growing payments market.

Headlines: Japan minister flying to Lebanon to make case for Ghosn's return
Description: Japan's deputy justice minister is traveling to Lebanon this weekend to try to make the case that fugitive ex-Nissan  Chairman Carlos Ghosn should stand trial in Japan.

Headlines: Explainer: China's rare earth supplies could be vital bargaining chip in U.S. trade war
Description: Rare earth elements are used in a wide range of consumer products, from iPhones to electric car motors, as well as military jet engines, satellites and lasers.

Headlines: Despite gun debate, Sturm Ruger board faced little opposition
Description: Gunmaker Sturm Ruger & Co  directors faced little opposition at its recent board election, a securities filing showed on Monday, despite its policy of not talking with shareholders even in the midst of a national debate over gun control.

Headlines: Uber shares likely to fall in stock market debut
Description: Uber Technologies Inc shares are likely to open below their initial public offering price of $45 in their long-awaited market debut on Friday, early price indications showed.

Headlines: Japan's SoftBank to open Saudi Arabian office: sources
Description: SoftBank  is planning to open a Saudi Arabian office, two sources familiar with the matter told Reuters on Tuesday, further strengthening its ties with the kingdom.

Headlines: U.S. factory activity in March was weakest since 2009: IHS Markit
Description: The U.S. manufacturing sector contracted in March, with activity hitting its lowest level since 2009, as the coronavirus pandemic caused widespread shortages, a survey confirmed on Wednesday.

Headlines: Green Growth to launch hostile bid for pot producer Aphria
Description: U.S. cannabis retailer Green Growth Brands Ltd  said on Thursday it would make a hostile takeover bid for Aphria Inc  in an all-stock deal valuing the Canadian pot producer at C$2.8 billion ($2.06 billion).

Headlines: U.S. lawmakers take jabs at Amazon, Big Tech in antitrust hearing
Description: Lawmakers on the House Judiciary Committee's antitrust panel pressed an executive from Amazon.com Inc on Tuesday about allegations that it competed against its own sellers and pushed them to buy advertising and fulfillment services.

Headlines: Airbnb hires Amazon veteran as CFO ahead of potential IPO
Description: Home-renting company Airbnb Inc on Monday hired Amazon.com Inc  veteran Dave Stephenson as chief financial officer (CFO), ahead of a widely anticipated initial public offering next year.

Headlines: Boeing, Jackson Square reach firm agreement for 30 737 MAX 8 aircraft
Description: Boeing Co  and U.S. aircraft leasing firm Jackson Square Aviation said on Monday they had reached a firm agreement over the purchase of 30 737 MAX 8 aircraft.

Headlines: Fed raises rates, signals confidence in strengthening economy
Description: The Federal Reserve raised interest rates on Wednesday and forecast at least two more hikes for 2018, signaling growing confidence U.S. tax cuts and government spending will boost the economy and inflation and lead to more aggressive future tightening.

Headlines: Mexico national guard to deploy on southern border from Monday: minister
Description: Mexico's National Guard will begin deploying on Mexico's southern border with Guatemala from Monday to contain the flow of migrants headed to the United States, Mexican Foreign Minister Marcelo Ebrard said on Friday.

Headlines: With inflation elusive, two Fed policymakers lay out a welcome mat
Description: Worried that current low inflation expectations will sap the U.S. central bank's ability to combat a future downturn, two Federal Reserve officials on Thursday made an unusual pitch: if inflation rises unexpectedly, the Fed should lay out the welcome mat.

Headlines: Huawei units plead not guilty to U.S. trade secret theft
Description: Huawei Device Co Ltd and Huawei Device USA Inc pleaded not guilty to U.S. fraud, trade secrets conspiracy and other charges, and a trial date was set for March 2020, the Justice Department said on Thursday.

Headlines: Salesforce announces $2.2 billion French investment as Macron meets Trump
Description: U.S. software company Salesforce  will invest more than $2.2 billion in its French business over the next five years, it said on Tuesday, in another sign of America Inc's new love affair with France since President Emmanuel Macron's election.

Headlines: Huawei pleads not guilty to U.S. charges in New York court
Description: China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd on Thursday pleaded not guilty to a 13-count indictment filed in a New York federal court against the company, as tensions have ratcheted up between the U.S. and Beijing.

Headlines: Berkshire sells entire stakes in U.S. airlines: Buffett
Description: Berkshire Hathaway Inc  sold its entire stakes in the four largest U.S. airlines in April, Chairman Warren Buffett said Saturday at the company's annual meeting, saying "the world has changed" for the aviation industry.

Headlines: EU parliament gets Facebook answers after Zuckerberg meeting
Description: The European Parliament distributed on Thursday what it called a first set of written replies from Facebook to oral questions put by lawmakers to CEO Mark Zuckerberg at a meeting in Brussels on Tuesday.

Headlines: Facebook should not be trusted with 'crazy' cryptocurrency plan: senators
Description: Democratic and Republican lawmakers said on Tuesday that Facebook Inc's track record of what they described as untrustworthiness should stand in the way of it launching a digital currency, labeling the plan "delusional" and "crazy" at a Senate hearing.

Headlines: Gene testing firm gets 25-year ban in $42.6 million kickback settlement
Description: A New Orleans-based genetics testing company and its three principals will pay $42.6 million to resolve charges they defrauded the federal government by paying kickbacks for referrals and billing for medically unnecessary tests, the U.S. Department of Justice said on Wednesday.

Headlines: London judge discharges jury in landmark Barclays Qatar case
Description: A London jury has been discharged in a landmark fraud trial of four former Barclays executives accused of paying Qatar undisclosed fees to help rescue the bank at the height of the credit crisis in 2008.

Headlines: Boeing to restart operations at Philadelphia area plants next week
Description: Boeing Co  said on Friday it would resume operations at production facilities in Philadelphia next week after a two week suspension due to the spread of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Explainer: Unraveling the Boeing 737 MAX Lion Air crash
Description: The crash of a Boeing Co 737 MAX jet in Indonesia on Oct. 29 has raised questions on whether the manufacturer shared enough information with regulators, airlines and pilots about the systems on the latest version of its popular narrow-body plane.

Headlines: Toshiba shares slump after sale of U.S. LNG business canceled
Description: Toshiba Corp shares fell by the most in two months on Friday after an agreement to offload its U.S. liquefied natural gas (LNG) business collapsed, a blow for the Japanese company which has been shedding assets to turn around its business.

Headlines: Size of OPEC+ oil cuts will depend on how much others cut: source
Description: Any final agreement for how much OPEC and its allies, a group know as OPEC+, will cut during their talks on Thursday would depend on the volumes that other producers such as the United States, Canada and Brazil are willing to reduce, an OPEC source said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Google-parent Alphabet to donate $800 million in response to coronavirus crisis
Description: Alphabet Inc  will donate more than $800 million in funds towards producing medical supplies used to fight COVID-19, and in ad credits to government and health organizations and businesses, Chief Executive Officer Sundar Pichai said on Friday.

Headlines: CVS, Aetna win U.S. approval for $69 billion deal
Description: Pharmacy chain CVS Health Corp  won U.S. antitrust approval for its $69 billion acquisition of health insurer Aetna Inc , the Justice Department said on Wednesday, paving the way for a combination with potential to cut U.S. healthcare costs for consumers.

Headlines: A poorer student falls behind in Hong Kong as coronavirus forces online learning
Description: When Hong Kong student Wendy received a question from her geography teacher during an online class, she scrambled to unmute her mother's cellphone, but the screen kept freezing. She had already used up her monthly five gigabytes data allowance.

Headlines: Volvo warns some vehicle engines may exceed emission limits
Description: Sweden's Volvo  warned on Tuesday that some of its truck and bus engines could be exceeding limits for nitrogen oxide emissions as an emissions control component it uses was degrading more quickly than expected, sending its shares lower.

Headlines: Alibaba demotes top executive after probe into behaviour: source
Description: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba Group Holding Ltd  has demoted Jiang Fan, one of its most senior executives, after an internal investigation into allegations of improper behaviour, according to a person familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Trump says Prince Harry is a terrific guy, denies casting Meghan as 'nasty'
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said Britain's Prince Harry was a terrific guy and denied casting his American-born wife, Meghan, as a nasty person, claiming media had distorted his words as he actually felt she was very nice.

Headlines: Teva Pharm to close plant in Israel after no buyer found
Description: Debt-laden Teva Pharmaceutical Industries said on Monday it would close an unprofitable plant in the Israeli port city of Ashdod in March 2019 after failing to find a buyer for the facility.

Headlines: 'Intensive' talks on Lufthansa with EU Commission ongoing: Germany
Description: Berlin is in intensive talks with the European Commission over a planned bailout for flagship German carrier Lufthansa , a government spokesman said on Friday.

Headlines: Trump says Huawei dispute could be resolved in trade deal with China
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump characterized Chinese telecommunications giant Huawei Technologies Co Ltd as very dangerous on Thursday but said its dispute with the United States could be resolved in a trade deal with China.

Headlines: Investors raise bets against Tesla shares - S3 Partners
Description: Investors raised their bets against Tesla Inc shares by 10 percent since mid-March on the view that the market was too optimistic on the electric car maker's prospects, financial analytics firm S3 Partners said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Walmart to invest $250 million in joint venture with content firm Eko: source
Description: Walmart Inc  has signed a joint venture with Eko, a developer of interactive video content, to attract shoppers and boost customer engagement, and will invest $250 million in the venture as well as a funding round, a source with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Indonesia finds design flaw, oversight lapses in 737 MAX crash: WSJ
Description: Indonesian investigators have found that design and oversight lapses played a key role in the October 2018 crash of Boeing Co's  737 MAX jet that killed all 189 people aboard, the Wall Street Journal said on Sunday.

Headlines: Coronavirus turmoil fuels the rise of AI-powered companies
Description: For the past seven years, a Munich-based firm called riskmethods has tried to interest companies in buying software that allows them to track all their suppliers in a way that minimizes risks in operating globally spread supply chains.

Headlines: Starbucks brings Beyond Meat and Oatly to China with new plant-based lunch menu
Description: Starbucks Corp  said on Monday it would roll out a plant-based food and beverage menu in China this week, launching Beyond Meat Inc  and Oatly products in a country which is trying to recover from coronavirus shutdowns.

Headlines: Explainer: What extra U.S. farm products could China buy?
Description: China has agreed to make unspecified new purchases of farm products from the United States, President Donald Trump said after meeting his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping in Japan.

Headlines: Cambridge Analytica and British parent shut down after Facebook scandal
Description: Cambridge Analytica, the firm embroiled in a controversy over its handling of Facebook Inc  user data, and its British parent SCL Elections Ltd, are shutting down immediately after suffering a sharp drop in business, the company said on Wednesday.

Headlines: IMF's Lagarde says China's Belt and Road should only go where sustainable
Description: China's massive Belt and Road infrastructure program should only go where it is needed and where the debt it generates can be sustained, International Monetary Fund Managing Director Christine Lagarde said on Friday.

Headlines: White House adviser will not rule out more money for states, small businesses
Description: White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Sunday he would not rule out anything in a new relief bill to ease the "tremendous hardships" of the coronavirus outbreak, including more money for state and local governments and small businesses.

Headlines: PG&E creditors propose $35 billion exit plan: Bloomberg
Description: Some creditors of PG&E Corp, including Elliott Management Corp and Pacific Investment Management Co (Pimco), are proposing a $35 billion plan for the California power utility to exit bankruptcy within a year, Bloomberg reported late on Wednesday.

Headlines: Qatar Airways defers half of some employees' wages for three months
Description: Qatar Airways on Tuesday said mid-level employees and above will have their salaries halved for at least three months but that staff would be back paid when the airline could afford it.

Headlines: Airbus first-half deliveries hit 16-year low despite June bounce
Description: Airbus  deliveries rose 50% in June compared with May and reached their highest level since the coronavirus crisis spread to Europe in March, but the accelerating recovery failed to prevent first-half deliveries from sliding to a 16-year low.

Headlines: Undeterred, Facebook to press on with Libra launch next year: executive
Description: Facebook still aims to launch its Libra digital currency next year, its executive overseeing the project told Swiss newspaper NZZ, as the company presses ahead despite authorities around the world pouring cold water on the plans.

Headlines: Walmart opts to leave CVS partnerships over pricing dispute
Description: CVS Health Corp  said on Tuesday Walmart Inc  is leaving its network for commercial and Medicaid prescription drug plans after the two companies failed to agree on pricing.

Headlines: Brazil, Mexico currencies both rebound but real has more legs than peso
