Description: The Brazilian real and Mexican peso have both rebounded strongly in recent weeks, but their rallies are starting to diverge with the peso running out of steam and the real gaining momentum.

Headlines: JPMorgan Chase takes smartphone account 'Finn' nationwide
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co  said on Thursday that it is now offering a digital bank account for smartphones nationally after testing and refining the app in St. Louis since October.

Headlines: Viacom profit beats on cost cuts, success of 'Bumblebee'
Description: Media company Viacom Inc beat quarterly profit estimates on Friday, as costs fell and its Paramount Pictures division gained from the success of its movies "Bumblebee" and "What Men Want".

Headlines: OPEC, Russia debate deeper oil cuts as new glut looms
Description: OPEC and its allies led by Russia are gearing up to approve deeper oil production cuts this week to prevent a new glut and a collapse on oil prices with OPEC member Iraq saying the move was supported by key members.

Headlines: GlaxoSmithKline prescribes commercial reboot for pharma division
Description: In January, GlaxoSmithKline's  new head of pharmaceuticals Luke Miels issued a blunt challenge to his managers: find budget savings of 20 percent.

Headlines: PepsiCo margin slip clouds profit beat, North America beverage rebound
Description: PepsiCo Inc's  quarterly profit margins disappointed investors on Tuesday as commodity and transportation costs jumped, overshadowing an earnings beat fueled by growth in emerging markets and a rebound in North American beverage sales.

Headlines: Toymaker Lego shuts all stores outside of China due to virus
Description: Danish toymaker Lego said on Wednesday it would close all of its stores, except for those in China, until at least March 27 due to the spread of coronavirus.

Headlines: Greensill drops libel suit against Reuters over bond story
Description: Greensill Capital said it has dropped a libel suit against Reuters over a story which said that the financing group had provided a false statement to market participants in 2018.

Headlines: Trade war fears ebb as U.S., China agree to continue talks
Description: Washington and Beijing both claimed victory on Monday as the world's two largest economies stepped back from the brink of a global trade war and agreed to hold further talks to boost U.S. exports to China.

Headlines: Deutsche Post says its freight unit needs to improve - report
Description: Deutsche Post DHL Group's  freight unit has to improve significantly to make sure the German logistics group hits its 2020 targets, its chief financial officer told a German newspaper.

Headlines: U.S. oil firms likely to 'organically' cut four million barrels per day: regulator
Description: OPEC members and other oil producers need to cut at least 20 million barrels per day of output, a Texas oil and gas regulator said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Oil gains while U.S. crude's discount to Brent deepens
Description: Oil prices rose on Monday as OPEC reported that the global oil glut has been virtually eliminated, while U.S. crude's discount to global benchmark Brent widened to more than $7, its deepest in five months.

Headlines: Mazda aims for all of its vehicles to be electric hybrid, EVs by 2030
Description: Mazda Motor Corp  said on Tuesday that all of the vehicles it produces by 2030 will incorporate electrification, while 5 percent of its cars will be all-battery electric vehicles (EVs).

Headlines: After years serving CEOs, Goldman's Ayco also wants other workers
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc is expanding a financial advisory service for top executives to target millions of other affluent employees at some of the biggest U.S. companies, as it seeks to build its retail and wealth management businesses.

Headlines: Bayer shares fall after judge questions part of proposed Roundup settlement
Description: Bayer shares fell more 6% on Tuesday after a U.S. judge questioned part of the German company's proposed settlement to deal with future claims relating to allegations that its widely used weedkiller Roundup caused cancer.

Headlines: Occidental's victory over Chevron for Anadarko
Description: Before Occidental Petroleum Corp clinched a deal on Thursday to buy Anadarko Petroleum Corp for $38 billion, it pursued its U.S. oil and gas exploration and production rival for nearly two years, culminating in the sector's most high-profile public contest since the 1980s.

Headlines: Under fire Danske Bank faces fresh money laundering inquiry
Description: Danske Bank  faced a new Danish money laundering inquiry on Thursday as political anger spread over a scandal involving 200 billion euros ($234 billion) in payments, many of which were suspicious, through Estonia.

Headlines: Sony stock surges after Reuters reports Third Point re-building stake
Description: Sony Corp shares surged more than 9 percent on Tuesday after a Reuters report saying Third Point LLC was again raising its stake in the Japanese conglomerate stoked speculation that fund owner Daniel Loeb was preparing to agitate for more change.

Headlines: U.S. seeks Warhol, Monet paintings linked to 1MDB scandal
Description: The U.S. Department of Justice on Wednesday said it was looking to recover another $96 million in assets in real estate and artwork allegedly linked to the 1Malaysia Development Berhad (1MDB) international money-laundering conspiracy.

Headlines: Stocks tumble to worst day in six weeks after Trump tariff action
Description: U.S. stocks slumped on Thursday as President Donald Trump's move to impose tariffs on up to $60 billion of Chinese imports drove fears about the impact on the global economy, fueling the biggest percentage declines in Wall Street's three major indexes since they entered correction territory six weeks ago.

Headlines: Amazon files lawsuit contesting Pentagon's $10 billion cloud contract to Microsoft
Description: Amazon.com Inc filed a lawsuit in a federal U.S. court on Friday contesting the U.S. Defense Department's decision last month to award a Pentagon cloud computing contract worth up to $10 billion to rival bidder Microsoft Corp.

Headlines: Dollar Tree chops value of Family Dollar brand, to shut 390 stores
Description: Dollar Tree Inc announced plans to close hundreds more Family Dollar stores on Wednesday as it wrote off $2.7 billion, or nearly a third of the value of the struggling discount chain it bought for $9 billion four years ago.

Headlines: Exxon could delay third Guyana project as government review drags on
Description: Exxon Mobil Corp  said on Tuesday that production at the Payara project, its third development in Guyana, could be postponed due to delays in government approvals as the company scales back spending elsewhere due to the crude price crash.

Headlines: Indivior says Reckitt settlement in U.S. unrelated to its cases
Description: Drugmaker Indivior Plc said on Thursday its former parent Reckitt Benckiser's $1.4 billion settlement with authorities in the United States was separate to its ongoing legal proceedings.

Headlines: Abu Dhabi state investor Mubadala halts business with Goldman Sachs amid 1MDB lawsuit
Description: Abu Dhabi state investor Mubadala has suspended new business dealings with Goldman Sachs since its subsidiary filed a lawsuit in November against the U.S. bank and others to recover losses suffered through its dealings with Malaysian state fund 1MDB.

Headlines: Best Buy shares surge 16 percent on upbeat profit view, robust holiday quarter
Description: Best Buy Co Inc shares surged 16 percent on Wednesday after it gave an upbeat profit forecast for the year and reported better-than-expected holiday-quarter sales.

Headlines: Goodbye inverted yield curve? Fed looks for alternative signals to guide policy
Description: Federal Reserve officials are scouring new niches of the financial markets to find signals accurate enough to warn the central bank when it is time to stop hiking interest rates before they risk tipping the economy into a recession.

Headlines: Facebook apology does little to satisfy lawmakers, Wall Street
Description: Facebook Inc came under further pressure from lawmakers, investors, advertisers and users on Thursday, the day after Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg admitted the social media network made mistakes in letting 50 million users' data get into the hands of political consultancy Cambridge Analytica.

Headlines: Ryanair rejects UK guidance for passengers to check in all luggage
Description: Ryanair  on Thursday rejected new British government guidance for passengers to check in all luggage including hand bags, saying it would instead recommend that passengers minimise checked-in luggage.

Headlines: Navistar to develop self-driving trucks with TuSimple
Description: Truck maker Navistar International Corp  has bought a minority stake in TuSimple and aims to co-develop self-driving trucks by 2024 with the technology company as it rolls out a national U.S. autonomous freight network, the two companies said on Wednesday.

Headlines: MGM Resorts withdraws 2020 financial targets on coronavirus hit
Description: MGM Resorts International  withdrew its forecast for 2020 on Wednesday, as it assesses the fallout of the coronavirus epidemic on its business.

Headlines: High-flying IPO stocks sell off after quarterly results
Description: Three of Wall Street's top-performing IPO stocks in 2019 tumbled late on Thursday after the companies' quarterly results failed to satisfy investors and justify their high valuations.

Headlines: Wall Street bounces back as stimulus hopes soothe recession fears
Description: Wall Street roared back to life on Tuesday, rebounding from the brink of bear market confirmation as bargain-hunting and hopes of government stimulus calmed investors' fears surrounding the coronavirus and growing signs of imminent recession.

Headlines: Britain's Saga links up with Goldman to tap over-50s savings
Description: Saga, the British tourism and insurance firm for the over-50s, said on Tuesday it ways teaming up with Goldman Sachs on savings products, as part of a drive to revive its bottom line after a profit warning in April.

Headlines: Basel tells big banks that simple might be better
Description: Big investment banks should accept that simple may be better when it comes to new rules for capital requirements to protect them from trading risks, a top regulator said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. manufacturing shrinks, 10-year yield hits three-year low
Description: U.S. Treasury yields fell on Tuesday, with the benchmark 10-year yield hitting its lowest since July 2016, after U.S. manufacturing data showed the first contraction since 2016 on worries about a weakening global economy and U.S.-China trade tensions.

Headlines: New dam disaster puts Vale CEO, deals and dividends under scrutiny
Description: When Fabio Schvartsman took the reins of Vale SA in 2017, he suggested a motto for the world's largest iron miner, turning the page on a tailings dam disaster that hit a small Brazilian town two years before: "Mariana, never again."

Headlines: Novartis recruits new compliance head from Siemens after ethics stumbles
Description: Novartis  has recruited a new chief ethics officer from Siemens  after costly bribery scandals and a disputed $1.2 million contract with President Donald Trump's former lawyer that the Swiss drugmaker now calls a mistake.

Headlines: Trade off: China soybean imports set for biggest drop in 12 years amid tariff conflict
Description: China's soybean imports are set to drop by a quarter in the last three months of 2018, their biggest fall in at least 12 years as buyers curb purchases amid the Sino-U.S. trade war and high domestic stockpiles.

Headlines: At IPO road show, Lyft executives look to lower insurance costs
Description: Lyft Inc executives are focused on cutting insurance costs and will phase in self-driving vehicles on simple routes first, they said at a road show for investors ahead of the ride-hailing company's initial public offering set for next week.

Headlines: Take Five: The virus data fog
Description: The first data releases coming out for February make for grim reading: China's factories were dealt a devastating blow last month as the coronavirus epidemic triggered the sharpest contraction in activity on record, with the health crisis paralysing large parts of the economy.

Headlines: LaSalle Hotel accepts Blackstone's $3.7 billion cash offer
Description: (This story corrects paragraph 9 to remove wrong reference to La Salle owning 'W' Los Angeles in May 21 story.)

Headlines: Wall Street Week Ahead: Investors look beyond drug makers as hunt for COVID-19 treatment heats up
Description: Investors are diversifying bets in the healthcare sector, as the rush to develop treatments for Covid-19 has driven up prices for some pharmaceutical stocks.

Headlines: Rolls-Royce considering cutting up to 15% of its workforce - source
Description: British aero-engine maker Rolls-Royce Holdings  is considering cutting up to 15% of its workforce, a source close to the company told Reuters, as customers cut production and airlines park planes due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: J.P. Morgan to settle allegations of violating sanctions: U.S. Treasury
Description: J.P. Morgan Chase Bank  has agreed to pay $5.3 million to settle allegations it violated Cuban Assets Control Regulations, Iranian sanctions and Weapons of Mass Destruction sanctions 87 times, the U.S. Treasury said on Friday.

Headlines: Turkish Airlines extends flight cancellations until May 20
Description: Turkish Airlines  has extended the cancellation of international flights to May 20 from May 1 over the coronavirus outbreak, the airline said on Tuesday, adding that domestic flights would remain suspended until April 20.

Headlines: Qualcomm asks U.S. judge to put anti-trust ruling on hold while chipmaker appeals
Description: Qualcomm Inc on Tuesday asked a federal judge not to enforce her decision that it illegally squeezed out rivals in the smartphone chips market as it plans to file an appeal that could take more than a year to wind through the courts.

Headlines: Coronavirus wipes $70 billion off global listed airlines
Description: The rapid spread of coronavirus has wiped almost a third - or $70 billion - off the world's top 20 listed airlines and reshuffled global rankings, elevating Air China into third place behind U.S. rivals, an analysis by Reuters shows.

Headlines: Volkswagen replaces Herbert Diess as CEO of the VW brand
Description: Volkswagen  replaced Herbert Diess as chief executive of the VW brand on Monday and installed chief operating officer Ralf Brandstaetter to lead cost cutting efforts at the company's largest plants in Germany.

Headlines: Oil near flat; virus impact offsets Libya supply disruptions
Description: Oil prices were near flat on Tuesday, pressured by concerns over the impact on crude demand from the coronavirus outbreak in China, but prices drew support from a reduction in supply from Libya.

Headlines: American Airlines' profit margin forecast helps shares up
Description: American Airlines  shares rose 4 percent on Thursday after the company said its profit margin for the current quarter would be higher than most on Wall Street expected, helped by a dip in fuel costs from their recent spike.

Headlines: Police body camera maker Axon sues U.S. FTC over antitrust litigation
Description: Axon Enterprise Inc  on Friday sued the U.S. Federal Trade Commission in a bid to have antitrust proceedings over an acquisition heard in a federal court and not in an internal FTC process, claiming that the FTC's ability to both prosecute and judge cases deprives companies of their constitutional rights.

Headlines: Bridgewater, Viking among big hedge funds that added Tesla in fourth quarter before rally
Description: Billionaire Ray Dalio's Bridgewater Associates, Viking Global Investors, and Granite Point Capital were among prominent hedge funds placing new bets on electric carmaker Tesla Inc  in the fourth quarter, positioning them to gain from its nearly 100% rally over the first six weeks of the year.

Headlines: T-Mobile reschedules analyst call without giving reason
Description: T-Mobile US Inc  has rescheduled a call with analysts that was to be held on Thursday following its earnings release, the company said on its website.

Headlines: Top Michelin executives agree to pay cuts to help with COVID-19 response
Description: French tyre company Michelin  said on Monday that its leading executives had agreed to take pay cuts as a gesture of solidarity to help deal with the negative effects of the hit to its business from the COVID-19 outbreak.

Headlines: Norwegian Air to overhaul its strategy in wake of pandemic: bondholder
Description: Norwegian Air , which is seeking creditor support for its rescue plan, has told bondholders it will overhaul its strategy in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic, according to an investor who took part in a briefing by the airline on Friday.

Headlines: Russia's major state banks see forex outflow amid sanctions threats
Description: Russia's largest lenders, state-owned Sberbank  and VTB , saw outflows of foreign currency deposits in August amid a rouble depreciation and concerns about new U.S. sanctions, according to an analysis of central bank data.

Headlines: Exclusive: Europe regulator to clear Boeing 737 MAX in January at earliest
Description: European regulators expect to clear Boeing's grounded 737 MAX to return to service in January at the earliest, following flight trials by European test pilots scheduled for mid-December, Europe's top aviation safety official told Reuters.

Headlines: Fast Retailing reopens more Uniqlo stores as pandemic measures ease
Description: Casual clothing chain Uniqlo has reopened more stores in the past week and plans to resume business at more shops in coming days as governments ease coronavirus restrictions, its owner Fast Retailing  said on Thursday.

Headlines: China Vice Premier Liu may still travel to U.S. this week: SCMP
Description: China Vice Premier Liu He could still travel to the United States for trade negotiations but shorten his trip or cancel it altogether, South China Morning Post reported on Monday, citing an unnamed source briefed on the latest plans.

Headlines: Majority of EU states back suspension of air travel refunds, France says
Description: Germany, Italy and Spain have joined a call by 12 European Union governments for the EU's executive body to suspend rules forcing crisis-hit airlines to offer full cash refunds for cancelled flights, France said in a statement on Saturday.

Headlines: U.S.: China reneged on trade commitments, sparking Trump tariff hike
Description: China backtracked on substantial commitments it made during trade talks with the United States, prompting President Donald Trump to impose additional tariffs on Chinese goods slated to go into effect on Friday, top U.S. trade officials said on Monday.

Headlines: Uber disabled emergency braking in self-driving car: U.S. agency
Description: Uber had disabled an emergency braking system in a self-driving vehicle that struck and killed a woman in Arizona in March even though the car had identified the need to apply the brakes, the National Transportation Safety Board said in a preliminary report released on Thursday.

Headlines: Volkswagen furloughs workers in Brazil as demand from depressed Argentina weakens
Description: Volkswagen's  Brazil operation is putting workers on a 20-day furlough, the company said on Monday, citing reduced demand from Argentina, which is undergoing an economic crisis that has derailed growth and slashed spending power.

Headlines: BP profit again outstrips forecasts, lifted by higher oil output
Description: A strong rise in oil and gas production helped BP  offset weaker crude prices and refining profit to again beat profit expectations on Tuesday, boosting its shares.

Headlines: Boeing to freeze hiring as cash woes mount over coronavirus, 737 MAX
Description: Boeing Co  is freezing new hiring and overtime except in certain critical areas to preserve cash, the U.S. planemaker's CEO said on Wednesday, as the coronavirus outbreak compounds the fallout from a year-old grounding of its money-spinning 737 MAX.

Headlines: EU should draw up list of medicines to be produced in Europe, says German health minister
Description: The European Union should draw up a list of active substances used in medicines whose production should be brought back to Europe to reduce dependency on China, German Health Minister Jens Spahn said on Monday.

Headlines: Bank of America picks ex Macron adviser Mourad to run investment banking for France: sources
Description: Bank of America  has hired Morgan Stanley veteran Bernard Mourad, who recently worked as an adviser to French President Emmanuel Macron, as its new head of corporate and investment banking for France, three sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: PSA Group 2019 sales slump 10% after record 2018
Description: French carmaker PSA Group  said on Thursday global sales fell 10% last year to 3.49 million units, compared with a record 3.88 million in 2018, as it suffered from declining volumes in China, the Middle East and Africa.

Headlines: U.S. Justice Department set to decide on T-Mobile, Sprint merger as soon as next week: source
Description: The U.S. Justice Department is set to decide as early as next week whether to approve the $26.5-billion merger of wireless carriers T-Mobile USA and Sprint Corp, a person briefed on the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: Factbox: How Australia plans to curb Facebook and Google's market power
Description: The Australian Competition and Consumer Commission has found, after an 18-month investigation, that Google and Facebook hold enormous power in the country's online advertising and news distribution markets, and that antitrust and privacy laws have not caught up to the real world.

Headlines: German cabin crew union plans further strikes at Lufthansa
Description: German cabin crew union UFO said on Saturday it was planning further strikes at Lufthansa  to increase pressure on management after talks with Germany's largest airline and two potential mediators did not yield any results.

Headlines: Oil, shares fall on potential limit on China investments
Description: Crude oil prices and a gauge of global equity markets fell on Friday after a report said the administration of U.S. President Donald Trump was weighing limits on the flow of U.S. portfolio investments into China.

Headlines: Factbox: China's tariffs on U.S. commodities and energy
Description: (The August 26 story corrects paragraph on pork to say total tariffs include the most favored nation tariff of 12%, not value added tax of 12%.)

Headlines: Continental Resources founder Hamm to step down as CEO
Description: Legendary U.S. oilman Harold Hamm, who once called the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries a "toothless tiger," will step down as chief executive of Continental Resources  and become its executive chairman, the company said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Vale shares fall after CEO is 'temporarily' ousted after dam disaster
Description: Shares in Brazil's Vale SA, the world's largest iron-ore miner, fell on Monday after its CEO Fabio Schvartsman and three other executives resigned over the weekend following a dam collapse in January that left over 300 dead.

Headlines: Ruling on Ryanair bid to delay COO's easyJet move set for next week
Description: An Irish High Court judge hopes to rule next week on whether Ryanair  can prevent its operations chief Peter Bellew from joining arch-rival easyJet  until 2021.

Headlines: Exclusive: India government asked banks to save Jet, avoid bankruptcy - sources
Description: India's government has asked state-run banks to rescue privately held Jet Airways without pushing it into bankruptcy, as Prime Minister Narendra Modi seeks to avert thousands of job losses weeks before a general election, two people within the administration told Reuters.

Headlines: Hong Kong on track for global IPO crown but many new listings sag
Description: Hong Kong is on course to take the global IPO crown this year for the most money raised in stock market flotations, narrowly ahead of arch-rival New York, but its new listings have posted the worst performance among leading bourses, data show.

Headlines: SAP reverts to co-CEOs after showman McDermott's decade of growth
Description: Bill McDermott stood down on Friday after a decade building up SAP  as the world's leading enterprise software company, handing the task of completing its transition to cloud computing to new co-CEOs Jennifer Morgan and Christian Klein.

Headlines: Trump mulling probe of auto imports on national security grounds
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump is considering launching a trade investigation of auto imports on national security grounds, a senior Trump administration official said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Bank investors await U.S. stress test results for capital returns
Description: U.S. investors expect banks and other financial institutions to announce large returns of capital to shareholders after the Federal Reserve publishes the first set of results from its annual stress test late Thursday.

Headlines: AB InBev told Indian authorities about cartel, triggering anti-trust probe
Description: An Indian anti-trust probe into beer price-fixing allegations was initiated after the world's largest brewer Anheuser-Busch InBev told the authorities last year it had detected an industry cartel, three people familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Singapore's migrant workers fear financial ruin after virus ordeal
Description: As Sharif Uddin contemplates leaving the cramped Singapore dormitory where he has spent weeks under coronavirus quarantine, fears about his future creep in.

Headlines: Trump giving Japan's Abe a hard time on trade despite close ties
Description: Tariffs on steel, threats of car import levies and intense  pressure for a two-way economic deal: despite warm personal ties, U.S. President Donald Trump is giving Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe a decidedly tough time on trade.

Headlines: China, U.S. officials meet for trade talks in Shanghai
Description: U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer and Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin shook hands with Chinese Vice Premier Liu He before beginning trade talks in Shanghai on Wednesday in a bid to end a year-long trade war.

Headlines: Factbox: How we die: coronavirus in perspective
Description: As the new coronavirus spreads and worldwide deaths linked to it top 3,400, global alarm is growing and has caused everything from consumer runs on face masks to mass school closures.

Headlines: U.S. energy secretary criticized by advocacy groups for 'redlining' comment
Description: Liberal groups criticized U.S. Energy Secretary Dan Brouillette on Tuesday for a comment they interpreted as comparing the reluctance of some banks to finance fossil fuels projects with discrimination against minorities.

Headlines: U.S. Justice Department to open Facebook antitrust investigation: source
Description: The U.S. Justice Department will open an antitrust investigation of Facebook Inc , a person familiar with the matter said on Wednesday, marking the fourth recent antitrust probe of the social media company.

Headlines: United Airlines adds more international routes for September
Description: United Airlines  said on Monday it was further expanding its international schedule in September by bringing back service between Chicago and Hong Kong and Los Angeles and Sydney, and adding new nonstop flights between Chicago and Tel Aviv.

Headlines: Trump says U.S. may pursue separate trade deal with Mexico
Description: President Donald Trump said on Wednesday the United States may hammer out a trade deal with Mexico, and then do a separate one with Canada later, sowing fresh doubts about the future of the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA).

Headlines: Acknowledging derogatory term, Eskimo Pie owner says to change ice cream's name
Description: The U.S. owner of Eskimo Pie ice cream will change the product's brand name and marketing, it told Reuters on Friday, becoming the latest company to rethink racially charged brand imagery amid a broad debate on racial injustice.

Headlines: New York Fed to hold overnight repo operation
Description: The New York Federal Reserve said on Tuesday it will hold an overnight repurchase agreement operation from 9:30 a.m. to 9:45 a.m. ET (1330 to 1345 GMT) "in order to help maintain the federal funds rate within the target range" of 2.00-2.25%.

Headlines: ViacomCBS to take 49% stake in film studio Miramax for $375 million
Description: Media company ViacomCBS Inc  said on Friday it would take a 49% stake in film studio Miramax, owned by Qatar's BeIN Media Group, for $375 million.

Headlines: Oil prices steady near year-and-a-half lows ahead of New Year
Description: Oil prices steadied on Friday after a week of volatile trading ahead of the New Year holiday, supported by a rise in U.S. equity markets but pressured by worries about a global glut of crude.

Headlines: Saudi exchange counting on foreign funds to aid Aramco IPO, chief says
Description: Saudi Arabia's stock exchange expects an influx of foreign funds to smooth the listing of national oil firm Saudi Aramco, despite concern among some analysts about whether the market can absorb the huge offer, the exchange's chief executive said on Sunday.

Headlines: Wall Street tumbles as virus fuels economic worry
Description: U.S. stocks suffered their worst day in over three months on Monday as China extended the Lunar New Year holiday due to a virus outbreak, fueling worries about the economic impact of containment efforts in the world's second largest economy.

Headlines: IKEA new CEO targets 'even more affordable' furniture as habits shift
Description: IKEA named insider Jon Abrahamsson Ring to succeed Torbjorn Loof as chief executive of the world's biggest furniture brand on Tuesday as it adapts to seismic shifts in shopping.

Headlines: Bayer launches $7 billion cash call to fund Monsanto deal
Description: Bayer  launched a 6 billion euros ($7 billion) rights issue on Sunday, a cornerstone of the financing package for its planned $62.5 billion takeover of seeds maker Monsanto .

Headlines: Exclusive: Where's the beef? Argentine ranchers hope more is headed for China
Description: Cattle ranchers in Argentina, which recently edged out neighbor Brazil as the top exporter of beef to China, are hoping to build on that status by getting more local meatpacking plants approved by Beijing, industry officials and other sources told Reuters.

Headlines: UTC expects 737 MAX goundings to impact earnings by up to 10 cents per share in 2019
Description: United Technologies Corp said on Wednesday said it expects an impact of up to 10 cents per share in 2019 from the groundings of Boeing Co's 737 MAX aircraft.

Headlines: Factbox: Ownership of leading European soccer clubs
Description: The Abu Dhabi-controlled soccer group that owns Manchester City has agreed to sell a $500 million stake to U.S. private equity firm Silver Lake, making it the world's most valuable soccer group with a $4.8 billion price tag.

Headlines: Exxon lops 30% off 2020 spending, deeper and later than rivals
Description: Exxon Mobil Corp  on Tuesday throttled back investment in shale, natural gas and deep water production, cutting planned capital spending by 30% this year as the coronavirus pandemic saps energy demand and oil prices tumble.

Headlines: Japan auto group says U.S. trade discussions going in direction of avoiding auto tariffs
Description: The chairman of the Japan Automobile Manufacturers Association said on Thursday that trade discussions between the United States and Japan were going in the direction of avoiding auto tariffs and that it was good for both countries.

Headlines: Britain's CMA toughens action against Lloyds Bank over PPI
Description: Britain's Competition and Markets Authority has demanded Lloyds Banking Group  toughen its procedures around payment protection insurance (PPI) after it accused the bank of breaching its current arrangements.

Headlines: Nasdaq hits record high as U.S. recession becomes official
Description: On the same day that the Nasdaq marked a new bull market, the U.S. economy was officially declared to be in a recession. The two milestones on Monday illustrate how an 11-week surge in stocks has occurred despite widespread economic devastation fueled by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Four-comma club: Predicting the next company to join trillion-dollar value elite
Description: The trillion-dollar market cap club expanded last week to a third U.S. company, with Google parent Alphabet Inc  topping the lofty valuation mark. Adding the next member, however, is likely to take a while.

Headlines: Imperial Brands hires Inchcape's Bomhard as CEO to revive e-cigarette sales
Description: Cigarette maker Imperial Brands Plc  named Stefan Bomhard, CEO of car dealer Inchcape , as its new chief executive on Monday to steer the company through challenges in e-cigarettes and vaping and falling consumption of tobacco products.

Headlines: U.S. labor market, economy struggle despite reopening of businesses
Description: The number of Americans filing claims for unemployment benefits fell moderately last week as a second wave of layoffs partially offset hiring by businesses reopening, suggesting the labor market could take years to recover from the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: U.S. judge rules for Bombardier, dismisses Comerica aircraft payments lawsuit
Description: A U.S. judge on Monday dismissed a lawsuit in which Comerica Inc sought millions of dollars from Bombardier Inc after the Canadian aircraft maker could not find buyers for four planes whose leases had expired.

Headlines: Trump: U.S. making a lot of progress with China
Description: President Donald Trump told reporters on Friday the United States is making a lot of progress with China, as two of the world's biggest economies work toward resolving their protracted trade dispute.

Headlines: U.S. services sector activity strengthens, eases gloom over economy
Description: U.S. services sector activity expanded at a brisk pace in May and industries hired more workers, offering some respite for an economy that is slowing following a temporary boost from exports and an accumulation of inventories in the first quarter.

Headlines: Wall Street ends down 2 percent as U.S.-China trade fears intensify
Description: U.S. stocks dropped about 2 percent on Friday, with the Dow falling more than 570 points, as U.S. President Donald Trump's latest tariff threat on Chinese imports fueled increasing concern over a U.S. trade war with China.

Headlines: Emirates says airline can still fly to Mexico, despite court ruling
Description: Emirates still has the right to offer flights to Mexico City, the Dubai state-owned carrier said on Sunday, after Mexican airline Aeromexico disputed an agreement between the United Arab Emirates and Mexico.

Headlines: China commerce ministry says it has proactively dealt with U.S. trade frictions
Description: China's Commerce Ministry has "proactively dealt with" trade frictions with the United States this year, it said on Sunday after an annual work conference.

Headlines: Euro rises to near two-week high, yields jump after ECB comments
Description: The euro rose to a nearly two-week high while the 10-year U.S. Treasury yield hit a 1-1/2-week peak on Wednesday after officials said the European Central Bank could wind down its stimulus program by the end of the year.

Headlines: Ethiopian Airlines has no immediate plans to attend Boeing's U.S. meeting
Description: Ethiopian Airlines won't attend a meeting in the United States called by planemaker Boeing to tell aviation leaders about a planned update to software that is a focus of investigation in two deadly crashes, an airline spokesman told Reuters on Monday.

Headlines: As coronavirus misinformation spreads on social media, Facebook removes posts
Description: Facebook Inc  said it will take down misinformation about China's fast-spreading coronavirus, in a rare departure from its usual approach to dubious health content that is presenting a fresh challenge for social media companies.

Headlines: Ten U.S. states developing 'reopening' plans account for 38% of U.S. economy
Description: The ten U.S. states coordinating plans separately from the White House to reopen businesses shut by the coronavirus are responsible for an outsized proportion of the U.S. economy.

Headlines: Amazon issues fix after some Blink home cameras found vulnerable to hacking
Description: Amazon.com Inc  said on Tuesday it had issued a fix to rectify security flaws in certain of its Blink home camera systems after a cyber security firm found vulnerabilities that could let hackers hijack the device.

Headlines: Clariant expects sales of about $2 billion in North America by 2021
Description: Swiss specialty chemicals maker Clariant  said on Thursday it expected North America to become its second-largest market with sales of about $2 billion by 2021.

Headlines: Exclusive: Some lessors prepare to end aircraft lease deals with Jet - sources
Description: Some lessors of India's Jet Airways have begun terminating lease deals over unpaid dues and are preparing to move the leased planes abroad, escalating a crisis for the carrier, five sources with knowledge of the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Instant View: Steady Fed sees no more hikes in 2019
Description: The Federal Reserve held interest rates steady on Wednesday and its policymakers abandoned projections for further rate hikes this year as the U.S. central bank flagged an expected slowdown in the economy.

Headlines: Fed's Powell stresses uncertainty, challenges facing U.S. economy
Description: U.S. Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell on Monday said the outlook for the world's biggest economy is "extraordinarily uncertain" and will depend both on containing the coronavirus and on government efforts to support the recovery.

Headlines: Trump says U.S. subsidizes Amazon for shipping
Description: President Donald Trump on Tuesday said the United States is subsidizing Amazon.com Inc  and that the online retailer must pay more to ship its products through the nation's postal agency.

Headlines: ECB ready to support economy, but governments must help, Villeroy says
Description: The European Central Bank is ready to support the economy in the face of the coronavirus outbreak, but governments with budget leeway also need to help, ECB policymaker Francois Villeroy de Galhau said in a Dutch newspaper interview released on Tuesday.

Headlines: China's Ucar, in which Luckin chairman is top shareholder, halts shares
Description: China's Ucar Inc, in which Luckin Coffee  Chairman Charles Zhengyao Lu is the biggest shareholder, suspended trading of its shares on Tuesday after regulators questioned the car service provider about how the alleged fraud at Luckin would impact it.

Headlines: Comcast shuts theme parks, delays film distribution due to COVID-19
Description: Comcast Corp  on Tuesday warned of a hit to its results from the coronavirus outbreak as it shut all its theme parks and delayed distribution of films in theaters worldwide.

Headlines: U.S. regulators ask Deutsche Bank to explain 'bad bank' proposal: FT
Description: U.S. regulators have sought explanation from Deutsche Bank AG about its "bad bank" proposal and its impact on U.S. operations at the loss-making German lender, the Financial Times reported on Monday.

Headlines: Best Buy executive chairman to step down
Description: Retailer Best Buy Co Inc  said on Wednesday Executive Chairman Hubert Joly would step down and will not stand for re-election at the shareholder meeting on June 11.

Headlines: UK PM May defeats rebels over plans to remain in EU customs union
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May narrowly avoided a defeat in parliament at the hands of pro-EU lawmakers from her own party on Tuesday, fending off a rebellion that threatened to worsen a crisis over her Brexit strategy.

Headlines: Petition by Walmart employee to protest gun sales gathers over 45,000 signatures
Description: A petition started by a junior Walmart Inc  worker in California to protest the retailer's sale of firearms, following two mass shootings over the weekend left 31 people dead in Texas and Ohio, has gathered more than 45,000 signatures.

Headlines: U.S. judge approves gun maker Remington's bankruptcy plan
Description: Weapons manufacturer Remington Outdoor Company Inc won approval for its bankruptcy plan on Wednesday, paving the way for the company to slash debt, boost its cash position and better weather the uncertain climate for firearms in the United States.

Headlines: Dropbox IPO priced higher than expected on strong demand
Description: Dropbox Inc's  initial public offering, the largest tech stock debut in more than a year, was priced at $21 per share, the company announced on Thursday, higher than expected.

Headlines: FTSE confirms new Unilever not eligible for UK blue chip index
Description: Consumer goods giant Unilever will not be included in Britain's blue-chip FTSE 100 index once it ends its dual-headed structure, index compiler FTSE Russell said.

Headlines: Mars aims to tackle "broken" cocoa model with new sustainability scheme
Description: Mars Wrigley Confectionery launched a new sustainability strategy on Wednesday with the aim of combating deforestation, child labor and poverty in what it called the "broken" cocoa supply chain.

Headlines: Trump 'not interested' in reopening U.S.-China trade deal after report of Beijing discontent
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday he opposed renegotiating the U.S.-China "Phase 1" trade deal after a Chinese state-run newspaper reported some government advisers in Beijing were urging fresh talks and possibly invalidating the agreement.

Headlines: BNY Mellon profit falls short on lower interest rates
Description: Bank of New York Mellon Corp  missed analysts' estimates for quarterly profit on Thursday, as the world's largest custodian bank earned less from its interest-earning assets due to rate cuts by the Federal Reserve.

Headlines: Oil drops as market braces for more OPEC crude and Wall Street slips
Description: Oil fell on Monday as investors prepared for an extra 1 million barrels per day (bpd) of oil to hit markets after OPEC  agreed to raise production and as U.S. equity markets slipped on trade war fears.

Headlines: China, U.S. should resume timely communication on trade: China adviser
Description: China and the United States should resume timely communication on trade and other issues, an adviser to the Chinese cabinet said on Thursday, stressing that the world's two biggest economies are too intertwined to be decoupled.

Headlines: France's Casino sells stores to Fortress, hits asset sales target
Description: Casino  has agreed to sell 26 stores worth 501 million euros ($567 million) to Fortress Investment Group, the French supermarket retailer said on Monday, fulfilling an assets sale target set out last year as part of plans to reduce its debt.

Headlines: General Electric CEO sets low 2019 profit targets, vows better from 2020
Description: General Electric Co Chief Executive Larry Culp on Thursday set conservative profit targets for this year and staked his reputation on hitting them and doing better in 2020 and beyond, igniting a rally in the stock.

Headlines: Intel has paths around Trump's China tariffs, analysts say
Description: Intel Corp, the world's biggest chipmaker by revenue and a prominent U.S. manufacturer, could avoid the most severe effects of a new list of Chinese tariffs proposed by U.S. President Donald Trump by shifting its production among its facilities, analysts said Monday.

Headlines: Brazil oil regulator to investigate Petrobras oil spill
Description: Brazil's oil regulator said on Monday that is has started an investigation into an oil spill at an offshore platform owned by Petroleo Brasileiro SA.

Headlines: Starbucks 'unlikely' to be overtaken in China by Luckin in 2019: CEO
Description: Starbucks Corp is unlikely to cede its leading position in China, the company's fastest-growing major market, to Chinese startup Luckin in 2019, Starbucks CEO Kevin Johnson said in an interview on Thursday.

Headlines: Fed modifying asset cap so Wells Fargo can make more small business loans
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve said on Wednesday it would "temporarily and narrowly" modify the growth restriction on Wells Fargo & Co's  balance sheet, allowing the bank to make more loans under government assistance programs for small businesses hurt by the coronavirus disruption.

Headlines: BOJ's Kuroda meets with PM Abe and vows response to coronavirus
Description: The Bank of Japan is ready to take further steps to support the economy in the face of the coronavirus epidemic, Governor Haruhiko Kuroda said after a meeting with Prime Minister Shinzo Abe on Thursday.

Headlines: Pacific trade deal spurs Canadian farm sales to Japan as U.S. watches
Description: At the Canadian embassy in Tokyo last month, beef promoters flew in a chef from Canada to cook New York strip steaks for hungry Japanese importers and restaurant suppliers.

Headlines: Trump says new trade pact to support 'hundreds of thousands' of U.S. jobs
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday touted the newly reached trade deal with Canada and Mexico that will replace NAFTA as a massive job engine, creating positions across the manufacturing, agriculture, technology and financial services sectors.

Headlines: Exclusive: Credit Suisse creates new anti-sexual harassment role
Description: Credit Suisse has carved out a new role to lead its handling of sexual harassment claims and examine group-wide policies, as Switzerland's second-biggest bank seeks to boost equal opportunities and create a fair treatment environment.

Headlines: Google to stop showing news snippets for French users
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google will stop showing news snippets from European publishers on search results for its French users, complying with a new European copyright law, the company said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Goldman banker highlights Morgan Stanley's Hong Kong IPO woes
Description: A senior Goldman Sachs  banker has highlighted to colleagues the role played by rival Morgan Stanley  in failed Hong Kong IPOs following the collapse on Friday of Budweiser APAC's $9.8 billion initial public offering, according to an internal email seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Sunexpress to fly tourists in Turkey back home after Thomas Cook collapse
Description: Sunexpress airline will provide extra capacity to fly tourists stranded in Turkey back to their homes after tourism agency Thomas Cook collapsed, a spokesman for the airline told Reuters on Wednesday.

Headlines: Honda to recall 1.2 million vehicles in North America to replace Takata airbags
Description: Honda Motor Co said on Tuesday it would recall 1.2 million Honda and Acura vehicles in North America to replace defective Takata airbags on the driver's side.

Headlines: Exclusive: Sweden's EQT targets Asia Pacific as IPO decision looms
Description: High above Stockholm's skyline, Sweden's EQT Partners is plotting the next chapter in its rapid rise from a Nordic-focused investor to the world's seventh-biggest buyout firm, with a focus on growth in the Asia Pacific region.

Headlines: Five decades ago, Boeing's new 727 jet also had a terrible start
Description: As Boeing Co and global airlines work to restore public confidence in the 737 MAX after two deadly crashes, they will have a play book they can use.

Headlines: Starbucks, Mercon announce separate sustainability loans
Description: Starbucks and Mercon Coffee Group separately announced sustainability-focused loan facilities on Monday, signaling the coffee sector's growing emphasis on sustainability as climate change and low global prices threaten the future of the crop.

Headlines: Powell: Fed not looking at negative rates
Description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, in a sober review of where the U.S. economy stands on the cusp of its reopening, said on Wednesday the country could face an "extended period" of weak growth and stagnant incomes, pledged to use more Fed power as needed, and issued a call for more fiscal spending.

Headlines: Hertz files for U.S. bankruptcy protection as car rentals evaporate in pandemic
Description: The more than a century old car rental firm Hertz Global Holdings Inc filed for bankruptcy protection on Friday after its business was decimated during the coronavirus pandemic and talks with creditors failed to result in much needed relief.

Headlines: Fidelity's asset management chief Morrison to retire
Description: Fidelity Investments said on Friday that its asset management chief, Charles Morrison, is leaving the company and that it plans to name a replacement in "the near term."

Headlines: Stocks rise on trade optimism, pound strengthens
Description: Global stock indexes rose on Thursday as optimism over a resolution to the trade war between the United States and China lifted sentiment, while sterling strengthened amid hopes of a second referendum on Britain's membership in the European Union.

Headlines: Amazon long-time executive Steve Kessel to step down
Description: E-commerce giant Amazon.com Inc's  long-serving executive Steve Kessel will leave the company after 20 years, a company spokesperson told Reuters on Friday.

Headlines: Factbox: Recent U.S. corporate responses to gun violence
Description: A series of mass shootings in the United States, including one each in Texas and Ohio last month that killed 31 people, once again has revived a national debate on firearms regulation, which in the past has led retailers and other U.S. companies to tighten restrictions on gun sales.

Headlines: Amazon is sued over warehouses after New York worker brings coronavirus home, cousin dies
Description: Amazon.com Inc has been sued for allegedly fostering the spread of the coronavirus by mandating unsafe working conditions, causing at least one employee to contract COVID-19, bring it home, and see her cousin die.

Headlines: Lufthansa applies for short-time work for 31,000 employees
Description: Lufthansa  has applied for short-time work for around 31,000 crew and ground staff at its core brand until the end of August, a spokesman said on Friday, as Germany's flagship carrier has slashed flights due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Walmart's Mexico business set to absorb two internal units
Description: The Mexican unit of U.S. retailer Walmart said on Wednesday a shareholder meeting would discuss the absorption of two internal units, Holding de Restaurantes y Servicios and Tiendas Wal-Mart.

Headlines: U.S. trade group says 'unrealistic' for American retailers to exit China
Description: The U.S. National Retail Federation (NRF) said on Friday it is "unrealistic" for American retailers to move out of China, the world's second-largest economy, as 95% of the world's consumers live outside the United States.

Headlines: French investigators to move ahead with Ghosn prosecution over palace party
Description: French prosecutors investigating a party that former Renault-Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn threw for his wife at the sumptuous Versailles palace will in the next few weeks ask judges to examine the case, bringing a prosecution a step closer.

Headlines: S&P 500 futures jump as trading resumes after Trump calls off tariffs on Mexico
Description: U.S. equity futures rose when trading resumed on Sunday after the United States and Mexico struck a deal late Friday to avert a tariff war, with Mexico agreeing to meet U.S. demands to stem the flow of illegal Central American migrants.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs says it's climbing toward Fed's capital demands
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc  has already boosted capital measures and is working to meet the Federal Reserve's benchmark for October, the Wall Street bank said in a statement on Monday.

Headlines: Tesla's Elon Musk, SEC to face off in U.S. court on April 4
Description: Lawyers for Elon Musk and the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission will square off in a Manhattan courtroom next week over whether the Tesla Inc chief executive should be held in contempt over one of his tweets.

Headlines: Exclusive: Turkey presses banks to agree high-stakes bailout of bad energy loans
Description: Turkey's plan to clean up some $13 billion in bad energy loans, one of the worst hangovers from last year's currency crisis, is taking shape even as some banks hold out for the government to agree to safeguards and higher electricity prices.

Headlines: In Canadian court, Huawei CFO's lawyer raises Trump comments on case
Description: The lawyer for Huawei Technologies' Chief Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou told a Canadian court on Wednesday that he has concerns allegations against her have a political character and raised U.S. President Donald Trump's comments on the case.

Headlines: U.S. weekly jobless claims fall slightly in latest week
Description: New applications for U.S. unemployment fell slightly last week and the number of Americans receiving benefits remained at a 45-year low as strong labor market conditions continued.

Headlines: U.S. consumer regulator sues pension lender for misleading borrowers
Description: The U.S. Consumer Financial Protection Bureau has filed suit against Future Income Payments, a Nevada company that offers cash advances in exchange for future pension benefits, which the regulator said are actually exceptionally high-interest loans.

Headlines: Amazon lawsuit blames Trump for loss of Pentagon cloud contract
Description: Amazon.com Inc on Monday accused U.S. President Donald Trump of exerting "improper pressure" and bias that led the Department of Defense to award a lucrative $10 billion cloud contract to rival Microsoft Corp.

Headlines: Britain could sell 10 percent stake in RBS as soon as this week: Sky News
Description: Britain could sell a 10 percent stake in Royal Bank of Scotland  as soon as this week, Sky News reported on Monday, citing banking sources.

Headlines: Wall Street ends down on Powell's sober outlook, call to Congress for help
Description: Wall Street's three major indexes closed lower for the second day in a row after Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell warned on Wednesday of extended economic weakness due to the coronavirus pandemic and called for Congress to agree on additional fiscal support.

Headlines: Fiat, PSA face EU antitrust probe over $50 billion merger: sources
Description: Fiat Chrysler  and Peugeot maker PSA  face a lengthy EU antitrust investigation after declining to offer concessions to allay EU antitrust concerns about their planned $50 billion merger, people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: UK government to make Huawei statement on Tuesday
Description: British minister Oliver Dowden will make a statement to parliament on Huawei some time after 1130 GMT on Tuesday, the opposition Labour Party said on Twitter.

Headlines: Anbang's former chairman contests all charges against him: Shanghai court
Description: The former chairman of Anbang Insurance Group Co Ltd [ANBANG.UL] Wu Xiaohui has contested all charges against him, the Shanghai No. 1 Intermediate People's Court said in a statement.

Headlines: Repo is Wall Street's big year-end worry. Why?
Description: The $2.2 trillion repurchase agreement market - part of the inner workings of the U.S. financial system - is facing what could be another strain as the year comes to a close. That could have wider implications than just Wall Street.

Headlines: 'Elbow to elbow:' North America meat plant workers fall ill, walk off jobs
Description: At a Wayne Farms chicken processing plant in Alabama, workers recently had to pay the company 10 cents a day to buy masks to protect themselves from the new coronavirus, according to a meat inspector.

Headlines: HPE could mitigate impact of future U.S. tariffs, CEO says
Description: Hewlett Packard Enterprise Co  can boost manufacturing at its facility in Wisconsin if trade tensions with China escalate, Chief Executive Antonio Neri said on Monday.

Headlines: Italy's UniCredit settles dispute with Caius
Description: British hedge fund Caius has made a payment to UniCredit  to settle a dispute over complex financial instruments which Italy's biggest bank counts toward its core capital, the two companies said.

Headlines: Half of Walmart's workforce are part-time workers: labor group
Description: Part-time workers account for half of Walmart Inc's  workforce, up from 20 percent in 2005, according to a labor group report on Friday that examined the company's increased shift away from more expensive full-time employees.

Headlines: Judge dismisses Wall Street 'fear gauge' lawsuit against Cboe
Description: A federal judge on Monday dismissed an antitrust lawsuit by investors who accused the parent of the Chicago Board Options Exchange of letting anonymous traders rig the "fear gauge," Wall Street's main gauge of future stock market volatility, at their expense.

Headlines: Exclusive: IKEA to revamp app as store strategy shifts
Description: IKEA is launching a new app to allow customers to shop remotely for products they can visualize in the context of their own homes, lessening the need for them to travel to its vast network of self-service, out-of-town stores.

Headlines: Daimler hurt by production delays at Mercedes, China slowdown
Description: Daimler's first-quarter operating profit fell 16 percent on Friday as a 718 million euro ($800 million) one-off gain failed to offset raw material costs, technology investments and production delays at three Mercedes-Benz factories.

Headlines: India's growth may decelerate further despite election spending
Description: Billions of dollars of pre-election spending by the Indian government and political parties in the next two months is  unlikely to stop the nation's economy from slowing further,  economists said.

Headlines: U.S. coronavirus deaths top 49,000, averaging 2,000 lives lost a day: Reuters tally
Description: U.S. coronavirus deaths topped 49,000 on Thursday as the number of lives lost in April rises by an average of 2,000 a day, according to a Reuters tally.

Headlines: Trade worries sink stocks as yuan slides to a decade low
Description: Stock markets around the world fell hard on Monday on fears that China's willingness to let the yuan slide in response to the latest U.S. tariff threat could further aggravate trade-related tensions between the world's two largest economies.

Headlines: SAP CEO aims to double market value to 250-300 billion euros by 2023: report
Description: Europe's largest technology company SAP aims to more than double its market value to between 250 billion euros and 300 billion euros ($282-$338 billion) by 2023, Chief Executive Bill McDermott told a German newspaper.

Headlines: Factbox: U.S. refiners revisiting crude supplies amid new PDVSA sanctions
Description: U.S. refiners on Monday said they would comply with the Trump administration's new sanctions on dealings with Venezuelan state-run oil company Petroleos de Venezuela (PDVSA) and take steps to lessen any impacts on consumers.

Headlines: Britain's FCA goes ahead with disputed 'Aramco' listing rule
Description: Britain's markets watchdog will press ahead with a new premium listing next month aimed at attracting companies like state-controlled Saudi Aramco to London, although the rules have been "refined" following investor criticism.

Headlines: Main Fiat Chrysler unions dismiss Ronaldo strike call as stunt
Description: Unions representing the majority of workers at Fiat Chrysler in Italy rejected a strike called by an independent labor group in protest against the huge sums of money spent by Italy's Juventus soccer club  to sign Cristiano Ronaldo.

Headlines: China says discussed remaining issues with U.S. trade negotiators
Description: China's commerce ministry said on Thursday that senior trade negotiators from the United States and China discussed the remaining issues in a phone call following the last round of talks in Washington.

Headlines: Icahn sells 10.5 million Herbalife shares back to company
Description: Billionaire investor Carl Icahn, who sparred for years with short-seller William Ackman over the future of Herbalife Nutrition Ltd , on Thursday said he sold roughly $552 million worth of Herbalife stock back to the company, trimming his stake to 21 percent.

Headlines: Heathrow starts voluntary redundancy scheme, can't rule out more job losses
Description: Britain's Heathrow Airport, which before the coronavirus pandemic was the busiest in Europe, said it had started a voluntary redundancy scheme after passenger numbers fell to an all-time low and it could not rule out further job losses.

Headlines: COVID-19 lawsuit takes on McDonald's like it was a rowdy bar
Description: As U.S. businesses reopen, worried workers and their advocates are borrowing a legal strategy commonly used to shut down rowdy topless bars to try and force employers to strengthen protection against further spread of the coronavirus.

Headlines: U.S. tech enforcer says will read 'closely' EU statement on Google
Description: The head of the U.S. Federal Trade Commission, which has investigated Alphabet's Google in the past for abuse of web dominance, said on Wednesday he would take a close look at Europe's recent decision to fine the company 4.34 billion euros ($5 billion).

Headlines: Operating an airline in France is not easy, costs high: Air France KLM CEO
Description: Air France KLM  is lobbying authorities in France as it pushes to try and make the market more competitive, the group's top boss said on Tuesday, adding that tax bills and the cost of operating out of airports there was higher than elsewhere.

Headlines: Nestle, other food groups likely suitors for GSK's Horlicks: sources
Description: Food giants Nestle , Kraft Heinz  and Unilever  are expected to bid for GlaxoSmithKline's  Horlicks health nutrition business, which could fetch more than $4 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Air Canada to suspend majority of its international, U.S. trans-border flights
Description: Air Canada said on Wednesday it would gradually suspend the majority of its international and U.S. trans-borderflights by March 31 in response to the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Scotland says U.S. tariff move shows UK's Brexit pipe dream
Description: The Scottish government said on Thursday that the imposition of U.S. tariffs on various goods including Scottish whisky indicated that the United Kingdom could not offset the damage from Brexit by striking a trade deal with U.S. President Donald Trump.

Headlines: Warren Buffett charity lunch in limbo after crypto promoter issues apology
Description: Chinese cryptocurrency entrepreneur Justin Sun issued a lengthy public apology on Thursday for the manner in which he promoted his $4.57 million charity lunch with Warren Buffett, raising questions over whether the event will go ahead.

Headlines: Pompeo chides HSBC for 'corporate kowtow' to Beijing
Description: U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo on Tuesday chided British bank HSBC  for backing moves by China to end Hong Kong's autonomy, saying such "corporate kowtows" got little in return from Beijing.

Headlines: American Airlines slashes flights but has no plans to halt U.S. service
Description: American Airlines Co  said on Thursday it is cutting additional flights this summer as travel demand has drastically shrunk amid the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Forcing China on trade with illegal action will not work: EU's Malmstrom
Description: The United States and the European Union should work together to reform the World Trade Organization and illegal action will not work to solve issues in international trade, EU Trade Commissioner Cecilia Malmstrom said on Thursday

Headlines: Deutsche Bank shares hit record low ahead of AGM
Description: Shares in Deutsche Bank set a new low on Monday, just days before investors gather for their annual general meeting.

Headlines: Tech titans Apple and Microsoft propel Wall Street rally
Description: Wall Street rallied on Friday, led higher by Apple and Microsoft as investors finished a turbulent week of trading and some states prepared to relax coronavirus-related lockdowns.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank axes at least 7,000 jobs in trading retreat
Description: Deutsche Bank  is slashing more than 7,000 jobs to cut costs and restore profitability, while keeping its international reach as its new CEO seeks to reassure investors and clients.

Headlines: Oil eases below four-year highs; U.S. inventory rise expected
Description: Oil prices eased slightly on Tuesday after rallying for three straight sessions, but remained close to four-year highs on worries that global supplies will drop due to Washington's sanctions on Iran.

Headlines: GM sold 200,000 electric vehicles in U.S. by 2018, triggering tax-credit phaseout: source
Description: General Motors Co  hit 200,000 total electric vehicles sold in the United States by the end of 2018, reaching a threshold that triggers a phase-out of a $7,500 federal tax credit over the next 15 months, a person briefed on the matter said Wednesday.

Headlines: VOI makes European push in crowded electric scooter-sharing market
Description: Sweden's VOI Technology plans to put a new fleet of thousands of electric scooters on European streets this summer to fend off competition in an increasingly crowded market.

Headlines: Switzerland warns Facebook's Libra it will face extra scrutiny
Description: Facebook's  Libra cryptocurrency suffered another setback on Wednesday when Switzerland said the proposed payments system could face strict rules that typically apply to banks, on top of tough anti-money laundering laws.

Headlines: Deutsche Boerse to include tech stocks in MDAX and SDAX in index shakeup
Description: Deutsche Boerse, the German stock exchange operator, is planning a major shakeup of the composition of three key indexes later this year that affects technology stocks.

Headlines: Mexican president lashes out at companies over layoffs, taxes as big business seethes
Description: Mexico's president threw himself into a new confrontation with businesses on Wednesday, accusing big companies of not paying taxes and upbraiding others for laying off workers during the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: China's Xiaomi picks Hong Kong for $10 billion IPO, lifts lid on financials
Description: Chinese smartphone and connected device maker Xiaomi is bringing its blockbuster initial public offering to Hong Kong, where it could raise about $10 billion in the largest listing globally in almost four years.

Headlines: Back to the future: Saudi investor forum saved by old mainstay oil
Description: Saudi Arabia's investment forum was designed to showcase the kingdom's new future away from oil, but it was black gold and old allies that rescued this week's event from the furor over the killing of journalist Jamal Khashoggi.

Headlines: JPMorgan to cut up to 140 jobs in Switzerland: source
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co  could eliminate up to 140 jobs in Switzerland in an effort to cut costs, a person familiar with the matter told Reuters on Monday, confirming a report by the Swiss financial news website Finews.

Headlines: Tesla promotes lower priced China-made Model 3 in sales push
Description: U.S. electric vehicle (EV) maker Tesla Inc said on Friday it would price its China-made Model 3 vehicles from 328,000 yuan ($47,529), 13% cheaper than those it currently imports as it pushes sales in the fast growing market.

Headlines: Germany's economic pain is here to stay
Description: It was meant to be a fleeting slowdown for Europe's economic powerhouse, followed by a rapid rebound.

Headlines: Lab-grown meat producer Memphis Meats raises $161 million in funding led by SoftBank
Description: Lab-grown meat producer Memphis Meats said on Wednesday it raised $161 million in a funding round led by Japan's SoftBank Group , Singapore's wealth fund Temasek Holdings and Norwest Venture Partners.

Headlines: U.S. senators tell drug company executives pricing is 'morally repugnant'
Description: U.S. senators called drug pricing practices "morally repugnant" and told drug company executives they do not want to hear them blame others for the high prices, taking an aggressive stance at a Senate hearing on the rising costs of prescription medicines.

Headlines: U.S. companies upbeat about business in Germany: survey
Description: Some 82 percent of U.S. companies operating in Germany expect revenues to increase this year, a survey showed on Friday, despite a brewing trade conflict over the U.S. decision to impose tariffs steel and aluminum imports.

Headlines: Lyft offers new cheaper rides with more waiting time
Description: Lyft Inc  said on Tuesday it would expand its program that provides cheaper rides to customers willing to wait longer for their pick-ups, at a time when curbs against the coronavirus outbreak have brought its affordable shared services to a halt.

Headlines: H&M starts protective apron production at supplier
Description: H&M, the world's second-biggest fashion retailer, said on Wednesday it had started producing protective aprons at a supplier and would deliver one million aprons to the Swedish healthcare system over the coming two weeks.

Headlines: Wall Street regulators take multiple actions against cryptocurrency firms
Description: Two Wall Street regulators on Tuesday announced a series of actions, including levying fines, against companies involved with cryptocurrencies, in a flurry of activity reflecting efforts to monitor the popular and unregulated asset class.

Headlines: As Germany reels from coronavirus, some officials debate impact on banks
Description: As Germany rolls out a 750 billion-euro economic stimulus package, officials and experts are discussing whether German lenders, including Deutsche Bank AG and Commerzbank AG, will be able to weather the economic fallout of coronavirus without state help.

Headlines: Swiss Railways will not take new Bombardier trains until earlier problems fixed
Description: Swiss Federal Railways said it would not take new trains from Bombardier  until the Canadian company fixes the ones already in service, raising questions over the timing of future deliveries for the 1.9 billion Swiss franc ($1.9 billion) contract.

Headlines: Airbus-owned Stelia Aerospace to build Portugal assembly plant
Description: Stelia Aerospace, owned by European planemaker Airbus , will open a 40 million euro ($44 million) assembly plant near Porto in Portugal, creating 240 jobs, company and government officials said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Comcast gets valid acceptances for less than 1 percent of Sky shares
Description: Comcast Corp said it had received valid acceptances for shares representing just 0.21 percent of Sky Plc after its 14.75 pound per share offer to buy 61 percent of the European broadcaster.

Headlines: As bitcoin trading shifts shape, big money stays away
Description: (This version of the December 7th story corrects spelling of first name to Erik (not Eric) in paragraph 21)

Headlines: Temperature checks, protective suits: Argentine grains sector braces for 1st coronavirus case
Description: Argentina is braced for the first case of coronavirus to be confirmed among the thousands of port workers and grains handlers involved in the country's key agricultural export sector, local industry officials said.

Headlines: Twitter notches first $1 billion quarterly revenue, beating estimates; shares jump
Description: Twitter Inc pulled in $1 billion in quarterly revenue for the first time on Thursday, beating expectations as efforts to make its platform more user-friendly brought in more people, and sending its shares up 14% in early trading.

Headlines: Amazon can be held liable for third-party seller products: U.S. appeals court
Description: A federal appeals court on Wednesday ruled against Amazon.com Inc  in a case that could expose the online retailer to lawsuits from customers who buy defective products from third-party vendors through its website.

Headlines: Navarro says China talks to continue, trade war won't slow U.S. economy
Description: White House trade adviser Peter Navarro said on Friday he does not believe the trade war in China will cause higher prices or a slower economy in the United States.

Headlines: Micron to buy Intel's stake in joint venture IM Flash Technologies
Description: Micron Technology Inc  said on Thursday it planned to take full control of IM Flash Technologies joint venture with Intel Corp .

Headlines: U.S. economy won't reclaim all of its lost ground until after 2021: CBO
Description: The U.S. economy should bounce back sharply in the third quarter after its deep coronavirus-related collapse, but it will not fully retake recover lost ground until sometime after next year, the non-partisan Congressional Budget Office said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Opel to add PSA model to Ruesselsheim production: Handelsblatt
Description: German automaker Opel is planning to start manufacturing a compact car for French parent PSA at its main Ruesselsheim plant from mid-2021 onwards, German business daily Handelsblatt reported, citing company sources.

Headlines: U.S. signs $450 million contract with Regeneron for COVID-19 therapy
Description: The U.S. government signed a $450 million contract with Regeneron Pharmaceuticals Inc  for its potential COVID-19 antibody cocktail, the drugmaker said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Nokia's profit expected to drop ahead of 5G fillip
Description: Telecom network equipment maker Nokia  is expected to post another plunge in quarterly profits on Thursday ahead of an anticipated boost later this year from next-generation 5G networks.

Headlines: Spanish government considering loans for Iberia: El Pais
Description: The Spanish government is considering granting soft loans to flagship airline Iberia, a unit of London-listed International Consolidated Airlines Group , newspaper El Pais reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs sued by ex-managing director who said he was whistleblower
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc  was sued on Thursday by a former managing director who said the Wall Street bank retaliated against him and fired him after he complained about its dealings with an unidentified, "notorious European businessman."

Headlines: Ryanair slashes flights, says could ground entire fleet
Description: Ryanair  will ground most of its aircraft over the next seven to 10 days as Europe's biggest low-cost airline braces for an up to 80% cut in capacity over the next two months and could even ground its entire fleet due to coronavirus travel restrictions.

Headlines: Emerging market stocks' descent to 17 month lows entices U.S. investors
Description: The steep decline in emerging market stocks since early this year are attracting some U.S. fund managers who think they may find long-term bargains amid the sell-off.

Headlines: Russia's Novak says gas talks to continue with Ukraine and EU
Description: Russian Energy Minister Alexander Novak said on Tuesday that three-way talks with Ukraine and the European Union would continue in the autumn, after he met representatives from Kiev and the European Commission in Berlin.

Headlines: Uber CEO expects further pressure as shares add to losses, down 12%
Description: Uber Technologies Inc's shares fell 12% on Monday, more than doubling their losses since the ride-hailing giant's poorly received market debut, and its chief executive officer said he expected the stock to remain under pressure in the coming months.

Headlines: Electric cars cast growing shadow on profits
Description: Electric cars are poised to arrive en masse in European showrooms after years of hyped concept-car launches and billions in investment by automakers and suppliers.

Headlines: Exclusive: Brazil's Odebrecht to propose bondholder losses of over 70 percent - sources
Description: Brazilian conglomerate Odebrecht SA next week will ask its  bondholders to accept losses of more than 70 percent from their bonds' face value as part of a restructuring, two sources with knowledge of the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Renault, Nissan join Waymo in exploring driverless services in France, Japan
Description: French automaker Renault SA, its Japanese partner Nissan Motor Co and tech giant Alphabet Inc's Waymo are exploring a partnership to develop and use self-driving vehicles to transport people and goods in France and Japan, the companies said on Thursday.

Headlines: Italy's deputy PM Salvini: would be proud of a UniCredit bid for Commerzbank
Description: Italy's Deputy Prime Minister and League leader Matteo Salvini said he would hail a takeover bid by Italy's UniCredit for German rival Commerzbank.

Headlines: U.S. FAA revokes certification of Xtra Aerospace after Lion Air crash
Description: The U.S. Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) on Friday revoked the repair certification of Florida-based Xtra Aerospace LLC, which fixed a sensor suspected of contributing to the catastrophic crash of a Lion Air 737 MAX a year ago.

Headlines: Takeda gets Japanese approval for $62 billion Shire purchase
Description: Takeda Pharmaceutical Co Ltd  said on Thursday Japan's Fair Trade Commission had approved its $62 billion acquisition of Shire Plc , bringing the Japanese firm closer to sealing a deal that will make it a global top 10 drugmaker.

Headlines: U.S. trade deficit widens, services sector contracts amid coronavirus
Description: The U.S. trade deficit increased by the most in more than a year in March as a record drop in exports offset a shrinking import bill, suggesting the novel coronavirus outbreak was upending the global flow of goods and services.

Headlines: Ford Canada CEO says firm has no plans for GM-style auto plant shutdown
Description: Ford Motor Co has no plans to carry out an auto plant shutdown in Canada along the lines of the closure announced by General Motors Co, the head of the automaker's Canadian operation said on Monday.

Headlines: Wells Fargo executives knew auto insurance program was flawed: lawsuit
Description: Wells Fargo & Co executives were warned that an auto insurance plan could be overcharging customers four years before the bank scrapped the program, according to a complaint released by a judge this week.

Headlines: McDonald's serves up quarterly beat on higher global sales, U.S. spending
Description: McDonald's Corp  blew past analysts' forecasts for profit and revenue on Monday, helped by higher sales in overseas markets and as U.S. customers spent more at its outlets.

Headlines: The obscure advisory committees at the heart of the U.S. drug pricing debate
Description: Expectations were high last year for three new migraine drugs hitting the market from Amgen Inc, Eli Lilly and Co and Teva Pharmaceutical Industries.

Headlines: GM to invest $22 million in Tennessee plant
Description: General Motors Co said on Thursday it will invest $22 million at its Tennessee plant to build fuel-efficient engines.

Headlines: Amazon launches bigger local online store in Singapore
