Description: Amazon.com Inc  has launched a bigger local store and marketplace in Singapore, expanding its product selection and  intensifying competition with rivals such as Alibaba Group Holding Ltd's  Lazada and Sea Ltd's  Shopee.

Headlines: Former Fed chief Bernanke sees bad year, no quick recovery
Description: The U.S. economy could shrink 30% or more this quarter as stay-at-home orders aimed at slowing the coronavirus outbreak choke off business, and it could be a couple of years before the economy regains its footing, former Federal Reserve Chair Ben Bernanke said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Fed's Bullard considers current U.S. rate setting 'slightly restrictive'
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve's interest rate increase in December likely tipped monetary policy into slightly restrictive territory, a step beyond the neutral level policymakers had hoped to hit, St. Louis Federal Reserve Bank President James Bullard said on Thursday.

Headlines: Delta to buy 20% of LATAM for $1.9 billion in regional shake-up
Description: (This September 26 story corrects airline group to SkyTeam alliance instead of the Sky Alliance in paragraph 6)

Headlines: Bayer scraps U.S. plans to produce crop chemical blocked by court
Description: Bayer AG said on Tuesday it will scrap a nearly $1 billion project to produce the chemical dicamba in the United States, but said the move is unrelated to a federal court decision that blocked sales of weed killers based on the product.

Headlines: Cryptocurrency miners seek cheap energy in Norway and Sweden
Description: Cryptocurrency miners are moving in to Norway and Sweden to take advantage of cheap hydro-electric energy and low temperatures to power and cool their servers.

Headlines: Minister to Air France-KLM boss: Fix airline before talk of stake sale
Description: France has no plans for now to sell its 14 percent stake in Air France-KLM , Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said on Thursday, pressing the group's new chief executive to focus on increasing competitiveness.

Headlines: Before hack tore through Twitter, online forum offered accounts for sale
Description: Before a hacking campaign tore through Twitter and compromised some of its most high-profile users, an ad went up on a gray market site that facilitates the trade of user accounts for many popular websites including Twitter.

Headlines: Malaysia regulator to probe if AirAsia broke rules in Airbus deals
Description: Malaysia's securities regulator said on Sunday it will examine whether AirAsia Group  and unit AirAsia X  broke securities laws, after UK prosecutors accused executives of receiving bribes from Airbus  for buying planes.

Headlines: China sovereign fund CIC says cautious of U.S. investment amid trade war
Description: China Investment Corp (CIC) reported a 37% dive in annual profit on Friday and said the ongoing Sino-U.S. trade war has made the Chinese sovereign wealth fund more cautious about investing in the United States.

Headlines: Russia calls on G20 to join efforts with OPEC+ on oil market
Description: Russian Energy Minister Alexander Novak called on the G20 group of the world's largest economies on Friday to join the efforts of the group of leading oil producers, known as the OPEC+, to stabilize energy markets.

Headlines: Trump pushes Congress for new coronavirus spending as Senate mulls second emergency bill
Description: Than U.S. President Donald Trump's administration pushed lawmakers to send money directly to Americans to counter the economic toll of the coronavirus outbreak, as the Senate weighed a multibillion-dollar emergency bill passed by the House of Representatives.

Headlines: Ferrari picks Louis Camilleri as CEO, Elkann as chairman
Description: Luxury sports carmaker Ferrari said on Saturday it had appointed board member Louis Camilleri as its new chief executive, replacing Sergio Marchionne who is seriously ill.

Headlines: Boeing expresses regret over ex-pilot's 737 MAX messages, faults simulator
Description: Boeing Co said on Sunday it understood the outcry over leaked messages from a former test pilot over erratic software behavior on its 737 MAX jet two years before recent crashes, and added it was still investigating what they meant.

Headlines: Bike-sharing firm Ofo's dramatic fall a warning to China's tech investors
Description: On the sidewalks of Shanghai and Beijing, once bright-yellow Ofo bicycles lie in varying states of disrepair - chains unhooked, wheels buckled and paint starting to fade - reflecting the quick rise and sharp fall of the Chinese bike-sharing startup.

Headlines: LafargeHolcim to close Paris, Zurich head offices, axing 200 jobs
Description: LafargeHolcim , the world's largest cement maker, will close its head offices in Paris and Zurich, eliminating 200 jobs as part of a cost-cutting drive.

Headlines: Elliott revives call to split Marathon Petroleum into three
Description: Elliott Management Corp on Wednesday urged Marathon Petroleum Corp  to split into three companies, saying it would boost shareholder value by as much as $40 billion, three years after the activist hedge fund asked the refiner to consider spinning off businesses.

Headlines: German prosecutors fine Daimler almost $1 billion for breaking diesel rules
Description: Daimler  will pay a fine of 870 million euros ($957 million) for breaking diesel emissions regulations, German prosecutors said on Tuesday.

Headlines: GM's Cruise gets $1.15 billion new cash from T. Rowe Price, SoftBank
Description: General Motors Co's majority-owned Cruise self-driving division said on Tuesday fund manager T. Rowe Price and a group of existing investors put down $1.15 billion in new equity, valuing the unit at $19 billion.

Headlines: Standard Chartered sets aside $900 million to cover U.S., British fines
Description: Standard Chartered PLC (StanChart) has set aside $900 million to cover fines resulting from regulatory investigations in the United States and Britain, potentially drawing a line under probes which have dogged the bank for years.

Headlines: Nissan to hold news conference at 1100 GMT to discuss board meeting
Description: Nissan Motor Co  said it will hold a news conference at 1100 GMT to discuss topics covered at board meeting today.

Headlines: Canada's TMX Group says it is looking into past conduct of CEO
Description: TMX Group  is looking into allegations about the past conduct of its chief executive officer, Lou Eccleston, the operator of the Toronto Stock Exchange said in a statement.

Headlines: How U.S. tax reform rewards companies that shift profit to tax havens
Description: The corporate tax cut passed by U.S. President Donald Trump and fellow Republicans that was in part designed to help dissuade U.S. companies from moving profits overseas may instead make the practice a lot more rewarding.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs bought Commerzbank's claim in Saudi's biggest debt saga: sources
Description: Goldman Sachs has bought a claim against The International Bank Corporation (TIBC), a Bahraini bank whose default 10 years ago triggered the biggest financial crisis in Saudi Arabia, three sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler profit rises, outlook 'firm' ahead of Peugeot merger
Description: Fiat Chrysler   posted a 7% rise in fourth-quarter profit on Thursday, boosted by strong business in North America and better results in Latin America as it headed into a merger with France's PSA .

Headlines: New York regulator to end supervision of Standard Chartered for compliance failings
Description: New York's Department of Financial Services (DFS) will end a period of monitoring of Standard Chartered  on Dec. 31, the DFS said on Wednesday, bringing to a close one strand of the bank's punishment for past failings in compliance controls.

Headlines: U.S. trade deficit shrinks on weak imports, exports
Description: The U.S. trade deficit unexpectedly narrowed in April as imports and exports tumbled, leading economists to warn that the Trump administration's "America First" agenda was curbing trade between the United States and the rest of the world.

Headlines: Wall Street drops after Saudi attacks, energy stocks spike
Description: Energy stocks spiked while most of Wall Street fell on Monday after weekend attacks on Saudi Arabia's oil facilities added to investors' concerns about geopolitical risk and a stumbling global economy.

Headlines: Lyft shares soar on Nasdaq debut, setting stage for Uber
Description: Lyft Inc's shares rose as much as 23 percent in their market debut on Friday, amid strong investor demand for the ride-hailing service that bodes well for larger rival Uber Technologies Inc.

Headlines: China's premier says cooperation with the U.S. can create mutual benefit
Description: China's premier Li Keqiang says cooperation between China and the United States can create mutual benefit, as negotiations between the world's two largest economies over a trade war continue to drag on.

Headlines: U.S. activist investors post strong gains as needling companies pays off
Description: Activist investors who are shaking up Corporate America with calls for operational fixes, refreshed boards and even sales of a company are delivering their best returns in six years with double-digit gains for 2019 after big losses in 2018.

Headlines: Foxconn looks for its next act but faces risks as it diversifies
Description: Foxconn, the Taiwanese contract manufacturer that rose to global prominence as the manufacturer of the Apple iPhone, is trying to reinvent itself as smartphone sales plateau and Apple Inc diversifies its supplier base.

Headlines: Canadian oil companies ask government for cash, credit to survive
Description: Canadian oil and gas companies are urging Ottawa to free up credit and cash to help them survive the twin shocks of COVID-19 spread and a crude price war, pitching ideas ranging from tax deferrals to backstopping bank loans.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco's 2019 profit down 21%, cuts spending
Description: Saudi Arabia's state oil giant Aramco said on Sunday its 2019 profit fell almost 21% due to lower crude oil prices and a drop in production volumes.

Headlines: Coronavirus fears weigh on U.S. manufacturing, services sectors
Description: U.S. manufacturing and services sectors activity stalled in February amid growing concerns about the deadly coronavirus' impact on the economy, boosting investor demand for safe-haven assets like government bonds.

Headlines: Exclusive: TIM excludes Huawei from 5G core equipment tender
Description: Telecom Italia (TIM)  excluded China's Huawei Technologies from a tender it launched this month for 5G equipment for the core network it is preparing to build in Italy and Brazil, two sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Stocks battered by Wall Street, fears of U.S. slowdown
Description: Global stocks fell on Wednesday, plagued by a flattening yield curve that sparked concerns about an economic slowdown in the United States and weakening expectations of a lasting U.S.-China trade truce, while the dollar steadied.

Headlines: China's top brokerage hires Vanguard ex-Asia boss for global drive
Description: China's Citic Securities Co. ,  has hired Charles Lin, the former Asia head of Vanguard Group, to be vice chairman of Hong Kong unit CLSA, as the biggest Chinese securities company seeks to build up an international presence.

Headlines: China's Shenzhen denies blocking Apple supplier Foxconn from resuming production
Description: Local Chinese authorities have not blocked Apple  supplier Foxconn  from resuming production amid a coronavirus outbreak, they said in a statement on Sunday, denying an earlier report in the Nikkei Business Daily.

Headlines: Audi, EnBW to turn electric car batteries into grid support tools
Description: German carmaker Audi  and utility EnBW  are setting up an electric car battery operation at EnBW's Heilbronn plant to build scaleable storage facilities by the end of this year, drawing on retired batteries to help power grids.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank investors unshaken by U.S. stress test failure
Description: Deutsche Bank investors took a largely long view on its failure in this year's U.S. stress tests, with its shares recovering on Friday from a record low hit earlier this week.

Headlines: Formerly detained Saudi businessmen Alwaleed and Alhokair in talks for loans
Description: Two businessmen formerly detained a part of Saudi Arabia's anti-corruption campaign are now in talks with banks for loans for their firms in excess of $3 billion, sources said, suggesting that bank markets are open again for those who have reached financial settlements with the government.

Headlines: Pilot shortages, unsold planes weigh on ATR deliveries: sources
Description: Franco-Italian turboprop maker ATR is tackling a slump in deliveries resulting from a combination of industrial delays, unsold aircraft and pilot shortages, industry sources said.

Headlines: Jury finds Platinum Partners founder guilty in fraud trial
Description: Mark Nordlicht, the founder of defunct hedge fund firm Platinum Partners, was found guilty on Tuesday of defrauding bondholders of an oil exploration company Platinum controlled, but cleared of charges he defrauded investors in Platinum's hedge funds.

Headlines: Boeing nominates former U.N. ambassador Haley to join its board
Description: U.S. aerospace manufacturer Boeing Co said on Tuesday it has nominated Nikki Haley, former U.S. ambassador to the United Nations and a close ally of President Donald Trump, to join its board of directors at the company's annual shareholders meeting on April 29.

Headlines: Boeing's 737 production cut hits its shares and those of suppliers
Description: Shares of Boeing Co fell 5 percent on Monday after the company said it would cut production of its 737 MAX aircraft, as it struggles with worldwide grounding of the narrowbody jet following two fatal crashes in less than five months.

Headlines: BlackRock talks on Intesa asset management tie-up cool but not off: sources
Description: Talks between BlackRock  and Intesa Sanpaolo  over an asset management tie-up have slowed due to political uncertainty, but the deal is not yet off, two sources familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Factbox: Impact of trade tariffs on European companies
Description: Some European companies are rethinking their strategies to cushion against the impact of trade tensions between the world's two biggest economies, the United States and China.

Headlines: South Korean prosecutors raid Hyundai's office in recall probe: Chosun Biz
Description: South Korean prosecutors on Wednesday raided the office of Hyundai Motor Co's quality division in southern Seoul as part of a probe into how the automaker and affiliate Kia Motors Corp handled vehicle recalls over engine defects, online media Chosun Biz reported.

Headlines: China's big three airlines seek Boeing compensation over 737 MAX grounding
Description: China's three biggest airlines have asked U.S. planemaker Boeing Co to compensate them for losses caused by the grounding and delayed deliveries of 737 MAX jets, just as regulators gather to discuss design changes for the troubled aircraft.

Headlines: Quarantined bankers, video roadshows: coronavirus hits Argentine debt talks
Description: Argentina's ambitious target to strike a deal with bondholders to revamp almost $70 billion in debts by the end of March was never going to be easy. Now a coronavirus outbreak and crashing bond markets threaten to complicate things further.

Headlines: Buffett's Berkshire helps bankroll Occidental's $38 billion bid for Anadarko
Description: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc committed $10 billion on Tuesday to Occidental Petroleum Corp's $38 billion cash-and-stock bid for Anadarko Petroleum Corp, boosting its chances of snatching a deal from Chevron Corp.

Headlines: Comcast second-quarter profit beats Wall St., misses on revenue
Description: Comcast Corp's  second-quarter profit on Thursday beat Wall Street estimates as it added more high-speed internet customers, but it lost more video and phone customers than expected.

Headlines: Harley-Davidson's profit beats estimates, shares rally
Description: Harley-Davidson Inc's  shares rallied on Tuesday after the motorcycle maker forecast a lower-than-expected hit to profit margins from U.S. President Donald Trump's trade tariffs and its quarterly earnings topped Wall Street estimates.

Headlines: SEC proposes rule to combat conflicted investment advice
Description: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission on Wednesday proposed a new rule that would require brokers at firms like Morgan Stanley  and Merrill Lynch Wealth Management to clearly explain the fees investors pay and commissions brokers earn when giving financial advice.

Headlines: McDonald's to curb antibiotic use in its beef supply
Description: McDonald's Corp said on Tuesday it plans to reduce the use of antibiotics in its global beef supply, fueling projections that other restaurants will follow suit.

Headlines: California farmers and Mexican cheese sales, U.S. trade war takes a toll
Description: Stephen Mancebo, a fourth-generation California dairy farmer with 2,300 cows, has battled ups and downs in his temperamental industry for a quarter-century only to find himself a casualty of a U.S trade war with one of his biggest customers - Mexico.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler revs up as Peugeot points to merger potential
Description: Fiat Chrysler shares jumped on Tuesday to the top of Europe's STOXX 600 after the president of Peugeot family holding company FFP told French daily Les Echos he would support a new deal and suggested Fiat Chrysler was among the options.

Headlines: Thyssenkrupp No.1 investor says it fully supports Chairwoman Merz
Description: The Alfried Krupp von Bohlen und Halbach foundation, Thyssenkrupp's  top shareholder with two seats on its supervisory board, on Wednesday said it fully supports chairwoman Martina Merz who is set to become the conglomerate's interim chief executive.

Headlines: Airbus stages maiden flight of upgraded A330-800
Description: Airbus  staged a maiden fight of the upgraded A330-800 jetliner on Tuesday, hoping the key milestone will boost the fortunes of a variant that has failed to make headway against newer types.

Headlines: How Chinese tariffs on U.S. imports will stand after February 14 cuts
Description: China is preparing to halve the extra tariffs on U.S goods that went into effect last September, including on crude oil, soybeans, pork and beef.

Headlines: Global stocks rally as U.S. eases Huawei restrictions
Description: The dollar rose and global equity markets advanced on Tuesday, led by chipmakers and companies exposed to Asia, after the United States temporarily eased trade restrictions on China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd.

Headlines: American Airlines flight attendants stand up to Boeing CEO on 737 MAX
Description: American Airlines' flight attendants union still has safety concerns about the Boeing 737 MAX and is demanding an active role in the relaunch of the grounded aircraft, its president told Boeing Co's  chief executive in a letter seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. senators draft plan to reform new plane design approvals after 737 MAX crashes
Description: Two key U.S. senators are circulating a bipartisan draft bill that would reform how the Federal Aviation Administration  certifies new aircraft in the wake of two fatal Boeing 737 MAX crashes that killed 346 people.

Headlines: Trump briefed on stock market sell-off: CNBC
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump has been briefed on Wednesday's stock market sell-off, a senior White House official told CNBC, as the Dow Jones Industrial Average dropped more than 3 percent in one day and the S&P 500 marked its biggest daily decline since February.

Headlines: Oracle to hire 2,000 workers to expand cloud business to more countries
Description: Oracle Corp  plans to hire nearly 2,000 additional workers as part of an aggressive plan to roll out its cloud computing services to more locations around the world, its cloud chief told Reuters on Monday.

Headlines: Autoliv says CEO Carlson to take the helm at spin-off Veoneer
Description: Autoliv  , the world's biggest maker of airbags and seatbelts, said on Thursday its chief executive Jan Carlson would become head of its electronics business, Veoneer, which it plans to spin off and list in the third quarter.

Headlines: Exclusive: Rosneft's Sechin flies to Venezuela, rebukes Maduro over oil shipments
Description: The head of Russian oil company Rosneft , Igor Sechin, flew to Caracas this week to meet Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro and complain over delayed oil shipments designed to repay loans, two sources briefed on the conversation said on Saturday.

Headlines: Cost to insure Tesla's debt rises on growing default fears
Description: (This version of the July 23 story corrects unit of upfront price in the final paragraph to "points" rather than "basis points".)

Headlines: U.S. firms hire 275,000 workers in April, most nine months: ADP
Description: U.S. private employers added 275,000 jobs in April, well above economists' expectations and the most since last July, supporting the view of a solid domestic labor market, a report by a payrolls processor showed on Wednesday.

Headlines: Cain withdraws from Fed consideration, citing lower pay, influence
Description: Herman Cain, facing resistance from his own political party as U.S. President Donald Trump's pick to fill a seat on the Federal Reserve Board, withdrew Monday from consideration for the post, citing what he said would be a decrease in influence and pay.

Headlines: Former State Street executive faces U.S. fraud trial
Description: A former executive at State Street Corp  went on trial on Monday on U.S. charges that he participated in a scheme to defraud the bank's clients by charging them secret commissions on billions of dollars in trades.

Headlines: Tesla delivers record number of electric cars in quarter, shares up 7%
Description: Tesla Inc  set a record for quarterly vehicle deliveries in a triumphant response to months of questions about demand for its luxury electric cars, sending shares up 7% after hours on Tuesday.

Headlines: No alternative to grounded Boeing 737 MAX, Aercap CEO says
Description: There is no alternative to the grounded 737 MAX and it would be "absolutely stupid" for Boeing  to launch a replacement before the next wave of technology a decade from now, the head of one of the world's top aircraft lessors said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Wall Street jumps as China stimulus measures soothe virus worries
Description: The Nasdaq hit a record high on Tuesday and the S&P 500 posted its biggest one-day gain in about six months as fears of a heavy economic impact from the coronavirus outbreak waned after China's central bank intervened.

Headlines: T-Mobile completes merger with Sprint
Description: T-Mobile US Inc said on Wednesday it officially completed the $23 billion merger with Sprint Corp, solidifying its position as the No.3 wireless providers in the United States.

Headlines: Warner Bros CEO Kevin Tsujihara resigns as AT&T probes 'mistakes'
Description: Kevin Tsujihara has resigned as the head of Warner Bros as one of Hollywood's most powerful studios investigates a report that he improperly helped an actress obtain roles at the studio.

Headlines: S.Korean shoppers go the distance to beat Chanel price hike
Description: More than a hundred shoppers waited in line outside a Chanel store in Seoul on Wednesday, shrugging off concerns about a second wave of coronavirus infections to beat imminent price hikes by the French luxury brand.

Headlines: Peugeot's DS brand adds mini-SUV to bolster rebounding sales
Description: French carmaker PSA Group unveiled an SUV version of its DS3 upscale mini as it builds on a sales rebound underway at the eight-year-old premium DS brand.

Headlines: Wells Fargo continues work from home policy to September: Bloomberg News
Description: Wells Fargo & Co  employees will be working from home till at least Sept. 7 due to the coronavirus pandemic, Bloomberg reported on Friday.

Headlines: South Korea boycott hitting sales of Japan's Uniqlo, company says
Description: A boycott on Japanese goods in South Korea has had an impact on casual clothing chain Uniqlo's sales in the country, the company said on Friday, highlighting the widening economic hit from a diplomatic row over Tokyo's wartime role.

Headlines: Brexit and the City: the real estate agent's view
Description: Like the towers now dominating its skyline, London property prices have moved in almost only one direction in recent decades, ever higher.

Headlines: Illinois corn yields seen below average but improve as tour scouts go West
Description: Corn farmers in west-central Illinois are facing potentially smaller corn yields this fall in what has been a challenging growing season after extreme weather and heavy rains delayed plantings across much of the U.S. Midwest, scouts on an annual tour said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Citi fires eight Hong Kong traders after review finds misconduct: sources
Description: Citigroup Inc has fired eight bankers and suspended three others from its equities trading desk in Hong Kong after an internal probe revealed misconduct in their dealings with clients, people with knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: Tesla accuses former employee of hacking and transferring data
Description: Tesla Inc has sued a former employee claiming that he  hacked the electric carmaker's trade secrets and transferred large amounts of company data to third parties, according to a lawsuit filed in federal court in Nevada on Wednesday.

Headlines: Citi avoids fine for overcharging interest to credit card customers
Description: The U.S. regulator for consumer finance said on Friday it would not penalize Citigroup  for overcharging credit card customers provided the bank returns $335 million to the 1.75 million borrower accounts that are due refunds.

Headlines: New Colorado environmental law stalls oil investment
Description: New environmental regulations in Colorado have chilled investment in the state's oil and gas fields as companies grapple with how local officials will respond to a law giving them more power to restrict energy production.

Headlines: Airbnb booking data from China offers glimpse of a rebound
Description: While the coronavirus pandemic has frozen global travel and hit the travel industry hard, data from home-sharing startup Airbnb Inc shows the number of domestic bookings in China for the first half of April were up more than 200% compared with the same period in March.

Headlines: Qualcomm accuses Apple of stealing its secrets to help Intel
Description: Qualcomm Inc on Tuesday accused Apple Inc of stealing its chip-making secrets and giving them to rival Intel Corp, paving the way for Apple to switch to Intel's improved semiconductors, which may have cost Qualcomm billions of dollars in lost sales.

Headlines: Ex-Fed's Yellen sees meager pick-up from Trump tax cuts
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's tax cuts are likely to give only a meager boost to productivity growth in the United States, former Federal Reserve chief Janet Yellen said on Thursday.

Headlines: Volkswagen to make batteries in Germany, slim down
Description: Volkswagen will invest almost 1 billion euros ($1.1 billion) in battery cell production at a facility in western Germany and is seeking to simplify the group by spinning off or selling units, the automaker said on Monday.

Headlines: Trump says China not ready to reach trade deal, repeats threat of more tariffs
Description: President Donald Trump on Tuesday repeated his threat to slap tariffs on an additional $267 billion of Chinese imports if Beijing retaliates for the recent levies and other measures the United States has imposed in an escalating trade war between the economic giants.

Headlines: Video makers want YouTube to change subscription tool
Description: Video makers with millions of subscribers on YouTube expressed frustration at a trade show last week that the service notifies only a portion of their followers about new posts, causing declines in viewership and their revenue.

Headlines: Saudi-Russian axis rules oil markets as Trump fights Iran
Description: Iran may be Russia's ally in the Syrian conflict but when it comes to oil, Tehran's arch-enemy Saudi Arabia takes precedence - if last week's OPEC meeting in Vienna is anything to go by.

Headlines: Impact of virus on China's economy will be temporary: PBOC papers
Description: The impact from a virus epidemic on China's economy will be limited and temporary, and the country's financial markets will return to normal in the long run, a commentary in a newspaper owned by the central bank said on Monday afternoon.

Headlines: Abraaj founder given more time to raise 15 million pound bail
Description: The Pakistani founder of Abraaj Group, once one of the largest emerging markets private equity investors, has been given more time to raise a 15 million pound ($19.5 million) bail by a London court, a court official said on Friday.

Headlines: Traders expect Cushing builds as refinery issues add to swelling supply
Description: U.S. crude traders are bracing for increasing supplies at Cushing, Oklahoma, the delivery point for benchmark crude futures, as unexpected refinery issues add to inventories that are already at the highest in more than a year.

Headlines: Explainer: How to read an aircraft's black box
Description: France's BEA safety investigators are searching for clues as to what caused an Ethiopian Airlines plane to hurtle to the ground after take-off, as they begin analyzing two black boxes that arrived in Paris on Thursday from the crashed Boeing 737 MAX.

Headlines: U.S. regulator proposes path for non-banks to gain deposit license
Description: A U.S. banking regulator proposed a set of standards Tuesday for how it would consider special charters to allow non-banks to accept deposits and engage in other limited banking activities.

Headlines: Hong Kong Airlines told to improve finances or risk losing license
Description: Hong Kong Airlines, controlled by cash-strapped Chinese conglomerate HNA Group, must shore up its financial position by Dec. 7 or risk the suspension or loss of its license, a Hong Kong air transport regulator said on Monday.

Headlines: Trump Fed nominee Shelton apologizes for likening currency forger to Rosa Parks
Description: Federal Reserve board nominee Judy Shelton on Thursday apologized for having likened a convicted currency counterfeiter to U.S. civil rights icon Rosa Parks in an unusual exchange with a lawmaker weighing her appointment to the central bank.

Headlines: Global regulator discrepancies over Boeing 737 MAX worry IATA
Description: The head of the International Air Transport Association (IATA) warned on Tuesday that any discrepancy among global regulators over reapproving Boeing Co's  737 MAX for commercial flight could set a worrying precedent for future aircraft programs.

Headlines: Novartis to streamline production in response to lower U.S. prices: NZZ am Sonntag
Description: Switzerland's Novartis  plans to streamline its worldwide production to increase its operating profit margin despite falling prices for its drugs in the United States, its chairman was reported as saying.

Headlines: Coronavirus brings jet refinancing boost: Avolon CEO
Description: Major aircraft lessor Avolon and its peers stand to benefit from the coronavirus outbreak as airlines shore up cash by refinancing their planes, the Dublin-based firm said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Starbucks closes most U.S., Canada cafes, moves to drive-through
Description: Starbucks Corp  said on Friday it will close most of its company operated cafes across north America for two weeks, limiting its services to drive-throughs, to help stem the spread of the highly contagious coronavirus.

Headlines: Capri estimates 70% plunge in first-quarter revenue, plans Michael Kors store closures
Description: Michael Kors owner Capri Holdings Ltd  on Wednesday estimated a stunning 70% drop in first-quarter revenue as the COVID-19 pandemic hammered demand for its luxury handbags and dresses.

Headlines: Israel, Boeing sign reciprocal spending deal: ministry
Description: Boeing  has agreed to spend billions of dollars in Israel over the coming decade if it wins major defense contracts, Israel's Economy Ministry said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Newmont says aware of Barrick's buyout talk but will not comment
Description: Newmont Mining Corp said on Friday it was aware that Canadian rival Barrick Gold Corp said it had studied an unsolicited buyout proposal for the company, a deal that would, if consummated, bring together two of the world's leading gold producers.

Headlines: Major 737 MAX buyer Air Lease remains confident in demand for jet
Description: Aircraft lessor Air Lease Corp , which has ordered 150 of Boeing's  grounded 737 MAX, remains confident in the jet's long-term value, Chief Financial Officer Greg Willis said on Wednesday after Boeing announced a new delay to its return.

Headlines: Stocks slip, dollar gains as China cuts growth target
Description: A gauge of world stock markets recovered from early declines but was slightly lower on Tuesday as China cut its growth targets to a 30-year low but added more stimulus, while strong U.S. economic data sent the dollar to a two-week high.

Headlines: Oil outlook sours as sanctions, global tensions fail to bring out bulls
Description: Sentiment in the oil market has shifted dramatically in recent days, with hedge funds, producers and traders all taking a more bearish tack in response to what they see as weakness in worldwide demand.

Headlines: Airbus grabs China Airlines narrow-body jet order
Description: Airbus unveiled an aircraft deal with Taiwan's China Airlines on Wednesday, snatching the carrier's medium-haul fleet renewal from Boeing a day after its U.S. rival made a shock entry into the single-aisle fleet of British Airways owner IAG.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. manufacturing group hacked by China as trade talks intensified - sources
Description: As trade talks between Washington and Beijing intensified earlier this year, suspected Chinese hackers broke into an industry group for U.S. manufacturers that has helped shape President Donald Trump's trade policies, according to two people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Apple inks deal with Samsung to distribute iTunes shows on TVs
Description: Samsung Electronics Co Ltd  said Sunday that it will add an app to its smart televisions in the coming months to let owners watch content bought on Apple Inc's  iTunes service, a possible first sign Apple is looking to distribute its forthcoming television service on devices made by others.

Headlines: Saudi Arabia says has 'nothing to do' with Bezos-AMI dispute
Description: Saudi Arabia had "absolutely nothing to do" with the National Enquirer's reporting on an extramarital relationship involving Amazon.com Inc Chief Executive Jeff Bezos, the kingdom's minister of state for foreign affairs said.

Headlines: Malaysia seeks payment relief by challenging 1MDB-IPIC settlement
Description: Malaysia will file a legal challenge to a settlement agreement between scandal-plagued state fund 1MDB and Abu Dhabi sovereign fund IPIC negotiated during the premiership of former leader Najib Razak, its attorney general said on Tuesday.

Headlines: China's February trade surplus with U.S. narrows sharply to $14.72 billion
Description: China's trade surplus with the United States narrowed to $14.72 billion in February, from $27.3 billion in January, customs data showed on Friday.

Headlines: Tariff talks 'have begun,' top officials meet Wednesday: Mexican minister
Description: Mexico's Foreign Minister Marcelo Ebrard said he started negotiating with officials in Washington on Friday after U.S. President Donald Trump threatened tariffs on imports of Mexican products but face-to-face talks will not happen until next week.

Headlines: UK to invest two billion pounds in new fighter programme through 2025
Description: Britain will invest 2 billion pounds ($2.7 billion) to 2025 to develop a fighter jet called Tempest that could be used with pilots or as a drone, its defence minister said on Monday, unveiling a life-sized model of the new stealthy warplane.

Headlines: Germany's Scholz says Lufthansa talks were good
Description: The German government on Monday held last-ditch talks about a 9 billion euros Lufthansa  bailout on Monday, Finance Minister Olaf Scholz said, as Berlin politicians seek to resolve a standoff with a key shareholder in the airline.

Headlines: U.S. waives tariffs on Japanese aluminum for Tesla battery cells
Description: The U.S. Commerce Department has agreed to Tesla Inc's request to waive 10 percent tariffs on imported aluminum from Japan used in the manufacture of battery cells at Tesla's Nevada Gigafactory, government documents show.

Headlines: Iran says it is seeking solution to sell oil and transfer revenues: IRNA
Description: Iran's vice president said on Sunday the government was seeking solutions to sell oil and transfer its revenues after the United States withdrew from a nuclear deal with Tehran and slapped fresh sanctions on Iranian energy and banking sectors.

Headlines: Shanghai tightens airport checks as imported virus infections in China jump
Description: Shanghai increased airport screening on Saturday as imported coronavirus infections from countries such as Italy and Iran emerge as the biggest source of new cases in China outside Hubei, the province where the outbreak originated.

Headlines: Apple, some U.S. retailers close stores to contain virus
Description: Apple Inc  said it is closing all its retail stores, except those in Greater China, for the next two weeks to minimize the risk of coronavirus transmission, a move that was followed by several U.S. retailers on Saturday.

Headlines: IPO prospectus lays out main risks to Aramco's operations
Description: Saudi state oil giant Aramco unveiled the prospectus for its initial public offering (IPO) on Saturday, laying out the main material risks that may adversely affect the company's business or its financial position.

Headlines: Vodafone names Heineken's Van Boxmeer as new chairman
Description: Vodafone , the world's second-biggest mobile operator, has recruited Jean-Francois Van Boxmeer, the current CEO of brewer Heineken , to succeed Gerard Kleisterlee as chairman from November this year.

Headlines: U.S business groups urge Trump to postpone further China tariff hike
Description: Over 160 business groups on Wednesday appealed to U.S. President Donald Trump in a letter to postpone all tariff hikes on Chinese imports scheduled this year, warning that it could hit shoppers with higher prices during the holiday season.

Headlines: Drugmaker Lundbeck to settle U.S. charity probe for $52.6 million
Description: Danish drugmaker Lundbeck  said on Wednesday that it will pay $52.6 million to resolve a U.S. probe into its financial support of patient assistance charitable foundations.

Headlines: No tariff fears for Nike after online success
Description: Nike Inc's  online sales growth and a bullish outlook in China put it on a firm path for years to come and should help it easily ride out rises in U.S. import tariffs on its Chinese-made sneakers, Wall Street analysts said on Wednesday after a strong set of quarterly results.

Headlines: Some LSE investors call on Hong Kong exchange to up bid by 20%, add cash
Description: Some London Stock Exchange investors have told Hong Kong Exchanges and Clearing (HKEX) that any bid must contain more cash and be up to 20% higher to persuade them to engage, three shareholders and a banking source close to the deal said.

Headlines: House panel to discuss Big Tech's impact on privacy, antitrust
Description: The House of Representatives' antitrust panel will hold a hearing next week to discuss the effect of consumer data collection by big tech platforms, like Alphabet's Google and Amazon, on online competition.

Headlines: Equality key to rescuing U.S.-China business ties: U.S. business lobby
Description: Recent strains in the relationship between the United States and China make it especially important to establish a policy of 'competitive neutrality' the American Chamber of Commerce in China said on Thursday.

Headlines: Boeing says new MAX delay not due to new technical issues
Description: Boeing's  decision to advise customers its grounded 737 MAX jet was unlikely to secure flight approval until mid-year was not due to any new technical issues, a senior marketing executive said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Subaru extends U.S. assembly plant shutdown through May 8
Description: Japanese automaker Subaru Corp  said Tuesday it will extend a shutdown of its Indiana assembly plant through May 8 because of declining market demand and supply chain issues related to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Bezos' Blue Origin and others get $2.3 billion in U.S. Air Force rocket contracts
Description: The U.S. Air Force on Wednesday said that it had awarded a total $2.3 billion in contracts to develop rocket launch systems for national security missions.

Headlines: Ghosn 'very comfortable' after Lebanon questioning: lawyer
Description: Carlos Ghosn's lawyer said he was "very comfortable" with legal proceedings in Lebanon on Thursday, after the fugitive ex-Nissan boss was questioned over an extradition request from Japan where he faces financial misappropriation charges.

Headlines: German authorities seek arrest of second Wirecard executive: Handelsblatt
Description: German prosecutors will seek the arrest of Jan Marsalek, former chief operating officer of Wirecard , the payments company engulfed in a $2.1 billion accounting scandal, business daily Handelsblatt reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: Tencent, Alibaba, Xiaomi units win Hong Kong online banking license
Description: Hong Kong's banking regulator has issued four more online-only banking licenses to units of Alibaba, PingAn and smartphone maker Xiaomi, as well as to a JV involving Tencent, ICBC and Hillhouse Capital.

Headlines: Big drone on campus: UPS gets U.S. government okay for drone airline
Description: United Parcel Service Inc on Tuesday said it won the U.S. government's first full approval to operate a drone airline, which gave it a lead in the nascent U.S. drone delivery business over rivals Amazon.com Inc and Alphabet Inc.

Headlines: CSX profit tops Wall St target on cost cuts, pricing power
Description: CSX Corp  on Tuesday posted quarterly profit that topped Wall Street's target, as the No. 3 U.S. railroad operator benefited from an ongoing cost-cutting drive and rising prices for carrying freight.

Headlines: Commerzbank cancels its 2019 dividend recommendation
Description: Commerzbank  said on Monday that it will not propose a dividend for 2019.

Headlines: AT&T to close Time Warner purchase by June 20: attorney
Description: AT&T plans to close its purchase of Time Warner Inc no later than June 20 after a U.S. court decided it could move ahead with the deal, the company's lead attorney said on Tuesday.

Headlines: China says willing to meet U.S. over trade issues on equal footing
Description: China is willing to resolve trade issues with the United States through mutually respectful talks and on an equal footing, said one of the country's vice commerce ministers Wang Bingnan on Saturday.

Headlines: Lyft to require passengers and drivers to wear masks
Description: Lyft  will require both passengers and drivers to wear masks and complete a health certification program, including confirming before each ride that they are not displaying symptoms associated with the novel coronavirus, the company said on Thursday.

Headlines: BT to strip China's Huawei from core networks, limit 5G access
Description: Britain's BT Group said on Wednesday it was removing Huawei Technologies' equipment from the core of its existing 3G and 4G mobile operations and would not use the Chinese company in central parts of the next network.

Headlines: EU executive to partly shield WTO candidate Hogan from public view
Description: EU trade chief Phil Hogan will limit public appearances after he put himself forward as a possible candidate to become the next head of the World Trade Organization, the European Commission said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Exxon used economic uncertainty to push for Paulsboro, N.J., contract: sources
Description: Exxon Mobil Corp  used economic uncertainty tied to the coronavirus pandemic to urge workers at its lubricants and packaging plant in Paulsboro, New Jersey, to vote for a proposed contract, according to two sources familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Ackman eyes more gains for his fund with help of Berkshire, others
Description: Billionaire investor William Ackman, whose portfolio has gained almost 50% this year, said his fund can keep delivering "high, long-term" returns, and he expects that a newly disclosed stake in Berkshire Hathaway Inc  will help boost gains.

Headlines: Elon Musk owes $507 million to banks helping Tesla raise capital
Description: Tesla Inc Chief Executive Elon Musk personally owes $507 million to Wall Street banks involved in Tesla's stock and debt sale, backed by his stake in the electric car maker, a company filing showed on Thursday.

Headlines: LVMH to make disinfectant gels to aid French coronavirus fight
Description: Louis Vuitton owner LVMH  said on Sunday that its cosmetics unit would manufacture large quantities of hand disinfectant gel to help stave off a nationwide shortage across France as the coronavirus rapidly spreads.

Headlines: How Santander's Brazil unit is driving growth with car loans
Description: At BM Multimarcas, a used-car dealer on the outskirts of Sao Paulo, owner Santel de Abreu Bernardo can show you jalopies that most big banks would not touch.

Headlines: Uber loses latest UK legal bid to block worker rights for drivers
Description: Uber has lost its latest court bid to stop its British drivers being classified as workers, entitling them to rights such as the minimum wage, in a decision which jeopardizes the taxi app's business model.

Headlines: Group close to India's ruling party seeks change in patent act after pro-Monsanto court verdict
Description: A nationalist group close to Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's party said on Tuesday it would seek a legislative amendment to the rules governing patents, after the country's top court ruled in favor of Monsanto's cotton seed patent.

Headlines: Car parts maker Faurecia sees record profits in 2022, shares rise
Description: French car parts maker Faurecia  said it was targeting record sales, profits and cash generation in 2022 as a result of its strategy program and the boost from its acquisition of Japanese company Clarion, lifting its shares.

Headlines: Hyundai confident reorganization will benefit shareholders
Description: South Korea's Hyundai Motor Group said on Wednesday it was "confident" its plan to streamline its governance structure would benefit shareholders, amid investor concerns that the controlling family's interests were being put first.

Headlines: Rio Tinto scraps plans for Canadian iron ore unit sale, floatation - WSJ
Description: Anglo-Australian miner Rio Tinto PLC   has cancelled plans for the sale or floatation of its Canadian iron ore business, following unsuccessful attempts to find buyers, the Wall Street Journal reported on Sunday.

Headlines: Banks and funds lower red flags on supercharged stocks
Description: A raft of major banks and fund managers have upgraded their view on global equities, with emerging-market stocks their top pick to benefit from signs of easing in the Sino-U.S. trade dispute.

Headlines: Investors focus on retailers as wages rise
Description: U.S. companies are warning about rising wages eating into profit margins, increasing investor worries that next year's expected drop in profit growth may be sharper than feared.

Headlines: 'Crown jewel' Aramco stirs loyal Saudi demand for giant IPO
Description: From taxi drivers to clerics, Saudis clamoring to own part of state oil giant Aramco went online and to local banks on Sunday at the start of a long-delayed share sale for what could be the world's biggest initial public offering.

Headlines: Berkshire invests in JPMorgan, Oracle as Buffett puts cash to work
Description: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc deepened its commitment to the U.S. financial industry, announcing a $4.02 billion stake in JPMorgan Chase & Co and new investments in PNC Financial Services Group Inc and Travelers Companies Inc, plus a stake in Oracle Corp.

Headlines: Tesla drops cheapest Model X, S variants, cuts prices to simplify lineup
Description: Tesla Inc  has dropped the standard-range variants of its Model X and Model S from its product lineup and adjusted prices across its range, in a sales push that comes days after the U.S. electric vehicle maker reported record deliveries.

Headlines: Thomas Cook customers may face two-month delay for refunds: watchdog
Description: Britain's aviation regulator said on Monday that refunds of bookings by Thomas Cook customers could take longer than expected as the regulator does not have all information needed from the collapsed travel firm.

Headlines: SEC freezes assets of 18 traders over alleged manipulation
Description: U.S. authorities said on Wednesday it has obtained an asset freeze against 18 traders, who are primarily China-based, over an international market manipulation scheme that has reaped more than $31 million in illicit profits over several years.

Headlines: Factbox: Ford and General Motors' electric vehicle plans
Description: Ford Motor Co  and General Motors Co , the top two U.S. automakers, have more than two dozen new battery electric vehicles (EVs) in the pipeline, according to their executives and suppliers familiar with the companies' plans.

Headlines: India court halts expansion of Vedanta's copper smelter after protest killings
Description: One person died and others were wounded by gunfire in southern India on Wednesday in fresh violence related to protesters' demands that a copper smelter be shut on environmental grounds. The day before at least ten people were killed by police during a mass demonstration against the plant.

Headlines: Shares in big banks climb as Fed approves capital plans
Description: Shares in the S&P 500 bank index  rose about 2% on Friday after the U.S. Federal Reserve approved the capital plans of the biggest U.S. banks, giving them a clean bill of health.

Headlines: Pentagon deal to boost Microsoft's position in cloud computing: analysts
Description: Amazon.com Inc's  firm grip on the cloud computing market could be threatened by Microsoft Corp's  multi-billion dollar contract with the Pentagon, Wall Street analysts said on Monday.

Headlines: Thomson Reuters expects higher 2018 costs, shares drop
Description: Thomson Reuters Corp   forecast its corporate costs would more than double for the year but revenue would only increase modestly. The prediction sent shares of the news and information company down 4 percent as investors fretted about earnings growth after it completes a plan to sell a majority stake in its largest unit.

Headlines: Wells Fargo officials enter $240 million settlement over bogus accounts
Description: Wells Fargo & Co executives and directors have reached a $240 million settlement with U.S. shareholders over the creation by bank employees of millions of unauthorized customer accounts.

Headlines: Discounts may help cure U.S. auto market's coronavirus hangover
Description: Texas auto dealer Hayden Elder says March was his worst month in 42 years selling cars thanks to the coronavirus, but April brought days that were "almost normal" and he expects bigger customer discounts to help him sell more Dodge Ram pickup trucks this month.

Headlines: Kraft Heinz cuts output at three plants, adds shifts for mac & cheese
Description: Kraft Heinz Co  said on Friday it has moved to significantly reduce production at three plants providing restaurant supplies amid the new coronavirus outbreak, but its CEO noted the company has added shifts at others to meet demand for packaged foods like macaroni and cheese.

Headlines: Boeing to pull the plug on its 747 jumbo jet: Bloomberg News
Description: Boeing Co  is pulling the plug on its 747 jumbo jet, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday.

Headlines: China says no one wants a trade war
Description: No one wants a trade war, China's foreign ministry said on Thursday, adding that the country was not provoking one, ahead of the start date of July 6 set by the United States to levy tariffs on $34 billion of Chinese imports.

Headlines: Rangers hold advantage but Gerrard preaches caution
Description: Rangers will head into the return leg of their Europa League qualifier against Maribor with a sense of optimism after a 3-1 win over the Slovenians on Thursday but manager Steven Gerrard knows from experience a two-goal lead in Europe is never enough.

Headlines: Trump to meet with Chinese Vice Premier Liu He at 2:45 p.m. EDT/1845 GMT Friday
Description: President Donald Trump will meet with Chinese Vice Premier Liu He at 2:45 p.m. EDT/1845 GMT on Friday as the world's two biggest economies try to reach a trade agreement, the White House said.

Headlines: Amazon to buy PillPack in potentially disruptive drug retail push
Description: Amazon.com Inc said on Thursday it would buy small online pharmacy PillPack, a move that will put the world's biggest online retailer in direct competition with drugstore chains, drug distributors and pharmacy benefit managers.

Headlines: Amazon, Berkshire, JPMorgan's healthcare venture names COO
Description: The newly formed healthcare venture of Amazon.com Inc, Berkshire Hathaway Inc and JPMorgan Chase & Co on Tuesday hired Jack Stoddard as chief operating officer.

Headlines: Fed alone cant stop coronavirus selloff, investors say, as stocks tumble again
Description: The Federal Reserve's unprecedented stimulus measures did little to brighten Wall Street's immediate outlook on coronavirus-ravaged stocks, as concerns remained about the lack of a government stimulus package and the ability to contain the pandemic.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler new CEO will announce plans for organization by end month
Description: Fiat Chrysler  new CEO Mike Manley will announce his organizational plans for the car maker by the end of September, the group's chairman said at a shareholder meeting called to vote on the appointment of the new manager after former Chief Executive Sergio Marchionne's sudden death.

Headlines: White House welcomes looks into reports Trump's consultants misused Facebook data: official
Description: President Donald Trump wants Americans' privacy to be protected and welcomes investigations into reports the Cambridge Analytica consulting firm that he hired to help win the 2016 U.S. election improperly used personal data of 50 million Facebook Inc users, a White House official said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Progress in U.S.-China trade talks sparks world stock rally
Description: Progress in the U.S.-China trade talks helped send world stock markets broadly higher on Friday and pulled investors out of the safety of government bonds.

Headlines: Goldman says legal losses could be up to $1.9 billion more than reserves
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc said losses related to ongoing lawsuits could possibly exceed its reserve for legal matters by up to $1.9 billion.

Headlines: Exclusive: BP eyes sale of Algerian gas plant after Rosneft talks fail - sources
Description: BP  is seeking buyers for its stake in a major Algerian gas plant deep in the Sahara desert after recent talks on a sale to Russian oil giant Rosneft  failed, three industry sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Tencent sues Toutiao for alleged defamation, demands 1 yuan and apology
Description: Chinese social media giant Tencent Holdings on Friday said it is suing two companies under domestic rival Toutiao for alleged defamation, escalating its growing feud with the firm behind what is currently the world's most downloaded iPhone app.

Headlines: China woes persist as pressure point for U.S. corporate profits
Description: The U.S.-China trade war persists as an impediment to the growth of U.S. companies, even as the two countries appear close to clinching a limited agreement.

Headlines: U.S. appeals court says Trump cannot dodge foreign corruption lawsuit
Description: A U.S. federal appeals court on Friday revived a lawsuit alleging President Donald Trump violated the U.S. Constitution by profiting from foreign and domestic officials who patronized his hotels and restaurants, moving a watchdog group closer to obtaining financial records from his real estate company.

Headlines: SoftBank shares close down 17% in biggest one-day fall
Description: Shares of SoftBank Group Corp  closed down 17% on Thursday in their biggest one-day fall, hammered by investor scepticism over the outlook for tech bets, such as office sharing firm WeWork and ridehailer Uber .

Headlines: Pfizer pumps $600 million into venture capital arm
Description: Pfizer Inc  said on Wednesday it planned to invest $600 million in its venture capital fund, a quarter of which would be earmarked for promising research on neuroscience.

Headlines: China's 2019 annual crude imports set record for 17th year
Description: China's crude oil imports in 2019 surged 9.5% from a year earlier, setting a record for a 17th straight year, as demand growth from new refineries built last year propelled purchases by the world's biggest importer, data showed on Tuesday.

Headlines: American Airlines president sees growth in higher-margin U.S. hubs
Description: American Airlines  President Robert Isom said on Wednesday he sees growth opportunities in three higher-margin hubs where the U.S. carrier will be adding gates and flights over the next three years.

Headlines: LVMH refrains from renegotiating Tiffany deal, sources say
Description: French luxury goods giant  is not asking to renegotiate its $16.2-billion acquisition of U.S. jewelry chain Tiffany & Co  after deliberating whether to do so, people familiar with the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: Credit Suisse CDS jump after CEO Thiam quits
Description: The cost of insuring exposure to debt issued by Credit Suisse  jumped by 3 basis points (bps) on Friday after Chief Executive Tidjane Thiam quit amid a power struggle at Switzerland's second-biggest bank.

Headlines: Fed's Harker says central bank works to keep markets liquid amid coronavirus 'black swan' shock
Description: Philadelphia Federal Reserve Bank President Patrick Harker said on Tuesday the global economy is reeling from the shock caused by the coronavirus, and that central bankers need to do what they can to stimulate the economy and keep markets functioning.

Headlines: As Stanley Ho prepares to cash in his chips, an uncertain future for SJM
Description: Macau's oldest gambling company, SJM Holdings , is playing catch up as its rivals ride the wave of a gambling boom in the southern Chinese territory.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco to meet investors in Dubai and Abu Dhabi: sources
Description: Saudi Aramco plans meetings with investors in Dubai next week, sources said, in which it is seeking to raise up to $25.6 billion in the world's biggest share sale.

Headlines: Oil hits 13-month lows as coronavirus cuts demand
Description: Oil prices fell to the lowest in more than a year on Monday as the coronavirus outbreak curtailed Chinese demand and sparked potential supply cuts by OPEC and its allies.

Headlines: Unilever to shield workers from financial impact of coronavirus
Description: Consumer goods giant Unilever Plc  said on Tuesday it would protect its workforce from the financial impact of the coronavirus by continuing to pay contractors and other part time staff for up to three months.

Headlines: British Airways could suspend 36,000 employees: BBC
Description: IAG-owned British Airways  is expected to announce a suspension of about 36,000 of its employees, BBC News reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: Porsche appeals against seizure of files in emissions raid
Description: Porsche has appealed against the seizure of files by prosecutors during a raid last week on the sports car brand's premises related to inquiries into emissions manipulations, prosecutors said.

Headlines: American Airlines preparing to send furlough warnings this week
Description: American Airlines  is preparing to send notices of potential furloughs, as well as early retirement packages to encourage voluntary departures, to its workers later this week, two people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: ECB pushes out rate hike, offers cheap cash to banks
Description: The European Central Bank changed tack on its tightening plan on Thursday, pushing out the timing of its first post-crisis rate hike until 2020 at the earliest and offering banks a new round of cheap loans to help revive the euro zone economy.

Headlines: Comcast launches tools to improve ad targeting on TV
Description: Comcast Corp on Monday launched new advertising capabilities to help advertisers find and target certain television viewers, as the largest U.S. cable TV provider tries to lure ad dollars away from digital rivals.

Headlines: Rogers pulls 2020 outlook, misses estimates as coronavirus crisis deepens
Description: Rogers Communications Inc pulled its 2020 forecast and reported a lower-than-expected profit on Wednesday, as widespread cancellation of sports events hammered ad sales and demand for new routers took a hit due to the lockdowns.

Headlines: More shale, who cares? Saudi Arabia pushes for at least $70 oil
Description: Budget needs are forcing Saudi Arabia to push for oil prices of at least $70 per barrel this year, industry sources say, even though U.S. shale oil producers could benefit and Riyadh's share of global crude markets might be further eroded.

Headlines: VW sees production stoppages due to new testing rules
Description: Volkswagen  faces production stoppages next quarter due to bottlenecks caused by new lab tests for emissions and fuel consumption, and will discuss the implications for workers in the coming days, it said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Swiss Re lines up UBS CEO Ermotti to become chairman in 2021
Description: Swiss Re  plans to make UBS Group Chief Executive Sergio Ermotti its chairman from next year, the world's second-biggest reinsurer said on Tuesday, turning to a financial industry veteran with scant insurance experience.

Headlines: Bitcoin tumbles as hackers hit South Korean exchange Coinrail
Description: South Korean cryptocurrency exchange Coinrail said it was hacked over the weekend, sparking a steep fall in bitcoin amid renewed concerns about security at virtual currency exchanges as global policy makers struggled to regulate trading in the digital asset.

Headlines: Raytheon beats profit estimates, raises full-year forecast
Description: Defense contractor Raytheon Co  beat analysts' estimates for third-quarter profit on Thursday and raised its full-year forecast, helped by sales of Patriot missile defense systems and cybersecurity services.

Headlines: Daimler threatened with recall of over 600,000 diesel models: Spiegel
Description: Daimler faces a recall order for more than 600,000 diesel-engine vehicles including C-Class and G-Class models because of suspected emissions manipulation, German magazine Der Spiegel reported on Friday.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs will slow consumer loan growth if market falters
Description: Goldman Sachs  will limit loan growth in one of its new business areas if it sees a marked deterioration in credit quality, potentially jeopardizing new Chief Executive David Solomon's task of boosting revenue by $5 billion by 2020.

Headlines: What changed for the Fed in seven weeks? Trade risks top the list
Description: On May 1, the Federal Reserve viewed the American economy as having a solid footing and risks to the outlook were muted.

Headlines: Instant View: S&P rises above 3,000 level for first time since March
Description: U.S. stocks rose above the 3,000 level for the first time since March 5 on Tuesday, continuing a rally that has pushed the benchmark index up nearly 35% from its March 23 closing low on hopes for a potential coronavirus vaccine and the reopening of businesses across the country.

Headlines: Volkswagen board formally okays Ford alliance projects
Description: Volkswagen  said on Thursday its supervisory board had approved several projects in a multibillion-dollar alliance with Ford Motor  that was first announced last July.

Headlines: GM to revive Hummer name with electric pickups, SUVs: sources
Description: General Motors Co  will revive the Hummer name to sell a new family of electric pickup trucks and sport utility vehicles and will tout the return with a Super Bowl ad featuring NBA star LeBron James, two people briefed on the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: Boeing postpones 777X event after Ethiopian Airlines crash
Description: Boeing Co said late Sunday it will postpone the planned ceremonial debut of its 777X widebody aircraft after Sunday's crash of an Ethiopian Airlines plane that left 157 dead.

Headlines: Macy's says return to normal business at least a year away
Description: Macy's Inc  warned on Tuesday its business was not likely to return to normal until late next year, even as it saw better-than-expected sales from stores reopening after COVID-19 lockdowns were lifted across the United States.

Headlines: Akzo Nobel reshapes business with 10 billion euro sale
Description: Akzo Nobel will sell its chemicals business in a 10.1 billion euro ($12.6 billion) deal to buyers led by Carlyle Group, the maker of Dulux paints said on Tuesday, making good on a promise made as it fought off a takeover last year.

Headlines: Myanmar activists welcome Zuckerberg's 24-hour target to block hate speech on Facebook
Description: Myanmar civil society groups welcomed a commitment by Facebook Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg to tackle hate speech within 24 hours as the social media giant fights messages inciting violence, but urged it to deploy more resources in the country.

Headlines: Four Republican lawmakers ask Trump to move forward with $10 billion Pentagon cloud contract
Description: Four Republican members of U.S. Congress, including House Armed Services Committee ranking member Mac Thornberry, sent a letter to President Donald Trump on Thursday urging him to move forward with a $10 billion cloud contract with the Defense Department.

Headlines: AirAsia mulls dual Airbus jet order but how much will it pay?
Description: AirAsia  is discussing the possible purchase of another 100 Airbus A321neo jets as the company's chief executive officer, Malaysian entrepreneur Tony Fernandes, and Airbus go down to the wire in parallel negotiations for an expanded order for larger A330neo jets, industry sources said.

Headlines: EU, China stumble over trade, human rights ahead of summit
Description: Tensions over trade, investments and minority rights are preventing China and the EU from agreeing a joint declaration at a summit next week, multiple sources in Brussels said on Friday, sapping a European push for greater access to Chinese markets.

Headlines: Trump considers delisting Chinese firms from U.S. markets: sources
Description: President Donald Trump's administration is considering delisting Chinese companies from U.S. stock exchanges, three sources briefed on the matter said on Friday, in what would be a radical escalation of U.S.-China trade tensions.

Headlines: U.S. economy growing modestly as trade war dents activity: Fed
Description: The U.S. economy grew at a modest pace in recent weeks, with manufacturing buffeted by a global slowdown while consumer purchases gave mixed signals on the strength of household spending, the Federal Reserve reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: Amazon opens pop-up store on China's Pinduoduo until year-end
Description: Amazon.com Inc on Monday said it will open a pop-up store on Chinese e-commerce platform Pinduoduo Inc that will run until the end of December and carry a selection of about 1,000 products from overseas.

Headlines: France holds out over start of EU trade talks with Trump
Description: France expressed reservations on Friday about proposed trade negotiations with the United States, diplomats said, while other EU countries supported talks with Washington that could ward off punitive U.S. tariffs on European cars.

Headlines: Kraft Heinz sees potential in baby food, will keep Plasmon
Description: Global packaged food group Kraft Heinz Co  will keep baby food line Plasmon and plans to leverage its 'Made in Italy' credentials to expand the brand abroad, Kraft Heinz Co's general manager for Italy said.

Headlines: UK's Cambridge University questions Facebook about academic's role in data breach
Description: Cambridge University said it wanted Facebook to confirm its academic Alex Kogan used no university data, resources or facilities at a time when the social network says he violated its rules by passing user information on to Cambridge Analytica.

Headlines: Britain's Lloyds criticized for mistreating victims of major fraud
Description: Lloyds Banking Group  has been heavily criticized for mishandling a compensation scheme for victims of one of Britain's biggest banking scandals in a report published on Tuesday.

Headlines: Cowboys owner Jerry Jones has a long-term game plan for Haynesville gas
Description: At a time when companies in a U.S. natural gas field have been losing money and exiting Louisiana's Haynesville shale basin, Dallas Cowboys' owner Jerry Jones' Comstock Resources  is picking up cheap assets, betting on the field's proximity to the growing U.S. Gulf Coast export hub.

Headlines: AT&T to cut jobs in weaker business units
Description: AT&T Inc is cutting some jobs in declining areas of its business, while hiring more people in faster-growing segments, an AT&T spokesman said on Monday.

Headlines: German industry groups warn U.S. on tariffs before Trump-Juncker meeting
Description: German industry groups warned on Sunday, before European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker meets U.S. President Donald Trump this week, that tariffs the United States has imposed or is threatening to introduce risk harming America itself.

Headlines: Ryanair's UK pilot union threatens strike action over promotion system
Description: The union representing Ryanair  pilots in Britain, the airline's largest market, has threatened possible strike action unless the company implements a transparent system to manage promotions and transfers, according to a letter seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Marriott looks to reboot loyalty plan after cyber attack
Description: Marriott International Inc will relaunch its loyalty program under a new brand name, the company said on Wednesday, as it seeks to undo the damage to its name from a massive cyber attack that led to millions of customer records being stolen.

Headlines: Ryanair sees risk to 2020 growth if 737 MAX grounded beyond November
Description: The boss of Europe's Ryanair Holdings  warned on Wednesday the impact of the prolonged grounding of Boeing Co's  737 MAX on the airline's growth plans may start to spill over to next summer if the airplane is not flying again by November.

Headlines: Boeing completes 737 MAX software update, working on pilot training plan
Description: Boeing Co said on Thursday it had completed a software update for its 737 MAX jets, which have been grounded worldwide since March after they were involved in two fatal crashes.

Headlines: Federal Reserve scraps 'qualitative' test for U.S. banks in 2019 stress tests
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve said on Wednesday it would no longer flunk banks based on operational or risk management lapses during its annual health check of the country's domestic banks.

Headlines: Sweden opens Ericsson bribery probe after U.S. settlement: paper
Description: Sweden's prosecution authority has opened an investigation into possible bribery by employees at mobile telecoms group Ericsson  that came to light during a U.S. probe into corruption, daily Dagens Industri wrote on Thursday.

Headlines: China vows 'necessary' measures in response to UK's Huawei ban
Description: China will take necessary measures in response to Britain's "discriminatory" ban on Huawei Technologies Co Ltd [HWT.UL], which has severely damaged China's investment confidence in the country, China's Commerce Ministry said on Thursday.

Headlines: Citigroup executives see better growth ahead, but not yet
Description: Citigroup Inc  is still on track to hit its goals for efficiency and revenue growth, executives said on Friday, as analysts pressed them to explain how those expectations line up with second-quarter results.

Headlines: Tesla ends 'Spartan diet' and seeks $2.3 billion to fund expansion
Description: Tesla Inc will raise up to $2.3 billion in new capital, renouncing what Elon Musk called a "Spartan diet" and easing Wall Street concerns about the money-losing company's ability to overcome a drop in sales and build new product lines.

Headlines: Stock market rally pauses, bonds edge higher on fears of second virus wave
Description: World equity markets slid and safe-haven bonds climbed on Tuesday as rising concerns about a second wave of coronavirus infections outweighed stronger economic data from China and upbeat corporate earnings in Europe.

Headlines: Asian business sentiment edges up to hit seven-year high: Thomson Reuters/INSEAD
Description: (This version of March 21's story has been refiled to remove the incorrect statement in the last paragraph that the auto sector matched its highest reading ever.)

Headlines: Low inflation? Nothing to worry about, Fed's George says
Description: Kansas City Federal Reserve Bank President Esther George on Sunday rejected the notion that the U.S. central bank should  cut interest rates to try to boost low inflation, which she said is largely a result of global forces that U.S. monetary policy can do little to counter.

Headlines: S&P 500, Dow gain as upbeat retail sales offset recession fears
Description: The S&P 500 and the Dow gained ground in a late rally on Thursday as upbeat retail sales data offset recessionary fears amid the simmering U.S.-China trade tensions.

Headlines: Worker crunch hits world's top medical glove maker as demand spikes
Description: The world's biggest maker of medical gloves is grappling with a serious shortage of workers as it tries to meet a huge surge in demand as countries such as the United States run out of personal protective gear due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: BlackRock may keep fees despite executive's U.S. campaign donation: SEC
Description: BlackRock Inc can keep fees from the state of Ohio despite a donation one of its top executives made to Governor John Kasich's U.S. presidential campaign, according to a preliminary ruling late on Friday by a securities regulator.

Headlines: Carmakers must offer customers incentives to replace diesel models: German minister
Description: Germany's transport minister is in talks with carmakers about how much money they should offer customers to exchange old diesel models for new cars, Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung reported.

Headlines: Justice Department's Delrahim recused from Google antitrust review
Description: The head of the Justice Department's Antitrust Division, Makan Delrahim, has been recused from the Google portion of the agency's review of big technology platforms due to potential conflicts of interest, a spokesman for the agency said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Coronavirus to drive European airline industry shakeout
Description: The coronavirus will accelerate a Darwinian shakeout in Europe's overcrowded airline industry that ultimately benefits Ryanair  and British Airways owner IAG, industry experts predict.

Headlines: Unilever preps for no-sweat Brexit with Magnum ice creams, deodorants
Description: Unilever is stockpiling ice creams in Britain and deodorants in continental Europe to guard against potential supply disruptions in the event of a no-deal Brexit.

Headlines: Japan failed to arrange fair trial for Ghosn: French lawyer
Description: Former Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn's lawyer on Friday told Japan's government that the authorities had failed to arrange for a fair trial that respected universal rights.

Headlines: Trian to skip PPG board challenge after new commitments: sources
Description: Trian Fund Management LP will not challenge PPG Industries Inc's  board of directors at its 2019 shareholder meeting after the U.S. paints and coatings company met some of the activist hedge fund's demands and announced new financial targets, people familiar with the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. health secretary backs proposed FDA crackdown on e-cigarettes: CNBC
Description: U.S. Health and Human Services Secretary Alex Azar told CNBC on Friday he was "completely in support" of the Food and Drug Administration's proposed crackdown on e-cigarettes.

Headlines: CME Group in advanced talks to buy Britain's NEX for $5.4 billion
Description: U.S. exchange operator CME Group  is in advanced talks to buy Britain's NEX Group  for about 3.8 billion pounds ($5.4 billion) to create a cross-border trading powerhouse.

Headlines: FCC chairman circulates order to approve Sprint, T-Mobile tie-up
Description: U.S. Federal Communications Commission Chairman Ajit Pai on Wednesday circulated a draft order that would grant approval to the $26 billion tie-up of T-Mobile Us Inc and Sprint Corp.

Headlines: Typhoon order outlook as good as it's been for some time: BAE CEO
Description: The outlook for export orders of the Typhoon fighter jet is as good as it's been for quite some time, with demand coming from the Middle East and Europe, the boss of BAE  said.

Headlines: UK's John Lewis plans 'phased' re-opening of department stores
Description: British retailer John Lewis Partnership said on Tuesday it will re-open its department stores on a "phased basis" after the government said non-essential retail could re-open from June 15.

Headlines: Hungary's MOL in talks for Chevron's $2 billion stake in giant Azeri oilfield: sources
Description: Hungarian energy firm MOL  is in talks to acquire Chevron's  stake in a giant oilfield in Azerbaijan for more than $2 billion, according to three banking and industry sources involved in the process.

Headlines: Former Goldman Sachs CEO pushes back on Warren's criticism, wealth tax
Description: Former Goldman Sachs Group Inc  Chief Executive Lloyd Blankfein pushed back on Tuesday against Elizabeth Warren's criticism of him and other prominent billionaires, saying the singling out of individuals makes him fear for the "political process in the United States."

Headlines: Delta to retire Boeing 777 aircraft fleet to rein in costs
Description: Delta Air Lines  said on Thursday it would no longer fly Boeing Co's  wide-body 777 aircraft and some of the other older high-maintenance jets, as the U.S. carrier looks to cut costs amid a steep fall in bookings due to travel restrictions around the world.

Headlines: World stocks rally on China-U.S. trade war truce, dollar down, yuan up
