Description: A truce in the U.S.-China trade war boosted global stocks to their highest in roughly three weeks on Monday, while triggering a dollar sell-off and pushing the Chinese yuan and several trade-dependent currencies higher.

Headlines: Two become one? Planemakers work on tech to cut pilot numbers
Description: Airplane manufacturers are working to adapt jets to reduce the number of pilots needed for long-haul flights and to build new cockpits designed for a single aviator in order to ease a global pilot shortage and cut airline costs.

Headlines: Facebook settlement with U.S. may include privacy oversight: Politico
Description: Facebook Inc and the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) are negotiating a possible settlement that would require the company to create an independent privacy oversight committee and take other steps to safeguard users, Politico reported on Wednesday, citing a source.

Headlines: Weak U.S. retail sales cast shadow over slowing economy
Description: U.S. retail sales fell for the first time in seven months in September, suggesting that manufacturing-led weakness could be spreading to the broader economy, keeping the door open for the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates again later this month.

Headlines: U.S.-China trade deal not falling apart: White House adviser
Description: The U.S.-China "Phase 1" trade deal reached in January is not falling apart and the two countries are still working to implement it, the White House's top economic adviser said on Friday, but President Donald Trump added that he was not "thrilled" with the agreement.

Headlines: Apple, Qualcomm battle over possible ban on some U.S. iPhone imports
Description: The staff of the U.S. International Trade Commission on Friday recommended that a trade judge find that Apple Inc  infringed at least one of Qualcomm Inc's  patents, a move that could lead to blocking the import of some iPhones.

Headlines: American Airlines is sued by family of woman who died after flight
Description: The family of a South Carolina woman has filed a wrongful death lawsuit accusing American Airlines  of refusing to make an emergency landing after she fell ill during an April 2016 flight, leading to her death from an embolism three days later.

Headlines: Russia starts testing coronavirus vaccine prototypes on animals
Description: Russian scientists have begun testing prototypes of potential vaccines against the new coronavirus on animals in a laboratory in Siberia, Russia's consumer health regulator said on Friday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Aramco offers struggling refiners sweeter terms for crude
Description: Saudi Aramco has offered oil refineries in Asia and Europe the option to defer payments for crude cargo deliveries by up to 90 days as plants struggle with shrinking demand, four refining industry sources said.

Headlines: EU antitrust official sees more scrutiny for Facebook, others
Description: Facebook and other tech giants may attract more regulatory scrutiny in future because of their market power, a senior EU antitrust official said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Emirates plans to cut about 30,000 jobs amid virus outbreak: Bloomberg News
Description: Emirates Group is planning to cut about 30,000 jobs to reduce costs amid the coronavirus outbreak, which will bring down its number of employees by about 30% from more than 105,000 at the end of March, Bloomberg News reported on Sunday.

Headlines: BNY Mellon puts brakes on changes in work-from-home rules for staff
Description: Bank of New York Mellon Corp backed away on Thursday from changing rules relating to its staff working from home, after a call to reevaluate the option invited severe criticism from employees.

Headlines: China will strive to hit growth target despite trade tensions with U.S.
Description: China will keep its economic growth within a reasonable range and achieve this year's target despite challenges, the state-run Xinhua news agency said on Tuesday as a trade war with the United States intensifies.

Headlines: Mercedes-Benz poised to clinch premium sales crown for 2019
Description: Daimler  sold 2.34 million Mercedes-Benz passenger cars in 2019 for a ninth consecutive year of record sales, it said on Thursday, putting the German carmaker in pole position to retain the title of biggest-selling premium car brand.

Headlines: Indonesia report on 737 MAX crash faults Boeing design, says Lion Air made mistakes
Description: Boeing, acting without adequate oversight from U.S. regulators, failed to grasp risks in the design of cockpit software on its 737 MAX airliner, sowing the seeds for a Lion Air crash that also involved errors by airline workers and crew, Indonesian investigators found.

Headlines: Allergan CEO says company is urgently looking at all options to boost share price
Description: Allergan Plc Chief Executive Brent Saunders said on Tuesday that he and the board of directors were looking with a sense of urgency at all options to revive the Botox maker's falling share price, but a lack of specifics failed to boost investor sentiment.

Headlines: Volkswagen's Skoda Auto February deliveries down 2 percent due to China
Description: Volkswagen's Czech unit Skoda Auto saw global deliveries drop 2 percent to 90,900 cars year-on-year in February, mainly due to depressed Chinese market, the carmaker said on Wednesday.

Headlines: FedEx cuts 2020 profit forecast - again - as seven-day delivery costs weigh
Description: FedEx Corp on Tuesday issued its second warning for fiscal 2020 profit as it spent heavily to launch Sunday delivery in time for the holidays, the continued tariff fight restrained global trade, and it grappled with fallout from its breakup with Amazon.com.

Headlines: IKEA to open first store in Ukraine next year
Description: Swedish retailer IKEA will open its first store in Ukraine next year because of the country's improved business climate, a senior executive said on a visit to Kiev on Wednesday.

Headlines: Southwest 737 MAX makes emergency landing, says computer system not to blame
Description: A Southwest Airlines Co Boeing 737 MAX 8 heading to the California desert for parking during a global ban of the aircraft made an emergency landing on Tuesday due to an engine-related problem shortly after take-off, the carrier said.

Headlines: Ford does not rule out plant closures in Europe as part of overhaul
Description: Ford  cannot rule out plant closures as part of its efforts to return its European operations to profitability, Steven Armstrong, group vice president, Europe, Middle East and Africa, said on Thursday.

Headlines: Italy court suspends fine on Telecom Italia over Vivendi control
Description: An Italian court has suspended a 74.3 million euro ($88 million)fine imposed on Telecom Italia  for failing to notify the government its main shareholder Vivendi  had effective control.

Headlines: Merck loses bid to revive $200 million Gilead verdict at U.S. high court
Description: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday handed a defeat to Merck & Co  by refusing to hear its appeal of a ruling that it had dishonestly obtained patent rights and could not collect a $200 million verdict against rival drugmaker Gilead Sciences Inc  in a dispute involving blockbuster hepatitis C drugs.

Headlines: Trump's tariffs trip up the all-American RV industry
Description: Carrie Gray points to a stack of unwelcome mail on a conference table at the offices of Renegade RV, one of the leading U.S. manufacturers of high-end recreational vehicles. Shes buried in bad news from most of her about 350 suppliers.

Headlines: Possible Mexican retaliatory tariff list excludes U.S. corn: sources
Description: Mexico has prepared a list of U.S. products that could be hit in retaliation for possible Trump administration tariffs, with a focus on Republican-leaning agricultural states but excluding corn, one of Mexico's biggest imports, officials said on Wednesday.

Headlines: From wagyu beef to melons, Japan's $2.2 trillion virus rescue piques struggling firms
Description: As the coronavirus jolts Japan, the government's huge stimulus package has come under fire from hard-hit restaurant owners for channelling funds for items like wagyu beef, melons and tourism rather than accelerating help for firms with burning cash needs.

Headlines: T-Mobile, Sprint amend merger terms, SoftBank takes a hit
Description: T-Mobile US  and Sprint Corp  said on Thursday that they had agreed on new merger terms that would reduce the stake of major Sprint shareholder SoftBank, while leaving the offer to other shareholders unchanged.

Headlines: Oil slides on fresh COVID-19 outbreaks, bump in crude stocks
Description: Oil prices settled lower on Wednesday on fuel demand worries due to an uptick in coronavirus cases, with emerging hotspots in China and the United States, and as U.S. crude stocks grew again, taking commercial inventories to another all-time high.

Headlines: Twitter warns fake account purge to keep erasing users, shares drop 19 percent
Description: Twitter Inc  on Friday said it lost 1 million monthly active users from the previous quarter and warned the closely watched figure could keep falling as it deletes more phony accounts, causing the biggest one-day decline in its shares since 2016.

Headlines: Japan's SoftBank set for small profit rise, Vision Fund IPO plans eyed
Description: Japan's SoftBank Group Corp is expected to report a small rise in its fourth-quarter profit, while investors look for details on whether the conglomerate plans to monetize its almost $100 billion Vision Fund through an IPO.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank in strategy shift to address tech woes
Description: Deutsche Bank  is creating a new technology division in a strategy shift designed to reduce complexity and lower costs while transforming systems that have held back the bank for years.

Headlines: Nissan extends U.S. production shutdown until mid-May
Description: Japanese automaker Nissan Motor Co  said Thursday it will extend a shutdown of U.S. manufacturing plants until mid-May, citing the ongoing impact of the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Walmart Chile to resume talks with union amid strike
Description: Walmart Chile said on Monday it would resume talks with a union of 17,000 workers who walked off the job last week amid a major push by the global retail giant to automate jobs and slash costs.

Headlines: Takeaway.com and Just Eat agree merger terms
Description: Amsterdam-based Takeaway.com  and British rival Just Eat  have finalised the terms of their deal to create a global food delivery company that can rival Uber Eats  as the largest outside China.

Headlines: Nestle CEO expects busier year for M&A deals
Description: Nestle  expects a "more vigorous" year for acquisitions in 2020 as the packaged food giant looks to expand its business, Chief Executive Mark Schneider said on Friday.

Headlines: Tech firms, including Microsoft, Facebook, vow not to aid government cyber attacks
Description: Microsoft, Facebook and more than 30 other global technology companies on Tuesday announced a joint pledge not to assist any government in offensive cyber attacks.

Headlines: Boeing will reassign 3,000 workers as airlines reach compensation deals over MAX
Description: Boeing Co  said Monday that it will reassign 3,000 workers to other jobs as it halts production of the grounded best-selling 737 MAX jet in mid-January.

Headlines: Wall Street hit hard by escalation of tariff war
Description: Wall Street's main indexes tumbled on Monday after Beijing announced plans to retaliate with higher tariffs on U.S. goods, raising fears that another round of tit-for-tat measures could push the U.S. economy toward recession.

Headlines: Amazon, after big hire, experimenting with sports media strategy: interview
Description: When Amazon.com Chief Executive Jeff Bezos was spotted schmoozing in NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell's booth during the Super Bowl in February, the media world exploded with anticipation about Amazon's imminent domination of sports media.

Headlines: WeWork plans to lay off 4,000 staff - FT
Description: Office-sharing startup WeWork is planning to cut as many as 4,000 jobs as a part of a turnaround plan put in place by top shareholder Japan's SoftBank Group after it took control of the company this week, Financial Times reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: Haier sees costs spike at GE arm amid steel tariffs, U.S.-China trade spat
Description: China's Haier Group said rising steel prices amid hefty U.S. import tariffs was driving up costs for its business in America, and warned that consumers stood most to lose from a mounting trade spat between the world's top two economies.

Headlines: U.S. chipmaker Broadcom told to stop exclusivity deals till EU probe ends
Description: U.S. chipmaker Broadcom has been ordered to halt exclusivity deals with six TV and modem makers for up to three years while EU antitrust enforcers investigate whether these agreements are aimed at thwarting rivals.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs leans on trading profits to boost capital, legal reserves
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc's  outsized reliance on trading and investment banking became a big advantage in the second quarter, driving up revenue while avoiding losses due to the coronavirus, but the pop may prove to be fleeting.

Headlines: GE charge, restatement may help explain cash issues
Description: General Electric Co is poised to shine light into a sizable part of its financial black box, an area that governs how it estimates revenue from long-term contracts.

Headlines: New NAFTA deal 'in trouble', bruised by elections, tariff rows
Description: More than six months after the United States, Mexico and Canada agreed a new deal to govern more than $1 trillion in regional trade, the chances of the countries ratifying the pact this year are receding.

Headlines: UK regulator orders recall of fire-risk Whirlpool washing machines
Description: Half a million washing machines manufactured by Whirlpool Corp  and sold in Britain are to be recalled following an order from the country's safety regulator which found they pose a fire risk.

Headlines: Netflix looms large as theater owners assess industry future
Description: As movie theater owners converge on Las Vegas for their annual convention, one topic that keeps coming up is how they contend with a company that has resisted their traditional business model: Netflix Inc.

Headlines: Air France-KLM wins aid deal, flags likely share issue
Description: Air France-KLM  secured 7 billion euros ($7.6 billion) in French government aid on Friday, as the airline industry struggles to survive the coronavirus crisis that has all but halted passenger traffic across much of the world.

Headlines: Mexico to protect steel exporters from Canadian measures: statement
Description: Mexico laments trade protections announced earlier in the day by Canada covering some steel products and will take action to protect its own exporters in the short term, according to a statement from Mexico's economy ministry on Thursday.

Headlines: S&P Global Platts sees Saudi oil strikes driving up risk premium in crude market
Description: Attacks on Saudi oil plants have boosted concerns about supply security in the Middle East and should raise the risk premium in the global crude market, shifting focus from a gloomy economic backdrop, S&P Global Platts said on Sunday.

Headlines: U.S. job openings hit record high of 7.14 million
Description: U.S. job openings jumped to a record high in August, far outpacing a rise in hiring, suggesting that companies could be increasingly having difficulties finding qualified workers.

Headlines: U.S. business spending on equipment strong; trade deficit widens
Description: New orders for key U.S.-made capital goods increased more than expected in June and shipments surged, pointing to solid growth in business spending on equipment in the second quarter.

Headlines: Billionaire James Packer quits 22 boards, deepens corporate withdrawal
Description: Billionaire James Packer has resigned 22 Australian company directorships in the last few weeks and no longer holds any board seat in his home country, corporate records show, signaling his almost full retreat from public business life.

Headlines: Trump rails against high oil prices, OPEC pushes back
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump accused OPEC on Friday of "artificially" boosting oil prices, drawing rebukes from some of the world's top energy exporters.

Headlines: Mattel rejects renewed merger bid from rival MGA Entertainment
Description: Toymaker Mattel Inc last week rejected another merger offer from Bratz doll maker MGA Entertainment Inc, MGA's chief executive officer, Isaac Larian, said on Tuesday.

Headlines: L'Oreal's beauty-conscious customers return post-lockdown
Description: Purchases of cosmetics are picking up - especially in China - as countries exit coronavirus shutdowns that forced forced hair salons and retailers to close, L'Oreal  Chief Executive Jean-Paul Agon said.

Headlines: Older workers helped fuel recent U.S. growth. Can it last?
Description: As a record-breaking economic expansion nears the decade mark, people like Marty Groth may determine whether it is forced into a lower gear.

Headlines: Tariffs threaten market-leading tech, consumer stocks
Description: U.S. technology and consumer discretionary stocks have been insulated from global trade tensions, but if another round of U.S. tariffs on Chinese goods goes into effect, even those high-flying sectors could come down to earth.

Headlines: EBay offers concessions to avert fight with Elliott: sources
Description: EBay Inc has informed Elliott Management Corp it is willing to explore shedding some of its key assets and give the hedge fund board representation in a bid to avert a proxy contest, people familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.

Headlines: GM's incentive plan for Cruise chief points to IPO: SEC filing
Description: General Motors Co on Wednesday outlined an incentive plan for the head of its self-driving car unit that points the way toward a possible initial public offering for the business.

Headlines: Alibaba to pioneer paperless listing in break with Hong Kong norm
Description: Alibaba's planned $13.4 billion share sale will be Hong Kong's first paperless stock market listing, a source with knowledge of the matter said, breaking with a long-held tradition of investors placing stock orders in bank branches.

Headlines: Dollar tumbles to two-week low as Nasdaq hit record closing high
Description: The dollar dropped to two-week lows on Wednesday, showing reduced safe-haven appeal for now, as U.S. tech stocks rallied and commodity prices firmed, even as sentiment remained cautious amid a resurgence of new coronavirus cases globally, particularly in the United States.

Headlines: India orders antitrust probe of Amazon, Walmart's Flipkart
Description: India ordered an investigation of Amazon.com Inc and Walmart's Flipkart on Monday over alleged violations of competition law in the latest setback for U.S. e-commerce giants operating in the country.

Headlines: White House's Kudlow hopeful on U.S.-China trade talks, agriculture buys
Description: White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow on Tuesday called it a good sign that top U.S. officials would be traveling to China to discuss reviving stalled trade talks, and said he expected Beijing to start buying U.S. agriculture products soon.

Headlines: Uniper chairman calls for signal from Fortum to resolve dispute
Description: Uniper's  chairman on Sunday said talks with major shareholder Fortum to resolve a dispute between the two companies were on hold after two of the German utility's board members resigned.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco IPO's institutional tranche oversubscribed: source
Description: The institutional tranche of Saudi Aramco's initial public offering (IPO) has been oversubscribed while the retail portion has received a little more than 10 billion riyals ($2.67 billion) in orders so far, a banking source told Reuters.

Headlines: We can live with German, EU ideas on vendor regulation: Deutsche Telekom
Description: It looks as though German and European policy makers are working towards rules governing vendors of telecoms network equipment that Deutsche Telekom  can live with,

Headlines: China picks new leaders for Macau, replaces economy chief
Description: China has appointed a slate of new officials to head the world's top gambling hub of Macau, changing key roles including the city's economy and justice secretaries.

Headlines: Peloton's Christmas ad mocked as sexist
Description: Exercise bike maker Peloton Interactive Inc  said on Wednesday it was encouraged by support from some customers and social media users, despite its Christmas ad coming under criticism for being "sexist" and "dystopian".

Headlines: Trump rips into China over coronavirus, 'very disappointed'
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday said he was very disappointed in China over its failure to contain the novel coronavirus, saying the worldwide pandemic cast a pall over his U.S.-China trade deal.

Headlines: Canada's Freeland holds firm on tariff retaliation at G7
Description: Talks among top world leaders at the Group of Seven summit have so far been cordial, but Canada will not change its mind when it comes to illegal U.S. steel and aluminum tariffs, Canadian Foreign Minister Chrystia Freeland said on Friday.

Headlines: Roche, Spark again extend $4.3 billion takeover offer
Description: Roche Holding  and Spark Therapeutics  announced on Tuesday another extension of the Swiss drugmaker's $4.3 billion takeover offer for the U.S. gene therapy specialist as regulatory reviews continue.

Headlines: Uber names Matt Olsen as chief security officer
Description: Uber Technologies Inc [UBER.UL] named Matt Olsen as its chief security officer, the ride hailing company's Chief Executive Officer Dara Khosrowshahi said in a tweet on Tuesday.

Headlines: On Huawei, UK PM Johnson says cannot be vulnerable to high risk state vendors
Description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson on Monday said the government would have to think carefully about the role China's Huawei plays in Britain because he does not want the country to be "vulnerable to a high risk state vendor".

Headlines: Toyota recalls 361,000 vehicles for air bag inflator issue
Description: Toyota Motor Corp  said on Wednesday it is recalling 361,000 older vehicles worldwide for potentially defective air bag inflators.

Headlines: Fire contained at Tesla Gigafactory in Nevada
Description: A fire broke out at Tesla Inc's  Gigafactory in Nevada's Tahoe-Reno Industrial Center late on Saturday but was contained by early Sunday and production had resumed, emergency officials and the company said.

Headlines: Tesla's Nuerburgring run revs up debate over speed records
Description: Tesla Inc's  attempts to humble Porsche with a new lap record on Germany's legendary Nordschleife racetrack have reignited a controversy about the value of lap times, as the circuit steps in to quash claims of cheating.

Headlines: RBS to consider appeals for indirect losses to businesses in turnaround unit
Description: Royal Bank of Scotland  will set up a process to consider appeals for alleged "consequential" losses suffered by businesses in its Global Restructuring Group (GRG), potentially opening the bank up to large claims for lost profits.

Headlines: U.S. core capital goods orders rebound; inflation muted
Description: New orders for key U.S.-made capital goods rose by the most in six months in January and shipments increased, but the trend in both measures of business spending on equipment remained soft, leaving forecasts for weak first-quarter economic growth intact.

Headlines: UK fashion retailer ASOS raises 247 million pounds in placing
Description: British online fashion retailer ASOS Plc  said it had raised 247 million pounds ($304 million) via a placing, to help it shore up its finances in case of a prolonged business downturn from the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Dutch court rejects Ryanair attempt to prevent pilots' strike
Description: A Dutch court on Thursday rejected a case from Ryanair   seeking to block pilots in the Netherlands from joining a wider European strike scheduled for Friday at the airline to protest slow progress in negotiating a collective labor agreement.

Headlines: U.S. dollar rises on weaker euro, Fed policy; stocks gain
Description: The U.S. dollar held near a one-week high against a basket of major currencies on Thursday following an interest rise by the Federal Reserve on Wednesday, while robust economic growth and a rally in the shares of Apple Inc and Amazon.com Inc boosted the U.S. stock market.

Headlines: Top shareholder's candidate for chairman elected to Danske Bank board
Description: Danske Bank  shareholders elected Karsten Dybvad, who was proposed by top shareholder A. P. Moller Holding as the bank's new chairman, to the board at an extraordinary general meeting (EGM) on Friday.

Headlines: Royal Caribbean sheds 26% of U.S. workforce as coronavirus hits travel
Description: Royal Caribbean Cruises Ltd  said on Wednesday it would layoffor furlough about 26% of its workforce in the United States, affecting nearly 1,300 of its more than 5,000 employees in the country, as the coronavirus chokes international travel.

Headlines: Exclusive: Global traders halt new Iran food deals as U.S. sanctions bite - sources
Description: Cargill, Bunge and other global traders have halted food supply deals with Iran because new U.S. sanctions have paralyzed banking systems required to secure payments, industry and Iranian government sources say.

Headlines: BOJ keeps upbeat view on regional Japan, labor shortages cloud outlook
Description: The Bank of Japan maintained its upbeat economic assessment for all nine regions of the country but some areas saw companies fret about rising costs from labor shortages, a sign that a tightening job market could constrain business activity.

Headlines: Bank of America profit slumps as heavy loan losses loom
Description: Bank of America Corp  saw its profit more than halve in the second quarter as it set aside $5 billion to cover potential loan losses, while warning that it would struggle as long as interest rates stayed low.

Headlines: KKR-backed Calsonic lines up 5 billion euro financing for Magneti takeover:  sources
Description: Calsonic Kansei has lined up around 5 billion euros ($5.9 billion) in financing from Japanese banks to fund its proposed acquisition of Fiat Chrysler's  unit Magneti Marelli, four sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Receding trade fears propel stocks to six-month peak
Description: The U.S. dollar rebounded and world shares hit a six-month high on Friday after China's moves to boost domestic consumption bolstered a rally driven by investor bets that the latest U.S.-China trade dispute was unlikely to dent global growth.

Headlines: Oil drops as Syria risk seen muted after weekend air strikes
Description: Oil prices dropped on Monday as investor concern waned about escalating tensions in the Middle East following air strikes on Syria over the weekend.

Headlines: EU fines GE $58 million over misleading data in Danish deal
Description: EU antitrust regulators on Monday fined U.S. conglomerate General Electric 52 million euros ($58.4 million) for providing misleading information in its takeover of Danish rotor blade maker LM Wind two years ago.

Headlines: Indonesia hands yacht linked to 1MDB over to Malaysia
Description: Indonesia handed over to Malaysia on Monday a $250 million luxury yacht, impounded earlier this year as part of an international hunt for assets purchased with billions of dollars allegedly siphoned off from state fund 1Malaysia Development Bhd.

Headlines: Take Five: Reshuffle the decks
Description: After one of the most severe equity market selloffs in decades comes the June 26 "Russell Recon", the once-a-year re-jig of FTSE Russells's U.S. index range, tracked by over $9 trillion in assets.

Headlines: Trump says he had a 'nice' meeting with Facebook CEO Zuckerberg
Description: President Donald Trump said in a tweet that he had a "nice meeting" with Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg on Thursday and he included a picture of him shaking hands with Zuckerberg in the Oval Office.

Headlines: Venezuela's deals to shield Citgo from creditors now in doubt
Description: Venezuela is facing the possible unraveling of a pair of billion-dollar settlements aimed at protecting the cash-strapped country's U.S.-based Citgo Petroleum Corp from seizure by creditors.

Headlines: Hundreds of foreign companies attend North Korea trade fair despite sanctions
Description: An international trade fair in North Korea this week may be the largest such event on record, analysts said on Tuesday, with hundreds of Chinese and other foreign vendors taking part despite sanctions pressure.

Headlines: Tesla to raise prices in China on August 30, may increase again in December: sources
Description: U.S. electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc  will raise prices in China on Friday, earlier than planned, and is considering increasing prices again in December should Chinese tariffs on U.S.-made cars take effect, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Trump urges automakers to build more vehicles in U.S., blasts NAFTA
Description: President Donald Trump on Friday pressed automakers to build more vehicles in the United States and launched a fresh attack on the North American Free Trade Agreement that has benefited them, while the companies urged him to work with California to keep nationwide U.S. vehicle emissions standards.

Headlines: After its near-death, AIG CEO plots revival by returning to basics
Description: Brian Duperreault, who rejoined American International Group Inc  as chief executive officer last year to turn the company around, remembers another era when the insurer was trying to blaze a trail toward greatness.

Headlines: U.S. expects China's top trade negotiator to visit 'most likely' this month
Description: U.S. officials expect China's top trade negotiator may visit Washington this month, signaling that higher-level discussions are likely to follow this week's talks with mid-level officials in Beijing as the world's two largest economies try to hammer out a deal to end a tit-for-tat tariff war.

Headlines: Boeing will not appeal trade case against Bombardier: spokesman
Description: Boeing Co  will not appeal against the U.S. trade commission ruling that allows Canada's Bombardier Inc  to sell its newest jets to U.S. airlines without heavy duties, a Boeing spokesman said on Thursday.

Headlines: M.M. Warburg sues Deutsche Bank over share trade tax
Description: Hamburg-based bank M.M. Warburg & Co said on Thursday it had filed a lawsuit against Deutsche Bank  seeking 46 million euros ($53.04 million) that the bank was ordered to pay in capital gains tax.

Headlines: Tesla cuts U.S. prices on all vehicles, shares drop
Description: Tesla Inc  on Wednesday cut U.S. prices for all its vehicles to offset lower green tax credits, and fell short on quarterly deliveries of its mass-market Model 3 sedan, sending shares of the electric vehicle maker down nearly 7 percent on worries of future profitability.

Headlines: Lab-grown diamond prices slide as De Beers fights back
Description: Since De Beers abandoned its decades-old policy of refusing to sell lab-grown diamonds as jewelery, the price gap between man-made stones and natural gems has widened - and the difference is set to get even bigger.

Headlines: Broadcom to supply wireless components to Apple
Description: Chipmaker Broadcom Inc  said on Thursday it has entered into two multi-year agreements with Apple Inc  for the supply of wireless components used in its products.

Headlines: Pompeo says China trade deal has 'got to be right': interview
Description: U.S. President Trump will reject a U.S.-China trade deal that is not perfect, but the United States would still keep working on an agreement, U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said in a media interview.

Headlines: Cisco beats earnings target, says has cushioned supply chain from tariffs
Description: Cisco Systems Inc reported better-than-expected quarterly earnings on Wednesday and gave an upbeat sales forecast for the current period, saying that minimal sales exposure to China and changes to its supply chains have helped cushion the blow of U.S.-China trade dispute.

Headlines: U.S. gun lobby takes aim at 'gun-hating' banks Citi, BofA
Description: The U.S. gun lobby is taking aim at "gun-hating" banks after Citigroup Inc and Bank of America said they would no longer provide certain banking services to gun-makers, according to industry lobbyists.

Headlines: Commerzbank CEO sees strong investment bank as good fit: source
Description: Commerzbank's chief executive believes a strong and focused investment bank would be a good addition to the lender, according to a person familiar with his thinking on Friday.

Headlines: Oil rises on expectations of Fed rate cut, another U.S crude drawdown
Description: Oil prices rose about 2% to a two-week high on Tuesday on optimism the U.S. Federal Reserve will cut interest rates this week for the first time in more than 10 years, boosting demand expectations in the world's biggest oil user.

Headlines: JetBlue shares jump after airline surpasses cost-cutting target
Description: JetBlue Airways Corp  said on Thursday it had shaved $314 million from its cost base over the past three years, delivering on a cost-cutting drive designed to enable budget-friendly airfares over the next decade.

Headlines: Google Maps seeks business, transit reviews in new look as it turns 15
Description: Alphabet Inc's  Google Maps on Thursday launched a redesign that prominently solicits users' reviews and photos of places they visit, seeking to increase its data in a field led by local search apps such as Zomato, TripAdvisor and Yelp.

Headlines: Fed policymakers worry growth plateauing, pledge more support
Description: (This July 7 story, corrects first name of Atlanta Federal Reserve Bank president to Raphael from Ralph in paragraph 5; the mistake also occurred in an earlier version of the story)

Headlines: Xerox appeals decision blocking Fujifilm deal as CEO returns
Description: (The May 4 story was corrected to add a dropped part of the quote by Subramanian to show full context of his remark, in the third paragraph)

Headlines: Oil slides 2% as glut forecast, China virus overshadow Libya disruption
Description: Oil prices fell more than 2% on Wednesday as a market surplus forecast by the International Energy Agency (IEA) and demand worries amid the outbreak of a virus in China outweighed concern over disruptions to Libya's crude output.

Headlines: NCAA president: Sports won't return until campuses reopen
Description: College sports will not resume until all students are back on campus, NCAA president Mark Emmert said Friday.

Headlines: Uber drivers plan protest over pay ahead of IPO
Description: Uber Technologies Inc's drivers in six U.S. cities are planning to shut their apps for 12 hours on May 8 to protest against low wages and working conditions, two days ahead of the company's expected market debut.

Headlines: U.S. job growth robust before coronavirus outbreak hit shores
Description: U.S. employers maintained a robust pace of hiring in February, giving the economy a strong boost heading into the coronavirus outbreak, which has stoked fears of a recession and prompted an emergency interest rate cut from the Federal Reserve.

Headlines: Stocks rally on preliminary U.S.-China trade deal, oil rises
Description: Global stock markets rallied on Monday, pushing Wall Street's three major indexes and a global gauge of equity performance to record highs after a preliminary U.S.-China trade deal pointed to stronger world growth, helping to lift oil prices.

Headlines: China bike-sharing firm Ofo faces 'immense' cash crunch, CEO vows to battle on
Description: Chinese bike-sharing startup Ofo, backed by Alibaba Group Holding Ltd , is battling "immense" cash flow problems and disbanding the firm has been considered as an option, its chief executive said in a letter to employees.

Headlines: Thyssenkrupp board member commits to steel ahead of unit review
Description: Thyssenkrupp  will remain committed to its Steel Europe division, which faces 2,000 layoffs, a board member said on Thursday, just weeks before the conglomerate presents a new strategy for the division.

Headlines: Safety first: Volvo to add in-car sensors to prevent drunk driving
Description: Swedish carmaker Volvo hopes to reinforce its reputation for safety-first driving by installing cameras and sensors in its cars from the early 2020s, monitoring drivers for signs of being drunk or distracted and intervening to prevent accidents.

Headlines: After miracle recovery, Fukushima brewers look to the Games to push sake globally
Description: The earth in Fukushima still trembled when Yoshihiro Miyamori drove in the dark towards his sake brewery. When he got back after midnight, he found smashed sake bottles and a crack in the wall of the building. It was March 11, 2011.

Headlines: Factbox: U.S. House Democrats back USMCA: What happens next?
Description: U.S. House Democrats on Tuesday backed a renegotiated version of the U.S.-Mexico-Canada (USMCA) trade agreement after a year of often acrimonious negotiations with the White House, and it was signed by the United States, Canada and Mexico.

Headlines: Fed's Evans: too early to cut growth outlook or rates on coronavirus
Description: Chicago Federal Reserve Bank President Charles Evans said on Thursday it was too soon to say if the U.S. growth forecast would be lowered due to the coronavirus epidemic, let alone if the U.S. central bank would need to cut rates. .

Headlines: Trump makes veiled WTO threat after EU warning on car tariffs
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump warned the World Trade Organization on Monday that "we'll be doing something" if the United States is not treated properly, just hours after the European Union said that U.S. automotive tariffs would hurt its own vehicle industry and prompt retaliation.

Headlines: Mnuchin, Kudlow say U.S. economy could open in May, defying experts
Description: The Trump administration's top economic officials said on Thursday they believe the U.S. economy could start to reopen for normal business in May, despite health experts' emphasis on prolonged social distancing measures to defeat the coronavirus.

Headlines: Versace sale turns up heat on fashion's independent outliers
Description: Michael Kors'  swoop on Versace leaves a shrinking universe of fashion brands determined to go it alone and fend off luxury empire builders, raising the pressure on those struggling financially to lift sales or sell out.

Headlines: Carmaker JLR urges UK lawmakers to prevent a no-deal Brexit
Description: Britain's biggest carmaker Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) urged lawmakers to rule out the possibility that the country leaves the European Union without a deal, to prevent companies from having to make costly contingency planning.

Headlines: Mylan deal puts future of its beleaguered EpiPen in spotlight
Description: Mylan NV's  planned merger with Pfizer Inc's  off-patent branded drugs business may have boosted its share price on Monday, but one of its most pressing problems remains: shortages of its flagship EpiPen emergency allergy treatment.

Headlines: Nestle CEO expects to hike prices in coming years
Description: Nestle  hopes to be able to pass on rising costs resulting from higher inflation in Western countries in coming years.

Headlines: Amazon's second headquarters faces new blocks in Virginia funding vote
Description: Amazon.com Inc's plan to set up a second headquarters in northern Virginia, after being rebuffed in New York, will face its first test when local officials vote on Saturday on a proposed financial package worth an estimated $51 million.

Headlines: Fed's Daly sees four to five year recovery in best-case scenario
Description: San Francisco Federal Reserve Bank President Mary Daly on Wednesday painted a grim picture of the U.S. economic outlook, saying that even under her best-case scenario unemployment will still top 10% at year's end and won't return to pre-crisis levels for four or five years.

Headlines: General Electric workers, shareholders protest at annual meeting
Description: General Electric CO  employees and shareholders voiced frustration on Wednesday with the company's poor performance, while attending the first annual meeting under Chief Executive Officer John Flannery, who has presided over a 43 percent decline in GE's stock price since taking over on Aug. 1.

Headlines: Exclusive: Walmart, Google-backed Deliv end online grocery partnership
Description: Walmart Inc and logistics firm Deliv pulled the plug on a key same-day grocery delivery partnership, dealing a setback in the retailer's race against rival Amazon.com Inc to deliver groceries to customers' homes.

Headlines: Global stocks dive on growth concerns, doubts over trade truce
Description: Global stocks tumbled on Tuesday as a flattening Treasury yield curve sparked recession warnings, while optimism sharply waned that the United States and China would quickly resolve their trade dispute.

Headlines: Japan brokers readying for new client surge ahead of SoftBank's mammoth IPO
Description: Japan's stockbrokers are rubbing their hands ahead of SoftBank's record-breaking $21 billion share sale, banking on the telco's brand power and unprecedented marketing campaign to boost business in a country replete with IPO-hungry investors.

Headlines: General Motors strike to dent U.S. October job growth
Description: A strike by General Motors  workers should weigh on U.S. job growth in October, government data showed on Friday.

Headlines: Italy's Conte wants G8 with Russia, not quick end to sanctions
Description: Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said on Saturday he hopes the Group of Seven nations can re-admit Russia as soon as possible but Italy is not seeking an overnight lifting of sanctions against Russia.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank, Commerzbank merger talk 'speculation': German finance minister
Description: German Finance Minister Olaf Scholz said on Friday he was in talks with banks about their future and called reports of a merger of Deutsche Bank and Commerzbank "speculation".

Headlines: Germany in Lufthansa bailout talks with key shareholder
Description: The German government held talks with Lufthansa's  biggest shareholder on Monday to persuade him to accept the terms of a 9 billion euro ($10 billion) coronavirus bailout that it has offered the airline group.

Headlines: Rare earth firms' stocks soar on U.S.-China trade war speculation
Description: Shares in rare earth-related companies soared on Tuesday, led by jumps in Chinese producers a day after Chinese President Xi Jinping visited a rare earth firm in southern China, sparking speculation the sector could be the next front in the Sino-U.S. trade war.

Headlines: Sears sues Lampert, claiming he looted assets and drove it into bankruptcy
Description: Sears Holdings Corp sued longtime former Chairman Eddie Lampert, his hedge fund ESL Investments and others like Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin, claiming they illegally siphoned billions of dollars of assets from the retailer before it went bankrupt.

Headlines: Beyond Meat shelves plans for Japan push, Mitsui says
Description: Beyond Meat Inc  has shelved plans to enter Japan, according to a Japan-based investor, focusing more on the U.S. market where it recently bolstered funding to fuel an expansion and beat out emerging faux-meat rivals.

Headlines: IATA still pursuing complaint against Honeywell after CFM deal
Description: The International Air Transport Association (IATA) is pursuing its complaint against Honeywell  to EU antitrust regulators, it said on Tuesday, even as the air transport group struck a deal over a similar grievance with engine maker CFM.

Headlines: WPP says acquisitions back on agenda after Kantar sale
Description: Advertising group WPP  will consider making acquisitions to bolster its capabilities in faster growing segments such as technology and commerce after selling a majority stake in its research arm Kantar, Chief Executive Mark Read said on Thursday.

Headlines: Top Chinese trade negotiator leaves U.S. trade representative's office
Description: China's top trade negotiator Liu He left the U.S. Trade Representative's office on Friday morning, after talks aimed at resolving a trade dispute between the United States and China.

Headlines: UBS's tech-savvy new boss Hamers not always loved by the Dutch
Description: Ralph Hamers made his mark as a tech-savvy chief executive who led Dutch bank ING  back to profitability after cementing its position as a no-frills lender in Germany and simplifying its product portfolio.

Headlines: The Foxconns of fast beauty propel South Korean cosmetics' success in China
Description: At a factory two hours south of Seoul, women clad in plastic caps and masks put peach-colored eye-shadow into cases, right next to a machine churning out a skin-color face powder.

Headlines: IMF forecasts deeper recession for sub-Saharan Africa
Description: Sub-Saharan Africa's gross domestic product is expected to shrink by 3.2% this year due to the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic, the International Monetary Fund said on Wednesday, more than a previous estimated contraction of 1.6%.

Headlines: FAA chief has no timetable for ungrounding Boeing 737 MAX
Description: The acting head of the Federal Aviation Administration said on Wednesday he does not have a specific timetable for when the agency may unground the Boeing 737 MAX that has been involved in two fatal crashes since October.

Headlines: Google bans apps that facilitate sale of marijuana
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google on Wednesday banned apps on its app store that facilitate the sale of marijuana or related products, as part of a change to its content policy.

Headlines: Trump moves to scrap trade privilege for India, Delhi plays down impact
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump looked set to open a new front in his trade wars with a plan to end preferential trade treatment for India that allows duty-free entry for up to $5.6 billion worth of its exports to the United States.

Headlines: Spain aims to convince Nissan to change mind on Barcelona plant, hopes Renault stays
Description: Spain will do everything it can to get Nissan  to reverse its decision to close its Barcelona plant, Foreign Minister Arancha Gonzalez Laya said on Thursday.

Headlines: Lockheed Martin speeds up payments to suppliers amid coronavirus slowdown
Description: Defense contractor Lockheed Martin Corp  said on Friday that it would advance more than $50 million to suppliers hurt by a sharp economic slowdown caused by efforts to stop the coronavirus.

Headlines: Uber may suspend accounts of riders, drivers who test positive for coronavirus
Description: Uber Technologies Inc  on Wednesday said it may temporarily suspend accounts of riders and drivers who have tested positive for the coronavirus or been exposed to it at the direction of health authorities.

Headlines: Nasdaq climbs to record; Dow capped by trade concerns
Description: The Nasdaq closed at a record on Wednesday, lifted by a climb in large-cap tech and consumer discretionary names, while the Dow and S&P 500 were hemmed in as concerns over an escalation in the U.S.-China trade skirmish simmered.

Headlines: Delta Air Lines shares drop on weak revenue outlook
Description: Shares in U.S. carrier Delta Air Lines Inc  dropped 4 percent in Thursday morning trading on concerns that slowing global economies would limit the No. 2 U.S. airline's revenue growth in 2019 despite strong travel demand.

Headlines: OPEC+ to debate oil cuts as big as 20 million bpd: sources
Description: OPEC and other oil producers will debate on Thursday oil cuts as big as 20 million barrels per day, equivalent to about 20% of global supplies, one OPEC source and a Russian source told Reuters.

Headlines: South Africa to oppose Airlink's bid to halt SAA creditors meeting
Description: South Africa plans to oppose an application by regional airline Airlink to put South African Airways (SAA) into provisional liquidation and prevent a meeting of SAA's creditors to discuss a restructuring plan, the government said on Monday.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank seeks to reassure employees, investors as stock slides
Description: Deutsche Bank's  top executives sought to assure employees and investors over its ability to weather the coronavirus as shares in the German lender hit a new low on Thursday amid a wider stock market sell-off.

Headlines: Air New Zealand to boost capacity as virus curbs ease, but higher fares expected
Description: Air New Zealand Ltd  said on Friday it would boost domestic capacity to 20% of usual levels once the country further loosens pandemic restrictions, but it cannot offer its lowest fares due to social distancing requirements.

Headlines: 'Safe like China': In Argentina, ZTE finds eager buyer for surveillance tech
Description: In Argentina's remote northern province of Jujuy, Chinese telecoms giant ZTE is installing a little slice of the Asian nation's vast surveillance state - security cameras that the local government says will help to curb street crime.

Headlines: GE drags premier U.S. corporate debt, which posts worst year since 2008
Description: (This december 30 story corrects name of indexes in paragraphs 4 and 22 to ICE BofAML from Bank of America/Merrill Lynch)

Headlines: Virgin Australia seeks aircraft waivers, owes $4.4 billion: administrator
Description: Virgin Australia Holdings Ltd  owes A$6.9 billion  ($4.39 billion) to more than 10,000 creditors based on an initial review and will seek a three-month payment waiver from aircraft lessors, its administrators said.

Headlines: Carmaker Jaguar says 'bad Brexit' would mean it could not stay in UK
Description: Britain's biggest carmaker Jaguar Land Rover has joined dissenters to a "hard Brexit", saying that Britain leaving the EU without a trade deal would cost it 1.2 billion pounds ($1.59 billion) a year and curtail its future UK operations.

Headlines: Facebook CEO plans to testify before U.S. Congress: source
Description: Facebook Inc chief executive Mark Zuckerberg will appear before the U.S. Congress to answer questions on data privacy and other issues, but it is not clear to which committee or committees he will testify, a source briefed on the matter said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Fed's short-term corporate funding plan boosts stocks, gold, dollar
Description: Gold, the dollar and global equity markets rose on Tuesday after the Federal Reserve said it would buy short-term corporate debt directly from companies to help relieve credit markets under strain from the economic impact of the coronavirus epidemic.

Headlines: Turkish lira undershooting fair value: global banking group
Description: The Turkish lira is significantly below fair value at the moment and should strengthen over the next one to two years as Turkey's economy slows and exports gain strength, improving the country's balance of payments outlook, economists for the Institute of International Finance said on Wednesday.

Headlines: GE explores stake sale in Enel renewables joint venture: sources
Description: General Electric Co is exploring a sale of its 50 percent stake in a renewable energy joint venture with Italy's Enel SpA, the latest deal GE CEO Lawrence Culp is pursuing to pay down debt, according to people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: TSX futures higher as oil prices climb
Description: Stock futures pointed to a higher opening for Canada's main stock index on Tuesday, as oil prices hit a 3-1/2-year high, buoyed by tight supply and looming U.S. sanctions against Iran.

Headlines: Columbia Threadneedle urges Unilever to engage with investors over move
Description: Unilever  shareholder Columbia Threadneedle has raised concerns about the consumer goods group's decision to overhaul its structure by picking Rotterdam for its main headquarters, citing the possible impact on the company's listing on London's stock exchange.

Headlines: BMW names Vukotich as new head of autonomous driving development
Description: Germany luxury carmaker BMW  said on Saturday Alejandro Vukotich will be the new head of its driver assistance and autonomous driving development department from January 2019.

Headlines: How to say the 'R-word': bank executives grapple with recession talk
Description: Executives at the largest U.S. banks are grappling with how to best talk about the slowing economy and its impact on their businesses as they enter earnings season, people familiar with their thinking told Reuters.

Headlines: Capital One says information of over 100 million individuals in U.S., Canada hacked
Description: Capital One Financial Corp  said on Monday that personal information including names and addresses of about 100 million individuals in the United States and 6 million people in Canada were obtained by a hacker who has been arrested.

Headlines: Exclusive: Beijing could ax extra tariffs on U.S. farm products to boost imports - China trade association chief
Description: Beijing could remove extra tariffs imposed since last year on U.S. farm products to ease the way for importers to buy up to $50 billion worth, rather than direct them to buy specific amounts, the head of a government-backed trade association said.

Headlines: Wall Street ends up after swings on reopening hopes, weak data, trade woes
Description: Wall Street's three major indexes closed higher after swinging between gains and losses on Friday as investors weighed worries about Sino-U.S. trade relations and weaker-than-expected U.S. economic data against growing optimism that easing coronavirus restrictions would boost activity this month.

Headlines: Court orders Dakota pipeline shut in latest blow to U.S. fossil fuel projects
Description: A U.S. court ordered the shutdown of the Dakota Access oil pipeline on Monday over concerns about its potential environmental impact, a big win for the Native American tribes and green groups who fought the major pipeline's route across a crucial water supply for years.

Headlines: Wall Street rallies on hopes of global economic stimulus
Description: U.S. stocks climbed on Monday as reports of stimulus efforts in China and Germany calmed fears of a severe downturn in the global economy that were stoked last week as bond yields fell.

Headlines: White House not planning new big trade initiative against China: official
Description: President Donald Trump's administration does not at this time have another new, big trade initiative planned against China and is focused on implementing the moves that have already been announced, a White House official said on Wednesday.

Headlines: EU court rules against BlackRock tax break claim
Description: BlackRock is not exempt from paying value added tax (VAT) on part of a service from an outside supplier to help manage its funds, a European Union court ruled on Thursday, dashing the fund sector's hopes for cost savings.

Headlines: One trillion yuan: China state carmaker FAW gains huge credit line
Description: China's state-owned automaker FAW Group said it signed a deal with 16 banks for a credit line worth more than 1 trillion yuan ($144 billion), an eye-catching amount analysts said was mostly symbolic, albeit an important signal of government support.

Headlines: Stocks lose steam in wake of Fed statement
Description: The S&P 500 ended slightly lower on Wednesday, as an initial boost from the likes of Apple, Boeing and General Electric following their quarterly results faded in the wake of a policy announcement from the Federal Reserve.

Headlines: Citing climate differences, Shell walks away from U.S. refining lobby
Description: Royal Dutch Shell Plc on Tuesday became the first major oil and gas company to announce plans to leave a leading U.S. refining lobby due to disagreement on climate policies, citing its support for the goals of the Paris climate agreement.

Headlines: Lebanon and Japan have 40 days to agree on Ghosn's fate: sources
Description: Lebanon and Japan have about 40 days to decide whether ousted Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn will be extradited to Japan or stand trial in Lebanon, a judicial source and a source close to Ghosn said on Thursday, following his escape from Japan last month.

Headlines: Disney to shut Hong Kong Disneyland again as coronavirus cases rise
Description: Walt Disney Co  is temporarily closing its Hong Kong Disneyland theme park from July 15 amid rising coronavirus cases in the Chinese-ruled city, the company said Monday.

Headlines: European shares rise on delayed Brexit vote, dollar gains; Wall Street flat
Description: A gauge of global equity markets traded little changed on Thursday as European shares rose ahead of new voting that backed a Brexit delay and bolstered the dollar, while Wall Street meandered on uncertainty over U.S.-China trade talks.

Headlines: Barclays cuts 2020 oil price outlook on price war, virus impact
Description: Barclays on Tuesday slashed its oil price forecasts for 2020, citing OPEC's failure to convince its allies including Russia to cut production further, which led to Saudi Arabia saying it would raise its output in April despite sluggish global demand.

Headlines: Germany aims to end use of glyphosate in this legislative period: spokesman
Description: Use of glyphoste-based weed-killers should be halted during the current legislative period which ends in three years, a spokesman for the German environment ministry said on Monday.

Headlines: FCC says it will accept comments until February 3 on Huawei, ZTE security risks
Description: The U.S. Federal Communications Commission (FCC) said on Friday it will accept public comments until Feb. 3 on its determination that China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd and ZTE Corp pose national security risks.

Headlines: Kremlin, responding to Trump, says attending G7 not a priority: Sputnik
Description: Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov, on U.S. President Donald Trump's remark that Russia should be attending a Group of Seven (G7) nations meeting, said: "Russia is focused onother formats, apart fromthe G7," Sputnik reported.

Headlines: Highlights: Goldman's shrinking equity trading desk, JP Morgan's Erdoes on volatility
Description: The following are highlights from Monday's Milken Institute Global Conference in Beverly Hills:

Headlines: U.S. moves to cut Huawei off from global chip suppliers as China eyes retaliation
Description: The Trump administration on Friday moved to block global chip supplies to blacklisted telecoms equipment giant Huawei Technologies, spurring fears of Chinese retaliation and hammering shares of U.S. producers of chipmaking equipment.

Headlines: Russia's Rusal debt removed from MarketAxess bond trading platform
Description: Debt issued by Russian company Rusal has been removed from bond trading platform MarketAxess after it was included in a new round of U.S. sanctions against Moscow.

Headlines: Asset managers farm out trading as costs and complexity climb
Description: It's 10 o'clock at night, and Benjamin Arnold's day is just beginning. The former Goldman Sachs trader is gearing up to trade equities in Asia from his small office thousands of miles away in Park City, Utah.

Headlines: Apple, Goldman Sachs start issuing Apple Cards to consumers
Description: Apple Inc and Goldman Sachs Group Inc rolled out a virtual credit card on Tuesday, which will help the iPhone maker diversify from device sales and also build out the Wall Street bank's new consumer business.

Headlines: U.S. auto sales in states with coronavirus lockdown orders to drop 80%: analysts
Description: Vehicle sales in U.S. states that implemented lockdown orders to curb the spread of the coronavirus will drop 80% or more, analysts said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. manufacturing contracts; private payrolls post first drop since 2017
Description: U.S. manufacturing activity contracted less than expected in March, but disruptions caused by the coronavirus pandemic pushed new orders received by factories to an 11-year low, reinforcing economists' views that the economy was in recession.

Headlines: Deaths, intubations swamp New Orleans doctors in coronavirus surge
Description: Emergency room doctor Thomas Krajewski stopped at the hospital room door at 2 a.m. to glance at the chart. He knew instantly the long odds faced by the patient inside: A man in his 70s, with a fever, short of breath.

Headlines: 'Lion King' lifts Disney earnings as streaming costs stay under budget
Description: Walt Disney Co's  popular theme parks and a remake of "The Lion King" pushed earnings past Wall Street targets on Thursday, and the company spent less than it had projected on its big plunge into streaming entertainment.

Headlines: Fed to keep open mind in review of strategy, tools, Clarida says
Description: The Federal Reserve will keep an open mind as it begins a broad review this year of its monetary policy framework that could result in changes to how it goes about ensuring that prices remain stable and employment plentiful, Fed vice chair Richard Clarida said on Friday.

Headlines: Indonesia's Garuda asks to cancel 737 MAX order it had been reconsidering before Ethiopia crash
Description: Garuda Indonesia has asked to cancel an order for 49 Boeing Co 737 MAX 8 jets, citing a loss of passenger trust following two crashes, although it had been reconsidering the order before the latest disaster in Ethiopia last week.

Headlines: Renault chairman auditions narrowed field of Nissan CEO candidates
Description: The Nissan Motor Co  CEO race has narrowed to a contest between three Renault-Nissan veterans, with Renault's chairman conducting interviews ahead of a Renault-Nissan alliance meeting scheduled for Wednesday, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: United Airlines extends cancellations of Boeing 737 MAX flights into August
Description: United Airlines said on Friday it is extending by one month its cancellations of Boeing Co 737 MAX flights, through Aug. 3, as the jetliner remains grounded following two fatal crashes.

Headlines: Movie theater chains sue New Jersey over coronavirus-related closures
Description: Six movie theater chains, including AMC Entertainment, Cinemark and Regal Cinemas, have sued New Jersey Governor Phil Murphy for refusing to let them resume operations, even after allowing churches, retailers and indoor shopping malls to reopen during the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Indexes drop from record highs, but tally strong weekly gains
Description: Wall Street fell from record levels on Friday after a four-day rally as investors digested the monthly U.S. jobs report and braced for the next coronavirus developments, but stocks still posted solid gains for the week.

Headlines: Amazon to stop non-essential sales in India
Description: Amazon.com Inc's  India unit on Tuesday said it will halt orders for non-essential products in India to prioritize customers' critical needs at a time when much of the country is under lockdown to prevent the spread of coronavirus.

Headlines: Treasury yields drop on reports trade deal may not come this year
Description: Treasury yields dropped on Wednesday on news a "phase one" U.S.-China trade deal may not be completed this year, according to Reuters sources.

Headlines: Dashboard of Japanese stocks with a stake in Olympics' success
Description: Japanese stocks banking on the success of the Olympics this year are taking a hit as the rapid spread of coronavirus is threatening cancellation of the world's biggest sporting tournament.

Headlines: Investment bank loss mars Thiam's final act at Credit Suisse
Description: Credit Suisse posted its highest annual profit in nearly a decade on Thursday, but volatile earnings at its investment bank and trading divisions muted outgoing Chief Executive Tidjane Thiam's swan song.

Headlines: Volkswagen has no plans to cede control of trucks ops: chairman
Description: Volkswagen  will not list its trucks business this year and has no plans to cede control of the division, chairman Hans Dieter Poetsch said on Friday.

Headlines: Shake Shack sees delivery disruption thru 2020 with Grubhub partnership
Description: Shake Shack Inc  expects its delivery sales to be volatile throughout 2020 after its move last year to an exclusive partnership with third-party platform Grubhub Inc , it said on Monday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Google unveils vetting process for drug rehab ads
Description: Google told Reuters Monday it would resume accepting ads from U.S. addiction treatment centers in July, nearly a year after the Alphabet Inc  unit suspended the lucrative category of advertisers for numerous deceptive and misleading ads.

Headlines: China investigating U.S. request to lift anti-dumping tariffs on DDGS
Description: China's commerce ministry confirmed on Thursday that it was examining an application from a U.S. trade association requesting a review of its anti-dumping tariffs on imports of distillers grains (DDGS) from the United States.

Headlines: Activist investor seeks to oust Trump friend Barrack from CEO job at Colony Capital
Description: Activist investor Blackwells is pushing to remove Tom Barrack, a billionaire friend of President Donald Trump, as CEO of Colony Capital, saying his mismanagement of the real estate and investment firm has cost shareholders billions of dollars in lost gains.

Headlines: Factbox: China approves new GMO soybean, corn and canola traits
Description: China approved five genetically modified crops for import on Tuesday, the first in about 18 months, as representatives from the Asian country and the United States met in face-to-face talks to try to resolve trade disagreements.

Headlines: U.S. Steel delivers unwelcome Christmas surprise to Michigan town
Description: The mayor of a Michigan steel town was attending his grandchildren's Christmas play Thursday evening when he got an unwelcome voicemail from an official of the town's top employer: United States Steel Corp .

Headlines: Jet Airways sale suffers setback as two potential investors back out
Description: Creditors' hopes of resurrecting India's Jet Airways  and salvaging some value from the bankrupt airline were dealt a fresh blow on Monday as two potential investors said they were no longer interested in putting money into the business.

Headlines: Oil mixed on forecast of falling U.S. fuel stockpiles
Description: Oil prices were mixed on Tuesday, paring earlier steep losses as investors focused on signs that U.S.-China trade tensions could ease next month and expectations that U.S. refined product stockpiles declined last week.

Headlines: Geordie Greig named as new editor of Daily Mail
Description: Geordie Greig has been named as the new editor of Britain's Daily Mail, the newspaper company Daily Mail and General Trust  said on Thursday.

Headlines: Asia's cash-rich firms more resilient in this year's equity selloff
Description: Shares of cash-rich firms in Asia have weathered this year's sell-off in much better shape than key stock indexes, a Reuters analysis showed, reinforcing views that investments in companies with strong finances safeguard returns during market crises.

Headlines: Harley-Davidson withdraws outlook due to coronavirus disruption
Description: Harley-Davidson Inc  on Thursday withdrew its financial forecasts as the coronavirus outbreak hurts its supply chain, and warned further disruptions could dent its ability to supply and sell motorcycles.

Headlines: Success with Snap helps venture firm Lightspeed raise $1.8 billion for new funds
Description: Venture capital firm Lightspeed Venture Partners has raised $1.8 billion to invest in startups from cryptocurrency to beauty supplies, hoping to build on its streak of lucrative bets in companies such as Snap Inc , the firm's partners told Reuters.

Headlines: Google bars elections ads from using political leanings, voter data
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google will stop giving advertisers the ability to target election ads using data such as public voter records and general political affiliations, the company said in a blog post on Wednesday.

Headlines: Tiger Woods' Masters win gives Nike investors another reason to cheer
Description: Nike Inc's long-time brand ambassador Tiger Woods gave investors another reason to cheer on Monday, after the world's biggest name in golf won the Masters, pushing the company's stock higher.

Headlines: Powered by hydrogen, Hyundai's trucks aim to conquer the Swiss Alps
Description: Hyundai's  hydrogen-powered 18-tonne trucks are set to hit the roads in Switzerland next month as the South Korean automaker looks to establish a case for its zero-emissions technology in a low carbon world.

Headlines: Richard Branson takes satellite launch business to Japan with airline ANA
Description: Sir Richard Branson's Virgin Orbit said on Thursday it plans to bring its satellite launch system to Japan in partnership with airline operator ANA Holdings Inc, which will provide maintenance and possibly aircraft.

Headlines: Exclusive: Japan to further ease rules on foreign ownership of stocks: sources
Description: Japan will add exemptions to new foreign investment restrictions for companies exposed to sensitive national security issues, government sources said, in a move aimed at keeping overseas capital in the country.

Headlines: China says U.S. demand on its state-owned enterprises is 'invasion' on economic sovereignty
Description: The United States has called on China to curb the development of its state-owned enterprises (SOEs), a demand that China sees as an "invasion" on its economic sovereignty, Chinese state news agency Xinhua said on Saturday.

Headlines: U.S. DOJ says pursuing investigations related to Malaysia's 1MDB
Description: The U.S Department of Justice said on Tuesday it would continue to pursue investigations into 1 Malaysia DevelopmentBerhad(1MDB) and looked forward to working with Malaysian law enforcement authorities, which have reopened a probe into the fund following a change of government this month.

Headlines: Motorbike taxi firms rev up for race into West Africa
Description: Motorcycle taxi companies are expanding in West Africa with backing from investors betting that the meteoric rise of two-wheeled taxi firms in Asia can be replicated in some of the fastest growing countries in the world.

Headlines: Oil prices down more than 1 percent on rising supply, trade war
Description: Oil prices dropped more than 1 percent on Tuesday on signs of rising supply and concern that global economic growth and demand for fuel will fall victim to the U.S.-China trade war.

Headlines: Pilots' union criticises UK's coronavirus job retention scheme
Description: The union representing British pilots has described the government's scheme to retain jobs through the coronavirus outbreak as confusing, lacking detail and taking too long to help those who are being laid off now.

Headlines: GM's mid-engine Corvettes roar onstage to take on Europeans
Description: General Motors Co  unveiled on Thursday its newly designed mid-engine 2020 Corvette in a splashy tribute to its emblematic sports car, even as the No. 1 U.S. automaker faces mounting pressures in a sluggish and uncertain global sales environment.

Headlines: Facebook agrees to pay UK fine over Cambridge Analytica scandal
Description: Facebook has agreed to pay a 500,000 pound ($644,000) fine for breaches of data protection law related to the harvesting of data by consultancy Cambridge Analytica, Britain's information rights regulator said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Apple buys startup focused on lenses for AR glasses
Description: (The story has been refiled to correct spelling of Microsoft HoloLens in final paragraph.)

Headlines: U.S. Justice Department will not appeal AT&T, Time Warner merger after court loss
Description: AT&T Inc emerged victorious on Tuesday over the Trump administration's drawn-out attempts to block its $85.4 billion purchase of Time Warner as the U.S. Justice Department said it would not fight an appeals court ruling approving the deal.

Headlines: China's economy worsens in July, industrial growth at 17-year low as trade war escalates
Description: China's economy stumbled more sharply than expected in July, with industrial output growth cooling to a more than 17-year low, as the intensifying U.S. trade war took a heavier toll on businesses and consumers.

Headlines: Honda says 16th U.S. death confirmed in air bag rupture
Description: Honda Motor Co said on Friday it had confirmed a 16th U.S. death has been tied to a faulty Takata air bag inflator.

Headlines: BMW says rivals are interested in joining forces on self-driving cars
Description: BMW  rivals and ride-hailing companies are considering joining its consortium for developing self-driving cars as auto industry profits come under increasing pressure, board member Klaus Froehlich said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Vivendi holds onto Mediaset stake as withdrawal right deadline expires: sources
Description: Vivendi  has decided not to exercise withdrawal rights over its Mediaset holding  as a deadline to liquidate the stake in the Italian broadcaster expired at the weekend, two sources close to the matter said on Monday.

Headlines: German region ready to help Opel, but won't be blackmailed: premier
Description: The German state of Thuringia is ready to offer assistance to carmaker Opel in order to keep the region's Eisenach plant open, state premier Bodo Ramelow told Reuters on Monday.

Headlines: France presses Renault over executive compensation paid via Dutch holding company
Description: The French government has told Renault  to provide more details on compensation paid to senior executives via a Dutch holding company jointly owned with alliance partner Nissan, Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said on Sunday.

Headlines: Chevron profit doubles as U.S. oil production jumps, shares rise
Description: U.S. oil and natural gas producer Chevron Corp  on Friday reported that its quarterly profit doubled on record oil and gas production, sending its shares up as much as 5 percent.

Headlines: White House's Kudlow floats cutting U.S. corporate tax rate in half
Description: White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow on Friday floated the idea of cutting the corporate tax rate in half for U.S. companies who bring their operations back from other countries.

Headlines: German's watchdog widens probe of possible Wirecard insider trading
Description: Germany's financial watchdog is widening its examination into possible insider trading of Wirecard shares to include any individuals who have sat on the company's management and supervisory boards in 2020, a BaFin spokeswoman said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Huawei denies German report it colluded with Chinese intelligence
Description: Huawei, the leading maker of telecoms network equipment, denied a newspaper report on Wednesday which said the German government was in possession of evidence that it had cooperated with Chinese intelligence.

Headlines: U.S. judge certifies Goldman Sachs gender bias class action
Description: A federal judge ruled that women accusing Goldman Sachs Group Inc of discriminating against them in pay, promotions and performance reviews may pursue their claims as a group in a class-action lawsuit.

Headlines: U.S. housing market mired in weakness; consumer sentiment ebbs
Description: U.S. homebuilding fell for a third straight month in July amid a steep decline in the construction of multi-family housing units, but a jump in permits to a seven-month high offered hope for the struggling housing market.

Headlines: IMF says it remains engaged in Argentina, focuses on stabilizing economy
Description: The International Monetary Fund is continuing talks with Argentina as authorities there try to stem spiraling economic problems in Latin America's third-largest economy, IMF spokesman Gerry Rice told reporters on Thursday.

Headlines: Icahn takes stake in insurer AmTrust, opposes go-private deal
Description: Billionaire investor Carl Icahn disclosed a 9.38 pct stake in insurer AmTrust Financial Services Inc  on Thursday.

Headlines: Wall Street analysts cut 737 MAX delivery forecast
Description: Boeing Co is now unlikely to deliver more than 500 of its 737 MAX planes to customers this year, and even that will depend on a swift removal of an effective halt in deliveries after June, Wall Street analysts said on Monday.

Headlines: Italy looks to safeguard biomedical valley leading fight against COVID-19
Description: Italy plans to tighten health checks to ensure that work is not disrupted in a small northern town specialising in the production of medical supplies to tackle its coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Goldman bumps up no-deal Brexit odds after May resignation
Description: Goldman Sachs raised its probability of a no-deal Brexit to 15% from 10% on Friday as Prime Minister Theresa May's resignation potentially opened the way for a more hardline politician to lead the UK to exiting the European Union.

Headlines: Wisconsin governor's office says evaluating shift in Foxconn LCD display project
Description: The Office of the Governor of Wisconsin said Wednesday it is evaluating changes in Foxconn Technology Group's project in the state after Reuters exclusively reported the Taiwanese company is reconsidering building a liquid crystal display panel factory there.

Headlines: OECD says U.S. still committed to global digital tax talks
Description: The United States remains committed to global talks on the taxation of big digital companies despite its call for a pause, the head of the Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD) said on Wednesday.

Headlines: China's Xiaomi cuts valuation to $55 billion-$70 billion: sources
Description: SHANGHAI/HONG KONG (Reuters/IFR) - Chinese smartphone maker Xiaomi has lowered its likely valuation to between US$55bn and US$70bn following its decision to delay its mainland share offering until after its Hong Kong IPO, three sources with direct knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: Saudi king said will boost oil output if needed: White House
Description: The leader of Saudi Arabia promised President Donald Trump that he can raise oil production if needed and the country has 2 million barrels per day of spare capacity, the White House said on Saturday, rowing back on an earlier Trump tweet that appeared to suggest the Saudis had agreed to boost output by that amount.

Headlines: French finance minister: open to possible China investment in St Gobain unit
Description: French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said on Thursday that in principle he would be open to a possible Chinese investment in a unit of French construction group St Gobain.

Headlines: Stocks waver on rising COVID cases, dollar in safety bidding
Description: Global equity markets closed little changed on Wednesday as a rally on economic and vaccine hopes faded, while fresh coronavirus outbreaks and rising geopolitical tensions in Asia boosted demand for the dollar and safe-haven debt.

Headlines: PES creditors fight to reject refinery sale to Hilco: court documents
