Description: Creditors of bankrupt Philadelphia Energy Solutions are opposing the sale of its oil refinery to Hilco Redevelopment Partners, saying another developer made a more lucrative bid for the site, according to court documents filed on Thursday.

Headlines: Twitter to offer $1 billion convertible note as shares rally
Description: Twitter Inc  is preparing a $1 billion convertible note offering, the social media hub said on Wednesday, one day after news that it would be included in the S&P 500 index sent its shares up 5 percent to a more than three-year high.

Headlines: Factbox: What we know about Boeing 737 MAX crash and what comes next
Description: More than 300 Boeing 737 MAX jets have been grounded worldwide after two fatal crashes in the past five months in Ethiopia and Indonesia killed nearly 350 people.

Headlines: U.S. defense chief rejects Amazon's accusations of bias in cloud contract
Description: U.S. Defense Secretary Mark Esper on Friday rejected any suggestion of bias in a Pentagon decision to award Microsoft Corp an up to $10 billion cloud computing contract, after Amazon.com Inc announced plans to challenge it.

Headlines: Exxon first quarter profit misses estimates on refining, chemical woes
Description: Exxon Mobil Corp , the world's largest publicly traded oil producer, posted a lower-than-expected quarterly profit on Friday as weakness in its chemical and refining operations offset a boost from higher crude prices  .

Headlines: Oil down slightly after U.S.-China trade deal, U.S. product build
Description: Oil prices were down slightly on Wednesday, pressured early by data showing big increases in U.S. refined products but recovered some of the losses later by the signing of a Phase 1 trade deal between Washington and Beijing.

Headlines: Facebook's Libra announces board as support shrinks further
Description: Backers of Facebook Inc's  Libra cryptocurrency project pledged to forge ahead after selecting a five-member board on Monday, shrugging off the latest member defection by online travel company Booking Holding earlier in the day.

Headlines: Internet provider groups sue Vermont over net neutrality law
Description: Five industry groups representing major internet providers and cable companies filed suit on Thursday seeking to block a Vermont law barring companies that do not abide by net neutrality rules from receiving state contracts.

Headlines: Commerzbank's market share is too small, CEO says amid merger talks
Description: Commerzbank's  market share is too small and organic growth is too slow, the lender's chief executive told employees as he weighs a tie-up with Deutsche Bank .

Headlines: U.S. Treasury's Mnuchin says airline aid 'next big thing' to be rolled out
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Thursday that aid for airlines will be the "next big thing" to be rolled out after the Federal Reserve announced new lending backstops for smaller and midsize companies and municipal bonds.

Headlines: Jaguar Land Rover to open technical engineering office in Hungary
Description: Britain's biggest carmaker Jaguar Land Rover  (JLR) will create 100 jobs with a new technical engineering office in Hungary to allow for close collaboration with suppliers in central and Eastern Europe, the firm said on Friday.

Headlines: Dutch government's 2019 purchase of Air France-KLM shares 'irregular': audit office
Description: A 2019 move by the Dutch government to buy a 14% stake in Air France-KLM  was not in accordance with the country's laws, the Netherlands' Court of Audit ruled on Wednesday.

Headlines: Mattel will close Canada factory after shuttering two manufacturing sites in Asia: WSJ
Description: Mattel Inc  will close a factory in Canada after shutting down two plants in Asia, as the toymaker reduces its manufacturing footprint to cut costs, the Wall Street Journal said on Sunday.

Headlines: Guggenheim's Scott Minerd says Fed will pause to start 2019
Description: The Federal Reserve is likely to hold its interest rate hikes on pause for the start of 2019 in order to stabilize markets, given economic growth is set to slow and financial conditions having tightened, Guggenheim Partners Global Chief Investment Officer Scott Minerd said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. core PCE price index hits 2 percent; spending slows
Description: U.S. consumer prices accelerated in the year to May, with a measure of underlying inflation hitting the Federal Reserve's 2 percent target for the first time in six years.

Headlines: Mexico readies 'industrial policy' to adapt to USMCA trade deal
Description: Incoming Mexican foreign minister Marcelo Ebrard on Monday said the government that takes office in December will promote an active industrial policy to help small companies adapt to rules in the new United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement trade deal.

Headlines: United says does not expect to fly the 737 MAX this summer
Description: (This Jan. 22 story corrects attribution in first and second paragraphs to Chief Commerical Officer Andrew Nocella from President Scott Kirby)

Headlines: Coronavirus leads Warren Buffett to mull changes to Berkshire Hathaway shareholder weekend: Omaha mayor
Description: Warren Buffett plans to wait until around April 1 to decide whether the coronavirus pandemic will require changes to Berkshire Hathaway Inc's  annual shareholder weekend a month later, Omaha, Nebraska's mayor Jean Stothert said.

Headlines: Wall Street rally pauses, but stocks mint weekly gain
Description: The S&P 500 ended marginally lower in a choppy session on Friday, but major indexes posted weekly gains for the first time in December following a wild few days of trading that saw equities rebound from a prolonged slide.

Headlines: Sony stock jumps after first-ever share buyback announcement
Description: Sony Corp announced its first-ever major share buyback on Friday, worth 100 billion yen ($910 million), helping its stock recover from a hammering days earlier when investors freaked over lackluster earnings.

Headlines: Nissan premium brand Infiniti aims to triple China sales: president
Description: (This story corrects headline to show title is "president" (not CEO).)

Headlines: Wall Street falls as solid jobs report boosts bond yields
Description: U.S. stocks dropped for a second straight day on Friday, weighed down by another rise in Treasury yields in the wake of a solid jobs report that capped off a week of robust data.

Headlines: American Airlines extends 737 MAX cancellations through June 5
Description: American Airlines said on Sunday it will extend cancellations of 90 flights a day through June 5 because of the grounding of Boeing 737 MAX aircraft following two deadly crashes in five months.

Headlines: Factbox: GM North America plant shutdowns could hit nearly 6,000 workers
Description: General Motors Co's plan to close three North American assembly plants and two transmission plants next year could affect nearly 6,000 workers, according to data on GM's media website.

Headlines: Walt Disney names creative heads of animation studios
Description: Walt Disney Co on Tuesday split the role of its outgoing creative head John Lasseter and appointed two Academy award winners to spearhead its two animation studios.

Headlines: China September rare earth exports fall nearly 18% from last month
Description: China's rare earth exports in September fell 17.9% from August, customs data showed on Monday, amid lingering fears that the world's top producer of the minerals will restrict supply because of its trade row with the United States.

Headlines: Dutch spy agency investigating alleged Huawei 'backdoor': Volkskrant
Description: Chinese telecoms equipment maker Huawei has a hidden "backdoor" on the network of a major Dutch telecoms firm, making it possible to access customer data, newspaper De Volkskrant said on Thursday, citing unidentified intelligence sources.

Headlines: Explainer: How does extradition to the U.S. work?
Description: The arrest in Canada of a top Chinese technology executive for possible extradition to the United States has roiled markets and cast doubt on a recent U.S.-China trade truce.

Headlines: SoftBank's Son admits mistakes after Vision Fund's $8.9 billion loss
Description: SoftBank  plunged to its first quarterly loss in 14 years on Wednesday, dragged down by an $8.9 billion hit at its giant Vision Fund, as CEO Masayoshi Son admitted poor investment judgment and turning a blind eye to problems at startup WeWork.

Headlines: Salesforce to buy Israel's ClickSoftware for $1.35 billion
Description: U.S. cloud-based service provider Salesforce  agreed to buy U.S.-Israeli software developer ClickSoftware for $1.35 billion in cash and shares, in a bid to accelerate growth of its cloud-based products to manage customer service operations.

Headlines: Thomas Cook France says seeking creditor protection
Description: The French arm of collapsed British travel firm Thomas Cook  said on Tuesday it was asking the French commercial court of Nanterre for creditor protection.

Headlines: Analysts' view: Market jitters over second COVID-19 wave are an overdue pullback
Description: A second straight day of record new coronavirus cases in Beijing and a spike in infections across a swathe of the United States has dented investor sentiment and sent stocks sharply lower on Monday.

Headlines: Herbalife prepared secret report to get into Ackman's thinking: book
Description: Herbalife Ltd.  commissioned a secret report to understand what made activist investor William Ackman tick as he accused the company of being a fraud and bet its share price would collapse to zero, a new book shows.

Headlines: Bostic: Fed's focus is its mandates not market pricing for rate cuts
Description: Strong market expectations of an upcoming Fed rate increase are not a reason for the central bank to make a policy move given a U.S. economy that continues to perform well, Atlanta Federal Reserve President Raphael Bostic said on Thursday.

Headlines: China fourth-quarter GDP grows 6%, in line with expectations and hovering near 30-year low
Description: China's economy grew 6.0% in the fourth quarter of 2019 from a year earlier, official data showed on Friday, in line with expectations and unchanged from the previous quarter's pace.

Headlines: Ghosn still in 'very difficult' conditions in Japan cell: lawyer
Description: Carlos Ghosn remains in very difficult conditions in his Japanese prison cell, Ghosn's French-based lawyer Jean-Yves Leborgne told French radio station RTL on Thursday.

Headlines: Qualcomm cutting 1,500 jobs at its California offices
Description: Chipmaker Qualcomm Inc  is cutting 1,500 jobs across multiple divisions at its offices in California, as part of its promise to investors to cut annual costs by $1 billion.

Headlines: EU signs Singapore trade deal, urges China to open up
Description: The European Union signed a free-trade deal with Singapore at a summit with Asian leaders on Friday and pressed China to allow greater foreign investment in its economy, but ran into familiar resistance from Beijing over state subsidies.

Headlines: Billionaire Lawrence Stroll seeks big stake in Aston Martin: report
Description: Canadian billionaire Lawrence Stroll, owner of Formula One team Racing Point, is preparing a bid for a major stake in Aston Martin , Autocar magazine reported, sending the luxury sports car maker's battered shares up 17% on Thursday.

Headlines: Saudi energy minister rejects Russian comments about kingdom's withdrawal from OPEC+ deal
Description: The Saudi energy minister on Saturday rejected Russia's remarks that the kingdom withdrew last month from a deal to cut output.

Headlines: California county says Tesla factory cannot operate normally in coronavirus shutdown
Description: Tesla Inc  cannot operate its main U.S. vehicle factory normally as the San Francisco Bay Area has begun a three-week lockdown to rein in the spread of coronavirus, a spokesman for the county's sheriff's office said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Fed announces more emergency moves to stem dollar, liquidity strains
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve continued to roll out emergency support on Friday as it enhanced efforts with other major central banks to ease a global dollar-funding crunch, backstopped a market essential for U.S. state and local government finances and ramped up its purchases of mortgage-backed securities.

Headlines: House panel wants Boeing CEO to allow employee interviews on 737 MAX crashes
Description: (In September 12 story, corrects name of European Union Aviation Safety Agency from European Aviation and Space Agency in paragraph 10)

Headlines: VW's labour chief sees no need for more cost cuts
Description: Volkswagen's  labour chief Bernd Osterloh has been on a roadshow to tell analysts and investors the carmaker has no need for deeper cost cuts in Germany.

Headlines: Murder of Didi passenger prompts China clampdown, outrage
Description: China pledged on Monday to tighten oversight of its transport industry and warned that the country did not need ride-hailing firms which compromised on passenger safety, days after a Didi Chuxing passenger was raped and murdered by her driver.

Headlines: Buy yen in crisis? Not this year
Description: The trade is familiar to investors worldwide: in times of turmoil, rush for cover by buying the Japanese yen.

Headlines: Factbox: Connecting Britons: Major telecom players in the UK
Description: Telefonica  is in talks with billionaire John Malone's Liberty Global  to explore a merger of its British mobile operator O2 with Liberty's Virgin Media cable network company, the Spanish company said on Monday.

Headlines: StanChart sees key markets leading quick economic recovery after loan losses hit first quarter
Description: Standard Chartered PLC  on Wednesday said it expects its main markets to lead global economic recovery from the COVID-19 crisis as early as later this year, striking an optimistic note after increased bad loan provisions squashed quarterly profit.

Headlines: Primark owner warns coronavirus threatens clothing supplies
Description: Primark owner Associated British Foods  warned on Monday there was a risk of shortages of some clothing lines later this year if delays in factory production in China are prolonged because of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Bombardier posts quarterly loss, lowers 2019 forecast; shares plunge
Description: Bombardier Inc lowered its full-year earnings and cash flow forecasts and reported a quarterly loss on Thursday, as it faces challenges in its important rail division, sending shares of the Canadian train and plane maker down 18%.

Headlines: U.S. oil up 1 percent on Venezuela turmoil, but hefty stock build weighs
Description: U.S. oil prices rose by 1 percent on Thursday, boosted by the U.S. threat of sanctions on Venezuela, but gains were capped by record high gasoline inventories and an unexpected big build in crude stocks in the United States.

Headlines: Trump, Putin discuss coronavirus, global energy markets: White House
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump spoke with Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin on Friday about the coronavirus and energy markets, the White House said.

Headlines: Fed's Rosengren flags risks to economy in WeWork-style model
Description: The rise in co-working spaces, like those offered by WeWork, may be a source of financial instability that could make the next U.S. recession worse by sparking a run on commercial real estate, Boston Federal Reserve Bank President Eric Rosengren said on Friday.

Headlines: Timeline: JD.com CEO's fateful journey to Minnesota
Description: Richard Liu, the billionaire chief executive of JD.com Inc, traveled to Minneapolis from China in late August for a doctor of business administration program at the University of Minnesota. It ended with an allegation of rape and a criminal investigation.

Headlines: U.S. lawmakers cut anti-ZTE measure from defense bill
Description: U.S. lawmakers cut measures from a defense bill that would have reinstated sanctions on China's ZTE Corp, abandoning an attempt to punish the company for illegally shipping U.S. products to Iran and North Korea.

Headlines: China hopes U.S. takes seriously China's position on trade
Description: China's foreign ministry said on Friday it hoped the United States can take China's position seriously and make a rational decision, after U.S. President Donald Trump announced plans to target up to $60 billion in Chinese goods with tariffs.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs, Apple to launch joint credit card: WSJ
Description: Goldman Sachs  and Apple Inc  are preparing to launch a joint credit card, the Wall Street Journal reported https://www.wsj.com/articles/goldman-sachs-apple-team-up-on-new-credit-card-1525965387 on Thursday.

Headlines: German official hopes EU tariffs don't impede U.S. trade pact
Description: A senior German official said on Thursday the European Union had no choice but to threaten tariffs on U.S. imports in a dispute over aircraft subsidies, but he hoped trade tensions would not affect talks with Washington over a broader trade agreement.

Headlines: Global stock markets fall on trade war pessimism; oil rallies
Description: Stock markets around the world retreated on Monday amid concerns over the potential wider impact of a trade spat between China and the United States, while oil prices rallied to a four-year high after OPEC ignored U.S. calls to raise supply.

Headlines: Factbox: How the North American trade deal will affect labor, environment, drugs
Description: New amendments to the U.S.-Mexico-Canada trade agreement (USMCA) focus heavily on stronger labor enforcement, outlining a detailed process to address any allegations that Mexican factories are violating workers' rights.

Headlines: IBM and other companies launch new blockchain network for supply management
Description: International Business Machines Corp  announced on Monday a new blockchain network aimed at improving manual and cumbersome supply chain management.

Headlines: Swiss trader Trafigura bulks up management committee
Description: Trafigura has tripled the size of its management committee, bolstering the position of CEO Jeremy Weir while also giving more responsibility to the next generation of potential leaders, the Swiss commodities trader said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Trump threatens tariffs on all $500 billion of Chinese imports
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday said he was ready to impose tariffs on all $500 billion of imported goods from China, threatening to escalate a clash over trade policy that has unnerved financial markets.

Headlines: Canada's Air Transat says airline deal with Thomas Cook could expand
Description: Canada's Air Transat  could expand a partnership deal with the airline arm of British tourism group Thomas Cook  to include codesharing and interlining, the boss of the Canadian carrier said.

Headlines: U.S. stocks retreat on virus fears
Description: Concerns over how the spreading coronavirus outbreak will impact growth in the U.S. and abroad is hitting stocks and pushing investors into haven assets.

Headlines: U.S. small business rescue program ignored Congress: watchdog
Description: The U.S. government's $660 billion program to rescue small businesses hit by the coronavirus pandemic thwarts the intention of Congress by making it hard for some borrowers to convert loans to grants and failing to prioritize the right businesses, a government watchdog said on Friday.

Headlines: Renault board to meet, discuss coronavirus crisis: sources
Description: The board of French carmaker Renault  will meet on Friday to discuss the coronavirus outbreak and its effect on operations, three sources close to the company said.

Headlines: Morgan Stanley executives offer cautious outlook after profit beat
Description: Morgan Stanley  reported a higher-than-expected profit on Thursday, bolstered by strength in bond trading and M&A advisory, but executives were careful not to sound too optimistic about the rest of the year.

Headlines: Trump announces plan to reopen virus-ravaged U.S. economy
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump laid out guidelines on Thursday for reopening the coronavirus-ravaged U.S. economy, saying states should take a phased approach to let Americans return to work as conditions allow.

Headlines: Leading French luxury stocks fall after latest U.S. tariff threats
Description: Shares in leading French luxury companies fell on Tuesday after the United States issued a new set of tariff threats on French products.

Headlines: Explainer: What's behind Japan's support of whaling?
Description: Japan has for decades been steadfastly defiant about hunting whales despite widespread anger, including from key allies like the United States.

Headlines: Germany's E.ON puts fate of Uniper management in Fortum's hands
Description: A vote that could have triggered a probe into whether managers of German energy company Uniper  tried to block the sale of a 47 percent stake to Finland's Fortum  was postponed on Wednesday in line with a proposal by Uniper's biggest shareholder E.ON .

Headlines: KPMG subject of second UK investigation over Carillion audit
Description: Britain's Financial Reporting Council (FRC) has opened a second investigation into how accounting firm KPMG audited the books of collapsed UK construction company Carillion, the watchdog said on Tuesday.

Headlines: It started with a kiss: how Juncker wooed Trump
Description: Some personal chemistry with a fellow veteran dealmaker and a quick sense that Donald Trump was ready to bargain helped Jean-Claude Juncker strike a surprise accord to avert a transatlantic trade war, for now.

Headlines: Factbox: Coronavirus cases reported at 19 of Amazon's U.S. warehouses
Description: Amazon.com Inc  is at the front line of responding to outbreaks of the novel coronavirus in the United States, delivering essential goods while more than half the population faces government stay-at-home orders.

Headlines: Ahead of Bezos visit, India antitrust chief says e-commerce firms shouldn't offer heavy discounts
Description: Big e-commerce firms should not offer steep discounts, must disclose discounting policies and ensure they do not drive brick-and-mortar rivals out of business, India's antitrust chief said as his commission launched a probe into Amazon.com and Walmart's Flipkart.

Headlines: CSX overcomes 'polar vortex' to top Wall Street's profit view
Description: CSX Corp on Tuesday reported a quarterly profit that topped Wall Street's target, after the No. 3 U.S. railroad operator pushed through price increases and contained labor and fuel costs by running fewer, but longer trains.

Headlines: U.S. equity markets not taking their cues from high-yield junk bonds
Description: A long-reliable warning signal for stock investors that the tide is about to turn against them briefly flashed caution amid last month's sell-off but does not appear to be calling an end to the bull market just yet.

Headlines: Chemicals maker Dow cuts costs as global slowdown bites
Description: Dow Inc  beat Wall Street's tempered profit estimates in the third quarter as it cut costs to offset a sharp drop in demand for chemicals used in plastics and other manufacturing, sending its shares up more than 5%.

Headlines: Military strike against Iran would result in 'all-out war': Zarif
Description: Any U.S. or Saudi military strike against Iran would bring "all-out war", Tehran said on Thursday, keeping up a drumbeat of warnings to its adversaries after they accused the Islamic Republic of a strike on Saudi oil facilities.

Headlines: Kraft Heinz hires global brand expert Patricio as CEO
Description: Kraft Heinz Co named Miguel Patricio as its next chief executive on Monday, hoping the 30-year marketing veteran will revitalize brands such as Planters nuts and Oscar Mayer bacon at one of the world's largest packaged food companies.

Headlines: Twitter to ban cryptocurrency ads from Tuesday as online crackdown widens
Description: Twitter Inc  will start banning cryptocurrency advertising from Tuesday, joining Facebook and Google in a clampdown that seeks to avoid giving publicity to potential fraud or large investor losses.

Headlines: 'Still time' for Thailand to solve U.S. duty-free issue: U.S. commerce secretary
Description: Thailand still has time to renegotiate with the United States over a suspension of duty-free preferences on imports of Thai goods before the suspension takes effect in April, U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross said on Monday.

Headlines: Instant view: Powell - Fed stands ready to act "as appropriate" to sustain expansion
Description: Concerns about trade policy and a weak global economy "continue to weigh on the U.S. economic outlook" and the Federal Reserve stands ready to "act as appropriate" to sustain a decade-long expansion, Fed Chairman Jerome Powell said on Wednesday in remarks that could bolster expectations of an interest rate cut later this month.

Headlines: HSBC sends home 100 London staff, confirms China coronavirus case
Description: HSBC Holdings PLC  has sent home more than 100 staff in London after a worker tested positive for the coronavirus, the first known case at a major company in Europe's main financial hub.

Headlines: Your questions on the lockdown and U.S. small business, answered
Description: After closing their doors to prevent the spread of the coronavirus, many small businesses face an uncertain future following government-ordered lockdowns.

Headlines: Roche's $4.3 billion Spark bid delayed again amid U.S., UK scrutiny
Description: Swiss drugmaker Roche's $4.3 billion takeover of U.S. gene therapy specialist Spark Therapeutics has been pushed back again, possibly beyond the first half, as regulators continue to scrutinize the deal for its effect on competition.

Headlines: China's Tencent cautious after surge in quarterly profit
Description: China's Tencent Holdings , the world's largest gaming company by revenue, warned on Wednesday of a difficult economic environment even as it reported a better-than-expected 35% jump in quarterly profit.

Headlines: Exxon quarterly profit misses due to refinery maintenance
Description: Exxon Mobil Corp , the world's largest publicly traded oil producer, posted a lower-than-expected quarterly profit on Friday as its production dropped and it spent heavily to upgrade several key refineries.

Headlines: U.S. FAA regulator head tells team to 'take whatever time needed' on 737 MAX
Description: The head of the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration has told his team to "take whatever time is needed" in their review of Boeing Co's 737 MAX, according to a Nov. 14 memo and video message reviewed by Reuters.

Headlines: Harley-Davidson beats forecasts as international sales rebound
Description: Harley-Davidson Inc  beat expectations for profit on Tuesday and stuck to its full-year shipment forecast, allaying fears of another major hit from European import tariffs and a further slump in sales in its main U.S. market.

Headlines: IKEA to open first store in Slovenia in 2020
Description: IKEA  will start building its first store in Slovenia in October with construction expected to be completed in about 12 months, the Swedish furniture retailer said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Estonian minister blamed for slow reform after Danske scandal
Description: Estonia's far-right finance minister has been criticized by lawmakers for holding up financial reforms promised after the Baltic state became the focus of Europe's biggest money laundering scandal.

Headlines: Vodafone expects mid-year EU approval on Liberty Global deal
Description: Vodafone still expects to secure EU antitrust approval for its $22 billion purchase of Liberty Global's assets in Germany and eastern Europe by the middle of the year, it said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Big thumbs-up from Wall Street after Fed signals patience on rates
Description: U.S. stocks surged on Wednesday after the Federal Reserve said it would be patient in lifting borrowing costs further this year, reassuring investors worried about a slowing economy.

Headlines: Dollar falls as Fed officials ring note of caution, pound bounces
Description: The dollar fell broadly on Friday in the wake of cautious comments from two U.S. Federal Reserve officials about global economic growth, while sterling rose following losses tied to fears about a Brexit deal.

Headlines: Trade hopes buoy Wall Street as China extends olive branch
Description: Wall Street moved higher on Wednesday, led by tariff-sensitive technology and industrial stocks after China extended an olive branch ahead of next month's trade negotiations with the United States.

Headlines: Philippine fast food specialist Jollibee hungry to expand in U.S., China
Description: Jollibee Foods Corp , the Philippine fast food specialist known for fried 'Chickenjoy' and chopped hotdogs in sweet spaghetti sauce, is doubling down on expansion plans in the United States and China that are likely to include more M&A.

Headlines: Bottler Coca-Cola HBC warns of higher finance costs, lower consumer spending
Description: Shares of soft drink bottler Coca Cola HBC AG fell 4 percent on Thursday after it warned of higher finance costs and weak consumer spending in several of its markets this year.

Headlines: Russia's Novak calls on all oil producers to join efforts
Description: Russian Energy Minister Alexander Novak said on Thursday that all the leading global oil producers should join their efforts to tackle falling oil demand.

Headlines: Ackman's Pershing Square unveils $900 million stake in Starbucks
Description: William Ackman said on Tuesday his activist hedge fund Pershing Square Capital Management LP has built a roughly $900 million position in Starbucks Corp , betting the world's biggest coffee chain can overcome stagnant sales in its home market.

Headlines: Colombia bans Boeing 737 MAX 8 planes from its airspace
Description: Colombia's civil aviation authority said on Wednesday it would not allow Boeing Co 737 MAX 8 planes to fly into its airspace after the grounding of the aircraft by several nations, while the cause of the deadly crash of an Ethiopian Airlines plane is investigated.

Headlines: PNB fraud defendant Choksi fears 'mob lynching' in India
Description: One of the main defendants in India's largest bank fraud case made a court application on Monday for cancellation of an arrest  warrant against him, citing fears for his life because of a growing number of mob lynchings in the country.

Headlines: German minister fears excluding Huawei could hurt economy
Description: Excluding China's Huawei from participating in the construction of Germany's 5G next-generation mobile network could hurt Europe's largest economy, Interior Minister Horst Seehofer said on Wednesday.

Headlines: IMF may need 'exceptional measures' to facilitate pandemic response: Georgieva
Description: The International Monetary Fund may need to step outside its comfort zone and consider "exceptional measures" to help countries deal with the coronavirus pandemic and mitigate its economic impact, Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva said on Monday.

Headlines: Trump pushes U.S. lawsuit against drug companies over opioids
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday again pressed U.S. Attorney General Jeff Sessions to sue drug companies over the nation's ongoing opioids crisis.

Headlines: French court cancels Monsanto weedkiller permit on safety grounds
Description: A French court canceled the license for one of Monsanto's glyphosate-based weedkillers on Tuesday over safety concerns, placing an immediate ban on Roundup Pro 360 in the latest legal blow to the Bayer-owned business.

Headlines: Asian markets a reluctant spectator to U.S. political theater
Description: Asian stocks were subdued on Monday as investors fretted that political instability in the United States was leaving the country rudderless at a time when the global economy was showing signs of faltering.

Headlines: Optimism over U.S.-China trade deal lifts equity markets
Description: Hopes for a resolution in a prolonged trade spat between the United States and China helped extend a week-long rally in world stock markets on Wednesday, and bond yields also climbed.

Headlines: UnitedHealth profit beats expectations, shares rise
Description: UnitedHealth Group Inc , the largest U.S. health insurer, beat Wall Street estimates for fourth-quarter profit on Tuesday, driven largely by growth in its Optum services business, including its pharmacy benefits unit.

Headlines: Toyota says Japan plants may be affected by virus-related supply issues
Description: Toyota Motor Corp  on Wednesday said that operations at its plants in Japan may be affected by supply chain issues linked to the new coronavirus outbreak in the coming weeks, as the global outbreak gathers pace.

Headlines: Investor Ackman opposes United Technologies' aerospace merger with Raytheon: source
Description: Billionaire investor William Ackman's activist hedge fund Pershing Square Capital Management LP is opposing United Technologies Corp's planned $120 billion aerospace merger with defense contractor Raytheon Co, a person familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. new home sales rise to 11-month high in February
Description: Sales of new U.S. single-family homes increased to an 11-month high in February and sales for January were revised higher, suggesting that lower mortgage rates were starting to lift the struggling housing market.

Headlines: Laptop 'for him', vacuum 'for her'? HSBC draws ire with Valentine offer
Description: A Valentine's day special deal for HSBC staff in Hong Kong offering discounted laptops 'for him' but vacuum cleaners and kitchen appliances 'for her' has angered staff over the sexist implications of the campaign.

Headlines: U.S. service sector slows more than expected in November
Description: U.S. services sector activity slowed more than expected in November amid lingering concerns about trade tensions and worker shortages, which could revive fears about the economy's health.

Headlines: U.S. Air Force finds additional deficiency in Boeing's aerial fuel system
Description: The U.S. Air Force announced on Monday an additional deficiency in the KC-46 Pegasus aerial fuel system built by Boeing , classifying it at the Category I level, meaning it is a major technical issue that may endanger the aircrew and aircraft.

Headlines: German prosecutors investigate Porsche board member over emissions
Description: German prosecutors are investigating current and former employees of Volkswagen-owned sports car maker Porsche, including a management board member, as part of their inquiries into emissions manipulations, they said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Lufthansa board rejects EU conditions on $10 billion bailout
Description: Lufthansa's  $10 billion government bailout was thrown into doubt on Wednesday after the German airline's supervisory board refused to accept the conditions attached by Brussels.

Headlines: Stocks surge in broad rally, Treasury yields rise
Description: Global equity markets surged on Monday, lifted by talk of more stimulus from China and by a broad rally on Wall Street that overcame a plunge in Boeing shares after one of its newest jets crashed, while U.S. debt yields rose on improved risk appetite.

Headlines: Northrop Grumman wins U.S. antitrust approval to buy Orbital ATK
Description: U.S. defense contractor Northrop Grumman  won U.S. antitrust approval to buy solid rocket motor supplier Orbital ATK Inc  with conditions, the Federal Trade Commission said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Global shares slip on China growth fears, dollar gains
Description: Global equity markets fell on Monday amid unease over the impact of the U.S.-China trade war on China's growth, while the dollar gained against the euro as Italian bond yields spiked on a  brewing spat over Italy's budget plans.

Headlines: U.S. Upper Midwest factory growth rebounds in April
Description: A gauge of manufacturing activity in the U.S. Upper Midwest rose in April, bolstered by increases in stronger production and hiring activities, according to a private-sector survey released on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. judge orders Boeing to turn over documents in 737 MAX crash litigation
Description: A Chicago judge on Thursday ordered Boeing Co to turn over documents on the development of its 737 MAX aircraft after lawyers representing some Ethiopian Airlines crash victims said their clients were not prepared to accept an offer by the planemaker to settle litigation.

Headlines: Exclusive: Blackstone in talks to take developer SOHO China private in $4 billion deal - sources
Description: Blackstone Group Inc is in exclusive talks to take SOHO China Ltd private in a $4 billion deal, said two sources, in one of its biggest bets yet on the Chinese market and which sent the target's shares to a 21-month high.

Headlines: Fiat's Maserati to invest at least 1.6 billion euros to launch new models
Description: Fiat Chrysler's  luxury brand Maserati will invest at least 1.6 billion euros ($1.75 billion) to produce its first hybrid and electric models, including a new super sports car and a new sport utility vehicle, it said on Thursday.

Headlines: SEC moves to ease information disclosure requirements
Description: The top U.S. securities regulator on Friday said it had voted to simplify and update requirements for disclosing information that it considers redundant or outdated, with the aim of reducing compliance burdens for companies.

Headlines: Image sharing website Pinterest files for IPO
Description: Pinterest Inc, the owner of the image search website known for the food and fashion photos that its users post, filed for an initial public offering with U.S. regulators on Friday, looking to tap into a red-hot market for new stock offerings.

Headlines: Like fine whisky, Texan oil exporters tout unblended crude
Description: Decades ago, a distiller in Scotland discovered the marketing power of "single malt" whisky, untouched by blending - a technique now being embraced by sellers of Texas crude oil.

Headlines: SK Innovation fuels LG Chem feud with EV battery patent lawsuit
Description: A feud between two South Korean battery makers escalated on Friday as SK Innovation Co Ltd  said it plans to sue bigger rival LG Chem Ltd  in the United States over alleged patent infringement related to electric vehicles (EV).

Headlines: U.S. DOJ in talks with states to win support for T-Mobile, Sprint  merger: WSJ
Description: The U.S. Justice Department is negotiating with state officials to get them to support a planned settlement that would allow T-Mobile US Inc  and Sprint Corp  to merge by selling assets to Dish Network Corp , the Wall Street Journal reported, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Air France plans to cut 6,500 jobs by 2022: sources
Description: Air France  aims to present a plan to trade unions to cut just over 6,500 jobs over the next two years, three sources familiar with the matter said on Tuesday, as the airline grapples with the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Facebook's cryptocurrency ambitions face privacy concerns, political backlash
Description: Facebook Inc announced ambitious plans on Tuesday to launch a new global cryptocurrency called Libra, part of an effort to expand into digital payments that immediately raised privacy concerns.

Headlines: Bank of America, RBS sued in U.S. over euro bond cartel
Description: Bank of America Corp and Royal Bank of Scotland Group Plc have been sued by investors in the United States over their alleged roles in a conspiracy among eight banks to rig prices in the $9.4 trillion European government bond market.

Headlines: Chinese importers to apply for tariff waivers on U.S. goods
Description: Chinese importers are preparing applications for waivers on import tariffs levied on more than 700 U.S. goods in the Sino-U.S trade war, after the finance ministry said it would start taking submissions.

Headlines: U.S. pending home sales slip in October: NAR
Description: Contracts to buy previously owned U.S. homes fell unexpectedly in October, with new contract signings down in three of the four U.S. regions.

Headlines: Lufthansa CEO: Grounding Boeing 737 MAX the right decision
Description: The decision by regulators around the world to ground Boeing's 737 MAX aircraft following last weekend's Ethiopian Airlines crash was right, the CEO of German airline Lufthansa said on Thursday.

Headlines: GameStop tops revenue estimates on robust Nintendo Switch sales
Description: GameStop Corp , the world's largest video game and gaming console retailer, reported revenue that beat analysts' estimates for the fourth straight quarter as sales of Nintendo Switch consoles remained strong.

Headlines: Euro zone economy set for deepest recession on record: Reuters poll
Description: The euro zone economy is already in its deepest recession on record, according to a Reuters poll of economists, who have stuck to a bleak outlook and worry the downturn might be even worse as coronavirus lockdowns across the bloc take their toll.

Headlines: Coronavirus punishes Warren Buffett's equity holdings
Description: The coronavirus pandemic may have erased around $64 billion of value from Warren Buffett's equity portfolio at Berkshire Hathaway Inc , setting up the conglomerate for one of the largest quarterly losses ever by an American company.

Headlines: Renault diesel allegations upheld by court study: report
Description: A French probe into alleged emissions cheating by Renault is a step closer to possible court action, Le Monde reported on Monday, after a technical report confirmed that some of its diesel engines were configured to emit more pollutants outside official test conditions.

Headlines: Apple CEO calls $1 trillion value a 'milestone' but not a focus
Description: Apple Inc  Chief Executive Tim Cook said on Thursday that the iPhone maker's $1 trillion market capitalization was "not the most important measure" of the company's success but was instead a result of its focus on its products, customers and company values.

Headlines: Netflix to let viewers pick how TV episodes and movies will end: Bloomberg
Description: Streaming giant Netflix Inc will now allow users to choose how a TV episode or movie will end as it pushes further into Interactive TV, Bloomberg reported on Monday.

Headlines: Ariane 6 rocket sees first commercial deals in race with SpaceX
Description: Ariane 6, Europe's next-generation space rocket, is expected to win its first two commercial launch orders in coming weeks, company officials said, a key milestone as the European launcher vies for orders against Elon Musk's U.S. competitor SpaceX.

Headlines: Tesla to recall 3,183 Model X vehicles in China: market regulator
Description: Tesla Inc  will recall 3,183 Model X vehicles in China, because of a potential issue that could make steering harder and increase the risk of a crash, according to the country's market regulator.

Headlines: Investors bristle as Apple's iPhone data goes the way of its headphone jacks
Description: First Apple Inc  took away the headphone jack on its iPhones. Then it took away the home button.

Headlines: Ray-Ban maker EssilorLuxottica halts dividend as postpones AGM
Description: Ray-Ban maker EssilorLuxottica  is suspending its dividend due to the coronavirus pandemic and said on Monday it was delaying its annual shareholder meeting by a month.

Headlines: Germany's Thyssenkrupp ends leadership vacuum, paves way for split
Description: Thyssenkrupp  acted to end its leadership and strategy crisis on Sunday, as its supervisory board filled its two top management posts and approved plans to split the German conglomerate in two.

Headlines: Trump, in trade feud with allies, say won't let them take advantage of U.S.
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday kept up his feud with  America's closest allies over trade, saying he could not allow them to continue taking advantage of the United States.

Headlines: Innoviz, Ouster raise millions for self-driving lidar sensors
Description: Self-driving technology continues to attract robust investment, as two tech startups, one in San Francisco and one near Tel Aviv, said this week they have raised nearly $200 million to support development and production of lidar sensors for automated vehicles.

Headlines: Japan's Fujifilm to spend $928 million to double capacity of Danish drug facility
Description: (This June 10 story corrects second paragraph to say facility makes antibody drugs, not viral vaccines)

Headlines: MSCI drops ZTE, four other companies from MSCI China A Inclusion Index
Description: Telecom equipment and smartphone maker ZTE Corp   and four other companies have been dropped from several MSCI indexes including the MSCI China A Inclusion Index as trading in the China-listed A shares of all five companies has been suspended.

Headlines: Global air traffic could drop by up to 1.2 billion passengers: ICAO
Description: International air passenger traffic could drop by as many as 1.2 billion travelers, or two-thirds, by September 2020, as the coronavirus pandemic weighs on demand, the United Nations aviation agency said on Wednesday in a statement, citing projections.

Headlines: Australia fines Volkswagen record $86 million for emissions breach: regulator
Description: Australia's competition regulator said the federal court has penalized Volkswagen AG  a record A$125 million ($86 million) for allegedly making false representations about compliance with the country's diesel emission standards.

Headlines: Mitsubishi Motors executive stresses importance of alliance with Nissan, Renault
Description: A top executive at Mitsubishi Motors Corp  said on Tuesday that the days of a single automaker being able to develop new technologies on its own were fading, stressing the importance of its alliance with Nissan Motor Co  and Renault SA .

Headlines: Finland's Nokia announces 5G partnership with Intel
Description: Finland's Nokia Oyj  has entered into partnership with Intel  to accelerate its so-far sluggish shift to 5G, the company said on Thursday, a day after announcing a similar deal with Marvell Technology .

Headlines: Halliburton follows Chevron in halting Venezuelan operations
Description: Oilfield services provider Halliburton Co  said on Friday it would cease most of its operations in Venezuela after the U.S. Treasury Department imposed tight new regulations on oil and gas companies doing business in the South American nation.

Headlines: Latin America grabs world spotlight for airline bankruptcies
Description: LATAM Airlines and Avianca Holdings  survived the Great Depression, but just a few weeks of quarantines forced both companies into bankruptcy, marking Latin America as the world's top spot for airline financial ruin.

Headlines: Bank of America names new French investment banking boss: memo
Description: Bank of America  has appointed Jrme Morisseau as its head of investment banking for France as it seeks to bolster its Paris franchise and win more business from large French clients, a memo seen by Reuters said.

Headlines: Investor Ackman tweets to Trump: Close down the country
Description: Billionaire investor William Ackman, who has long worried about risks posed by the coronavirus, called on the Trump administration on Wednesday to seal off the country for 30 days and said stocks would "soar" if such restrictions were imposed.

Headlines: Hyundai Motor Group shares gain after Elliott calls for major change
Description: Shares of three key affiliates of Hyundai Motor Group gained ground on Tuesday after U.S. activist hedge fund Elliott Management stepped up pressure for changes in the South Korean companies.

Headlines: Online banks to take bigger share of U.S. deposit market: Evercore
Description: Online banks, such as Ally Financial Inc  and Capital One Financial Corp , are expected to take a bigger chunk of the overall U.S. deposit market, after racking up $95 billion in customer deposits this year with enticing yields on most savings accounts.

Headlines: GM expects to spend more on EVs than gas-powered cars in next five years: CEO
Description: General Motors Co  expects to spend more on developing and selling electric vehicles (EVs) than gasoline-powered cars over the next five years, Chief Executive Mary Barra said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Exxon shareholders reject resolutions on climate and splitting CEO, chairman roles
Description: Exxon Mobil Corp shareholders on Wednesday rejected a proposal to split the chief executive officer and board chairman roles that some had promoted to protest a decision to strike an unrelated climate change resolution from the ballot.

Headlines: First companies will debut on Shanghai's STAR Market on July 22
Description: The first batch of companies will start trading on the STAR Market on July 22, the Shanghai Stock Exchange said on Friday.

Headlines: Retailers offer discounts, waive shipping fees to boost online sales
Description: After closing their stores earlier this week to limit the spread of the coronavirus, several retailers are dangling site-wide discounts and free shipping to entice people stuck at home to shop.

Headlines: Japan's first-quarter GDP decline likely smaller than initial estimates on firmer capex: Reuters poll
Description: Japan's first quarter economic contraction was likely smaller than initially estimated, a Reuters poll showed, thanks to stronger business spending although the country is still expected to slide deeper into recession this year.

Headlines: Fresenius alleges 'blatant fraud' at U.S. drugmaker Akorn
Description: German healthcare group Fresenius  alleged it uncovered "blatant fraud at the very top level" of U.S. generic drugmaker Akorn Inc  after Fresenius agreed to acquire the company for $4.75 billion, according to a court filing made public late on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. telecoms supply chain rules, seen hitting Huawei, under review: official
Description: Rules to implement a White House executive order that is expected to pave the way for China's Huawei to be banned from the U.S. telecoms supply chain are "under consideration and review," a Commerce Department official said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler to pay Tesla hundreds of millions of euros to pool fleet
Description: Italian-U.S. carmaker Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV (FCA) has agreed to pay electric carmaker Tesla Inc hundreds of millions of euros to allow Tesla vehicles to be counted in its fleet to avoid fines for violating new European Union emission rules.

Headlines: U.S. businesses see big hit from coronavirus, Fed survey shows
Description: U.S. businesses expect a "very large and very negative impact" from the coronavirus pandemic and efforts to slow its spread, according to a survey published on Monday by the Atlanta Federal Reserve Bank.

Headlines: Democrats probe whether White House interfered in AT&T Time Warner merger
Description: Two U.S. House Democrats on Thursday asked the White House and Justice Department to turn over documents that could show whether Republican President Donald Trump sought to intervene in the regulatory review of AT&T Inc's $85 billion acquisition of Time Warner Inc.

Headlines: Luckin Coffee delays annual filing amid accounting probes
Description: Luckin Coffee Inc  said on Wednesday it would not file its annual financial report on time as it was dealing with investigations into hundreds of millions of dollars worth of fabricated sales.

Headlines: TJX holiday quarter same-stores sales beat estimates
Description: Off-price apparel retailer TJX Cos Inc reported better-than-expected quarterly same-store sales on Wednesday, as steep discounts drove more shoppers to its T.J. Maxx and Marshalls stores during the holiday season.

Headlines: Equities slide as Fed heightens worry over growth slowdown
Description: World equity markets continued a week-long slide on Thursday, one day after the U.S. Federal Reserve indicated it was set on its path to hike interest rates next year despite signs that global economic growth is stuttering.

Headlines: American Airlines posts $2.2 billion loss on pandemic, first since bankruptcy exit
Description: American Airlines  on Thursday posted a $2.2 billion net loss, its first quarterly loss since emerging from bankruptcy in 2013, and warned of a roughly $70 million per day cash burn in the second quarter as the coronavirus pandemic halts travel.

Headlines: Microsoft trims jobs as it enters new fiscal year
Description: Microsoft Corp said on Thursday it had trimmed its workforce across geographies and teams as it entered a new fiscal year from July 1.

Headlines: Robots Luise, Renate join Airbus A320 production line in Hamburg
Description: European planemaker Airbus inaugurated a new production line for its best-selling A320 jet with robots Luise and Renate joining human workers as it turns to new automation to help it deal with an eight-year order backlog.

Headlines: World's central bankers feel the heat as populists demand easy fix
Description: Central bankers from the United States to Europe are coming under pressure from their governments to loosen their purse strings again as a decade of accelerating economic growth and booming markets fueled by cheap cash comes to an end.

Headlines: In makeover mode, Burberry bets on new branding to boost sales
Description: It has a hotshot new designer known for dressing Beyonce and is experimenting with monthly product launches on social media.

Headlines: Tokyo prosecutors say no conspiracy with Nissan, Ghosn failed to justify his acts
Description: Tokyo prosecutors struck back at ousted Nissan Motor boss Carlos Ghosn on Thursday, saying his allegations of a conspiracy between prosecutors and the automaker were false and that he had failed to justify his acts.

Headlines: Worldline's $8.7 billion Ingenico deal to create European payments leader
Description: Payments company Worldline agreed on Monday to buy French rival  Ingenico  in a 7.8 billion euro ($8.7 billion) deal,  creating a European leader in a sector trying to keep up with fast-changing consumer habits and technologies.

Headlines: Russia's En+ says U.S. sanctions highly likely to hurt business
Description: Russia's En+ Group, which manages the assets of tycoon Oleg Deripaska, said on Monday that new U.S. sanctions were "highly likely" to materially affect its business and prospects in an adverse way.

Headlines: U.S. pilot program allows online grocery shopping with food stamps
Description: The U.S. Department of Agriculture on Thursday said it has launched a pilot program in New York that allows consumers dependant on food stamps to use them to buy groceries online, a move that is likely to boost sales at retailers like Walmart Inc and Amazon.com Inc.

Headlines: Thomas Cook customers say hotel in Tunisia stopped them leaving
Description: British tourists in Tunisia said their hotel stopped them leaving for several hours on Saturday night over concerns about payment by their holiday operator Thomas Cook, though the Tunisian government said the incident was a misunderstanding.

Headlines: WeWork and the new brand of office-space providers
Description: WeWork owner The We Company published detailed financial statements for the first time on Wednesday, revealing breakneck revenue growth and soaring losses as it prepares for an initial public offering as early as next month.

Headlines: Nissan to lay off 1,000 Mexican workers, cites market challenges
Description: Japanese carmaker Nissan Motor Co Ltd  will lay off about 1,000 workers in Mexico at two factories, citing "challenging market conditions," the company said on Thursday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Saudi PIF in talks to invest in aspiring Tesla rival Lucid - sources
Description: PIF, the Saudi Arabian sovereign wealth fund that Tesla Inc  CEO Elon Musk has said could help him fund a $72 billion deal to take his electric car maker private, is in talks to invest in aspiring Tesla rival Lucid Motors Inc, people familiar with the matter said on Sunday.

Headlines: Uber to start shipping car disinfectants to drivers
Description: Uber Technologies Inc will begin shipping disinfecting car spray to selected drivers in areas most affected by the coronavirus outbreak, an executive said on Thursday.

Headlines: Taking aim at Intel, Qualcomm launches chip for business PCs
Description: Qualcomm Inc , the biggest supplier of chips for mobile phones, on Thursday pushed further into the PC market with a line of chips designed to power business machines.

Headlines: Italian, French unions say FCA-Peugeot merger plan only benefits shareholders
Description: A planned merger between Fiat Chrysler and Peugeot owner PSA  would only benefit shareholders, two of the biggest Italian and a French unions said on Thursday, criticising a decision not to include labour groups in the decision.

Headlines: Nissan denies corporate conspiracy to oust ex-chairman Ghosn
Description: Nissan Motor Co Ltd  on Monday blasted suggestions in media reports of a conspiracy within the company to oust former chairman Carlos Ghosn.

Headlines: Best Buy signals robust holiday shopping demand with upbeat forecast
Description: Best Buy Co Inc  signaled it expected a strong holiday shopping season by forecasting fourth-quarter profit above Wall Street estimates on Tuesday, sending shares of the biggest U.S. consumer electronics retailer up over 8%.

Headlines: No need for ECB to adapt policy after recent weak data: Coeure
Description: The European Central Bank does not need to adapt its monetary policy after recent weakness in some euro zone economic indicators, ECB Executive Board member Benoit Coeure said on Monday.

Headlines: Canada to aid steel, aluminum industries hit by U.S. tariffs: source
Description: Canada will hit back against U.S. tariffs on its steel and aluminum by offering affected companies and workers up to C$800 million ($603 million) in aid, a source familiar with the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: Trump says he is speeding help to farmers hurt by coronavirus dislocation
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday he has directed his agriculture secretary to expedite help to farmers, especially small farmers, hurt by the economic disruption caused by the new coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Wall Street Week Ahead: Clouds may be parting for dividend investors
Description: U.S. companies are cutting their dividends less than investors anticipated, providing a potential boost to a stock market rally that has clashed with concerns over a recent surge in coronavirus infections.

Headlines: U.S. job growth seen slowing in March, jobless rate likely fell
Description: U.S. job growth likely slowed in March as the boost from mild temperatures faded, but the gains were probably more than enough to push the unemployment rate down to 4.0 percent, indicating the labor market continues to tighten.

Headlines: China to slap additional tariffs on $16 billion of U.S. goods
Description: China is slapping additional tariffs of 25 percent on $16 billion worth of U.S. imports from fuel and steel products to autos and medical equipment, the Chinese commerce ministry said, as the world's largest economies escalated their trade dispute.

Headlines: Fed's commitment to act upstaged by Trump's furor
Description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said the central bank would "act as appropriate" to keep the U.S. economy healthy in a deteriorating global economy, but stopped short of committing to rapid-fire rate cuts and drew fire from President Donald Trump.

Headlines: China's top feed producer New Hope builds three pig farms in Vietnam
Description: China's top feed producer, New Hope Group, said on Thursday it is building three pig farms in neighboring Vietnam, even as an incurable pig disease spreads through the Southeast Asian country.

Headlines: Fed's Daly says she's in a 'watch and see' mode on rates
Description: San Francisco Federal Reserve President Mary Daly on Thursday said she is in a "watch and see" mode as she assesses the need for another U.S. interest-rate cut for an economy that has "strong" momentum but faces headwinds from uncertainty and a global growth slowdown.

Headlines: S&P 500 futures fall after Trump ousts McMaster
Description: S&P 500 e-mini futures fell 0.33 percent late on Thursday after U.S. President Donald Trump tweeted that he was replacing his national security advisor.

Headlines: British supermarket Sainsbury's to remove most customer purchasing limits
Description: British supermarket group Sainsbury's  said on Friday it would start to remove the customer purchasing limits it imposed to prevent coronavirus stockpiling as customers start to buy just what they need.

Headlines: U.S. appeals court asks why Facebook encryption order should stay sealed
Description: Federal appeals court judges asked prosecutors on Tuesday why a lower court could seal a ruling that absolved Facebook from having to wiretap a criminal suspect using one of the companys encrypted services.

Headlines: U.S. senator calls for action on forced labor in China's Xinjiang
Description: A senior U.S. senator on Tuesday accused U.S. firms of willfully ignoring "horrific" forced labor conditions in China's Xinjiang region and called on the Commerce Department to stop American companies and consumers buying goods produced by such labor.

Headlines: Incoming BASF boss rules out DowDuPont-style break-up
Description: The incoming boss of BASF  has thrown his weight behind the chemical titan's contentious strategy of keeping divergent businesses folded into one company, at a time when its major rivals such as DowDuPont are breaking themselves up.

Headlines: U.S. stock futures hit five-month high
Description: U.S. stock futures rose to a five-month high on Friday, extending their recent rally on expectations of solid earnings growth among U.S. firms despite threats from trade wars.

Headlines: Renewed U.S.-China trade tensions push down Wall Street
Description: Wall Street's major indexes dipped on Wednesday as inflamed trade tensions between the United States and China weighed on investor sentiment.

Headlines: Strong U.S. retail sales lift second-quarter GDP estimates
Description: U.S. retail sales rose solidly in June as households boosted  purchases of automobiles and a range of other goods, cementing expectations for robust economic growth in the second quarter.

Headlines: Head of French carmaker PSA says Europe's CO2 cuts will threaten jobs: Le Figaro
Description: The EU's plans to slash carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions from vehicles and push carmakers to go electric will threaten 13 million jobs in Europe's auto industry and benefit Asia, the head of French carmaker PSA told Le Figaro.

Headlines: Britain's Cuadrilla says 'micro seismic event' occurred at fracking site near Blackpool
Description: British shale gas company Cuadrilla Resources said a tremor measuring 2.1 ML on the Richter scale was recorded at the company's shale gas exploration site late on Saturday.

Headlines: Spotify faults itself for margin gains; stock hits new lows
Description: Spotify  sent its shares tumbling as much as 10 percent on Thursday after the world's most popular paid music streaming service said it would continue to sacrifice profit margins to generate future growth.

Headlines: U.S. urged to invest more in AI; ex-Google CEO warns of China's progress
Description: U.S. government funding in artificial intelligence has fallen short and the country needs to invest in research, train an AI-ready workforce and apply the technology to national security missions, a government-commissioned panel led by Google's former CEO said in an interim report on Monday.

Headlines: Huawei warns China will strike back against new U.S. restrictions
Description: Huawei warned on Tuesday that 2020 would be its most difficult year yet due to American trade restrictions which dealt a blow to its overseas sales in 2019, and predicted the Chinese government would retaliate against the United States.

Headlines: Big Ag turns to peas to meet soaring global protein demand
Description: Cargill, the global grains trader, sees the future of protein in the humble pea.

Headlines: China's major shareholders sell A-shares, pressuring markets
Description: Business owners and major shareholders are selling down their stakes in listed companies, producing a glut of shares in a market already under pressure from a slowing economy and the impact of the Sino-U.S. trade dispute.

Headlines: Is new Disney CEO Bob Chapek up to the task?
Description: A global pandemic and the challenge of figuring out the future of entertainment greeted Bob Chapek on Wednesday as he took over as Chief Executive Officer of Walt Disney Co .

Headlines: CBS CEO Moonves survives board meeting amid misconduct probe
Description: CBS Corp's  board left Chief Executive Leslie Moonves in his post on Monday as it discussed sexual harassment claims against him and took steps to select an outside counsel to lead an independent investigation into the matter, the company said in a statement.

Headlines: Standard Chartered  compliance chief leaves bank after investigation
Description: Standard Chartered  compliance chief Neil Barry will leave the bank with immediate effect, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters, after an investigation into his behavior.

Headlines: Safran CEO cautious on supply chain once Boeing grounding lifted
Description: The head of French jet engine maker Safran  has voiced caution over the ability of aerospace supply chains to ramp up quickly after the return to service of the Boeing 737 MAX, which has been grounded for months following two fatal accidents.

Headlines: Blackstone raises offer for Japan's Unizo, tops Lone Star's bid
Description: Blackstone Group  has raised its proposed offer to buy Japanese hotel chain Unizo Holdings  to 6,000 yen ($53.78) from 5,600 yen per share, the U.S. private equity firm said on Monday, topping a bid by U.S. investment fund Lone Star.

Headlines: Astellas ramps up M&A, buys U.S. biotech Xyphos for as much as $665 million
Description: Astellas Pharma Inc  has bought U.S.-based Xyphos Biosciences Inc to expand its immuno-oncology business, a deal worth up to $665 million including potential development milestones and its second acquisition announced this month.

Headlines: Siemens steels itself for EU rejection of rail merger with Alstom
Description: Siemens will accept defeat if the European Union rejects its pleas to allow it to combine with Alstom to create a powerful Franco-German rail business.

Headlines: Wall Street tumbles, S&P falls as much as 2 percent
Description: Wall Street's major indexes fell on Monday, with the S&P 500 sliding 2 percent, weighed by technology and financial stocks as shares of Apple Inc  and Goldman Sachs Group Inc  came under pressure.

Headlines: Global stocks rally, yuan surges as investors bet on China revival
Description: Global stock markets rallied and China's yuan posted its biggest gain since December on Monday as investors bet the Chinese economy would boost global growth even as surging coronavirus cases delayed business re-openings across the United States.

Headlines: China's ZTE shakes up board in bid for U.S. ban lift
Description: Chinese telecoms giant ZTE Corp announced a new board on Friday in a radical management shakeup as part of a $1.4 billion deal with the United States, moving it closer towards getting a devastating American supplier ban lifted.

Headlines: Forecasters unanimous: U.S.-China trade war bad for economy - Reuters poll
Description: The U.S. economy will expand at a robust pace in coming quarters but slow to 2 percent by the end of 2019, according to forecasters polled by Reuters who unanimously said the escalating trade war with China was bad economic policy.

Headlines: Los Angeles delays movie theater reopenings after rise in coronavirus cases
Description: Los Angeles Mayor Eric Garcetti on Monday announced he was taking a "hard pause" on when movie theaters in the city can reopen, citing an increase in coronavirus cases.

Headlines: Tencent targets 10 percent of managers for job cuts or demotion: Bloomberg
Description: Tencent Holdings Ltd is putting about 10 percent of its managers on notice, as China's largest gaming and social media company shakes up its workforce amid cooling growth and intensified competition, Bloomberg reported on Tuesday, citing sources.

Headlines: Exhausted Dutch minister leading coronavirus fight quits
Description: The minister leading the Dutch government's fight against the coronavirus resigned on Thursday, a day after collapsing from exhaustion during a parliamentary debate on the epidemic.

Headlines: EU's Moscovici warns of hit to markets if trade tensions escalate
Description: A further escalation in trade policy tensions between the European Union and the United States would hit financial markets and hurt both sides, said European Commissioner for Economic and Financial Affairs Pierre Moscovici.

Headlines: OPEC sees oil rally towards $80 as short-term spike, not supply-driven
Description: OPEC sees oil's rally towards $80 a barrel as a short-term spike driven by geopolitics rather than any supply shortage, four OPEC delegates said, a sign the group is not rushing yet to rethink its supply-cutting agreement.

Headlines: Turkey's economic pain felt as far as Tennessee
Description: Turkey's currency crisis has roiled emerging-markets investors far and wide, including the U.S. state of Tennessee, where the state's retirement system is the biggest institutional holder in a Turkey exchange-traded fund (ETF).

Headlines: GM to invest $2.2 billion at Detroit factory to make electric trucks, SUVs
Description: General Motors Co will invest $2.2 billion in its Detroit-Hamtramck assembly plant to build electric trucks and sport utility vehicles, a move that would create 2,200 jobs, the No.1 U.S. automaker said on Monday.

Headlines: Veritas Capital, Elliott clinch $5.5 billion acquisition of Athenahealth: sources
Description: Private equity firm Veritas Capital and hedge fund Elliott Management have agreed to acquire U.S. healthcare software maker Athenahealth Inc  for $5.5 billion in cash, people familiar with the matter said on Sunday.

Headlines: ValueAct's Ubben cheers BlackRock's new stance on climate change
Description: Investor Jeffrey Ubben, already betting there is money to be made from coaxing corporations into being better citizens, gained an ally on Tuesday when BlackRock Inc chief Laurence Fink told companies to tackle climate change or face his wrath.

Headlines: Alibaba's on-demand online services unit valued at $30 billion: sources
Description: Alibaba Group's newly formed on-demand online services unit has rocketed in value to as much as $30 billion after raising $4 billion in fresh funds, people with knowledge of the situation told Reuters.

Headlines: Amazon jitters offset upbeat jobs data on Wall Street
Description: Wall Street ended mixed on Friday, as optimism from a surge in January U.S. job growth was offset by a weaker-than-expected outlook from Amazon.com Inc that battered retail stocks.

Headlines: Instant View: China media say some progress made with U.S. in trade dispute talks
Description: China and the United States have reached a consensus on some areas of their trade dispute but are still relatively far apart on other issues, China's official Xinhua news agency said on Friday.

Headlines: China, Greece agree to push ahead with COSCO's Piraeus Port investment
Description: China and Greece agreed on Monday to push ahead with a 600 million euros investment by COSCO Shipping into Greece's largest port, Piraeus, as part of efforts to boost its role as a hub in rapidly growing trade between Asia and Europe.

Headlines: Turkey says nothing will come of Halkbank case if law in U.S. works
Description: Nothing will come of a case against Turkey's state-owned lender Halkbank "if the law in the United States works", Turkish Foreign Minister Mevlut Cavusoglu said on Sunday, adding that the case was politically motivated.

Headlines: Amazon leases 12 aircraft to bolster air cargo fleet
Description: Amazon.com Inc  said on Wednesday it leased 12 Boeing 767-300 converted cargo aircraft from Air Transport Services Group Inc , bringing its total fleet to more than 80, as it pushes for faster delivery to meet a surge in online orders.

Headlines: Emirates to operate limited passenger services to U.S., Asia, North Africa
Description: Dubai's Emirates said on Monday it planned to operate limited passenger services to Algiers, Tunis, Jakarta, Manila, Taipei, Kabul and Chicago.

Headlines: Toyota to invest $170 million in Mississippi plant, create 400 jobs
Description: Toyota Motor Corp  will invest $170 million in an existing plant in Mississippi to build the next generation of its Corolla sedan, the Japanese automaker said on Thursday.

Headlines: Conagra mitigates inflation hit with fewer discounts, cost control
Description: Conagra Brands Inc  reported third-quarter profit above market estimates and raised its full-year profit forecast as the maker of Swiss Miss cocoa countered higher commodities and freight costs by cutting back on discounts and other expenses.

Headlines: EU says Johnson & Johnson's deal for Takeda patch may harm competition
Description: EU antitrust regulators have opened a full investigation into Johnson & Johnson's acquisition of Takeda Pharmaceutical's surgical patch product TachoSil, concerned that the deal could lead to reduced choice and higher prices for customers.

Headlines: Stocks gain on China trade data, easing pandemic worries
Description: Equity markets rallied globally on Tuesday as Chinese trade data defied expectations of a deep downturn as a result of the coronavirus pandemic, igniting hopes that world economies can soon recover and removing the safe-haven allure of the greenback.

Headlines: Ford set to end production at Blanquefort in France, jobs at risk
Description: Ford  will end production at its Blanquefort plant in France by late August next year after rejecting a rescue deal for the factory, in a move which drew the ire of France's finance minister due to the risk of large-scale job losses.

Headlines: Growing field of activist investors pushes companies to perform better
Description: More investors who typically make passive bets flexed their muscles last year and helped push a total of 922 companies to perform better by improving operations and capital allocation, data from research group Activist Insight show.

Headlines: Iran says Trump responsible for high oil prices: Shana
Description: * Iran oil minister Bijan Zanganeh says the real responsibility for the current oil price hike lies with the U.S. President - Shana

Headlines: Global stocks fall on U.S.-China trade spat, oil rises
Description: Global stocks ended lower on Monday as investors eyed an escalating trade dispute between the United States and China while oil prices rose on bets that an OPEC production increase would be smaller than expected.

Headlines: OPEC oil output drops on Saudi cut, outages and sanctions
Description: OPEC oil supply has fallen in January by the largest amount in two years, a Reuters survey found, as Saudi Arabia and its Gulf allies over-delivered on the group's supply-cutting pact while Iran, Libya and Venezuela registered involuntary declines.

Headlines: Hyundai Motor posts big profit miss on U.S. recalls; shares dive
Description: Hyundai Motor Co's  third-quarter net profit plunged by a shocking two-thirds, hit by a $440 million one-off charge related to U.S. recalls and sending its shares tumbling to near nine-year-lows on Thursday.

Headlines: Foxconn, Chinese firms refit production lines to make masks amid virus outbreak
Description: A number of Chinese manufacturers including a subsidiary of Apple Inc  partner Foxconn  have refitted production lines to make masks and medical clothing, as a deadly coronavirus spreads across China.

Headlines: Hedge fund heaps criticism on Tesla after Musk's conference call
Description: A small hedge fund manager who has long been betting against Tesla Inc  on Thursday redoubled his call for the stock to fall to zero, comments that came as investors were already hammering the electric car maker.

Headlines: Ghosn would not get fair trial if tried alongside former employer Nissan, lawyer says
Description: Ousted Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn would not get a fair trial by a Tokyo court if he were tried alongside his former employer, a lawyer for Ghosn said on Tuesday, saying the carmaker was more like a prosecutor than a defendant in the case.

Headlines: Exxon shareholders soundly reject splitting CEO/chairman roles
Description: Exxon Mobil Corp  shareholders soundly rejected climate-related proposals and splitting the chairman and chief executive's roles at the oil major's shareholder meeting on Wednesday.

Headlines: Samsung retrieving all Galaxy Fold samples after defect reports: source
Description: Samsung Electronics is retrieving all Galaxy Fold samples distributed to reviewers, a person with direct knowledge of the matter said on Tuesday, as the firm smarts from the reputational blow of postponing the launch of its first foldable smartphone.

Headlines: Summer is over for investors as global worries build
Description: Investors returning from their summer holidays in the coming days are likely to feel a distinct chill in the air as they assess the world economy.

Headlines: More than 100 British companies halt dividend payments due to coronavirus pandemic
Description: More than 100 British companies have postponed or ditched dividend payments in a bid to preserve cash for what could be a lengthy enforced shutdown of large parts of the UK and global economy due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Stocks and oil up, but US dollar slips amid ongoing geopolitical risk
Description: Stocks across the globe rose on Monday, helping lift oil prices, but shares on Wall Street ended far from their highs after the FBI raided the offices of President Donald Trump's long time lawyer.

Headlines: No threats to break UK intellgence ties after 5G decision: security source
Description: There have been no threats from other countries' intelligence agencies to break ties with Britain after it announced it would grant Huawei a limited role in its 5G mobile network, a British security source said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Oil gains over 1 percent as Saudi stands by OPEC output cuts
Description: Oil prices rose more than 1 percent on Monday, lifted by comments from Saudi Energy Minister Khalid al-Falih that an end to OPEC-led supply cuts was unlikely before June.

Headlines: Fed Chair Powell says strong job market can reduce U.S. racial inequality
Description: The best way the Federal Reserve can help reduce racial inequality is to return the U.S. labor market to its pre-coronavirus strength, U.S. Fed Chair Jerome Powell said on Tuesday, as he sidestepped questions over whether the Fed itself contributes to the problem.

Headlines: VW's Porsche expects to repeat record vehicle sales this year
Description: Volkswagen's  Porsche brand does not need a stock market listing to fund growth, Chief Executive Oliver Blume said, adding he is confident the maker of the iconic 911 sportscar can repeat last year's record sales in 2018.

Headlines: IBM seeks $167 million from Groupon in dispute over early internet patents
