Description: International Business Machines Corp on Monday asked a U.S. jury to award it $167 million in a lawsuit accusing e-commerce marketplace operator Groupon Inc of using patented technology without authorization.

Headlines: Apple shipped 2.5 million iPhones in China in March following virus slump: government data
Description: Apple Inc  shipped roughly 2.5 million iPhones in China in March, a slight rebound after one of its worst months in the country ever, according to government data published on Friday.

Headlines: Focus squarely on Trump as Dec 15 tariffs loom in US-China trade war
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump has days to decide whether to impose tariffs on nearly $160 billion in Chinese consumer goods just weeks before Christmas, a move that could be unwelcome in both the United States and China.

Headlines: United Air CEO grilled over NRA discount, workers rights at annual meeting
Description: United Airlines executives faced questions about ending its discount for a gun rights group and how it treats its workers at the carrier's annual shareholders meeting on Wednesday.

Headlines: Irish regulator investigates Facebook over private photo glitch
Description: An Irish regulator said on Friday it was investigating Facebook Inc  following the company's disclosure that a bug may have exposed private photos of up to 6.8 million users, the latest in a series of Facebook privacy glitches.

Headlines: Aston Martin unveils 'sports car for the skies' at airshow
Description: James Bond would love it. Aston Martin, maker of the luxury sports cars favored by the fictional British spy, has now come up with a futuristic personal aircraft it has dubbed "a sports car for the skies".

Headlines: 'Bull's-eye' landing caps Boeing's faulty astronaut capsule test mission
Description: Boeing Co's  Starliner astronaut spacecraft made a "bull's-eye" landing in the New Mexico desert on Sunday, a successful ending to a crewless test mission that two days earlier failed to reach the orbit needed to dock with the International Space Station.

Headlines: Timeline: Key dates in the U.S.-China trade war
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump and Chinese Vice Premier Liu He

Headlines: Fed raises interest rates, signals more hikes ahead
Description: After weeks of market volatility and calls by President Donald Trump for the Federal Reserve to stop raising interest rates, the U.S. central bank instead did it again, and stuck by a plan to keep withdrawing support from an economy it views as strong.

Headlines: Phase one trade deal with China is in good shape: U.S. Commerce Secretary
Description: The initial "phase one" trade pact with China appears to be in good shape and is likely to be signed around mid-November, although a finite date is still in question, U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross said on Friday.

Headlines: Factbox: The Australian financial crime regulator's accusations against Westpac
Description: Australia's Westpac Banking Corp  has been accused of 23 million breaches of anti-money laundering law, with regulators saying the company enabled payments from convicted child sex offenders and "high risk" countries over half a decade.

Headlines: France's Macron: G7 statement on trade only first step
Description: French President Emmanuel Macron said on Saturday that a joint statement from Group of Seven nations was just a first step and marked an attempt to "stabilize things" as a trade dispute with the United States threatened to tear the alliance apart.

Headlines: Gojek CEO quits to join Indonesian cabinet, replacements named
Description: Gojek CEO and co-founder Nadiem Makarim said on Monday he had resigned to join Indonesia's new cabinet, and the ride-hailing and payments company said two senior executives would jointly take over running operations of the $10 billion firm.

Headlines: Trump, Xi reaffirm backing for Phase 1 of U.S.-China trade deal
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump expressed confidence in China's strength and resilience in confronting its coronavirus outbreak during a conversation with President Xi Jinping on Thursday, a White House spokesman said.

Headlines: British Airways-owner IAG lifts ownership restrictions, boosting shares
Description: British Airways-owner IAG  lifted a restriction on non-EU investors' ability to buy its stock, helping boost its share price by more than 5%.

Headlines: MSCI CEO says limiting capital flows to China would be 'devastating'
Description: Restricting the flow of U.S. capital to China would have a "devastating" impact on global markets, the head of index provider MSCI Inc  told CNBC on Friday.

Headlines: Murdoch's Fox launches sports betting with FOX Bet
Description: When Rupert Murdoch's Fox Corp  launches the FOX Bet sports betting platform on Monday, it will do what no other major media company has done in North America: become the face of a sports gambling platform.

Headlines: Tesla plans to use stock-cash mix to pay off March debt: Bloomberg
Description: Tesla Inc will pay a 50-50 mix of stock and cash to holders of its bonds due in March, if they elect to convert the debt, Bloomberg reported on Thursday, citing a copy of the settlement notice.

Headlines: Trump says trade negotiations with China going very well
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Wednesday sounded a positive note on the ongoing trade talks with China, telling reporters that Washington had sent a talented team of negotiators to Beijing this week and the negotiations are going along very well.

Headlines: UK says will fly back 4,500 people on Friday after Thomas Cook failure
Description: Britain's Civil Aviation Authority (CAA) said it plans to fly 26 flights on Friday to bring another 4,500 people back to the country after the collapse of travel firm Thomas Cook.

Headlines: China vowed to move immediately on new trade commitments: U.S. official
Description: China vowed over the weekend to move immediately on new commitments it made to improve trade relations with the United States, a top White House official said on Monday.

Headlines: Google removes ads served to users seeking voting info for 'misrepresentation'
Description: Google  said on Monday it had removed ads for companies that charge people large fees to register to vote or harvest their data, which appeared when users searched for voter information.

Headlines: Cheesed-off European dairy producers dismayed at U.S. tariffs
Description: European cheese makers complained on Thursday of being held "hostage" in a transatlantic trade battle that had nothing to do with them after the United States slapped 25% tariffs on the sector in retaliation for state aid to aerospace group Airbus.

Headlines: China warns UK: 'Dumping' Huawei will cost you
Description: China warned British Prime Minister Boris Johnson on Wednesday that his decision to ban Huawei from the 5G network would cost Britain dearly in investment, casting the move as the result of politicised pressure from U.S. President Donald Trump.

Headlines: Exclusive: Mexican private sector pitches $92 billion in energy investment - document
Description: Mexico's private sector has drawn up a broad package of proposed energy investments for the government worth almost $92 billion, according to a document seen by Reuters on Wednesday, providing a potential lift to the country's misfiring economy.

Headlines: 'Fasten your seatbelt': Investors brace for Europe Inc. results amid coronavirus
Description: Investors will be hunting for companies that can rein in costs, preserve cash and avoid amassing big inventories during the coronavirus crisis as Europe Inc. prepares to report the steepest profit fall since the 2008 global financial meltdown.

Headlines: Thyssenkrupp needs new strategy, targets not enough: investor
Description: Thyssenkrupp  needs a broad overhaul in strategy carried about by a new external chief executive, as mid-term targets announced this week will not be enough to put the German group back on track, according to one of its investors.

Headlines: BlackRock strategists advocate trimming investment portfolio risk
Description: Strategists at the world's largest asset manager BlackRock Inc told their financial adviser clients on Wednesday to look at cutting back on risk and lower expectations for high returns on stocks and bonds.

Headlines: Russia to keep U.S. investor Calvey under house arrest until January: TASS
Description: A court in Moscow ruled on Tuesday that U.S. investor Michael Calvey should remain under house arrest facing charges of embezzlement until January 13, the TASS news agency reported.

Headlines: BMW says May sales of BMW, Mini vehicles dip due to China tariffs
Description: BMW  said vehicle sales fell 2.1 percent in May, weighed down by China tariffs, the launch of a new model, and a 13.6 percent drop in German deliveries as cities like Hamburg started banning older diesel vehicles from key streets.

Headlines: Trial of former Nissan boss Ghosn's expected to start in September: NHK
Description: The trial of former Nissan Motor Co boss Carlos Ghosn on charges of under-reporting his salary is expected to start in Tokyo in September, Japan's public broadcaster NHK said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Brazil investors pour record $5.4 billion into domestic equity funds: BAML
Description: Brazilian investors are pouring a record amount of cash into local equity funds, while foreign investors notched up their sixth straight week of buying, Bank of America Merrill Lynch said on Friday.

Headlines: Turkey unveils first fully homemade car in $3.7 billion bet on electric
Description: Turkey unveiled its first fully domestically-produced car on Friday, saying it aimed to eventually produce up to 175,000 a year of the electric vehicle in a project expected to cost 22 billion lira ($3.7 billion) over 13 years.

Headlines: Halfway through, 2018 delivers little to S&P 500 investors
Description: Halfway through 2018, investing in Wall Street's leading S&P 500 stock index has been nothing to shout about.

Headlines: Global airfares, hotel rates to rise in 2019: industry forecast
Description: A strong global economy and rising oil prices are expected to push up the cost of air travel in 2019, with fares seen rising 2.6 percent and hotel rates up 3.7 percent, although there are downside risks from a trade war, according to an industry forecast.

Headlines: Factbox: Huawei's involvement in telecoms networks around the world
Description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson is set to ban Huawei Technologies Co from Britain's 5G network on Tuesday, angering China but delighting U.S. President Donald Trump by signalling that the world's biggest telecoms equipment maker is no longer welcome in the West.

Headlines: Berlin declines to comment on reports Deutsche Bankseeking new CEO
Description: The German government on Wednesday declined to comment on reports that lender Deutsche Bank  has begun searching for a new chief executive.

Headlines: Lloyds Bank boss Horta-Osrio to step down after a decade at the helm
Description: Lloyds Bank  Chief Executive Antnio Horta-Osrio said on Monday he would step down next year after a decade at the helm, leaving Britain's biggest domestic bank to find a successor to steer it through the coronavirus fallout.

Headlines: Oil jumps on U.S. plans to tighten Iran sanctions; dollar eases
Description: Crude oil jumped almost 3% on Monday after the United States said it will take more steps to choke off Iranian oil exports, while U.S. equities were mixed as Wall Street braced for corporate results in a busy earnings week.

Headlines: Trump tweetstorm hasn't slanted view of Fed : Reuters poll
Description: President Donald Trump's barrage of tweets blasting the U.S. Federal Reserve appears to have been ignored by both Republicans and Democrats who largely see the central bank as neutral in its decision making, according to results of a new Reuters Ipsos poll.

Headlines: Home-bound users fume as video apps do not sync with TVs
Description: Kat Volpe laid out an exercise mat and tried to sync her iPhone with her big screen TV for a fitness class webcast on Instagram last week during New York's coronavirus lockdown.

Headlines: Amazon unsuccessfully approached UK supermarket Waitrose in 2017: Sunday Times
Description: Amazon  made an unsuccessful informal attempt to buy upmarket British supermarket chain Waitrose late last year, the Sunday Times newspaper reported.

Headlines: Walmart seeks ad business boost in fight with Amazon
Description: Walmart Inc will consolidate advertising sales for its stores and websites, it said on Tuesday, aiming to boost profits from an untapped business as the world's largest retailer competes with marketing titans Amazon.com Inc, Alphabet Inc's Google and Facebook Inc.

Headlines: Buffett says wealthy Americans are 'definitely undertaxed'
Description: Billionaire investor Warren Buffett said on Monday that the wealthy, including himself, are not paying enough taxes.

Headlines: Another victim of coronavirus: Spain's religious statue-kissing
Description: A Spanish pre-Easter tradition, where Catholics flock in droves to kiss statues of Jesus and Mary, fell victim to the coronavirus epidemic this week as churches with some of the most sought-after statues told worshippers not to touch or kiss them.

Headlines: Dell maintains plans to go public despite Icahn opposition
Description: Dell Technologies Inc said on Tuesday it was sticking to its plans to go public by buying back its tracking stock , a day after activist investor Carl Icahn opposed the move.

Headlines: Walmart opens first small high-tech supermarket in China
Description: (Walmart corrects online platform where its products can be bought, to JD Daojia, not JD.com, in this April 2nd story)

Headlines: Thyssenkrupp in leadership turmoil as chairman quits
Description: The chairman of Germany's Thyssenkrupp  has resigned, following the company's chief executive under pressure from activist shareholders demanding a radical restructuring of the embattled industrial conglomerate.

Headlines: Zoom hires ex-Facebook security chief as Google bans desktop app
Description: Zoom Video Communications Inc  has tapped former Facebook security chief Alex Stamos as an adviser as safety and privacy concerns about its fast-growing video-conferencing app drive a global backlash against the company.

Headlines: Mexico, U.S. officials meet in high-stakes tariff talks at White House
Description: Mexican officials met with their U.S. counterparts for talks in Washington on Wednesday aimed at reaching a deal to stave off the imposition of U.S. tariffs on Mexican goods next week, even as their government prepared to retaliate if duties go ahead.

Headlines: Walmart to pay $282 million to settle seven-year global corruption probe
Description: Walmart Inc said on Thursday it will pay $282 million to settle a seven-year-long investigation into whether its overseas units in Mexico, Brazil, China and India violated the U.S. Foreign Corrupt Practices Act.

Headlines: S&P cuts Airbus outlook amid concern over deliveries, advances
Description: Ratings agency Standard & Poors placed Airbus  on its watch list for a possible downgrade as doubts surfaced over the future level of aircraft deliveries and advance payments from airlines battered by the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Venezuela turns to India for oil exports as U.S. sanctions bite
Description: Venezuelan oil company PDVSA is looking to double exports to India as U.S. sanctions hobble deliveries to the United States and Europe.

Headlines: Dongfeng and PSA extend joint venture despite stake sale to smooth mega-merger
Description: China's Dongfeng Motor Group  and Peugeot maker PSA  are extending their business cooperation, despite the Chinese company reducing its stake in PSA to help smooth the French carmaker's merger with Fiat Chrysler Automobiles (FCA).

Headlines: Airlines urge regulators not to compete on safety after Boeing crisis
Description: Global airlines urged regulators on Friday not to compete over setting new safety rules, after two crashes led to the grounding of the Boeing 737 MAX and raised questions about the international influence of the U.S. aviation authority.

Headlines: Cathay Pacific CEO 'relatively confident' air cargo market will pick up in second half
Description: Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd Chief Executive Rupert Hogg said he was "relatively confident" the air cargo market would pick up in the second half after a weak start to the year.

Headlines: Nissan may report first quarterly loss since March 2009: sources
Description: Nissan Motor Co  may report its first quarterly loss in more than a decade on Thursday because of slumping sales, sources familiar with the company said, adding more pressure on efforts to rebuild the company after Carlos Ghosn's ouster.

Headlines: Airbus picks planes boss Faury as next CEO to end uncertainty
Description: Planemaking boss Guillaume Faury was named as the next chief executive of Airbus  on Monday, ending months of uncertainty over the leadership of Europe's largest aerospace group and underlining the dominance of its commercial jet arm.

Headlines: France's Atos boosts U.S. presence with Syntel acquisition
Description: French IT services company Atos  is boosting its North American operations with a $3.4 billion cash deal to buy Michigan-based IT services provider Syntel Inc .

Headlines: Czech breweries roll back the barrels, turn to bottles and cans
Description: Czech breweries -- including Pilsner Urquell and Budejovicky Budvar -- have stopped refilling kegs and started storing their beer in cooled cellars as they seek to limit damage from pub closures caused by the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Factbox: What is Slack?
Description: Slack Technologies Inc, whose instant messaging app has taken workplaces by storm, went public via a direct listing on June 20, instead of the more popular initial public offering route.

Headlines: U.S. labor market slowing as job openings, hiring fall
Description: U.S. job openings and hiring fell in June, suggesting that demand for labor was cooling in tandem with a slowing economy, which could provide another reason for the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates again next month.

Headlines: SEC rescinds guidance that bolstered proxy advisers
Description: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission handed public companies a procedural victory on Thursday in their efforts to reduce the influence of proxy advisory firms, rescinding a pair of staff letters that critics said encouraged mutual funds to rely on their recommendations.

Headlines: UniCredit renews commitment to boosting shareholder returns: chairman
Description: UniCredit  remains strongly committed to increasing returns for investors in Italy's biggest bank, its chairman said, following a decision to suspend dividend payments and a share buyback to comply with supervisory guidance.

Headlines: Merck to buy Austrian vaccine maker as it jumps into COVID-19 race
Description: Merck & Co Inc , which has largely kept to the sidelines of the race for COVID-19 treatments, said it was buying Austrian vaccine maker Themis Bioscience and would collaborate with research nonprofit IAVI to develop two separate vaccines.

Headlines: WPP's Sorrell to attend board meeting as investigation continues: source
Description: WPP  Chief Executive Martin Sorrell is expected to attend a long-planned board meeting next Tuesday despite an ongoing investigation into an allegation of misconduct that was ordered by the directors, a person familiar with his plans said.

Headlines: Deutsche-Commerzbank merger collapse just delays sector revamp: UBS CEO
Description: Consolidation in the European banking industry remains inevitable, UBS Chief Executive Sergio Ermotti told journalists on Thursday after Deutsche Bank and Commerzbank called off talks.

Headlines: Airbus to furlough 3,200 staff at Broughton factory in Wales
Description: Airbus  will furlough around 3,200 staff at its Broughton factory in Wales, the European planemaker said on Monday after it warned staff that the coronavirus crisis had put its survival at stake.

Headlines: China refuses to concede on U.S. demands to ease curbs on tech firms: FT
Description: Ahead of fresh high-level trade talks this week, China is not conceding to U.S. demands to ease curbs on technology companies, the Financial Times reported on Sunday, citing three people briefed on the discussions.

Headlines: Brazil's Petrobras revisits whistleblowers in wake of trading scandal
Description: Brazil's Petroleo Brasileiro SA is re-examining its treatment of whistleblower complaints after the indictment of six of the state-run oil firm's traders in December indicated that efforts to root out corruption had faltered, according to three people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Sale of shut Philly refinery to real estate developer delayed
Description: The closing of a $252 million sale of the Philadelphia Energy Solutions (PES) oil refinery to a Chicago-based real estate developer has been delayed, a city official and source with knowledge of the agreement said on Friday.

Headlines: We won't meddle in Lufthansa operating business, says German minister
Description: German Economy Minister Peter Altmaier said on Thursday the government would not get involved in the operating business of airline Lufthansa  after shareholders approved a 9 billion euro ($10 billion) government bailout.

Headlines: U.S. firms sour on their future in China as trade war bites: AmCham
Description: The China-U.S. trade war is souring the profit and investment outlook for U.S. companies operating in the world's second-biggest economy, a survey by a prominent American business association showed.

Headlines: Volkswagen CEO concerned Russia-U.S. sanctions row could hit partner GAZ
Description: Volkswagen  is concerned that a row between the United States and Russia over new sanctions imposed by the United States could hit business with its Russian partner GAZ Group , Chief Executive Herbert Diess said on Friday.

Headlines: Uber launches boat service in Nigeria's megacity Lagos
Description: Global ride-hailing firm Uber Technologies Inc [UBER.UL] on Friday launched a pilot test of a boat service in Nigeria's commercial capital Lagos to attract commuters seeking to avoid the megacity's notoriously congested roads.

Headlines: China willing to work with U.S. to implement Argentina talks agreement: Foreign Ministry
Description: China is willing to work with the United States to implement the consensus reached during talks between the two countries' leaders in Argentina, the Chinese foreign ministry said in a statement on Sunday.

Headlines: German prosecutors charge ex-Audi boss Stadler over emissions cheating
Description: German prosecutors said on Wednesday they had filed charges against former Audi Chief Executive Rupert Stadler, who is being investigated over his role in Volkswagen's  emissions test cheating scandal.

Headlines: U.S. markets gyrate after Fed cuts rates, stocks fall
Description: Wall Street turned negative after Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell characterized the U.S. central bank's first rate cut since 2008 as a "mid-cycle adjustment to policy," suggesting the move was not the start of a lengthy series of rate cuts.

Headlines: Exclusive: Europe to tell G20 rising trade tensions can seriously hit global growth
Description: European Union countries will tell the world's financial leaders next month that rising trade tensions can have a "serious adverse" effect on global growth and that they should reject protectionism and commit to solving disputes through the WTO.

Headlines: Boeing fix will prevent repeated activation of anti-stall system: sources
Description: A Boeing Co software fix for the grounded 737 MAX will prevent repeated operation of an anti-stall system at the center of safety concerns and deactivate it altogether if two sensors disagree widely, two people familiar with pilot briefings said.

Headlines: U.S. asks allies to shun Huawei equipment, WSJ reports; sector stocks fall
Description: The U.S. government is trying to persuade wireless and internet providers in allied countries to avoid telecommunications equipment from China's Huawei Technologies [HWT.UL], the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. pension funds may pour $400 billion into stocks, lifting virus-hit markets: JP Morgan
Description: U.S. pension funds that delayed rebalancing their portfolios are likely to pump about $400 billion into stocks over the next two quarters, analysts at JP Morgan said, providing a potential boost to equity markets battered by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Credit Suisse CEO targets annual profit of 5-6 billion Swiss francs: newspaper
Description: Credit Suisse  is aiming for an annual profit of 5 to 6 billion Swiss francs for the next two years as the bank puts its problems behind it, Chief Executive Tidjane Thiam told Swiss newspaper NZZ am Sonntag in an interview to be published on Sunday.

Headlines: Airbnb warns 2020 revenue can fall by half amid COVID-19 hit: The Information
Description: Home rental company Airbnb has projected its revenue can fall about 54% to some $2.2 billion this year due to the COVID-19 pandemic, The Information reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: U.S. in China trade talks again, demands 'change of posture'
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's top economic adviser said on Tuesday that the United States welcomed the resumption of talks with China on trade, while Vice President Mike Pence warned Beijing to change its behavior so as to avoid a new cold war with the United States.

Headlines: Wizz Air suspends all flights to and from Varna over coronavirus
Description: Wizz Air  has suspended all flights to and from Bulgarian city of Varna in an attempt to help curb the spread of the coronavirus, the low-cost carrier said in a statement on Tuesday.

Headlines: Trump welcomes China's call for 'calm' trade talks, wants same in Hong Kong
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday said China's call for "calm" trade negotiations sent a positive message and should also be applied to the situation in Hong Kong.

Headlines: Boeing's engine proposal deadline looms for new mid-market jet: report
Description: Three of the largest engine makers face a Wednesday deadline to provide Boeing Co  with formal proposals for how they would power the planemaker's possible new mid-market jet, an aviation magazine reported.

Headlines: Ukraine to block entry to residents registered in separatist-held areas to stop coronavirus spread
Description: Ukraine's government at a televised meeting on Friday decided to ban citizens registered in separatist-held territory in the eastern Donbass region from entering government-controlled areas.

Headlines: Dollar wobbles as decent U.S. data tempers safe-haven demand
Description: The dollar retreated on Wednesday in choppy trading, as generally solid U.S. economic data and improving European numbers diminished its appeal as a safe haven, though the currency's outlook remained upbeat given renewed risks posed by the novel coronavirus.

Headlines: FAA tells U.S. Senate it would need 10,000 new employees, $1.8 billion to assume all certification
Description: The Federal Aviation Administration told a U.S. Senate panel would need an additional 10,000 employees that would cost $1.8 billion if it were to assume all responsibilities for aircraft certification.

Headlines: Gulfstream expects more queries during certification after Boeing MAX crashes
Description: Gulfstream Aerospace Corp President Mark Burns said on Tuesday he expected regulators to ask for more details on software when the company certifies its new G700 long-range corporate jet, following two crashes involving the Boeing 737 MAX.

Headlines: Wall Street dominance over Europe's struggling banks hits record
Description: Wall Street's dominance over struggling European banks has reached record levels as U.S. firms reap the benefits of booming markets at home, while their transatlantic rivals are trapped in endless restructurings, data showed on Thursday.

Headlines: Lloyd's of London sets up independent group to improve culture
Description: Lloyd's of London said on Tuesday that former Virgin Money boss Jayne-Anne Gadhia would be part of a committee to "drive long-term culture change" in the world's oldest insurance market.

Headlines: Broker group warns of investor risks posed by U.S. direct share-listing proposal
Description: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission risks weakening investor protections if it allows companies to raise money in the public market through a direct listing without the support of underwriting banks, an influential broker group said on Friday.

Headlines: Japan Post Bank admits improper sales to elderly clients, discovers 19,500 cases
Description: Japan Post Bank Co Ltd  said on Friday it had improperly sold investment trust products to elderly customers in about 19,500 cases, the latest instance of misconduct at the state-backed postal and financial group before a planned share sale.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler prepares to part with Magneti Marelli
Description: Fiat Chrysler  said on Thursday its board had tasked management to proceed with spinning off Magneti Marelli and distributing shares in a new holding for 99-year old parts business to FCA investors.

Headlines: Walgreens, Rite Aid set minimum age to sell tobacco products at 21 years
Description: Drugstore retailers Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc and Rite Aid Corp will no longer sell tobacco products to customers who are below 21 years old, amid a crackdown on widespread teenage tobacco use.

Headlines: Ride-hailing companies suspend Barcelona services after new regulations
Description: Ride-hailing companies Uber and Cabify are to suspend their services in Barcelona in response to the regional government's imposition of limits on how they operate in the city.

Headlines: U.S. government sued for access to auto tariff probe report
Description: A conservative group has sued the U.S. government for access to a report on whether auto imports pose a big enough security risk to justify hefty tariffs on the sector, part of a growing chorus demanding a copy of the document.

Headlines: Fujifilm could walk away from Xerox deal if no progress for six months
Description: Japan's Fujifilm Holdings Corp  said on Thursday it may have no choice but to abandon a $6.1 billion merger with Xerox Corp  if there is no progress in talks with the U.S. firm's new board for about half a year.

Headlines: T-Mobile U.S. profit beats estimates as it signs up more customers
Description: T-Mobile US Inc first-quarter revenue and profit jumped from a year earlier, beating Wall Street's estimates, as competitive pricing lured new subscribers to its monthly cellphone plans.

Headlines: Automakers to warn Trump of $45 billion higher vehicle costs if tariff imposed
Description: An automotive trade group said on Tuesday it would tell the Trump administration that a U.S. threat to impose a tariff of up to 25 percent on imported passenger vehicles under national security grounds would cost American consumers $45 billion annually, or $5,800 per vehicle.

Headlines: Air Canada to lay off over 5,100 employees due to virus outbreak: union
Description: Air Canada  will temporarily lay off more than 5,100 employees as it attempts to check the impact of the coronavirus pandemic, the union representing the Canadian airline's flight attendants said on Friday.

Headlines: L Brands CEO in talks to step aside and sell Victoria's Secret: WSJ
Description: Victoria's Secret-owner L Brands  Chief Executive Officer Leslie Wexner is in talks to step aside from the role and is exploring strategic alternatives for the lingerie brand, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: Instant View: U.S. February job growth stalls but wage gains strong
Description: U.S. job growth almost stalled in February, with the economy creating only 20,000 jobs amid a contraction in payrolls in construction and several other sectors, which could raise concerns about a sharp slowdown in economic activity.

Headlines: Stocks flat on data, earnings; pound volatile
Description: A gauge of world stock markets was flat on Wednesday as U.S. data that raised concerns about a slowing economy was offset by a solid start to earnings season, while sterling was volatile as negotiations on a Brexit deal continued.

Headlines: Mitsubishi Aircraft signs MOU for 100 SpaceJet planes
Description: Mitsubishi Aircraft Corp and Mesa Airlines Inc, a regional airline operator, entered into a memorandum of understanding to begin talks on purchase of 100 SpaceJet M100 aircraft.

Headlines: Ryanair says European delays may mean no 737 MAX jets for next summer
Description: Ryanair  may not receive any 737 MAX aircraft from Boeing  in time for its summer season due to European delays in testing the grounded jets, Chief Executive Michael O'Leary said.

Headlines: UPS buying 10,000 electric delivery vans, will test Waymo self-driving vehicles next month
Description: United Parcel Service Inc on Wednesday expanded its efforts to cut emissions and delivery costs with separate deals to order 10,000 electric delivery trucks from UK-based Arrival Ltd and test Waymo self-driving vehicles to carry packages.

Headlines: German transport ministry confirms official hearing on Opel emissions
Description: The German transport ministry confirmed on Sunday that the country's federal motor vehicle authority (KBA) is conducting an official hearing into the emissions technology used in three models of car made by Opel.

Headlines: Egypt's top administrative court lifts ban on Uber, Careem services
Description: Egypt's top administrative court on Saturday lifted a ban on operations by ride-hailing companies Uber and Careem, which have faced fierce opposition from traditional taxi drivers, a judicial source and lawyer said.

Headlines: Facebook product chief Cox to exit as focus shifts to messaging
Description: Facebook Inc's chief product officer and one of its earliest employees, Chris Cox, said on Thursday he is leaving the company just days after Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg revealed a plan to transform the world's biggest social network into an encryption-focused messaging company.

Headlines: Japan's SoftBank taps into Mexican fintech startup Clip: sources
Description: Japan's SoftBank Group invested about $20 million in Mexican payments startup Clip early this year, one of its first Latin America deals as it launches a $5 billion technology fund in the region, said three people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Factbox: When will the Boeing 737 MAX fly again?
Description: Boeing Co's  best-selling jet, the 737 MAX, was grounded globally in March, days after the crash of an Ethiopian Airlines flight that followed a similar Lion Air disaster in Indonesia in on Oct. 29, 2018. A total of 346 people died in the two crashes.

Headlines: Total's entry into Spanish power market shows rising competition: Naturgy CEO
Description: France's Total entering Spain's electricity market through the purchase of assets from Portugal's EDP  shows how competition is increasing in the country, the Chief Executive of utility Naturgy said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Icahn launches proxy fight after stalled talks with Occidental CEO
Description: Activist investor Carl Icahn formally launched on Thursday a proxy fight against Occidental Petroleum  to win control of four board seats, a regulatory filing showed, after talks with the oil company's CEO failed to reach an agreement.

Headlines: Cambodia reports 10 new cases of coronavirus, bringing total to 47
Description: Cambodia reported 10 new cases of coronavirus on Thursday, raising its tally to 47.

Headlines: Mexico's rising oil nationalism faces debt-rating crisis
Description: Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador took office in December vowing to revive state-owned energy company Pemex and put the brakes on foreign investment to give the public a bigger cut of the country's oil wealth.

Headlines: PSA trade unions give the nod to merger with Fiat
Description: The majority of unions representing workers at Peugeot maker PSA  are in favour of a planned $50 billion merger with Fiat Chrysler , PSA executives and union representatives said.

Headlines: Fed's offered flood of credit so far just a trickle in practice
Description: The Federal Reserve's promise in the early days of the coronavirus pandemic to flood the U.S. economy with trillions of dollars seemed like the proverbial central bank bazooka.

Headlines: German regulator found defeat devices in Daimler diesel cars: BamS
Description: Germany's road vehicle authority KBA has found five "illegal switch-off devices" in Daimler  car engines, newspaper Bild am Sonntag (BamS) reported on Sunday.

Headlines: Uber signals recovery in rides as lockdown restrictions ease
Description: Uber Technologies Inc said on Wednesday trip requests were gradually picking up, but still remained significantly below prior year levels, as several countries start to lift coronavirus-led restrictions.

Headlines: Delta Air not expecting flight cancellations as result of tech issue
Description: Delta Air Lines Inc said it was not expecting flight cancellations as a result of a technical glitch that had affected booking, check-in and boarding services.

Headlines: Wells Fargo to pay special compensation to front-line workers amid coronavirus outbreak
Description: Wells Fargo & Co  will join other large U.S. banks in paying out special compensation to front-line employees, according to a memo seen on Monday by Reuters.

Headlines: Sprouts ended Amazon Prime Now delivery partnership on May 1
Description: Sprouts Farmers Market Inc  said on Thursday it ended its Prime Now delivery partnership with Amazon.com  on May 1 and cut its full-year sales targets, sending shares of the U.S. supermarket chain down almost 12 percent.

Headlines: British Boeing supplier Senior Plc reaffirms 2019 forecast
Description: British engineering firm Senior Plc reaffirmed its expectations for 2019 on Tuesday, a day after Boeing said it would suspend production of its 737 MAX jet in January.

Headlines: Timeline: Fiat Chrysler and Peugeot merger marks next round of consolidation
Description: Fiat Chrysler and Peugeot maker PSA on Wednesday reached a binding agreement for their roughly $50 billion merger, as the auto industry scrambles to develop zero-emissions vehicles and tackle slowing demand.

Headlines: Bank of England ready to replenish its COVID-19 warchest
Description: The Bank of England looks set to give itself at least another 100 billion pounds ($127 billion) in bond-buying firepower next week to try to stop the coronavirus crisis from inflicting further damage on Britain's economy.

Headlines: For Fed Chair Powell, March was pure madness as coronavirus response intensified
Description: A half-hour staff meeting in a secure location.

Headlines: As Wall Street reels, veterans recall '87 while the young look to textbooks
Description: As U.S. financial markets reel from a week of historic swings, industry veterans are drawing on memories from their earliest years on Wall Street, while younger professionals are looking to lessons from history books.

Headlines: McDonald's plans fresh round of layoffs: WSJ
Description: McDonald'sCorp is planning a new round of layoffs to flatten out its management structure further, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday, citing a company email sent to all its U.S. employees, suppliers and franchisees.

Headlines: Fed was divided on rate cut, wanted to avoid appearing on path for more cuts
Description: Federal Reserve policymakers were deeply divided over whether to cut interest rates last month but were united in wanting to signal they were not on a preset path to more cuts, a message not likely to sit well with U.S. President Donald Trump.

Headlines: Factbox: Planes, cheese, whisky and wine on U.S. tariff target list
Description: The World Trade Organization opened the door on Wednesday for the United States to impose tariffs on $7.5 billion European goods over subsidies for Airbus .

Headlines: Exclusive: South Africa seeks to unlock stalled arms sales to Saudi, UAE
Description: South Africa aims to free up over a billion dollars in stalled weapons sales, including to Saudi Arabia and United Arab Emirates, by amending a document at the heart of an export row, a senior arms control official told Reuters.

Headlines: Pipe dream? Chevron, Woodside vie to shape Australia's LNG sector
Description: After spending a decade and billions of dollars developing Australia's vast gas reserves, U.S. energy giant Chevron Corp and local firm Woodside Petroleum are at odds over the pace and timing of the next leg of expansion.

Headlines: Exclusive: Iran slams U.S. for seeking Saudi oil output hike, says OPEC wont comply
Description: Iran said on Friday a U.S. request for Saudi Arabia to pump more oil so that it could cover a drop in Iranian exports was "crazy and astonishing" and said OPEC would not heed the appeal, setting the stage for a tough OPEC meeting this month.

Headlines: China urges WTO members: Put U.S. tariff 'beast back in the cage'
Description: China called on World Trade Organization members on Monday to unite to prevent the United States "wrecking" the WTO, and it urged them to oppose U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs targeting China's alleged theft of intellectual property.

Headlines: Chile's Codelco plans to raise $1 billion in 2019
Description: Chile's state-owned miner Codelco, the world's largest copper producer, plans to raise up to $1 billion next year to help finance the overhaul of its existing mines, Chairman Juan Benavides said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Risk assets fall as Chinese virus triggers anxiety
Description: Risk assets took a hit across the globe on Tuesday, while the Japanese yen and U.S. Treasury prices gained, as financial markets reacted to mounting concern about a new strain of flu-like virus out of China.

Headlines: Equities cruise to three-month highs, dollar under protest pressure
Description: World stock markets hit their highest levels since March and oil prices jumped on Tuesday as signs of a global economic recovery from the coronavirus pandemic offset concerns over the worst civil unrest in the United States in decades.

Headlines: Asia M&A clocks second best on record, strength to persist despite trade troubles
Description: Asia Pacific M&A volumes clocked their second-highest level on record this year and dealmakers are optimistic the momentum will persist into 2019, with inbound deals into China emerging as a strong theme amid political and macroeconomic headwinds.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler to name Jeep's Manley to replace Marchionne as CEO: source
Description: Fiat Chrysler (FCA) has named Mike Manley, the head of the carmaker's profit engine Jeep, as its new chief executive, replacing Sergio Marchionne who had to step down after serious complications from surgery, a source close to the matter said.

Headlines: WTO warns of trade crisis as German car bosses face U.S. tariff talks
Description: The global system of international trade is in crisis, the World Trade Organization (WTO) warned on Tuesday, as German car bosses gathered in Washington hoping to stave off potential tariffs on U.S. imports of luxury cars.

Headlines: Small-cap S&P 600 index confirms bear market
Description: As U.S. stocks have been rocked by trade tensions and monetary policy worries, shares of small-cap companies, by one measure, have now confirmed that they are in their first bear market in three years.

Headlines: Thyssenkrupp to cut admin jobs as part of restructuring: sources
Description: Thyssenkrupp  is slashing some administrative jobs to cut down on the more than 2 billion euros ($2.2 billion) of costs it incurs in that field each year, two people familiar with the matter told Reuters on Monday.

Headlines: Melrose wins UK engineer GKN with $11 billion hostile bid
Description: Melrose Industries  has narrowly clinched an 8 billion-pound ($11 billion) takeover of British engineer GKN , winning an acrimonious three-month battle for control of the FTSE 100 company.

Headlines: GE unit wins $450 million U.S. defense contract: Pentagon
Description: GE Medical Systems Information Technologies Inc, a unit of General Electric Co, has been awarded a $450 million U.S. defense contract for patient monitoring systems, accessories and training, the Pentagon said on Friday.

Headlines: UK PM May promises to protect planemakers' supply chains in Brexit
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will on Monday seek to reassure aviation bosses that her under-fire Brexit plan won't disrupt their supply chains, and promise that the industry will flourish as Britain leaves the European Union.

Headlines: Novartis sales, profits rise in first quarter on COVID-19 buying rush
Description: Novartis  saw first-quarter sales climb as hospitals and patients stocked up on drugs to avoid being left short during the coronavirus crisis, lifting profits for the Swiss drugmaker.

Headlines: Explainer: As Draghi era ends at ECB, cheap money concerns nag
Description: Mario Draghi hands over power at the European Central Bank to Christine Lagarde amid fierce debate over the ultra-loose money policies he spearheaded to aid a eurozone recovery from the financial crisis.

Headlines: Bang & Olufsen would listen if approached by buyer: chairman
Description: Luxury TV and speaker maker Bang & Olufsen  would listen if approached by a buyer, chairman Ole Andersen told newspaper Borsen, following three earnings warnings this year.

Headlines: Bank of America executive sees consumer unit's efficiency ratio flat to down
Description: Bank of America Corp's  co-head of consumer and business banking said on Tuesday he expects the consumer banking unit's efficiency ratio to remain flat or improve further as it cuts more costs tied to moving physical checks and cash.

Headlines: Trump 2020 budget slashes foreign aid, hikes defense spending: official
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday asked Congress in his fiscal 2020 budget to slash spending for foreign aid while increasing spending on the military and for the wall he wants to build on the U.S.-Mexico border, a senior administration official told reporters.

Headlines: Olympics delay deals setback to Samsung's plans to win over Japan market
Description: For Samsung Electronics Co Ltd , the 2020 Tokyo Olympics were going to be its springboard to attain a long-held goal - making significant inroads into Japan's lucrative smartphone market where Apple Inc  dominates.

Headlines: Fed's George says standing by to lend in 'this extraordinary time'
Description: Kansas City Federal Reserve President Esther George said on Tuesday that the regional Fed bank continues to carry on with its key functions, and is ready to extend credit when needed through the U.S. central bank's emergency lending window.

Headlines: Canada's envoy to China says 'misspoke' on Huawei CFO case
Description: Canada's ambassador to China said he "misspoke" when he said Huawei Technologies Co Ltd  Chief Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou had a strong case against extradition to the United States, John McCallum said in a statement on Thursday.

Headlines: New Mexico AG sues Google for collecting school kids' personal data
Description: New Mexico Attorney General Hector Balderas on Thursday sued Alphabet Inc's  Google search engine, alleging that its educational software collects young students' personal information without the required parental consent.

Headlines: States fight bonus pay for CEO of OxyContin maker Purdue
Description: The chief executive officer of OxyContin-maker Purdue Pharma LP should not collect a potential $1.3 million bonus when he has been accused of contributing to the opioid epidemic, a group of state attorneys general said in a court filing on Monday.

Headlines: VW to intensify talks with Northvolt on battery project: Boersen-Zeitung
Description: Volkswagen is intensifying talks with Swedish startup Northvolt on plans to jointly build up battery cell production in Salzgitter, near its headquarters in Lower Saxony, one of its board members told a German newspaper.

Headlines: Cadillac edges Tesla in semi-automated driving test
Description: General Motors Cos  Cadillac outscored Tesla Inc  in a new ranking of partially automated driving systems tested by Consumer Reports and released on Thursday.

Headlines: Jaguar Land Rover to cut 4,500 jobs, mainly in Britain
Description: Britain's biggest carmaker Jaguar Land Rover said it will cut around 4,500 jobs, mainly in its home market, as it tries to tackle a slowdown in China and a slump in demand for its diesel-powered vehicles.

Headlines: J&J blockbuster loses ground to biosimilars despite Quebec court ruling
Description: Johnson & Johnson's Remicade, a blockbuster drug that treats autoimmune disorders, has steadily lost market share among patients enrolled in the Canadian province of Quebec's public drug program, even after a court ruling reinstated full coverage in January, a Reuters analysis of government data shows.

Headlines: BlackRock cuts stake in scandal-hit Danske Bank to below 5 percent
Description: BlackRock has cut its holding in Danske Bank, which is embroiled in a major money laundering scandal, Denmark's biggest bank said in a statement.

Headlines: East African airlines suspend China flights due to coronavirus
Description: Kenya Airways and RwandAir said on Friday that they had suspended all flights to and from China until further notice after a virus outbreak killed more than 200 people in China and spread to 18 countries.

Headlines: U.S. Drug distributors propose $10 billion to end state lawsuits over opioids: Bloomberg
Description: Drug wholesalers AmerisourceBergen Corp , McKesson Corp  and Cardinal Health Inc  have proposed a $10 billion settlement for claims that they played a part in the U.S. opioid epidemic, Bloomberg reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with negotiations.

Headlines: Tesla starts building Long Range Model 3 cars at China plant
Description: U.S. electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc  said on Thursday it had started producing Long Range Model 3 vehicles in its Shanghai factory and aimed to deliver them to customers soon.

Headlines: Nissan CEO calls for Renault board to review Ghosn findings
Description: Nissan  expects alliance partner Renault's  board to back its ousting of Chairman Carlos Ghosn once it sees evidence from the Japanese carmaker's investigation, Chief Executive Hiroto Saikawa said in a Monday newspaper interview.

Headlines: U.S. regulator is reviewing Abbott's fast COVID test after studies raise accuracy concerns
Description: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration said on Thursday that Abbott Laboratories  speedy coronavirus test, which can deliver results within minutes and is used at the White House, could potentially be inaccurate but can still be used to test patients.

Headlines: BlackBerry to buy cybersecurity firm Cylance for $1.4 billion
Description: BlackBerry Ltd raised its bets on artificial intelligence and cybersecurity on Friday with the $1.4 billion purchase of California-based machine-learning specialists Cylance.

Headlines: Elliott presses SoftBank to identify $10 billion of investments it holds: sources
Description: Elliott Management Corp is pressing SoftBank Group Corp  for details of nearly-$10 billion of investment securities on its balance sheet, as part of its campaign to improve the value of the Japanese conglomerate in which it holds a stake, sources said.

Headlines: Air France-KLM CEO forfeits bonus under Dutch pressure
Description: Air France-KLM  Chief Executive Ben Smith said on Thursday he had given up his 2020 bonus, after a Dutch minister urged executive pay restraint in return for the billions of euros in government aid sought by the airline group.

Headlines: AccorHotels to decide on Huazhu board seat after Huazhu buys stake in company
Description: AccorHotels  said on Tuesday it will decide in the coming weeks whether to grant Huazhu Hotels  a board seat after the Chinese hospitality group bought 4.5 percent of its capital.

Headlines: Saudi SABIC lifts Swiss chemicals maker Clariant stake
Description: Chemical giant Saudi Basic Industries Corporation (SABIC)  said on Tuesday that it had raised its stake in Swiss chemicals maker Clariant  to 31.5% from 25%.

Headlines: What to look for in the Fed's U.S. economic outlook
Description: U.S. Federal Reserve policymakers on Wednesday will publish their first economic projections since the coronavirus pandemic set off a recession in February, estimates expected to signal a collapse in output this year and near-zero interest rates for the next few years.

Headlines: Lloyds and Barclays hit by $4 billion insurance mis-selling claims
Description: Lloyds  and Barclays  on Monday said a surge in late claims could see them pay out around $2 billion more each to settle Britain's costliest consumer banking scandal, the mis-selling of payment protection insurance (PPI).

Headlines: Saudi crown prince expects economic growth of 2.5 percent in 2018
Description: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman said on Wednesday the kingdom will continue with reforms and spending on infrastructure, predicting the economy will grow by 2.5 percent this year.

Headlines: South Korea says may retaliate against Japan high-tech export curbs
Description: South Korea said on Thursday it may retaliate against Japan's latest export limits on high-tech materials, as a row over forced wartime labor threatened to disrupt global supplies of memory chips and smartphones.

Headlines: 'Death Cross,' growth abroad threaten U.S. dollar
Description: Storm clouds are gathering over the U.S. dollar, threatening a two-year rally in the currency that has squeezed corporate profits and angered President Donald Trump.

Headlines: Trump says Fed raising rates was a mistake: CNBC
Description: The United States' economy would be growing at a pace near 4% if wasn't for the lingering effect of Federal Reserve rate hikes, President Donald Trump told CNBC in an interview on Wednesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: London Metal Exchange to delay ban on tainted metal until 2025 - sources
Description: The London Metal Exchange (LME) will postpone plans to ban metal tainted by human rights abuses until 2025, giving producers three more years to comply with guidelines and the exchange time to rethink its approach, industry sources said.

Headlines: Airbus says tougher to meet jet delivery goal after snags
Description: European planemaker Airbus softened its key target for jet deliveries on Wednesday and warned that reaching it would be a "greater stretch" after a sequence of industrial problems.

Headlines: Tweak to U.S. payment to banks may bolster Fed's credibility
Description: A small cut to an interest rate little known beyond Wall Street could lead to a big payoff for the Federal Reserve's most important asset: its credibility.

Headlines: China ready to hit back at U.S. with rare earths: newspapers
Description: China is ready to use rare earths to strike back in a trade war with the United States, Chinese newspapers warned on Wednesday in strongly worded commentaries on a move that would escalate tensions between the world's two largest economies.

Headlines: Netflix shares plunge as global growth falls short, U.S. customers shrink
Description: Netflix Inc  said on Wednesday it lost U.S. streaming customers for the first time in eight years and missed targets for new subscribers overseas, an announcement that jarred investors ahead of looming competition.

Headlines: T-Mobile spent $195,000 at Trump Hotel in D.C. since merger announcement
Description: T-Mobile Us Inc's chief executive, John Legere, and other company leaders have spent $195,000 on hotel stays and other expenses at the Trump International Hotel in Washington since the company sought approval for a $26 billion merger with Sprint last April, documents released on Tuesday show.

Headlines: Brazil set to start QE cautiously but may need to bring out 'bazooka'
Description: Brazil appears set to embark cautiously on unconventional monetary policy using small interventions to tackle dysfunction in bond markets, as it does with foreign exchange, but the severity of the crisis may ultimately force it to emulate the dramatic steps taken in the United States and Europe.

Headlines: Bond yields rise worldwide on stimulus concerns; earnings loom
Description: Fear that U.S. and Japanese policymakers will scale back economic stimulus sent quivers through debt markets on Monday, while U.S. stocks gained ahead of major company earnings reports.

Headlines: Blackstone adds Alphabet CFO Ruth Porat to its board
Description: Blackstone Group Inc  said on Thursday Alphabet Inc's  finance chief, Ruth Porat, will join the private equity firm's board of directors.

Headlines: Arrested Nissan executive Kelly says Ghosn paid appropriately: NHK
Description: A former Nissan Motor  executive arrested along with ex-chairman Carlos Ghosn has defended Ghosn's compensation, saying it was discussed with other officials and paid out appropriately, Japanese public broadcaster NHK said on Saturday.

Headlines: Taiwan's Foxconn calls Sino-U.S. trade spat a 'tech war'
Description: Foxconn, the world's largest electronics contract manufacturer, on Friday said the U.S. and Chinese governments are engaged in a technology war, not a trade war, describing the spat as the biggest challenge the Taiwanese company is facing.

Headlines: U.S., China face deep trade, IP differences in high-level talks
Description: The United States and China launch a critical round of trade talks on Wednesday amid deep differences over Washington's demands for structural economic reforms from Beijing that will make it difficult to reach a deal before a March 2 U.S. tariff hike.

Headlines: As Zuckerberg heads to Brussels, British lawmakers ask for answers
Description: British lawmakers want their European counterparts to quiz Facebook FB.O CEO Mark Zuckerberg about a scandal over improper use of millions of Facebook users' data, as he will not give evidence in London himself.

Headlines: Trump's auto tariff plan threatens GM's $7 billion South Korea rescue
Description: Fresh off a $7 billion rescue for its loss-making South Korean operation, General Motors  faces a new threat as U.S. President Donald Trump considers higher vehicle import tariffs that could "make or break" its Asian subsidiary.

Headlines: Wall Street nosedives as investors flee on trade war fears
Description: Wall Street tumbled on Friday with more than 1,000 points knocked off the Dow in two days as investors, increasingly nervous about a potential U.S. trade war with China, shied away from risk ahead of the weekend and sought shelter from further losses.

Headlines: As Aramco hails record IPO, Abu Dhabi's ADNOC whips up $19 billion
Description: The talk's all been about Saudi Aramco, and the suspense of its historic drive to whip up international cash. But, more quietly, its Gulf oil peer ADNOC has also been courting foreign funds - and its efforts compare favorably.

Headlines: NIBC agrees to Blackstone's reduced takeover offer
Description: NIBC  has agreed to a proposed takeover by Blackstone , the Dutch bank said on Monday, despite the U.S. private equity firm lowering its bid in light of the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Alibaba puts CFO in charge of investment in major management reshuffle
Description: China's Alibaba Group Holding Ltd on Tuesday unveiled its most significant business reshuffle since co-founder Jack Ma announced his pending retirement, as the e-commerce firm looks to bolster its investment focus in the face of slowing growth.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs sees 'modest' emerging market rebound in 2019
Description: Investment bank Goldman Sachs said on Tuesday that it expected emerging market shares, currencies and bonds to see a modest rebound next year.

Headlines: Global stocks drop on fears of expanding trade war
Description: Global equities tumbled and safe-haven sovereign bonds surged Friday after U.S. President Donald Trump's unexpected threat of tariffs on Mexican goods added to fears that escalating trade wars will push the U.S. and other major economies into recession.

Headlines: Major U.S. airlines cancel China flights as government steps up warnings
Description: All three major U.S. airlines announced the cancellation of flights to mainland China on Friday as the U.S. government unveiled additional steps to curb the spread of the coronavirus, which originated in China.

Headlines: Factbox: Top S&P 500 companies exposed to China
Description: Investor worries about a trade war between the United States and China ratcheted up on Wednesday, leaving a number of large U.S. companies potentially in the crosshairs of a dispute because of their business with China.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler boss Manley to head European auto lobby group ACEA
Description: The European carmakers' association (ACEA) has appointed Fiat Chrysler  Chief Executive Mike Manley as its new president from January 2020, it said on Thursday.

Headlines: World stocks rebound, U.S. yields above 15-month lows
Description: Global stock markets broadly rebounded on Tuesday after a two-day swoon while benchmark U.S. Treasury yields steadied above 15-month lows as risk appetite improved after worries of a recession clouded trading since late last week.

Headlines: South Korea, Japan to hold export control talks via teleconference, Jiji says
Description: South Korea and Japan will hold export control talks originally planned for March 10 in Seoul via teleconference, the Jiji news agency reported on Friday, reflecting the widening impact of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Global airlines call for government aid and United warns of cuts to U.S. routes
Description: Airlines on Thursday appealed for urgent government financial support as U.S. carriers rushed to cut flights to Europe in the wake of new U.S. travel restrictions aimed at combating the coronavirus outbreak, while United Airlines warned of U.S. travel disruption as the virus spreads domestically.

Headlines: China limits number of rides drivers can offer through car-pooling services
Description: China's Ministry of Transport said car-pooling services have to limit the daily number of rides drivers can offer through apps such as Didi Chuxing's Hitch, which began trial operations this month a year after passenger deaths left the service suspended.

Headlines: Deutsche Telekom postpones shareholder meeting over coronavirus
Description: Deutsche Telekom  on Monday postponed its March 26 annual general shareholders meeting due to the coronavirus, saying it planned to hold the gathering during the first eight months of this year as required by law.

Headlines: Oil breaks above $60/bbl, but doubts about growth curb gains
Description: Oil prices rose nearly 3 percent on Monday, clawing back some of last week's steep losses, but gains were capped by uncertainty over global economic growth and further signs of increasing supply, including record Saudi production.

Headlines: German carmakers to resume production as lockdowns ease
Description: German carmakers including Volkswagen  and Mercedes-Benz  will restart production at some German factories next week after the country eased restrictions designed to contain the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Hard Brexit could ground UK flights for three weeks: Ryanair CEO
Description: A hard Brexit could ground UK flights for up to three weeks but would be survivable for Ryanair , the Irish budget airline's CEO Michael O'Leary said ahead of a meeting of European Union leaders in Brussels on Wednesday.

Headlines: Air France faces new strikes over domestic network cuts
Description: Air France  unions have called for strikes at its domestic carrier Hop as pilots seek improved pay and conditions and ground staff press for job guarantees, union officials said.

Headlines: Exclusive: Microsoft's $7.5 billion GitHub deal set for EU approval - sources
Description: U.S. software giant Microsoft  is set to win unconditional EU antitrust approval for its $7.5 billion purchase of privately held coding website GitHub, two people familiar with the matter said on Monday.

Headlines: Pelosi had 'productive meeting' with U.S. trade representative on deal: aide
Description: U.S. House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi had a "productive meeting" with U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer almost entirely focused on a new United States-Mexico-Canada (USMCA) trade deal, one of her aides said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Apptio to go private in $1.94 billion with Vista Equity Partners
Description: Software company Apptio Inc  said on Sunday it agreed to be bought by private equity firm Vista Equity Partners for $1.94 billion in cash, two years after going public.

Headlines: Brazil narrows field to China, Russia, France for Angra 3 nuclear partner
Description: (This October 23 story corrects paragraph 8; Westinghouse owned by Brookfield Business Partners, not Toshiba Corp as erroneously reported)

Headlines: Microsoft wants to invest in Indonesia data centers, says Indonesian president
Description: Microsoft Corp is keen to invest in data centers in Indonesia which will soon make regulatory changes to facilitate the move, the country's president said after meeting with the software giant's CEO on Thursday.

Headlines: Oil steady as attack in Syria supports but U.S. crude stocks weigh
Description: Oil futures were mixed on Wednesday as a Turkey-launched offensive in Syria and hopes of progress in ending the U.S.-China trade war supported oil, but a build in U.S. crude inventories held prices back.

Headlines: Ruth's Chris owner to speed repayment of $20 million federal rescue loan
Description: Ruth's Hospitality Group Inc, owner of the Ruth's Chris Steak House chain of restaurants, on Thursday said it would quickly repay $20 million of federal rescue loans it received to help maintain payroll through the coronavirus crisis, a program aimed at small businesses.

Headlines: Global stocks end 2019 near record highs, dollar slides
Description: The dollar slid to a six-month low on Tuesday as progress on U.S.-China trade tensions led investors to higher-risk assets, while a year-end rally that lifted global equity markets to record highs stayed alive on the last trading day of 2019.

Headlines: Bayer nears seven-year low after $2 billion award in Roundup trial
Description: Bayer shares fell by as much as 5 percent on Tuesday after a California couple were awarded more than $2 billion in the largest U.S. jury penalty over allegations its Roundup weed killer causes cancer.

Headlines: Exclusive: Ford likely to end independent India business with new Mahindra deal - sources
Description: Ford Motor Co is nearing a deal with Mahindra & Mahindra to form a new joint-venture company in India, a move that will likely see the U.S. automaker cease independent operations in the country, two sources with direct knowledge of the talks told Reuters.

Headlines: Trump: 'ahead of schedule' on China trade deal
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday he expected to sign a significant part of the trade deal with China ahead of schedule but did not elaborate on the timing.

Headlines: GE still sees $1.4 billion cash cost from Boeing 737 MAX grounding in 2019
Description: General Electric Co  still expects the grounding of Boeing Co's  737 MAX jetliner to reduce its cash flow by $1.4 billion in 2019, provided the aircraft remains grounded all year, GE Chief Executive Larry Culp said during a conference call on quarterly earnings on Wednesday.

Headlines: Global stocks tumble on souring sentiment; oil falls
Description: Stocks fell sharply on Thursday while the Japanese yen rose in a move toward safety assets, with traders citing the Sino-U.S. trade war, Italy's budget concerns and a widening gap between the United States and Saudi Arabia.

Headlines: American Airlines CEO says burning less cash but demand outlook still uncertain
Description: American Airlines Chief Executive Doug Parker said on Wednesday that he expects a daily cash burn of about $40 million in June, down from a previous forecast of $50 million per day, thanks to cost-savings measures to address the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Altice, Dish urge U.S. to intervene in T-Mobile-Sprint deal
Description: U.S. cable and satellite TV providers Altice USA Inc  and Dish Network Corp  have urged U.S. regulators not to approve the planned merger between T-Mobile US Inc  and Sprint Corp  in its current form, according to filings published on Tuesday.

Headlines: Hasbro blames Toys 'R' Us for poor first quarter
Description: Hasbro Inc  reported worse than expected results for the first quarter on Monday, blaming the bankruptcy of Toys 'R' Us for a slide in revenue but also promising the worst would be over in the first half of 2018.

Headlines: Canada, isolated over Huawei 5G, is studying British decision
Description: Canada, the only member of an elite intelligence-sharing network yet to decide whether to allow the use of Huawei Technologies Co Ltd 5G technology, on Tuesday said it was studying Britain's decision not to ban the Chinese telecoms giant from the West's next-generation communications.

Headlines: Hong Kong's bourse brushes off Chinese snub over dual-class shares
Description: Hong Kong's exchange described as "temporary" a dispute with its Shanghai and Shenzhen counterparts over plans to bar investor access to dual-class shares, as shares in smartphone maker Xiaomi Corp  recovered from the depths of its 10-percent slide on Monday.

Headlines: Gold surges on Mideast risk but stocks pare losses
Description: Gold prices shot to an almost seven-year high on Monday as U.S.-Iranian tensions drove demand for safe-haven assets and pushed a gauge of global equity markets lower, but shares on Wall Street rebounded on a less worrisome view of events.

Headlines: Amazon says CEO Bezos willing to testify before Congress: NYT
Description: Amazon.com Inc Chief Executive Officer Jeff Bezos is willing to testify before a House antitrust investigation into the market power of major tech companies, the New York Times reported https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/15/technology/amazon-jeff-bezos-congress.html on Monday, citing a lawyer for Amazon who wrote to lawmakers.

Headlines: Daly appointment shows diversity gap between regional Feds
Description: The appointment of Mary Daly as the second-ever woman to head up the San Francisco Federal Reserve makes plain that some regional central banks continue to make strides in creating a diverse leadership as criticism intensifies about the Fed's hiring policies while others fall behind.

Headlines: Ryanair can bide its time for better plane deals, says O'Leary
Description: Ryanair  can wait out price rises sought by planemakers since the global grounding of the Boeing 737 MAX, the Irish airline's boss said on Tuesday.

Headlines: BNP Paribas CEO rules out big deals when asked about Deutsche Bank
Description: BNP Paribas  chief executive Jean-Laurent Bonnafe effectively ruled out a tie-up with struggling German rival Deutsche Bank  on Thursday, saying the French lender is not considering any large takeovers or mergers.

Headlines: Dish Network cuts jobs, re-evaluates business in coronavirus fallout
Description: Dish Network Corp  has cut staff and is re-evaluating  its business to cope better with the fallout from the coronavirus pandemic, the U.S. satellite TV provider told Reuters, without disclosing the number of employees laid off.

Headlines: P&G operating margin, grooming product sales dip on strong dollar; shares drop
Description: Procter & Gamble Co reported a decline in its third-quarter operating margin on Tuesday and said a strong U.S. dollar hurt sales of its grooming products, sending shares of the maker of Tide and Gillette products down as much as 3.3%.

Headlines: China, EU lambast United States for miring WTO in crisis
Description: The United States came under fire from China and the European Union on Monday, accused by both major trading partners of taking protectionist measures and bringing the World Trade Organization (WTO) to its knees.

Headlines: U..S can quickly recover lost farm trade to China once deal clinched: Ag Secy
Description: The United States will be able to quickly recover lost markets for U.S. farm products to China once Washington and Beijing clinch a trade deal, U.S. Agriculture Secretary Sonny Perdue said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. President Donald Trump meets China's Liu He: CCTV
Description: Chinese Vice Premier Liu He, who is leading a trade delegation in Washington, has met U.S. President Donald Trump, state broadcaster China Central Television said on Friday.

Headlines: Former Nissan boss Ghosn's wife says he may not get fair trial in Japan: CNBC
Description: Carole Ghosn, the wife of former Nissan  Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Carlos Ghosn, on Thursday raised doubts about her husband getting a fair trial in Japan in an interview to CNBC.

Headlines: China posts scant rise in outbound investment in 2018 amid outflow curbs
Description: China's overseas investment rose only marginally in 2018 as the yuan weakened and regulators cracked down on deals that were suspected to be skirting controls on moving money out of the country.

Headlines: Trump says 'not even a little bit happy' with Fed's Powell: report
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday kept up his criticism of Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell, saying rising interest rates and other Fed policies were damaging the U.S. economy, the Washington Post said.

Headlines: Zoom says added over 100 features as part of 90-day security plan
Description: Zoom Video Communications Inc said on Wednesday it has added over 100 features to its video conferencing as part of its 90-day plan to address security and privacy concerns.

Headlines: Tech sector pushes the S&P 500 to slight gain
Description: Technology shares led the S&P 500 marginally higher on Wednesday, as a healthy forecast from IBM helped mitigate worries over the developing coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: As FAANG stocks falter, fund managers make bets on survivors
Description: A bear market in the so-called FAANG stocks - Wall Street's most popular trade going into the year - is pushing fund managers into searching for the next big growth companies that can lead the overall market higher.

Headlines: Japan downgrades second-quarter GDP as trade war hits business investment
Description: Japan's economy grew at a slower pace than initially estimated in the second quarter as the U.S.-China trade war prompted a downward revision of business spending, intensifying calls for the central bank to deepen stimulus this month.

Headlines: Trump tariffs force companies to rework supply chains
Description: From global manufacturers such as Harley-Davidson Inc  to small tech startups, companies are scrambling to rework supply chains built for an era of stable, open trade policy that is now under threat.

Headlines: U.S. Justice Department to curb bid-rigging in government purchases
Description: The U.S. Justice Department plans to be more aggressive in pressing antitrust charges against companies that have rigged bids for government contracts, the agency's antitrust chief said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. tech funds turn to Visa, Paypal as FANGs fade
Description: Some tech-heavy U.S. fund managers have turned to the once-stodgy payments sector as an alternative to so-called FANG stocks as high-flyers like Facebook Inc  and Google parent Alphabet Inc  falter.

Headlines: China's industrial output to grow around 5.6% year-on-year in 2019: ministry
Description: China's industrial output is expected to grow around 5.6% in 2019, the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology said on Monday.

Headlines: U.S. consumer confidence rebounds, house prices increase
Description: Consumer confidence rebounded in May, but households were a bit pessimistic about their short-term income prospects even as they  expected strong job growth to persist, which could restrain consumer spending.

Headlines: Trump says he will seek U.S. trade accord with Brazil
Description: President Donald Trump on Tuesday said he will pursue a U.S. trade agreement with Brazil, suggesting a friendly relationship with President Jair Bolsonaro could help lower trade barriers between the two biggest economies in the Americas.

Headlines: Powell's whatever-it-takes pledge puts limits of Fed's reach in spotlight
Description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's message in announcing a barrage of monetary policy and liquidity actions was clear: The U.S. central bank will use all the tools at its disposal to keep credit flowing through the U.S. and global financial system.

Headlines: BMW expands UK vehicle recall to 390,000 cars
Description: BMW  is expanding a recall of vehicles in Britain, which it launched last week, by 88,000 cars to a total of 390,000, in the wake of a BBC investigation which found that some vehicles could cut out completely while being driven.

Headlines: Factbox: Snakes and ladders - SoftBank Vision Fund's climbing, sliding valuations
Description: The $100 billion Vision Fund of Japan's SoftBank Group Corp  has in just over two years burnt through much of its capital investing in money-losing, late-stage tech startups in areas as varied as autonomous driving, healthcare and finance.

Headlines: Carlyle to buy 25% of Bharti Airtel's data center arm for $235 million
Description: Carlyle will buy a 25% stake in Indian telecom firm Bharti Airtel Ltd's data center arm for $235 million, the U.S. private equity group said on Wednesday, as it taps into the rapid growth of digital services in India.

Headlines: Nestle to launch ruby chocolate KitKat in Europe and Americas
Description: Nestle  will launch a ruby chocolate version of its KitKat brand in Europe next week after it made its debut this year in Japan and South Korea, the Swiss food group said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Banks back Democrats in bid to rebuild bipartisan support
Description: Banks are going to bat for Democrats in the U.S. November midterm congressional elections as part of an ambitious strategy to rebuild the bipartisan support they enjoyed before the 2007-2009 financial crisis.

Headlines: Credit Suisse CEO sees business 'going in right direction'
Description: Business conditions are improving after a tough start to the year, Credit Suisse  Chief Executive Thomas Gottstein said in a presentation released on Wednesday.

Headlines: Gold gains as trade concerns weigh on global markets
Description: Signs of further escalation of the U.S.-China trade war and weak UK economic data weighed on global markets on Friday, capping a volatile week that has pushed gold to its highest level in six years.

Headlines: General Motors says in talks to invest $2.73 billion in Brazil till 2024
Description: General Motors Co said on Saturday it is negotiating "feasibility conditions" to invest 10 billion reais ($2.73 billion) in Brazil from 2020 to 2024, after having warned last month that new investments would depend on returning to profit.

Headlines: Apple welcomes court ruling against EU tax order
