Description: Apple said on Wednesday that it was pleased that Europe's second-top court had rejected an EU order to the iPhone maker to pay 13 billion euros ($14.78 billion) in Irish back taxes.

Headlines: Factbox: U.S. coal-fired power plants scheduled to shut
Description: U.S. power companies expect to retire or convert from coal to gas over 13,800 megawatts (MW) of coal-fired plants in 2019 after shutting over 13,300 MW in 2018, according to U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) and Thomson Reuters data.

Headlines: UK, U.S. and industry officials to meet before Huawei decision: Downing Street
Description: Officials from the British and U.S. governments and the telecoms industry will meet on Monday, before Britain is due to take a decision on the possible use of Huawei [HWT.UL] equipment in future 5G mobile networks, Prime Minister Boris Johnson's spokesman said.

Headlines: Toyota strengthens Japan partnerships with bigger Subaru stake
Description: Toyota Motor Corp  will raise its stake in Subaru Corp  to 20% from around 17%, the two Japanese automakers said on Friday, as they leverage their scale to better compete in developing new vehicle technologies.

Headlines: Trump ups ante on China, threatens duties on nearly all its imports
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump warned on Friday he was ready to slap tariffs on virtually all Chinese imports into the United States, threatening duties on another $267 billion of goods on top of $200 billion in imports primed for levies in coming days.

Headlines: Bayer gets Monsanto profit boost but legal burden mounts
Description: German drug and farming supplies company Bayer posted a 45 percent gain in quarterly core earnings thanks to the acquisition of seed maker Monsanto, while the legal burden it took on with the deal mounted.

Headlines: Amazon secures top Champions League rights for Germany
Description: Amazon.com has secured the rights to broadcast top European soccer Champions League matches for the 2021/22 season in Germany, the U.S. company said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Boeing's new 737 MAX flight control system 'seems foolproof': Norwegian CEO
Description: Boeing's new MCAS flight control system for its 737 MAX aircraft appears foolproof, Norwegian Air Chief Executive Bjoern Kjos said on Wednesday after visiting the plane maker in Seattle.

Headlines: Exclusive: Airbus puts six jets made for AirAsia up for sale as crisis deepens
Description: Airbus  has put six jets made for one of its largest customers up for sale after giving up on Malaysia's AirAsia  taking delivery of them, sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Boeing wins $2.46 billion U.S. defense contract: Pentagon
Description: The Boeing Cowon a $2.46 billion U.S. defense contract for the production and delivery of 19 P-8A Poseidon long-range anti-submarine warfare and surveillance aircraft and other equipment, the Pentagon said in a statement on Friday.

Headlines: China factory gate deflation deepens on global demand slump
Description: China's producer prices fell by the sharpest rate in more than four years, underscoring pressure on the manufacturing sector as the COVID-19 pandemic reduces trade flows and global demand.

Headlines: U.S. weekly jobless claims race to more than two-year high
Description: The number of Americans filing applications for unemployment benefits jumped to more than a two-year high last week, but that probably does not signal a pickup in layoffs as the claims data tends to be volatile in the period following the Thanksgiving Day holiday.

Headlines: Multi-strategy hedge funds outperformed peers as market plunged
Description: Multi-strategy hedge funds - those that bet on a broad array of markets using teams of traders, leverage and centralized risk management - have flourished as stocks ended their worst three months since the 2008 financial crisis.

Headlines: Xilinx resumes some Huawei sales, but lower forecast sends shares down
Description: Xilinx Inc  said it had resumed some sales to Huawei Technologies Co Ltd but forecast current-quarter revenue below Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, citing the impact of U.S. restrictions on selling to the Chinese telecommunications firm.

Headlines: Hedge funds hold their nerve on China, seek opportunities
Description: Hedge funds are holding their nerve on China's ability to rebound quickly from a coronavirus outbreak that has rattled global markets, but many are also adding caveats as they try to predict the potential economic fallout.

Headlines: HSBC first-half profit rises 16%, announces $1 billion buyback
Description: HSBC  reported on Monday its first-half pretax profit rose 15.9% and announced a further buyback of $1 billion, defying some analysts' expectations it might pause its strategy of returning extra capital to investors.

Headlines: Wall Street rises but pares gains late after report of FBI raid
Description: Wall Street's major indexes rose on Monday as a softer stance by U.S. policymakers on China tariffs powered a rebound from last week's selloff, but stocks pared much of their gains late in the session after a report that the Federal Bureau of Investigation raided the office of President Donald Trump's lawyer.

Headlines: Bombardier's surprise forecast cut rattles stock, bond investors
Description: Canada's Bombardier Inc cut its full-year profit and revenue forecasts on Thursday as it wrestled with production challenges in its key railcar-making unit, rattling markets ahead of the company's annual general meeting next week.

Headlines: CBS expands NFL streaming rights to include mobile devices
Description: CBS Corp  on Monday expanded its streaming agreement with National Football League to include mobile devices and extended the rights through the 2022 season, the media company said.

Headlines: JPMorgan close to winning lead advisory role for Saudi Aramco IPO: source
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co  is close to winning the lead advisory role for Saudi Aramco's initial public offering, a source familiar with the situation said on Sunday.

Headlines: UK to purge Huawei from 5G by end of 2027, siding with Trump over China
Description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson ordered Huawei equipment to be purged completely from Britain's 5G network by the end of 2027, risking the ire of China by signalling that the world's biggest telecoms equipment maker is not welcome in the West.

Headlines: New U.S. tariffs on China are unfortunate: EU trade chief
Description: New U.S. tariffs on Chinese imports represent an unfortunate escalation of global trade tensions and are the wrong method to force Beijing to reform, the European Union's trade chief said on Tuesday.

Headlines: FTC requests AbbVie, Allergan for more information on $63 billion deal
Description: The U.S. Federal Trade Commission (FTC) has requested for more information from AbbVie Inc  and botox maker Allergan Plc  on their $63 billion deal, the companies said on Friday.

Headlines: Chinese sneeze could give Europe Inc. a nasty flu
Description: With sluggish growth translating into the most disappointing earnings in years, European stocks are set for a tough ride if a full blown Sino-U.S. trade war erupts following Presidents Donald Trump and Xi Jinping's G20 dinner on Saturday.

Headlines: The $280,000 lab-grown burger could be a more palatable $10 in two years
Description: (This July 9 story corrects to change company name to Biotech Foods in paragraph five.)

Headlines: U.S. states probing Hyundai, Kia over vehicle fires: Connecticut AG
Description: A group of U.S. states is investigating Hyundai Motor Co and Kia Motors Corp for potential unfair and deceptive acts related to reports of hundreds of vehicle fires, Connecticut Attorney General William Tong said on Monday.

Headlines: Democrats seek probe of key FAA decisions on 737 MAX approval
Description: The chairman of the U.S. House of Representatives transportation committee and another key Democrat asked the Transportation Department's inspector general on Tuesday to examine key decisions made by the Federal Aviation Administration in certifying Boeing's 737 MAX jet for use.

Headlines: Oil drops to 13-month low on weak Chinese demand, traders eye OPEC+ cuts
Description: Oil prices fell to their lowest level since December 2018 on Monday on weaker Chinese demand in the wake of the coronavirus outbreak and as traders waited to see if Russia would join other producers in seeking further output cuts.

Headlines: Swedish economic crimes authority carries out search at Swedbank headquarters
Description: Sweden's Economic Crime Authority is carrying out a search at Swedbank's head office in relation to an ongoing investigation into whether the bank breached insider trading regulations, the authority said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. set to quickly widen trade war with EU tariffs after WTO ruling: sources
Description: The United States' top trade body is likely to release a list of European goods subject to new tariffs Wednesday afternoon, after the World Trade Organization's landmark ruling on illegal aircraft subsidies, industry sources said.

Headlines: Nissan to gradually withdraw from diesel vehicle market in Europe
Description: Japanese carmaker Nissan will gradually stop selling diesel cars in Europe, in a further sign of weakening demand for those cars as customers worry about tax rises and looming bans and restrictions related to diesel in many countries.

Headlines: H&M's brand COS to test clothing rentals in China with YCloset
Description: H&M , the world's second-biggest fashion group, said on Friday its brand COS had teamed up with Chinese subscription rental platform YCloset to try renting out clothes in the country as environmentally conscious consumers rein in purchases.

Headlines: General Mills sales hit by low demand for Nature Valley, Fiber One bars
Description: General Mills Inc's quarterly sales fell short of Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, hurt by lower demand for its Nature Valley and Fiber One snack bars, sending its shares down as much as 10%.

Headlines: Hasbro results dented by lingering Toys 'R' Us woes, shares drop
Description: Toymaker Hasbro Inc  missed analysts' expectations for quarterly revenue and profit on Monday, as the demise of major retail partner Toys 'R' Us hurt sales in Europe and the United States, sending its shares down as much as 8 percent.

Headlines: Dropbox tops revenue, profit estimates on higher subscriber additions
Description: Dropbox Inc  beat analysts' estimates for third-quarter revenue and profit on Thursday, as the online file hosting company signed up more individual and business customers to its platform.

Headlines: Court approves procedures for auctioning Weinstein Co
Description: A U.S. bankruptcy judge approved on Friday procedures for auctioning the film studio co-founded by Harvey Weinstein, who was fired by the company last year in the wake of allegations of sexual assault.

Headlines: Exclusive: China buys U.S. soybeans a day after trade talks - traders
Description: Chinese state-owned firms bought at least 1 million tonnes of U.S. soybeans on Friday, a day after high-level bilateral talks yielded progress toward a trade deal and a Chinese commitment to buy more U.S. soybeans.

Headlines: Microsoft granted license to export 'mass-market' software to Huawei
Description: Microsoft Corp  said on Thursday it had been granted a license from the U.S. government to export software to Huawei Technologies Co Ltd.

Headlines: Senate Democrats seek Fed probe into Deutsche Bank and Trump
Description: A group of U.S. Senate Democrats is urging the Federal Reserve to investigate Deutsche Bank AG's relationship with President Donald Trump and his son-in-law and adviser Jared Kushner.

Headlines: Amazon holds talks with workers in Poland as strike threatened
Description: Amazon said on Friday it was in talks with employees in Poland after unions threatened strike action, seeking higher pay in distribution centres.

Headlines: Trade worries extend equities' slide into new quarter
Description: The worst start to a year for world shares since 2010 continued into the third quarter on Monday, with another slump in Chinese shares and weakening global factory surveys leading global equity markets lower.

Headlines: Manager at Turkish jet operator told authorities he helped Ghosn escape because of threats: newspaper
Description: A manager at Turkish jet operator MNG Jet has told authorities that he assisted unwittingly in the escape of ex-Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn from Japan because he had been threatened by a former acquaintance, Hurriyet newspaper reported on Saturday.

Headlines: As trade war pinches China, it opens doors wide for foreign money
Description: As the Sino-U.S. trade war drags on, Beijing is throwing its door wide open to foreign investors as concerns grow over declining exports, capital flight and persistent yuan weakness.

Headlines: Lyft buys digital car-top advertising startup Halo Cars
Description: Lyft Inc has bought U.S.-based startup Halo Cars, which allows drivers to make money through digital advertisements displayed on top of their vehicles.

Headlines: Cathay Pacific in talks to buy stake in HNA's HK Express Airways
Description: Hong Kong flagship carrier Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd said on Tuesday it is in "active discussions" about an acquisition involving budget airline Hong Kong Express Airways Ltd, although an agreement has yet to be reached.

Headlines: Viacom sets Netflix deal that augurs future strategy
Description: Viacom Inc  on Friday announced a multi-picture deal with Netflix , and promised to make more films and TV shows for other companies, further signaling that it will not directly take on big tech rivals that stream to consumers and will instead supply them with content.

Headlines: Nike posts surprise loss as COVID-19 hits wholesale business
Description: Nike Inc  on Thursday reported an unexpected quarterly loss - its first in more than two years - hurt by closures of department and retail stores due to lockdowns spurred by the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Starboard buys stake in Dollar Tree, seeks sale of Family Dollar: WSJ
Description: Activist investor Starboard Value LP has acquired a stake in discount store operator Dollar Tree Inc  and is asking the company to sell its Family Dollar business, the Wall Street Journal reported on Sunday.

Headlines: Fifth Third Bancorp pays $4.7 billion for MB Financial's Chicago muscle
Description: U.S. regional bank Fifth Third Bancorp  has agreed to buy smaller rival MB Financial Inc  in a stock-and-cash deal valued at about $4.7 billion, as it looks to expand in Chicago and broaden its middle market customer base.

Headlines: Carrefour confident over overhaul despite fourth-quarter 'yellow vests' hit
Description: Carrefour  said on Tuesday it was confident its  overhaul plan was on track, although sales growth slowed slightly in the fourth quarter as 10 weeks of anti-government protests hit hypermarket sales in its core French market.

Headlines: Warning light flashing for Slovakia's auto industry
Description: When David landed an assembly line job at Volkswagen's  Bratislava factory, his colleagues congratulated him on securing a well-paid position he could ride to retirement.

Headlines: PVH cuts profit forecast as CEO sees retail softness, shares tank
Description: PVH Corp cut its annual profit forecast by 10 cents a share on Wednesday as the Calvin Klein and Tommy Hilfiger brands owner grapples with tariffs and slowing retail growth, exacerbated by weak spending from overseas shoppers in the face of a strong U.S. dollar, sending its shares down 12% after hours.

Headlines: Bottler Coca Cola HBC's April sales lose fizz as lockdowns weigh
Description: Soft drinks bottler Coca Cola HBC AG  on Thursday said sales in April fell by more than a third as fast-food chains, theatres and other public arenas stayed shut to limit the spread of the new coronavirus during stay-at-home orders.

Headlines: UK's Johnson: Northern Ireland as well protected from virus as Ireland
Description: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson said on Monday that people in Northern Ireland were being as well protected from the coronavirus outbreak as people just across the border in the Republic of Ireland, which has adopted more stringent measures.

Headlines: Global stocks stay near record highs; focus turns to central banks, earnings
Description: World stocks traded just below record highs on Monday, pausing ahead of this week's central bank meetings, economic data and earnings, while oil prices rose to their highest in over a week after blockades began shutting down two Libyan oilfields.

Headlines: Bayer reaps profit lift from Monsanto seeds, consumer health
Description: Bayer's $63 billion purchase of U.S. seeds maker Monsanto made its mark on the German company's fourth quarter earnings on Wednesday, lifting profit and boding well for the peak season of its enlarged agriculture business.

Headlines: Trump says he expects Apple to announce it will build plant in Texas
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday he wanted Apple Inc  to build its plants in the United States and expects the technology firm to announce it will build one in Texas.

Headlines: Scout24 to explore sale or spin-off of autos portal: CEO
Description: Scout24  will explore the potential sale or spin-off of its autos marketplace, CEO Tobias Hartmann said, responding to activist investor Elliott's call to sell the business to boost shareholder returns.

Headlines: U.S. ban on Chinas ZTE forces telecoms to rethink business: sources
Description: The U.S. trade ban on Chinese telecom equipment maker ZTE   wreaked havoc at wireless carriers in Europe and South Asia and forced operators worldwide to consider broadening their supply networks, industry sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Global airlines issue warning over trade tensions
Description: Global airlines issued a warning on Sunday over growing international trade tensions, saying they could damage the airline industry and the world economy.

Headlines: U.S. says it is still reviewing Bayer's planned Monsanto acquisition
Description: The U.S. Justice Department said on Wednesday it was pressing on with its review of German conglomerate Bayer's plan to buy Monsanto and noted the two regions' very different markets in terms of genetically modified seeds.

Headlines: Albertsons pulls off downsized IPO after years of trying
Description: U.S. supermarket operator Albertsons Companies Inc  decided to go ahead with a downsized $800 million initial public offering (IPO) on Thursday, the culmination of multiple attempts by its private equity owner Cerberus Capital Management LP to cash out.

Headlines: Trump: China, other nations have become 'spoiled' on trade
Description: President Donald Trump said on Thursday that China and other countries had become "very spoiled" on trade, as U.S. and Chinese officials hold high-level talks in Washington on trade ties.

Headlines: U.S. airline shares tumble as Buffett sell-off adds to worries
Description: Shares of the top four U.S. airlines dropped on Monday after billionaire investor Warren Buffett said Berkshire Hathaway  offloaded its entire stake in the carriers last month, adding to the sense of crisis around the industry.

Headlines: Daimler warns of "significant adverse effects" of virus outbreak
Description: German luxury carmaker Daimler  on Friday warned of risks for the economy and its own business from the outbreak of coronavirus that is spreading in China and around the world.

Headlines: Oil climbs over $1/bbl on U.S.-China trade deal hopes, Mideast tension
Description: Oil prices rose more than $1 a barrel on Tuesday after news that China and the United States were resuming trade talks ahead of a meeting at the G20 summit later this month, spurring hopes that the two countries would resolve an ongoing trade war.

Headlines: In Papua New Guinea, Exxon's giant LNG project fuels frustration
Description: From her red-roofed home near Papua New Guinea's capital of Port Moresby, Isabelle Dikana Iveiri overlooks a giant plant used by Exxon Mobil Corp to liquefy billions of dollars' worth of natural gas before it is shipped to Asian buyers.

Headlines: KFC to sell Beyond Meat's plant-based 'fried chicken' in the southern U.S.
Description: Beyond Meat said on Wednesday it will supply plant-based "fried chicken" to several KFC stores in Tennessee and North Carolina, after a test conducted last year showed strong consumer demand.

Headlines: Oil traders ready for musical chairs as China tariffs loom
Description: Oil markets are bracing for a reshuffle of global trade flows as China threatens to impose tit-for-tat tariffs on imports of U.S. energy products, including crude.

Headlines: Purdue Pharma seeks to halt opioid suits against company, Sacklers
Description: OxyContin maker Purdue Pharma LP on Wednesday asked a U.S. bankruptcy judge to halt for roughly nine months more than 2,600 lawsuits alleging the company and its controlling Sackler family helped fuel the U.S. opioid crisis, according to court documents.

Headlines: Aeva signs sensor deal with Audi's self-driving unit
Description: Aeva Inc, a startup company founded by former Apple Inc engineers Soroush Salehian and Mina Rezk, has signed a sensor-system deal with an Audi-owned unit that is working on self-driving technology for Volkswagen AG.

Headlines: Ford's China ventures increase May sales as market rebounds
Description: Ford Motor's  China ventures have reported year-on-year sales growth for May in a sign of how the world's biggest auto market is continuing its recovery from coronavirus-induced lows.

Headlines: Too early for the ECB to contemplate coronavirus response: Makhlouf
Description: It is too early for the European Central Bank to assess whether it needs to respond to the coronavirus epidemic with policy, even if the epidemic presents a risk to growth, Irish central bank chief Gabriel Makhlouf said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Wells Fargo board weighs keeping interim CEO in place - sources
Description: Wells Fargo & Co board members are considering keeping interim Chief Executive Allen Parker in the job permanently even after saying they would seek an outsider to fill the role, according to two sources familiar with the board's thinking.

Headlines: Nord Stream 2 to press on with Europe gas pipe, despite U.S. sanctions
Description: The group behind Nord Stream 2 said on Saturday it aimed to complete a pipeline to boost Russian gas supplies to Europe as soon as possible, after U.S. sanctions prompted a major contractor to suspend pipe-laying activities.

Headlines: Murdoch's new Fox debuts on Nasdaq, names ex-Speaker Paul Ryan to board
Description: Fox Corp debuted on the Nasdaq on Tuesday, marking a new phase for billionaire Rupert Murdoch's media business after the $71 billion sale of Twenty-First Century Fox Inc's film and television assets to Walt Disney Co.

Headlines: Netflix chief marketing officer to leave
Description: Netflix Inc said on Thursday Chief Marketing Officer Kelly Bennett will step down after seven years in the role, during which the online video-streaming giant's paid subscribers jumped five-fold to 139 million.

Headlines: Canada's Trudeau says NAFTA deal possible by Friday
Description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said on Wednesday that it may be possible to reach a deal on NAFTA ahead of U.S. President Donald Trump's Friday deadline.

Headlines: Volkswagen sees V-shaped recovery lasting into 2022
Description: Volkswagen expects a V-shaped recovery lasting into 2022, its sales chief said on Tuesday, as businesses try to work out how quickly they will rebound from the coronavirus pandemic which shut large parts of the economy around the world for months.

Headlines: Ford sees higher metal costs, hopes China and U.S. can settle trade issues
Description: Ford Motor Co  has seen higher steel and aluminum costs driven by trade tariffs bite into profit, but is hopeful the United States and China can avoid further tensions that could make things more costly, a top Ford executive said on Monday.

Headlines: Boeing sees fix for latest 737 MAX software flaw in September
Description: Boeing Co  will take until at least September to fix a newly identified problem on its grounded 737 MAX, a company official told Reuters, meaning the workhorse jet's return to service will be delayed until October at the earliest, significantly longer than most airlines had expected.

Headlines: Mexico green lights auto industry restart, heeding U.S. calls
Description: Mexico will begin opening some automotive factories from May 18 under a plan unveiled on Wednesday that loosens coronavirus restrictions and paves the way for U.S. car giants to ramp up output dependent on parts made south of the border.

Headlines: Airbus-Boeing trade war would benefit Chinese planemaker, France says
Description: An escalation in the subsidy row involving European planemaker Airbus and U.S. rival Boeing would be senseless and serve only to benefit an emerging Chinese competitor, France's finance minister said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Japan's curbs on high-tech materials exports to South Korea could backfire
Description: Japan's curbs on exports of high-tech materials to South Korea could backfire in the long run, eroding its dominance over a key link in the global chip supply chain, suppliers and experts say.

Headlines: Weak holiday sales at Kohl's, J.C. Penney spell more trouble for stores
Description: Kohl's Corp  and J.C. Penney Co Inc  reported lower holiday season sales on Thursday, a sign that traditional brick-and-mortar retailers struggled to compete with record-breaking online shopping between Thanksgiving and New Year's Day.

Headlines: U.S. companies, labs rush to produce blood test for coronavirus immunity
Description: As the United States works overtime to screen thousands for the novel coronavirus, a new blood test offers the chance to find out who may have immunity - a potential game changer in the battle to contain infections and get the economy back on track.

Headlines: Main Street's boldest take on Wall Street in bankruptcy stock frenzy
Description: When Bryan Quevedo received his U.S. government stimulus check last month, he invested $1,000 in the stock of bankrupt car rental company Hertz Global Holdings Inc.

Headlines: China steel industry adds voice to steel import concerns
Description: China's steel industry on Tuesday urged Beijing to ensure any increase in steel products seeking a market in the wake of U.S. tariffs did not affect its domestic industry, following the announcement of a European Union import probe.

Headlines: Exxon continues drilling offshore Guyana as Venezuela lodges complaint
Description: Exxon Mobil Corp  said on Wednesday its oil drilling and development activities offshore Guyana were unaffected by a weekend incident in which Venezuela's navy stopped two exploration vessels the company had hired.

Headlines: Nissan finds more improper testing, considers recall: Nikkei
Description: Nissan Motor Co  has found more cases of improper testing of vehicles in Japan and is considering recalling affected cars, the Nikkei reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Hyundai, Kia Motors to develop new solar charging tech for vehicles
Description: Hyundai Motor Co  and its affiliate Kia Motors Corp  are planning to launch a solar charging technology for some Hyundai vehicles to meet global emission regulation targets, the South Korean automakers said on Wednesday.

Headlines: China's Sinopec signs purchase agreements worth $45.6 billion at Shanghai Expo
Description: China's state-owned Sinopec signed purchase agreements worth $45.6 billion on Thursday, covering supplies of crude oil, chemicals, coal and equipment.

Headlines: Britain's Thomas Cook scrambles for $250 million to avert collapse
Description: Britain's Thomas Cook  needs to find an extra 200 million pounds ($251 million) to satisfy its lenders or one of the world's oldest holiday company risks collapse, potentially stranding thousands of holidaymakers across Europe.

Headlines: Masks, cleaning, filtration better than blocking middle seats: United CEO
Description: United Airlines Holdings Inc  Chief Executive Scott Kirby said on Thursday that facial masks, aircraft cleaning and air filtration systems are better measures for preventing the spread of the coronavirus on airplanes than trying to social distance.

Headlines: JPMorgan Chase will invest $125 million in programs to encourage people to save money
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co will provide $125 million over the next five years to nonprofit groups in the United States and abroad that help people save, pay down debt and improve their credit scores, the bank said on Wednesday.

Headlines: AT&T closes $85 billion deal for Time Warner
Description: AT&T Inc, the No. 2 wireless carrier, on Thursday closed its $85 billion deal to acquire media company Time Warner Inc after U.S. antitrust regulators indicated they would not seek a delay.

Headlines: Ride-hailing companies Uber, Lyft won't testify before Congress
Description: Uber Technologies Inc and Lyft Inc declined to appear on Wednesday at a U.S. House of Representatives hearing on issues relating to the ride-hailing industry, a congressional committee said.

Headlines: Aurora partners with Fiat Chrysler over self-driving tech
Description: Self-driving car software startup Aurora said on Sunday it would partner with Fiat Chrysler to build autonomous platforms for commercial vehicles, the latest collaboration with an automaker for the fast-growing Silicon Valley company.

Headlines: Germany will have to change oversight laws after Wirecard case: Scholz
Description: The Wirecard case will result in changes to laws on financial oversight, Finance Minister Olaf Scholz said on Friday, as German prosecutors probe alleged fraud, balance falsification and market manipulation at the collapsed firm.

Headlines: easyJet says will ground most of its fleet from Tuesday
Description: British low-cost airline easyJet  said it would ground most of its aircraft from Tuesday in response to travel restrictions aimed to prevent the spread of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Canada gives Lockheed Martin first chance to bid on warships design
Description: The Canadian government on Friday said Lockheed Martin Corp  would be given first chance to bid on a contract to design 15 warships that will end up costing Canada around C$60 billion ($46 billion).

Headlines: U.S. says several airlines' operations affected by non-FAA data program
Description: Operations for Southwest Airlines Co, United Continental, JetBlue Airways Co, Alaska Air Group and Delta Air Lines Inc were impacted on Monday by data problems, the Federal Aviation Administration said in a statement.

Headlines: Online service or property agent? EU court to define Airbnb's status
Description: U.S. homesharing site Airbnb will get a better idea of how it should be labeled when Europe's top court rules on Thursday on the tricky question of whether it is an online booking service or a real estate agent subject to onerous rules.

Headlines: After Fed selloff, is a U.S. bear market next?
Description: U.S. stocks took another body blow on Wednesday after the Federal Reserve raised interest rates again and the central bank chairman did not soften his tone about the outlook for further financial tightening to the degree investors had hoped.

Headlines: China November exports fall, but import growth hints of recovering demand
Description: China's exports in November shrank for the fourth consecutive month, underscoring persistent pressures on manufacturers from the Sino-U.S. war but growth in imports may be a sign that Beijing's stimulus steps are helping to stoke demand.

Headlines: 'We screwed up' not buying Google shares, Berkshire's Munger says
Description: One of Warren Buffett's and Charlie Munger's biggest regrets was not buying shares of Google owner Alphabet Inc.

Headlines: Trump encountered second person who later tested positive for coronavirus, White House physician says
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump encountered a second individual last weekend who later tested positive for coronavirus, but the president did not require testing for the virus or quarantining, the White House physician said on Friday.

Headlines: France says pressure on Amazon workers 'unacceptable' amid lockdown
Description: Amazon  workers in France are coming under unacceptable pressure, Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said on Thursday, after staff complained they faced not getting paid if they stopped showing up due to fears of coronavirus contamination.

Headlines: Sports Direct offers Debenhams loan in return for more equity
Description: Sports Direct said on Wednesday it offered Debenhams an interest-free loan in return for a further 5 percent stake, just as the department store chain was on the brink of securing funds to fend off a bid from Sports Direct's founder, Mike Ashley, to take charge of the company.

Headlines: U.S. stocks correction overdue, Bloomberg best placed to beat Trump: Scaramucci
Description: U.S. stocks are headed higher, although a 10% correction is "long overdue", Anthony Scaramucci, founder and co-managing partner of Skybridge Capital, said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Sainsbury's Coupe says exit not due to failure of Asda deal
Description: The boss of British supermarket group Sainsbury's , Mike Coupe, said he was not stepping down in May because of his failure to buy rival Asda last year.

Headlines: Ted Baker taps Debenhams executive Osborne as new CFO
Description: British fashion retailer Ted Baker Plc  said on Thursday Rachel Osborne will become its new finance chief once she steps down from the same position at Debenhams, following just one year in the role at the department store chain.

Headlines: Shell writes down up to $2.3 billion on weaker economic outlook
Description: Royal Dutch Shell  said on Friday it expected to write down up to $2.3 billion in the fourth quarter, the latest major energy company forced to shrink estimates for sector values due to a weaker economic outlook.

Headlines: Bombardier to shed Belfast factory in revamp, shares slide on forecast fears
Description: Bombardier put its Belfast wing-making factory on the block as part of a wider shake-up, while the plane and train maker's reluctance to say it would meet 2020 goals sent shares lower.

Headlines: Wall Street roars back as trade war fears fade
Description: Wall Street scored its best day in 2-1/2 years and the Dow Jones Industrial Average saw its third-biggest point gain ever on Monday, as trade war fears eased on reports the United States and China are willing to renegotiate tariffs and trade imbalances.

Headlines: Southwest says fleet data gives it confidence in 737 MAX
Description: Southwest Airlines said on Tuesday that it remains confident in the safety and airworthiness of its 34 Boeing MAX 8 aircraft, noting that the aircraft produces thousands of data points during each flight which are constantly monitored.

Headlines: FAA must boost oversight to address Allegiant Air maintenance issues: audit
Description: The U.S. Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) needs to improve its oversight to address maintenance issues at Allegiant Air, the 11th largest U.S. carrier, according to a report seen by Reuters on Tuesday.

Headlines: Air France-KLM creates single joint venture with Chinese partners
Description: Air France, KLM , China Southern Airlines  and Xiamen Airlines will merge their existing joint venture agreements, the Franco-Dutch airline group said on Monday.

Headlines: Brexit campaigner Banks says - Cambridge Analytica pitched but we did not hire them
Description: Brexit campaigner Arron Banks said Cambridge Analytica pitched for work with the Leave.eu campaign ahead of the 2016 Brexit referendum but that ultimately it never did any work - paid or otherwise - for the campaign.

Headlines: China says U.S. solar tariffs violate trade rules, lodges WTO complaint
Description: China's commerce ministry said a U.S. decision to subsidize renewable energy firms and impose tariffs on imported products has seriously distorted the global market and harmed China's interests, firing the latest shot in a broader trade conflict.

Headlines: Huawei files to trademark mobile OS around the world after U.S. ban
Description: China's Huawei is in the process of potentially launching its "Hongmeng" operating system (OS) to replace the U.S. Android OS, an executive said on Thursday, after Reuters reported that the company has applied to trademark the OS in various countries.

Headlines: Facebook launches fact-checking service on WhatsApp in Italy to fight coronavirus hoaxes
Description: Facebook Inc. launched a service in Italy to check the accuracy of information on coronavirus circulating on its messaging platform WhatsApp, the U.S. tech firm said on Thursday.

Headlines: Lifeblood of Amazon merchants threatened as coronavirus infects Chinese workers
Description: Amazon.com Inc  sellers are bracing for product shortages as Chinese workers - worried about the fast-spreading coronavirus - may be unable or unwilling to return to idled factories.

Headlines: In farewell to U.S. shoppers, Toys 'R' Us urges 'Play on!'
Description: As Toys "R" Us Inc stores across the United States marked their final day in business on Friday, the bankrupt toy retailer posted a farewell message to customers on its website next to an image of its iconic Geoffrey the Giraffe mascot thanking them and urging them to "Play on!"

Headlines: U.S. companies in China mostly oppose tariffs, survey shows
Description: Most U.S. businesses operating in China oppose using tariffs as a weapon to solve their problems ranging from market access to poor protection of intellectual property rights, a survey suggested on Thursday.

Headlines: China says hopes countries don't abuse rules to limit investment
Description: China hopes other countries do not abuse national security rules to impede normal investment, Vice Commerce Minister Qian Keming said on Saturday.

Headlines: Subaru shares fall after NHK report of mileage cheating
Description: Japan's Subaru Corp  falsified mileage and emissions readings on hundreds of vehicles, the country's national broadcaster NHK reported on Thursday, knocking off as much as 3 percent from Subaru's share price.

Headlines: Huawei to seek remedies after being blacklisted by United States
Description: Huawei said on Thursday that it would seek ways to resolve the issue after the U.S. Commerce department blacklisted the Chinese telecoms equipment maker the previous day.

Headlines: Latest subpoena sours Chipotle's quarterly beat
Description: Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc said on Thursday it received another subpoena from U.S. federal prosecutors, seeking information related to an outbreak that left hundreds of people sick last year in one of its Ohio restaurant.

Headlines: Uber sells Southeast Asia business to Grab after costly battle
Description: Uber Technologies Inc has agreed to sell its Southeast Asian business to bigger regional rival Grab, the ride-hailing firms said on Monday, marking the U.S. company's second retreat from an Asian market.

Headlines: Accounting firms must help in Wirecard case - Germany
Description: Auditors must help with clearing up the case of Wirecard, the payments firm which disclosed a hole in its books that accountants EY said was the result of a sophisticated global fraud, the German economy ministry said on Friday

Headlines: Australia's AMP misled corporate watchdog for almost a decade: inquiry hears
Description: Australia's largest wealth manager AMP Ltd  lied to the country's corporate watchdog for almost a decade to cover its widespread practice of charging customers for services it did not provide, an inquiry heard on Tuesday.

Headlines: Advertising blitz, sugar-free Gatorade drive PepsiCo profit beat
Description: PepsiCo Inc  benefited from an ad blitz in the third quarter, beating profit and sales estimates, as more health-conscious consumers bought its low-calorie beverages and snacks in North America.

Headlines: Amazon expands physical footprint with bigger cashier-less grocery shop
Description: Amazon.com Inc  is bringing its cashier-less store technology to a larger stage.

Headlines: Walmart creates Angus beef supply chain, cutting out meat processors
Description: Walmart Inc is taking control of the supply chain for Angus beef sold in some of its stores, cutting out meat processors as the company looks to offer higher quality products in an intensely competitive grocery industry.

Headlines: StanChart expects record fall in global oil demand in 2020
Description: Standard Chartered on Tuesday said it expects global oil demand to decline by a record amount in 2020 citing the rapidly spreading coronavirus and the travel restrictions imposed to contain it.

Headlines: Santander to sell Puerto Rico unit to FirstBank in $1.1 billion deal
Description: Banco Santander  said on Monday it had agreed to sell Santander Bancorp, the Spanish lender's retail and commercial banking franchise in Puerto Rico, to FirstBank Puerto Rico in a deal valued at $1.1 billion.

Headlines: Hunt for new WPP CEO after Sorrell is 'well advanced': chairman
Description: The hunt for a new chief executive of WPP  after the sudden departure of Martin Sorrell in April is well advanced and moving ahead rapidly, Chairman Roberto Quarta told the advertising company's annual general meeting on Wednesday.

Headlines: China offers to open discussions on post-Brexit trade deal: UK minister
Description: China has offered to open discussions on a post-Brexit free trade deal with Britain, British Foreign Minister Jeremy Hunt said in Beijing on Monday.

Headlines: Facebook to double office presence in London
Description: Facebook said on Monday it would double its presence in London, acquiring nearly 600,000 square feet (56,000 square meters) of office space across two buildings in King's Cross - enough for more than 6,000 workstations.

Headlines: Hedge fund Third Point calls on Sony to spin off semiconductor unit
Description: Daniel Loeb's activist hedge fund Third Point LLC called on Sony Corp on Thursday to spin off its semiconductor business and sell off stakes in Sony Financial and other units, in order to position itself as a leading global entertainment company.

Headlines: In bail reprise, Ghosn leaves Tokyo jail, agrees to limit contact with wife
Description: Former Nissan Chairman Carlos Ghosn walked out of a Japanese jail for a second time late on Thursday, freed on $4.5 million bail after agreeing to curbs on contacting his wife as he awaits trial on financial misconduct charges.

Headlines: UK fashion retailer New Look to exit China, close 120 stores
Description: British fashion group New Look is to exit China and will close its remaining 120 stores there by the end of the year, it said on Thursday.

Headlines: Japan-U.S. shared broad understanding over trade: Japan economy minister
Description: Japan and the United States have reached a broad understanding over how to promote bilateral trade and may announce specifics on Wednesday, Economy Minister Toshimitsu Motegi was quoted as saying after meeting U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer.

Headlines: Oklahoma judge reduces Johnson & Johnson opioid payout to $465 million
Description: An Oklahoma judge on Friday said Johnson & Johnson must pay that state $465 million for fueling the opioid epidemic through the deceptive marketing of painkillers, down from his original award of $572 million.

Headlines: Julius Baer to cut jobs as profitability lags
Description: Julius Baer plans to axe 130-140 jobs, or around 2 percent of its workforce, as part of a cost-cutting plan announced on Monday, after a tough end to 2018 caused the Swiss private bank to scale back growth targets.

Headlines: Economists see deeper Argentina contraction: central bank poll
Description: Economists expect Argentina's gross domestic product to shrink 1.9 percent this year compared to a 0.3 percent previously estimated contraction, according to the median forecasts of a central bank poll published on Tuesday.

Headlines: Euronext may sweeten offer for Oslo Bors as Nasdaq makes rival bid
Description: Stock markets operator Euronext said on Monday it may increase its offer for Oslo Bors VPS after Nasdaq  made a higher rival bid.

Headlines: Instant view: Powell - Fed is 'insulated' from short-term political pressure
Description: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell on Tuesday said the U.S. central bank is "insulated from short-term political pressures," as policymakers faced new calls by President Donald Trump to cut interest rates.

Headlines: Lufthansa files motion to prevent cabin crew strike: spokeswoman
Description: Lufthansa , Germany's biggest airline, has filed a motion with a Frankfurt court to prevent a flight attendants' strike scheduled for this week, a company spokeswoman said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Ryanair not interested in buying Thomas Cook airlines
Description: Ryanair  is not interested in taking over any of the airlines of travel firm Thomas Cook , which has gone into liquidation, its chief executive said on Thursday.

Headlines: Exclusive: OPEC's new price hawk Saudi Arabia seeks oil as high as $100 - sources
Description: Top oil exporter Saudi Arabia would be happy to see crude rise to $80 or even $100 a barrel, three industry sources said, a sign Riyadh will seek no changes to an OPEC supply-cutting deal even though the agreement's original target is within sight.

Headlines: Abbott hits record high as diabetes device fuels profit beat
Description: Abbott Laboratories  beat analysts' estimates for quarterly profit and lifted its full-year earnings forecast on Wednesday, boosted by a near 64% jump in sales of its blood sugar monitoring device.

Headlines: Tencent says non-gaming business revenue contribution to rise
Description: Tencent Holdings, Asia's second-most valuable listed firm, said on Thursday its revenue mix will diversify further, with the contribution from the company's non-gaming business increasing.

Headlines: JPMorgan Chase probably unable to accept small business loan applications Friday: memo
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co  emailed many small business customers on Thursday to tell them it is still awaiting federal guidance on the small business loans program Congress approved last week, and it may not be ready to accept applications when the program launches on Friday.

Headlines: Tesla CEO Elon Musk tweets that 'coronavirus panic is dumb'
Description: Tesla Inc's Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk tweeted on Friday that the coronavirus "panic" was "dumb".

Headlines: Aurora Cannabis to take C$1 billion in charges, cuts 500 jobs as CEO exits
Description: Aurora Cannabis said Chief Executive Terry Booth will retire and Executive Chairman Michael Singer become interim CEO as the beleaguered marijuana producer announced C$1 billion ($752.79 million) in impairment charges on Thursday.

Headlines: Kinder Morgan profit, cash flow rise on Gulf Coast Express pipeline strength
Description: U.S. pipeline operator Kinder Morgan Inc  reported a 26% rise in quarterly profit on Wednesday, benefiting from higher gas takeaway from the Permian Basin through its Gulf Coast Express pipeline.

Headlines: Exclusive: Neiman Marcus creditor calls for deal with Saks Fifth Avenue - letter
Description: Hedge fund Mudrick Capital Management LP asked Neiman Marcus Group's independent directors on Tuesday to explore a combination with rival department store chain Saks Fifth Avenue, challenging the company's plan to reorganize under bankruptcy protection.

Headlines: Alphabet public market capitalization tops $1 trillion
Description: The public market capitalization of Google parent Alphabet  topped the $1 trillion mark shortly before the close of trading on Thursday, making it the fourth S&P 500 component to top the lofty level.

Headlines: Stock gains curtailed, with U.S. lower, on report U.S.-China trade deal not imminent
Description: Concerns that a trade deal between the United States and China may not be imminent reined in a rally in world equity markets and reversed gains on Wall Street on Friday, while strong U.S. wage growth boosted U.S. bond yields.

Headlines: U.S. grocer Albertsons expects IPO to raise up to $1.3 billion
Description: U.S. grocery retailer Albertsons Cos Inc said on Thursday its initial public offering would target to raise up to $1.32 billion.

Headlines: Airbus, French exporters reel as U.S. tariffs loom in subsidy row
Description: Shares in Airbus and French luxury goods exporters fell on Monday as the European Union acknowledged it may face U.S. tariffs in a long-running dispute over aircraft subsidies, part of an escalating tit-for-tat trade row.

Headlines: Any aid for Germany's Lufthansa must have strings attached: senior SPD lawmaker
Description: Any state support for Germany's largest airline, Lufthansa , must come with strings attached, a senior legislator for the Social Democrats said, suggesting that management should be banned from receiving dividends or bonuses.

Headlines: Nike misses quarterly profit estimates on higher marketing expenses
Description: Nike Inc  missed analysts' estimates for quarterly profit on Thursday, as the world's largest sportswear maker spent more on marketing and new product launches.

Headlines: U.S. manufacturing sector stabilizing, challenges remain
Description: New orders for key U.S.-made capital goods slipped in February and shipments were unchanged, but data for January was revised slightly higher, which could support views that the manufacturing sector was stabilizing.

Headlines: France nears 1-billion-euro crisis fund for aero suppliers: sources
Description: French government and industry officials are negotiating a 1-billion-euro, privately led investment fund for small aerospace suppliers in which major manufacturers could invest 200 million euros, people familiar with the proposals said on Wednesday.

Headlines: PSA first-quarter sales jump 42 percent on Opel-Vauxhall acquisition
Description: French automaker PSA Group  posted a 42 percent increase in first-quarter revenue, lifted by its acquisition of Opel-Vauxhall.

Headlines: Wall Street ends modestly lower but energy shares rise
Description: The Dow and S&P fell modestly on Monday, ending well off session lows, as gains in energy shares helped curb declines stemming from trade war concerns after China's retaliation to U.S. tariffs.

Headlines: German carmakers eye Brandenburg after Tesla expansion push
Description: The German state of Brandenburg has received a flurry of inquiries from German carmakers after electric car start-up Tesla  opted to build its European factory there, Brandenburg's Economy Minister Joerg Steinbach told Reuters.

Headlines: Ford could reopen two U.S. truck plants next Friday: source
Description: Ford Motor Co  could resume production of its best-selling F-150 pickups as early as Friday, May 18 in Dearborn and Kansas City, according to a source familiar with the automaker's plans.

Headlines: Two former Pinterest policy employees say they faced racism at work
Description: Two former Pinterest employees who left the image-sharing company in late May publicly alleged in tweets on Monday that they had experienced racial discrimination in the workplace.

Headlines: Bangladesh factory safety group seeks to delay closure, flags lingering risks
Description: A group set up by European fashion brands to improve factory safety in Bangladesh has sought a stay on a court order that calls for its local operations to end this week, its executive director said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Urban Outfitters predicts 60% fall in same-store sales on slow recovery
Description: Apparel retailer Urban Outfitters Inc  on Tuesday projected a 60% decline in same-store sales in the second quarter due to tepid demand recovery from the COVID-19 pandemic disruptions, sending its shares down 6% in extended trading.

Headlines: State-run Air India working to contain costs
Description: State-run airline Air India Ltd said on Thursday it was working to contain costs by reducing debt, aircraft lease rentals, as well as staffing and operating expenses.

Headlines: Volkswagen labour boss says will block sale of specialist assets
Description: Volkswagen's  powerful works council will continue to block the potential sale of specialist industrial assets and instead seek to work with the carmaker's new chief executive to  develop them, its labour leader told Reuters.

Headlines: Mexico and U.S. studying NAFTA rules of origin proposals - minister
Description: Mexico's economy minister Ildefonso Guajardo said on Monday the country has put forward a proposal to update the North American Free Trade Agreement's contentious rules of origin, and in turn was studying the U.S. position.

Headlines: Google to spend $1 billion on new campus in New York
Description: Alphabet Inc's  Google is investing more than $1 billion on a new campus in New York, becoming the second major technology company after Amazon to pick America's financial capital to expand and create thousands of jobs.

Headlines: Renault chairman vows to get Nissan alliance back on track next year
Description: Renault Chairman Jean-Dominique Senard is determined to get the carmaker's alliance with Japan's Nissan  back on track next year, he said on Tuesday, adding other matters such as a potential tie-up with Fiat Chrysler were less of a priority.

Headlines: Audi says no cars in U.S. affected by latest emissions issue
Description: Audi  said on Tuesday that no cars in the United States were affected by its latest emissions software issues.

Headlines: Panasonic to exit solar production at Tesla's New York plant as partnership frays
Description: Panasonic Corp  said it would exit solar cell production at Tesla Inc's New York plant, the latest sign of strain in a partnership where Panasonic's status as the U.S. electric vehicle (EV) maker's exclusive battery supplier is ending.

Headlines: Nissan grants Renault execs boardroom seats, ending dispute
Description: Japan's Nissan said on Friday it would grant alliance member Renault's representatives seats on key committees of its board, ending a dispute between the two automakers.

Headlines: White House's Kudlow: Not certain what U.S. will do on China's ZTE: Politico
Description: White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Tuesday it was far from certain what steps the U.S. government would take on China's ZTE Corp, which he characterized as an enforcement, rather than trade, issue.

Headlines: Wall Street falls as U.S.-China tariffs kick in
Description: The S&P 500 and the Dow closed lower on Monday after a new round of U.S.-China trade tariffs kicked in, dampening last week's hopes for talks between the two countries, and as investors awaited a widely expected interest rate hike by the Federal Reserve.

Headlines: Johnson & Johnson cuts price of TB drug bedaquiline in poorer countries
Description: Johnson & Johnson  said on Monday it was slashing the price of its version of tuberculosis drug bedaquiline to $340 from $400, for a six-month treatment, in low- and middle-income countries, to scale up its use during the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Google's fight against EU antitrust fine to be heard February 12-14 at EU court
Description: Alphabet unit Google's fight against a 2.4-billion-euro ($2.64 billion) EU antitrust fine will be played out over three days in February 2020 at Europe's second-highest court, according to parties involved in the case.

Headlines: Ford's slow China run persists, sales skid again in March
Description: Ford Motor Co's business in China continues to falter amid a dearth of fresh products, even though the American automaker earlier this week said it plans to launch two new models in the world's biggest auto market by the end of the year.

Headlines: Boeing assumptions on 737 MAX emergency response faulted: NTSB
Description: Boeing Co  failed to adequately consider how pilots respond to cockpit emergencies in its 737 MAX safety assessment and may need to make changes to flight deck alerts, pilot procedures and training, the National Transportation Safety Board said.

Headlines: Citi raises minimum wage to $15 per hour
Description: Citigroup Inc.  raised its minimum wage to $15 per hour earlier this year following pressure from politicians and similar moves by other big banks.

Headlines: Telecom Italia reappoints Genish as CEO after Elliott coup
Description: Telecom Italia (TIM)  reappointed Amos Genish as chief executive on Monday, as the phone group enters a new phase after activist fund Elliott wrestled board control from top shareholder Vivendi .

Headlines: Uber drivers go on strike in London and U.S. ahead of IPO, early protests sparse
Description: Uber drivers in London and major U.S. cities held a series of strikes on Wednesday to protest the disparity between gig-economy conditions and the sums that investors are likely to make in Friday's blockbuster stock market debut.

Headlines: Fed done raising interest rates; significant chance of cut in 2020: Reuters poll
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve is done raising interest rates until at least the end of next year, according to economists in a Reuters poll who gave a 40 percent chance of at least one rate cut by end-2020.

Headlines: Some U.S. metals importers resigned to higher prices as Trump's tariffs bite
Description: U.S. metals importers that applied last year for exemptions from tariffs on steel and aluminum are losing hope the Commerce Department will approve their petitions, as the recent government shutdown added to a wait that for some has stretched to eight months without a ruling.

Headlines: Algeria energy minister says OPEC+ countries to discuss 'substantial' oil output cuts
Description: Algeria energy minister and OPEC president said on Tuesday OPEC+ countries will discuss new "substantial" oil production cuts at their meetings in Vienna this week, Algerian state news agency APS reported.

Headlines: U.S. judge blocks Qualcomm effort to put antitrust ruling on hold
Description: A U.S. judge on Wednesday ruled against Qualcomm Inc's effort to block the implementation of a sweeping antitrust ruling against it as the mobile chip supplier pursues an appeal that could take more than a year to wind through the courts.

Headlines: Stocks climb on Huawei extension, buoying U.S. Treasuries
Description: Global equity markets edged higher on Monday, lifting prices of U.S. government debt, as a 90-day extension allowing U.S. companies to do business with China's Huawei eased the latest spike in investor angst over U.S.-Sino trade tensions.

Headlines: Sprint sues AT&T over 5G branding
Description: Sprint Corp sued AT&T Inc late on Thursday, saying it was misleading consumers into believing that they were using fifth generation or 5G wireless network, a technology that has not yet been widely deployed.

Headlines: China's state media urges U.S. industry to rally against Trump tariff threat
Description: Chinese state media on Sunday called on industrial and commercial sectors in the United States to rally against President Donald Trump's plans for an additional $100 billion in tariffs against Chinese goods.

Headlines: Chinese consumers snap up yoga mats, video games, condoms as coronavirus keeps them at home
Description: As the coronavirus epidemic keeps hundreds of millions of Chinese stuck at home, they're shopping online to stave off boredom with games for Nintendo's  Switch console, yoga mats, books and condoms all showing big jumps in orders.

Headlines: U.S.-China trade negotiations set to resume on October 10: CNBC
Description: Trade talks between the United States and China are set to resume on Oct. 10 in Washington, CNBC reported on Thursday, citing three people close to the talks.

Headlines: Investors scope out potential European wins from U.S.-China frictions
Description: Nobody wins a trade war, International Monetary Fund chief Christine Lagarde said in March. But for some European companies, a bit of friction couldn't hurt.

Headlines: Ryanair cancels 1 percent of flights on Friday as strike crisis deepens
Description: Ryanair  plans to cancel only 1 percent of its flights during a strike by Ireland-based pilots on Friday, but Europe's largest low-cost airline is bracing for far wider industrial action across five countries next week.

Headlines: Facebook unites payment service across apps with Facebook Pay
Description: Facebook Inc  said on Tuesday it was launching Facebook Pay, a unified payment service through which users across its platforms including WhatsApp and Instagram can make payments without exiting the app.

Headlines: U.S. Treasury taps Wall Street firms for aid advice: sources
Description: The U.S. Treasury Department has hired Wall Street bankers and lawyers to advise on providing tens of billions of dollars in aid to the airline, cargo and defense sectors, people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler to be in net cash position by end of June: CEO
Description: Fiat Chrysler will end the second quarter in a net cash position, Chief Executive Sergio Marchionne said on Friday, kicking off the company's five-year strategy presentation.

Headlines: Timeline: Key dates in the U.S.-China trade war
Description: Top U.S. and Chinese trade officials met on Thursday for the first time since late July to try to find their way out of a bitter, 15-month trade war as new irritants between the world's two largest economies threatened to dash hopes for progress.

Headlines: Telecoms lobby demands access to high-band spectrum for 5G
Description: The global telecoms industry on Tuesday demanded access to the high-capacity spectrum it says it needs to support data-intensive 5G services, accusing the space lobby of hogging frequencies in a way that could stunt the technology.

Headlines: U.S. business groups warn 'Buy America' order would harm pandemic response
Description: White House plans to expand "Buy America" mandates to the medical equipment and pharmaceutical sectors could worsen shortages of urgently needed medicines and delay discovery of a vaccine for the new coronavirus, over 80 business groups warned.

Headlines: U.S. fights AT&T deal by citing Time Warner's clout with cable companies
Description: The Justice Department, seeking to stop AT&T Inc's deal to purchase Time Warner Inc, sought on Monday to show how often Time Warner subsidiary Turner would threaten to cut off cable companies to win concessions during contract negotiations.

Headlines: Daimler braced for emissions-test impact as profit weakens
Description: Mercedes maker Daimler  blamed U.S.-China tariffs for a 30 percent drop in second-quarter profit and predicted a further decline as new emissions test standards hit sales.

Headlines: U.S. buyback announcements slow, but on track for $1 trillion: TrimTabs
Description: U.S. companies' taste for their own shares is set to push buybacks past the $1 trillion-a-year mark for the first time as soon as November, TrimTabs Investment Research said, even as its latest data showed the pace of new repurchase announcements slowing during the second-quarter reporting season.

Headlines: Factbox: What to know about Facebook's content oversight board
Description: Facebook Inc  on Wednesday announced the first 20 members of its independent oversight board that can overrule the companys own content moderation decisions. Here are some key facts about how the board will work:

Headlines: Lufthansa has good prospects for future: German ministries
Description: The German Finance and Economy Ministries on Monday said Lufthansa  was an operationally healthy company before the coronavirus outbreak, as well as profitable and with good future prospects, but had got into trouble due to the pandemic.

Headlines: Colombian businesses call for more aid after quarantine extension
Description: Colombian businesses on Tuesday called on the government to expand measures to help companies weather coronavirus, after President Ivan Duque extended a nationwide lockdown by two weeks.

Headlines: Airbus Helicopters sees 18-month wait for oil & gas demand pick-up
Description: Airbus expects it will be another 18 months before it sees the first signs of a recovery in demand for large helicopters from the oil and gas industry, the head of its helicopter division said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Vodafone steps up fight for Liberty deal with German access offer
Description: Vodafone stepped up its battle to gain regulatory approval for its Liberty Global deal on Tuesday by offering rival Telefonica Deutschland access to its enlarged high-speed broadband network.

Headlines: No Santa Rally? Trade fears threaten Wall Street's end of decade
Description: Wall Street's poor start to December has some investors bracing for a choppy end-of-year as fears about the U.S.-China trade war resurface.

Headlines: Kazakhstan confirms global deal to cut oil output by 9.7 million bpd
Description: Kazakhastan's Energy Ministry said on Sunday it confirmed reports that the OPEC+ group of countries had agreed to cut the global oil output by 9.7 million barrels per day for two months starting on May 1.

Headlines: Intercontinental Exchange abandons deal talks with eBay
Description: New York Stock Exchange owner Intercontinental Exchange Inc (ICE)  said it had decided to stop exploring deal options with eBay Inc , just hours after its chief executive said he would "love" to speak with the e-commerce company.

Headlines: Lawsuit targets 'hidden fees' in Wells Fargo finance programs
Description: Wells Fargo & Co has been hit with a lawsuit by a Texas jewelry company accusing it of encouraging thousands of retailers nationwide to charge hidden fees to customers using financing programs created by the bank.

Headlines: U.S. retail sales post biggest gain in one-and-a-half years in March
Description: U.S. retail sales increased by the most in 1-1/2 years in March as households boosted purchases of motor vehicles and a range of other goods, the latest indication that economic growth picked up in the first quarter after a false start.

Headlines: Bank of America raises planned Paris job moves before Brexit: sources
Description: Bank of America is looking to move more jobs than originally envisaged to its new Paris office, in what is expected to be one of the biggest such shifts from London ahead of Brexit, two sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: World stocks jump on less dire virus data, oil falls after OPEC+ delay
Description: World stock markets jumped on Monday, encouraged by slowdowns in coronavirus-related deaths and new cases in some global hot spots, while oil prices tumbled again due to a delay in talks between Saudi Arabia and Russia to cut supply.

Headlines: U.S. judge puts Amazon challenge to Pentagon JEDI contract on hold
Description: A U.S. judge on Friday put on hold a suit by Amazon.com Inc  challenging the Pentagon's decision to award a $10 billion contract to Microsoft Corp .

Headlines: Future Retail secures deal to open 7-Eleven stores in India
Description: U.S.-based 7-Eleven Inc expects to open its first branded store in India this year, after reaching a deal with Future Retail Ltd to run the chain in the Asian nation.

Headlines: Britain's Lloyds Banking Group suffers hours-long online outage
Description: Britain's Lloyds Banking Group  suffered an outage on Wednesday that left customers of its Lloyds, Halifax and Bank of Scotland operations unable to access accounts online for several hours.

Headlines: U.S. watchdog proposes national standard for disclosing expired debt
Description: The U.S. consumer watchdog on Friday proposed establishing a national standard for how debt collectors must inform borrowers when they cannot be sued for expired debt.

Headlines: Pfizer veteran Ian Read to retire as executive chairman
Description: Pfizer Inc  said on Friday Ian Read will retire as executive chairman at the end of this year, after a four-decade association with the largest U.S. drugmaker that included eight years as chief executive officer.

Headlines: Boeing-Embraer deal on knife-edge as markets tumble
Description: Brazil has upheld proposals by Boeing Co  to buy the jetmaking arm of Embraer , but plunging markets have raised urgent questions over the fate of the $4.2 billion deal as aviation reels from the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Women running the money? Rarely at hedge funds
Description: Generous salary and juicy bonus? Check. Client meetings at private members' club? Check. Swanky Mayfair office? Check. Company maternity scheme? Maybe, well get back to you.

Headlines: Conoco has seized Venezuela PDVSA products from Isla refinery: Curacao
Description: U.S. oil major ConocoPhillips  has seized products belonging to Venezuelan state oil company PDVSA [PDVSA.UL] from the Isla refinery it runs on Curacao, an island official told Reuters on Sunday.

Headlines: Ford plans to close Bordeaux plant if no buyer found
Description: Ford  plans to close its Blanquefort gearbox plant in southwestern France if no buyer can be found for the site, which employs 900 workers, the U.S. carmaker said on Thursday.

Headlines: Facebook shares drop as executives quit, Christchurch live-stream shooting stirs outrage
Description: Shares of Facebook Inc fell as much as 5 percent on Friday to their lowest in nearly three months after the surprise departure of Chief Product Officer Chris Cox, at a time when the company is again being scrutinized over its handling of privacy, extremism and political content.

Headlines: Trump panel wants to give USPS right to hike prices for Amazon, others
Description: The United States Postal Service should have more flexibility to raise rates for packages, according to recommendations from a task force set up by President Donald Trump, a move that could hurt profits of Amazon.com Inc and other large online retailers.

Headlines: Financial Times reaches a million paying readers
Description: The Financial Times has reached a milestone of a million paying readers, it said on Monday, with revenues and profits continuing to rise since the London-based business publication was acquired by Japan's Nikkei from Pearson in 2015.

Headlines: U.S. Treasury chief to plan for trade meeting in China soon: spokesman
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin will plan for another trade meeting in China at some point soon, a Treasury spokesman said on Tuesday, adding to President Donald Trump's earlier statements that U.S. dialogue with Beijing was continuing.

Headlines: U.S. closely following Danske Bank money laundering case: paper
Description: U.S. authorities are closely following an investigation into Danske Bank  over allegations that Denmark's biggest lender had been involved in money laundering through its Estonian branch.

Headlines: Ghosn's family taps U.N. rights working group to show violations in detention
Description: Carlos Ghosn's lawyers have submitted a dossier to a United Nations' working group which showed that the former head of Renault's rights had been violated during detention in Japan, one if his lawyers said on Monday.

Headlines: Fed's Evans sees one or two more rate hikes this year
Description: Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago President Charles Evans said on Friday that two further interest-rate hikes this year by the U.S. central bank would not be surprising, given the strength of the economy.

Headlines: Corporate earnings boost most stocks, oil surges higher
Description: U.S. stocks ended mixed on Wednesday while most other global shares rose, as investors were drawn to riskier assets because of upbeat earnings from companies in Europe and the United States.

Headlines: Lagardere may get help from allies in fight with Amber Capital
Description: Lagardere  gained almost 13% on Thursday after Les Echos reported the French multimedia conglomerate could get help from French tycoon Vincent Bollore and Marc Ladreit de Lacharrire, who heads finance group Fimalac, in its fight with  Amber Capital.

Headlines: EU investigates decision to hire BlackRock to advise on green rules for banks
Description: The European Commission's decision to hire BlackRock , the world's largest asset manager, to advise it on new environmental rules for banks, has triggered an investigation by the European Ombudsman following complaints by several lawmakers and a civil group.

Headlines: Tesla resumes tree cutting in Germany to build Gigafactory
Description: Tesla Inc  said it had resumed tree cutting in Gruenheide, Germany so it can construct its first European car and battery factory following moves by environmentalists to stop local deforestation.

Headlines: Trump trade adviser says administration will help farmers: CNBC
Description: White House trade adviser Peter Navarro on Thursday defended U.S. trade action toward China, saying it ultimately would lead to free trade after imbalances are corrected and that the Trump administration would help American farmers who could take an economic hit in the process.

Headlines: Citi sets restrictions on gun sales by retail clients
Description: Citigroup Inc  added restrictions on firearms sales for new retail-sector clients, the Wall Street bank said on Thursday, the strongest move to date by a major U.S. lender following last month's high school shooting in Florida.

Headlines: Daimler vows to cut costs after one-offs bring loss
Description: Luxury carmaker Daimler  said it would intensify cost cuts after legal risks for diesel-related issues and the cost of replacing Takata airbags triggered a 1.56 billion euros ($1.74 billion) loss before interest and taxes in the second quarter.

Headlines: Global energy players converge on Washington as China trade war lurks
Description: The worlds biggest oil and gas players are gathering for a summit in Washington D.C. this week that will be overshadowed by the specter of shifting trade patterns due to a trade dispute between the United States and China.

Headlines: Peugeot signals openness to deals after JLR report
Description: PSA Group said on Thursday it was ready to consider potential tie-ups, after the French carmaker's shares briefly rose on a report that it was in advanced talks with Tata Motors to acquire UK-based Jaguar Land Rover (JLR).

Headlines: Wells Fargo moves jobs abroad after U.S. layoffs, government says
Description: Wells Fargo & Co.  has been hiring overseas after pledging to eliminate thousands of jobs, according to a Department of Labor investigation.

Headlines: U.S. Disneyland workers say proposed July reopening may be too early
Description: Unions representing 17,000 workers at Walt Disney Co's Disneyland Resort in California have told the state's governor they are not convinced the theme park will be safe enough to reopen by the company's July target date.

Headlines: Trump says China woes help U.S. in trade talks, downplays Apple warning
Description: President Donald Trump on Friday downplayed a revenue warning from Apple Inc that cited slowing sales in China and said China's weakening economic growth puts the United States in a strong position as negotiators from the world's two largest economies prepare for trade talks next week.

Headlines: Exclusive: Spain's Repsol suspended swap deal for Venezuelan oil under U.S. pressure
Description: Spain's Repsol suspended its swaps of refining products for crude with Venezuela's state-run oil company PDVSA, people familiar with the matter said, as U.S. officials weighed penalties for foreign firms doing business with Venezuela.

Headlines: Bitcoin tumbles as U.S. senators grill Facebook on crypto plans
Description: The cryptocurrency market took a beating on Tuesday with bitcoin losing over 10% in value after U.S. lawmakers grilled Facebook on its cryptocurrency plans, as political and regulatory scrutiny of digital coins intensifies.

Headlines: Intellia CEO not involved in Starboard's Bristol-Myers board challenge
Description: Intellia Therapeutics Inc Chief Executive John Leonard, who U.S. drug maker Bristol-Myers Squibb Co said last week was nominated by hedge fund Starboard Value LP to sit on its board, is not affiliated with the effort, an Intellia spokeswoman said on Thursday.

Headlines: T-Mobile/Sprint urge court for deal approval, states warn of price hikes
Description: A group of U.S. states suing to block T-Mobile US Inc from merging with Sprint Corp on Wednesday told a federal judge that the deal would raise prices for consumers, while the phone companies pushed back and emphasized they would compete aggressively to push prices down.

Headlines: UniCredit CEO Mustier ruled out of HSBC role: source
Description: UniCredit Chief Executive Jean Pierre Mustier has ruled himself out of a switch to European rival HSBC , a source with knowledge of the matter told Reuters on Sunday.

Headlines: New $1 billion fund aims to steer antibiotic companies in tough market
Description: Several large drugmakers including Merck & Co Inc  and Pfizer Inc  on Thursday unveiled a $1 billion fund to bolster struggling antibiotic companies and sustain a pipeline for new treatments.

Headlines: Mexican Senate should ratify USMCA trade deal 'soon': president
Description: Mexico's government will send a new North American trade deal on Thursday to the Senate, which should ratify the accord "soon," President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said at a news briefing.

Headlines: Oil jump lifts Wall Street as jobless claims data surges
Description: U.S. stocks rallied on Thursday as hopes for a truce in the price war between Saudi Arabia and Russia and a cut in oil output drove gains, taking some sting out of a shocking jump in Americans filing jobless claims due to coronavirus-led lockdowns.

Headlines: Virgin Atlantic to cut 3,000 jobs, stop using Gatwick: Sky News
Description: Virgin Atlantic is to cut just over 3,000 jobs, or up to a third of its workforce, and stop using Gatwick Airport as part of its battle to survive, Sky News reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco sees full oil production from attacked sites by end September
Description: Saudi state oil company Aramco said it will bring back by end September full crude output at Abqaiq and Khurais, the two oil facilities damaged by attacks last weekend that U.S. officials have blamed on Iran.

Headlines: Intel buys software business from Canada's Pivot Technology in 5G push
Description: Intel Corp  has agreed to purchase a software business from Toronto-based Pivot Technology Solutions Inc  for $27 million, the U.S. chipmaker said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Softbank's Saudi-backed Vision Fund to raise $4 billion in debt
Description: SoftBank's  Vision Fund is raising $4 billion in debt to help finance acquisitions and has hired Goldman Sachs  and Mizuho  to work on the deal, a presentation seen by Reuters said.

Headlines: U.S. senators hold call with Saudi officials urging them to put oil cut in motion
Description: Republican U.S. senators from oil states who recently introduced  legislation to remove American troops from Saudi Arabia said on Saturday they had spoken with three officials from the kingdom and urged them to take concrete action to cut crude output.

Headlines: French fiscal administration launches probe over Ghosn's wealth: Liberation
