Description: The French fiscal administration has launched an in-depth probe into the wealth of former Renault-Nissan Chairman Carlos Ghosn, French daily Liberation reported on Sunday, citing sources.

Headlines: Goldman CEO memo calls Apple Card 'a beginning' on launch day
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc  officially became a credit-card lender on Tuesday by rolling out its first product with Apple Inc , but the bank has aspirations to grow much bigger in consumer lending, its chief executive said in an internal memo viewed by Reuters.

Headlines: Biden previews manufacturing plan to counter 'America First' president
Description: Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden on Tuesday promised to revive U.S. manufacturing so that the country is not dependent on China, taking aim at his rival's promises to revive factories.

Headlines: S&P 500 ends slightly lower on earnings disappointments; yields slip
Description: U.S. stocks cut sharp early losses to end mostly down slightly on Thursday as some disappointing earnings reports offset strong economic data, while bond yields slid after a surprising drop in euro zone inflation data.

Headlines: China has invited Lighthizer, Mnuchin for further trade talks: CNN
Description: Beijing has officially invited U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer, Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin, and their teams for further trade talks in China, a CNN reporter said in a tweet https://twitter.com/CristinaAlesci/status/1182700642416152583?s=20 on Friday.

Headlines: China, U.S. maintain close contact on trade issues: foreign ministry
Description: China's Foreign Ministry said on Friday China and the United States have maintained close contact on bilateral trade issues.

Headlines: VW creates entry-level JETTA brand to capture first-time buyers
Description: Volkswagen on Tuesday said it will launch an entry-level JETTA brand in China in the third quarter this year, as a way to capture first-time buyers in the world's largest car market which has started to sputter.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler CEO: We'll talk alliances, but we can go it alone
Description: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles  Chief Executive has a message for Renault SA and other would-be partners: We are happy to talk, but we can go it alone.

Headlines: Air France KLM raises estimate of impact from strikes to 400 million euros
Description: Air France KLM  has raised its estimate of the impact to the company from a wave of strikes to around 400 million euros ($473.6 million), compared to a previous 300 million euros estimate, said a group spokeswoman on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. says EU stalling on Airbus, blocks request for WTO compliance panel
Description: The United States said on Wednesday the European Union and four of its planemaker states have failed to bring subsidies for Airbus  into line with a WTO ruling of last May, an accusation refuted by the EU.

Headlines: Trade war backfire: Steel tariff shrapnel hits U.S. farmers
Description: Lucas Strom, who runs a century-old family farm in rural Illinois, canceled an order to buy a new $71,000 grain storage bin last month - after the seller raised the price 5 percent in a day.

Headlines: Dollar falls on rising inflation expectations, higher euro
Description: The dollar fell in North American trade on Tuesday as expectations for inflation picked up slightly and the euro rose on optimism about the possibility of a European Union stimulus package.

Headlines: World shares hit two-month high, dollar firms as Trump speech nears
Description: World stocks rose to a fresh two-month high on Tuesday to keep up their fast start to 2019 while the U.S. dollar strengthened for a fourth straight session as investors looked toward an annual address by the U.S. president later in the evening.

Headlines: Guatemala bans arrivals from U.S., Canada to fight coronavirus
Description: Guatemala will from Monday widen travel restrictions to fight the spread of coronavirus, banning arrivals from the United States and Canada, President Alejandro Giammattei said on Friday.

Headlines: Shares, dollar rebound on thaw in U.S.-China trade war
Description: U.S. and European stocks jumped, the dollar strengthened and Treasury yields rose on Tuesday after the United States said it would delay tariffs on some Chinese products, easing concerns that a protracted trade war would harm global growth.

Headlines: Longer, greener, broader: strategies for a world awash in new bonds
Description: Century bonds and green bonds, the first 20-year U.S. Treasury issue in decades, securities for mom-and-pop investors and with growth-linked payouts -- a borrowing binge is forcing governments to think creatively to get the funds they need.

Headlines: Biogen scraps two Alzheimer drug trials, wipes $18 billion from market value
Description: Biogen Inc and partner Eisai Co Ltd are ending two late-stage trials of their experimental Alzheimer's disease drug aducanumab, a major setback in the quest to find a treatment for the mind-wasting disease and a blow to Biogen, which lost more than $18 billion of its value on Thursday.

Headlines: Wall St. climbs as weak private jobs data boost rate cut hopes
Description: Wall Street's major indexes rose on Wednesday as investors bet on a Federal Reserve interest rate cut after weak private sector jobs data and hopes grew that the United States and Mexico would reach an agreement to avoid U.S. tariffs on Mexican goods.

Headlines: Petrobras should focus on oil exploration and production: incoming CEO
Description: The incoming chief executive of Brazilian state-controlled oil company Petroleo Brasileiro SA  said in a newspaper interview on Monday that BR Distribuidora , its fuel distribution unit, is not a natural fit for the company and does not generate returns.

Headlines: Public Storage only bidder left for National Storage with $1.25 billion bid
Description: U.S.-based Public Storage  emerged on Friday as the likely buyer of Australia's largest self-storage operator National Storage REIT  with its current A$1.89 billion ($1.25 billion) offer, after two rivals dropped out of the race.

Headlines: Factbox: OPEC+ talks face challenges over baseline for cuts and U.S. role
Description: OPEC and its allies hold talks on Thursday to discuss plans for the biggest coordinated oil output cut in history but two hurdles remain: reaching a deal on the levels from which to make reductions and securing the participation of the United States.

Headlines: Threading the needle: Boeing's cost challenge for new mid-sized jet
Description: Boeing Co  played for time on its proposed new mid-sized jet at the Farnborough Airshow last week, announcing it would decide next year whether to launch its first all-new plane in a decade and giving itself 9-12 months to hone its business case.

Headlines: Man GLG hires Asia equities head from rival BlackRock
Description: Man GLG, the discretionary investment arm of asset manager Man Group , has hired Andrew Swan from rival BlackRock  to lead its Asia ex-Japan equities business, it said on Thursday.

Headlines: Tesla Autopilot engaged in 2018 California crash; driver's hands off wheel: NTSB
Description: The National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) said on Tuesday that a Tesla Model S was in Autopilot mode and the driver's hands were off the wheel when it struck a fire truck in Culver City, California, one of a series of crashes the board is investigating involving Tesla's driver assistance system.

Headlines: Tyre industry pushes back against evidence of plastic pollution
Description: A growing body of scientific research linking tyre wear to microplastic pollution, as well as increasing scrutiny from lawmakers in the European Union (EU), has led the $180 billion-a-year tyre industry to fight back.

Headlines: Appeals court sides with exchanges in U.S. SEC fee row
Description: A U.S. appeals court ruled on Tuesday that the Securities and Exchange Commission cannot force stock exchanges to conduct a costly experiment to see how the fees they charge and the incentives they offer affect brokers' trading habits.

Headlines: From wind tunnels to megadeals, the Boeing sales boss facing new MAX storm
Description: Days after stealing the Paris Airshow with a deal to sell 200 of the grounded 737 MAX, Boeing's sales chief faces fallout from the discovery of a new flaw that will delay the jet's return to service.

Headlines: After the triumph of Animal Crossing, a thin pipeline for Nintendo
Description: The runaway success of Nintendo Co Ltd's  island life simulator Animal Crossing: New Horizons has overshadowed an uncomfortable fact for fans of the Switch console - it lacks upcoming titles.

Headlines: Apple, Amazon, Google partner to make smart home devices more compatible
Description: Amazon.com Inc , Apple Inc  and Alphabet Inc's  Google are partnering to lay the groundwork for better compatibility among their smart home products, the companies said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Commerce Department bars U.S. companies from selling to China's ZTE
Description: The United States has banned American companies from selling telecommunications equipment to China's ZTE Corp after the Chinese company illegally shipped telecom equipment to Iran and North Korea, the Commerce Department said on Monday.

Headlines: Factbox: Big U.S. auto dealers have significant import exposure
Description: Several U.S. auto dealers derive a significant portion of their revenue from imported vehicles, which could be affected if tariffs are imposed on auto imports.

Headlines: BP launches $3 billion sale of U.S. onshore assets to fund BHP deal: sources
Description: Britain's BP has launched the sale of U.S. oil and gas onshore assets that could raise more than $3 billion to help pay for other fields in the United States it bought in October from BHP , industry and banking sources said.

Headlines: Wall Street eyes earnings stabilizer after FAANG stocks wobble
Description: Wall Street is hoping that first-quarter earnings growth and corporate forecasts are strong enough to bring the FAANG group of stocks back into favor and take the spotlight off worries that caused the recent sell-off in the high-flying group.

Headlines: Exclusive: Pompeo to meet oil executives, push U.S. crude exports, Iran policy - sources
Description: U.S. Secretary Of State Mike Pompeo will meet with top oil executives before he addresses a conference on Tuesday, seeking to get them to help the administration's effort to boost crude exports to Asia and to support its policy of isolating Iran, according to three people at two companies briefed on the agenda.

Headlines: Wall Street Week Ahead: Data will show damage of tariffs, strong dollar on U.S. goods exporters
Description: It's no longer a probability, it's a reality: the escalating U.S.-China trade war and the strengthening dollar appear to be inflicting measurable damage on U.S. goods makers that rely on global markets.

Headlines: Amazon Music cuts monthly price to 99 cents for students with Prime subscription
Description: Amazon.com Inc  on Tuesday lowered the price of its paid music service to 99 cents per month from $4.99 for students with a Prime subscription.

Headlines: Bed Bath & Beyond hires Target executive as CEO
Description: Bed Bath & Beyond Inc  on Wednesday hired Target Corp's  Mark Tritton as chief executive officer, months after its long-time head, Steven Temares, left the company under pressure from activist investors, sending its shares up 23%.

Headlines: Apple News users reach 100 million, App Store sales rise
Description: Apple Inc's  news service has reached 100 million monthly active users and customers spent more than $1.4 billion in the App Store between Christmas and New Year, the latest signs of growing revenue from the iPhone maker's services business.

Headlines: Blackstone to invest $400 million in gene therapy venture with Ferring
Description: Blackstone Group Inc  said on Monday it will invest $400 million in a joint venture with Swiss drug company Ferring that is working on an experimental gene therapy for bladder cancer, the private equity giant's largest ever bet on drug development.

Headlines: Florida risk helped ruin Uber for insurer James River
Description: A Bermuda-based insurer that recently severed ties with an Uber Technologies Inc affiliate said on Thursday the risk of providing driver ride-hailing coverage had become too great and that it had mispriced policies during its initial years on the account.

Headlines: Brookfield to buy most of Oaktree to build juggernaut to rival Blackstone
Description: Brookfield Asset Management Inc said on Wednesday it will buy most of Oaktree Capital Management  in a roughly $4.8 billion deal, creating an alternative-asset manager that will challenge the likes of industry giant Blackstone Group.

Headlines: Giant Aramco listing a critical test for young Saudi exchange
Description: The imminent listing of oil giant Aramco will be a pivotal moment for Saudi Arabia's young and untested Tadawul stock exchange.

Headlines: In Vietnam, a mega casino rises with the help of a Macau junket company
Description: Along a three-kilometer (2-mile) stretch of coastline in central Vietnam, construction cranes are digging up mounds of sand and rubble where the country's biggest casino is set to open next year.

Headlines: Virgin Australia has 20 potential buyers, deal seen by June: administrators
Description: Virgin Australia Holdings Ltd's  administrators said on Thursday they had given eight potential buyers access to a data room and were negotiating with another 12 about doing so as they seek to sell the country's second-biggest airline by end-June.

Headlines: AB InBev enrolls Citi, BAML to work on $5 billion Asia IPO: sources
Description: Anheuser-Busch InBev has enlisted Citigroup and Bank of America Merrill Lynch (BAML) to the team of banks working on the sale of its Asia-Pacific business, three people with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Wall Street volatility raises fears of another selloff
Description: The evaporation of a rally on Wall Street in the closing minutes of Tuesday's session shows that many investors fear the U.S. stock market is in danger of a renewed tumble due to uncertainty surrounding  the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Trump says SoftBank Son's U.S. investment hitting $72 billion
Description: MT. PLEASANT, Wis. - U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday SoftBank Group Corp  Chief Executive Masayoshi Son is increasing his investment in the United States to $72 billion, significantly more than the $50 billion he had previously pledged.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler faces $79 million U.S. penalty for fuel economy shortfall
Description: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV on Wednesday said it faces a $79 million U.S. civil penalty for failing to meet 2017 fuel economy requirements, as regulators reported more  automakers were falling short of U.S. greenhouse gas emissions standards.

Headlines: Daimler CFO won't renew his term when it ends in 2019
Description: Daimler's  finance chief Bodo Uebber won't seek to renew his contract when it expires in December 2019, the carmaker said late on Sunday.

Headlines: Boeing 737 MAX boosted by IAG plan to order 200 jets
Description: Boeing's grounded 737 MAX jet received a boost on Tuesday after British Airways-owner IAG signed a letter of intent to order 200 of the planes and said it was confident that it would return to service in the coming months.

Headlines: Roche to complete $4.3 billion Spark deal as regulators give all clear
Description: Swiss drugmaker Roche  plans to complete its $4.3 billion takeover of gene therapy specialist Spark Therapeutics  on Tuesday after U.S. and British authorities ruled the deal would not hurt competition in hemophilia A treatment.

Headlines: World stock markets slip on second wave virus fears, safe-havens rise
Description: Global stock markets meandered on Thursday as a continued rise in coronavirus cases dashed hopes of a swift recovery from the pandemic-induced economic slump and drove demand for safe-haven currencies such as the dollar and Japanese yen.

Headlines: Oil climbs on Venezuelan crisis despite surging U.S. supply
Description: Oil prices edged higher on Friday as political turmoil in Venezuela threatened to tighten crude supply, but concerns over surging U.S. fuel stocks and global economic woes weighed on sentiment.

Headlines: Facebook attempts to turn its cheek on the charts
Description: Reuters - ** In wake of plunge that saw Facebook FB.O press against significant support, shares attempting to show their good side again on the charts

Headlines: Factbox: Reaction after EU court strikes down transatlantic data transfer deal
Description: Europe's top court on Thursday quashed a transatlantic data transfer deal for the second time because of U.S. surveillance concerns in a ruling that could disrupt thousands of companies that rely on the pact.

Headlines: Daimler, Bosch to deploy self-driving taxis in California test program
Description: German automaker Daimler AG and auto supplier Bosch Corp [ROBSCJ.UL] will deploy self-driving taxis in California's Silicon Valley region next year as part of a test program of vehicles designed for city driving, the two companies said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Renault-FCA merger idea remains good opportunity: France's Le Maire
Description: The idea of a merger between Renault SA and Fiat Chrysler (FCA) remains a good opportunity, but nothing has changed in terms of the conditions the French government has set, French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said on Monday.

Headlines: Ubisoft announces staff departures after misconduct allegations
Description: French video games group Ubisoft announced several staff departures on Saturday after conducting a review in response to allegations of misconduct at the company, which earlier reports said centered around sexual misconduct charges.

Headlines: UK says bailing out Thomas Cook would have thrown 'good money after bad'
Description: The British government decided there was no point bailing out Thomas Cook as it would have been a waste of taxpayers' money to throw good money into a business that was not meeting the needs of its customers, the business minister said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Regulators weigh 'startle factors' for Boeing 737 MAX pilot training - Transport Canada executive
Description: Global regulators are looking at "startle factors" that can overwhelm pilots as they consider revised protocols for the Boeing 737 MAX, Nicholas Robinson, the head of civil aviation for Transport Canada, told Reuters on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. Commerce Department to announce section 232 tariff changes
Description: U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross will hold a news briefing at 9 a.m. (1300 GMT) to announce "Section 232" national security-related tariff modifications, the U.S. Commerce Department said in a statement on Thursday.

Headlines: Russia's VTB bank apologizes for CEO who called UK's Boris Johnson a 'jerk'
Description: Russian state bank VTB  apologized for its CEO Andrey Kostin who made what it called an "emotional comment" on Monday when he described former British foreign minister Boris Johnson as a "jerk".

Headlines: Dollar Tree stock is a bargain, down 18 percent this year: Barron's
Description: Shares of Dollar Tree Inc  are as big a bargain as the $1 goods it sells in its stores, with shares off 18 percent this year and trading at a discount to its biggest competitor Dollar General Corp  and there is a possible activist investor in the wings, according to Barron's.

Headlines: Trump does not see oil reserve release after Saudi attacks
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday he did not think it would be necessary to release oil from the Strategic Petroleum Reserve after attacks on Saudi oil facilities, saying oil prices have not spiked very much.

Headlines: UK to continue to grant contracts to embattled Interserve: FT
Description: Britain's government will continue granting contracts to Interserve Plc  as the debt-laden outsourcing company battles to avoid a Carillion-style collapse, the Financial Times reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. new home sales at seven-month high; services sector picks up
Description: Sales of new U.S. single-family homes rose to a seven-month high in December, but November's outsized jump was revised lower, pointing to continued weakness in the housing market.

Headlines: U.S. charges two former Herbalife executives in China over bribery scheme: source
Description: U.S. prosecutors criminally charged two former executives of Herbalife Nutrition Ltd's  Chinese unit with running a decade-long scheme to bribe Chinese government officials to win business and evade regulatory scrutiny, a person familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: BT says Huawei ban can be absorbed in 500 million pounds already earmarked
Description: BT , Britain's biggest mobile and broadband company, said it estimated that a ban on Huawei's equipment in its 5G networks would cost it no more than the 500 million pounds ($630 million)it had earmarked to comply with a cap imposed earlier this year.

Headlines: Slump in oil prices and China data weighs on stocks
Description: Stocks around the globe suffered their biggest drop in two weeks on Friday as weak Chinese economic data sapped demand for equities while oil prices weakened again on Friday.

Headlines: Testing times from Beijing to Wall Street
Description: If you were surprised by this month's bounce in global stock markets, next week may tell you if you should join in or stay out.

Headlines: Volkswagen to replace head of software division: Handelsblatt
Description: Volkswagen  is replacing its head of software development, newspaper Handelsblatt reported on Sunday, as the German carmaker wrestles with the transition to electric vehicles.

Headlines: Wirecard administrator sees strong interest from potential buyers
Description: Wirecard's  administrator said on Tuesday that more than 100 investors have expressed interest in buying the collapsed German payments firm's core business and holdings.

Headlines: Google says issues affecting YouTube, Gmail, Google Cloud in U.S. resolved
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google said on Sunday it had resolved the network congestion in the eastern United States that affected services in Google Cloud, G Suite and YouTube.

Headlines: Jack Dorsey pledges $1 billion of his Square stake for COVID-19 relief efforts
Description: Twitter Inc  Chief Executive Officer Jack Dorsey on Tuesday pledged $1 billion of his stake in Square Inc , the payments processor that he co-founded and heads, to help fund relief efforts related to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Trump says had an excellent meeting with China's Xi
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Saturday he had an excellent meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping, as good as it was going to be.

Headlines: High oil prices hurt consumers, dent fuel demand: IEA chief
Description: High oil prices are hurting consumers and could also have adverse implications for producers, the executive director of the International Energy Agency (IEA) said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Investors revolt against executive pay plans at tarnished Australian banks
Description: Shareholders voted against the executive remuneration plans of two of Australia's biggest banks on Wednesday following misconduct revelations that have swept through the country's financial sector.

Headlines: Trump to impose 5% tariff on Mexican imports over illegal immigration
Description: President Donald Trump said on Thursday the United States will impose a 5% tariff on all goods coming from Mexico starting on June 10 until illegal immigration across the southern border is stopped.

Headlines: U.S. senators scrutinize meat packers' big profits during pandemic
Description: U.S. senators are calling for investigations of record profit margins for beef processors like Tyson Foods  and Cargill, after ranchers complained surging meat prices due to coronavirus hoarding did not translate into higher cattle prices.

Headlines: Developing countries unlock key industries to safeguard earnings and jobs
Description: From Africa to Asia and Latin America, emerging countries disproportionately bruised by the COVID-19 pandemic are allowing some key industries to start back up in a bid to soften the economic blow.

Headlines: China says talks with U.S. trade delegation have just begun
Description: China has just begun talks with a trade delegation from the United States, the foreign ministry said on Thursday, soon after the group led by U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin arrived in Beijing, the capital.

Headlines: Oil falls more than 2% on U.S.-China trade deal doubts, stronger dollar
Description: Oil prices lost about 2% on Monday on worries that global crude demand could stay under pressure as few details about the first phase of a U.S.-China trade deal did little to assure a quick resolution to the tariff fight.

Headlines: Trump says Christmas shopping was factor in tariff decision
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday his administration decided to delay tariffs on some Chinese imports until mid-December to avoid hurting U.S. shoppers heading into the Christmas holiday.

Headlines: UK pulls up Rolls-Royce for slow supplier payments
Description: Engine maker Rolls-Royce said on Monday that it had been suspended from the UK government's Prompt Payment Code (PPC) after failing to pay suppliers in time.

Headlines: U.S. House Speaker Pelosi requests intelligence briefings on Saudi attacks
Description: U.S. House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi has requested a briefing for all House members on the Saudi Aramco attacks and Iran, a spokesman said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Starbucks to reopen 150 drive-thru locations in UK this week
Description: Starbucks Corp  said on Monday it would begin a phased reopening of 150 of its drive-thru locations and some takeaway-only stores in the United Kingdom as the country eases coronavirus-led restrictions on road travel.

Headlines: U.S. airlines now requiring masks, promise more safety measures
Description: With the largest U.S. airlines now set to mandate - and provide - facial coverings for all passengers over the next two weeks, many are turning their focus to other measures to prevent the spread of the new coronavirus during air travel.

Headlines: Exclusive: Bentley warns worst case no deal Brexit would hit profitability, investment
Description: The boss of carmaker Bentley said failure to reach a Brexit deal would be "quite damaging" to annual profit in the worst case scenario, limit the company's ability to invest and could lead to its plant closing for an additional few days.

Headlines: Iran says actions taken to continue trade after U.S. sanctions
Description: Iran said on Monday it has taken necessary banking measures to continue trade with its partners after the United States reimposed sanctions on Tehran's energy and financial sectors, Iranian state TV quoted the head of the country's Central Bank Abdolnassr Hemmati as saying.

Headlines: Stocks stage furious rally late after national emergency declared
Description: Wall Street staged a furious rally in the waning moments of the session on Friday after U.S. President Donald Trump declared a national emergency to combat the rapidly spreading coronavirus, although major averages still suffered sharp losses for the week.

Headlines: China's multi-story hog hotels elevate industrial farms to new levels
Description: On Yaji Mountain in southern China, they are checking in the sows a thousand head per floor in high-rise "hog hotels".

Headlines: Roche, Spark push back takeover deadline in $4.3 billion deal
Description: Roche  and Spark Therapeutics  agreed to extend the deadline for the Swiss drugmaker's $4.3 billion takeover bid for the U.S. gene therapy specialist, Roche said, adding it remains "fully committed" to a deal it sees closing this year.

Headlines: Factbox: House cleaning at Thyssenkrupp could start M&A wave
Description: Steel-to-submarines conglomerate Thyssenkrupp has changed the structure of its sprawling empire, splitting operations into three categories as it seeks to simplify the business, stop cash burn and revive its battered share price.

Headlines: Amazon plans to split second headquarters in two cities: sources
Description: Amazon.com Inc is planning to split its second headquarters evenly between two cities, people familiar with the matter said Monday, in a twist to a more than year-long contest that has drawn overtures from locales across North America.

Headlines: Bayer close to glyphosate settlement worth $8-10 billion: Handelsblatt
Description: Bayer AG is close to agreeing a settlement worth $8-10 billion over claims its glyphosate-based Roundup weedkiller causes cancer, German business daily Handelsblatt reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. health insurers may balk at paying for coronavirus antibody testing
Description: U.S. health insurers may balk at covering tests that look for coronavirus antibodies in some cases, arguing that employers or the government should foot a bill expected to run into billions of dollars.

Headlines: U.S. private payrolls dive by a record 20.2 million
Description: U.S. private employers laid off a record 20.236 million workers in April as mandatory business closures in response to the novel coronavirus outbreak savaged the economy, setting up the overall labor market for historic job losses last month.

Headlines: Dow suffers record decline in points as Wall Street leads global stocks lower
Description: The Dow industrials posted the largest-ever points drop on Thursday as Wall Street led stocks across the globe lower, with traders fretting over the economic impact of the spreading coronavirus.

Headlines: Britain's M&S warns of severe impact from coronavirus
Description: British retailer Marks & Spencer  warned on Friday trading over the next 9-12 months in its clothing, homewares and international businesses was likely to be "severely impacted" by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: U.S. to end all waivers on imports of Iranian oil, crude price jumps
Description: The United States on Monday demanded that buyers of Iranian oil stop purchases by May 1 or face sanctions, a move to choke off Tehran's oil revenues which sent crude prices to six-month highs on fears of a potential supply crunch.

Headlines: Tencent pulls blockbuster game PUBG in China, launches patriotic alternative
Description: Tencent Holdings Ltd on Wednesday shut down its test version of global blockbuster "PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds" in China and shifted users to a similar, more patriotic video game which, unlike PUBG, has regulatory approval to generate revenue.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco eyes new petrochemical plant in Texas: sources
Description: Saudi Arabia's national oil company Saudi Aramco on Saturday is expected to disclose initial steps toward a multibillion-dollar chemical plant in Texas, according to sources familiar with the company's U.S. operations.

Headlines: Alibaba takes control of film group in $160 million share purchase
Description: Alibaba Group Holding Ltd  said on Monday it will increase its stake in Hong Kong-listed Alibaba Pictures  to 51 percent, taking control of the film unit's board.

Headlines: Netflix chief says 'The Crown' will look a bargain after streaming explosion
Description: Netflix Chief Executive Reed Hastings said on Friday the entrance of Apple, Disney and NBC to the global streaming market will push content costs to levels that make its epic drama about the British Royal family "look like a bargain".

Headlines: Investor Cerberus open to Deutsche Bank merger with Commerzbank: source
Description: U.S. investor Cerberus, a major shareholder in both Deutsche Bank and Commerzbank, is open to a merger between Germany's two biggest lenders, a person familiar with the matter said on Wednesday, raising the chances of a tie-up.

Headlines: This is no 2008: Mnuchin borrows from Paulson's economic crisis playbook
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin has stepped into the breach as the Trump administration's point man to rescue the economy from coronavirus devastation, taking on the role his former Goldman Sachs boss, Hank Paulson, played over a decade ago.

Headlines: Hey big spender - how luxury brands are raising the stakes on Instagram
Description: Big-spending luxury brands like Gucci, Louis Vuitton and Christian Dior are splashing out on everything from dance-fuelled fashion shows to teams of advisers as they target social media platforms in the hunt for young shoppers.

Headlines: Opel labor leaders fear Eisenach plant workforce could halve
Description: German labor leaders fear Opel's Eisenach factory could lose half its 1,800 workforce unless a deal is struck with owner PSA Group  over working conditions, amid escalating tensions between German union IG Metall and Opel's management.

Headlines: After Monsanto patent ruling, Indian farmers hope for next-gen GM seeds
Description: Monsanto's victory this week in a patent case in India regarding genetically modified (GM) cotton seeds has raised hopes among farmers that the company will now launch its next-generation seeds.

Headlines: Shoemaker Vans treads warily as China fumes over Hong Kong protests
Description: U.S. sports brand Vans has removed "a small number" of submissions in a sneaker design competition including one apparently giving a shout out to Hong Kong's pro-democracy protests, as companies weigh the risks of angering China.

Headlines: Chipotle adds steak dish carne asada in rare addition to menu
Description: Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc  said on Tuesday it would add a new steak dish to its menu nationwide for the first time in three years, as the Mexican food chain looks to drive sales in a crowded U.S restaurant market.

Headlines: EDF's Flamanville reactor start again delayed to 2020
Description: Problems with weldings have forced French utility EDF  to delay the start-up date for its troubled Flamanville 3 nuclear reactor to the second quarter of 2020 and pushed its cost estimate up to three times the original budget.

Headlines: Trade war dims outlook for U.S. business operations in China: survey
Description: U.S. companies doing business in China are still making profits there, but 81% say escalating trade tensions between the world's two largest economies have affected their business operations, a survey released Thursday by the US-China Business Council found.

Headlines: GM extends North American shutdown, does not set restart date
Description: General Motors Co  said Thursday it will extend a shutdown of its North American plants beyond March 30, but added it does not know when it will restart operations.

Headlines: Korean Air CEO's mother, younger sister back him amid family feud
Description: Korean Air  CEO Cho Won-tae's mother and younger sister said on Tuesday they support the flag carrier's current leadership headed by Cho.

Headlines: Exxon Mobil profit tops estimates but production falls
Description: Exxon Mobil Corp on Friday reported a quarterly profit that topped analysts' estimate on higher prices received for its oil and natural gas but its production volumes fell on a year-over-year basis.

Headlines: U.S. judge questions SEC on delay in filing Volkswagen suit
Description: A federal judge on Friday sharply questioned the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission on the timing of its civil suit filed in March accusing Volkswagen AG of defrauding investors and demanded the agency explain its rationale.

Headlines: Ford plans new wireless tech for cars starting 2022
Description: Ford Motor Co  said on Monday it plans to roll out a wireless technology for its new vehicle models in the United States, starting 2022, that will allow direct communication between connected devices.

Headlines: GE inks $21 billion biopharma sale to Danaher in U-turn under Culp
Description: General Electric said on Monday it would sell its biopharma business to Danaher Corp for $21.4 billion in the biggest strategy reversal since Lawrence Culp took over as the industrial conglomerate's chief executive in September.

Headlines: Trump signs off on tariff deal with China: Bloomberg News
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday signed off on a trade deal with China that would delay a new round of tariffs that was to be put in place on Dec. 15, Bloomberg News reported.

Headlines: CVS Health raises full-year profit forecast on Aetna strength
Description: CVS Health Corp on Wednesday raised its full-year profit forecast and reported first-quarter earnings that topped Wall Street estimates due to growth in its Aetna health insurance business, and as drug prices fell within its expectations.

Headlines: Thyssenkrupp CEO says company needs to hike profitability, restructure
Description: Thyssenkrupp's  new chief executive, Guido Kerkhoff, told employees the conglomerate needs to raise its profitability and restructure its Industrial Solutions and Elevators division to restore credibility with capital markets.

Headlines: Take Five: When doves coo - World markets themes for the week ahead
Description: Following are five big themes likely to dominate the thinking of investors and traders in the coming week and the Reuters stories related to them.

Headlines: No 'V'-shape return from devastating U.S. job loss, Fed policymakers say
Description: As many parts of the world's biggest economy begin to reopen after weeks of stay-at-home orders that slowed the spread of the coronavirus but gutted jobs, Americans should not expect a quick return to growth, U.S. Federal Reserve officials said on Friday.

Headlines: Trump says would intervene in arrest of Chinese executive
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday he would intervene with the U.S. Justice Department in the case against a Chinese telecommunications executive if it would help secure a trade deal with Beijing.

Headlines: Exxon's Cyprus gas discovery adds another giant to East Med collection
Description: ExxonMobil added another giant gas discovery to the east Mediterranean region after finding a gas-bearing reservoir offshore Cyprus but infrastructure bottlenecks and geopolitical disputes mean output from the field could be far off.

Headlines: HNA to get China state support for fundraising: Bloomberg
Description: China's top leaders have agreed to help debt-laden conglomerate HNA Group Co  raise funds, Bloomberg reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Southwest pilots say extra training required after 737 MAX software update
Description: Extra computer-based training will be required after a planned update to the software on the Boeing Co 737 MAX aircraft, Southwest Airlines Co's pilot union said on Wednesday, adding that it was seeking additional information for pilots.

Headlines: Palm oil sustainability group reinstates Nestle membership
Description: Nestle's  membership in the Roundtable on Sustainable Palm Oil (RSPO) has been reinstated three weeks after it was suspended, according to a joint statement issued by the company and the industry watchdog.

Headlines: Factbox: More U.S. companies join Facebook ad boycott bandwagon
Description: A handful of U.S. companies have pulled advertising from Facebook Inc in support of a campaign that called out the social media giant for not doing enough to stop hate speech on its platforms.

Headlines: U.S. fourth-quarter growth revised up to 2.9 percent; consumer spending surges
Description: U.S. economic growth slowed less than previously estimated in the fourth quarter as the biggest gain in consumer spending in three years partially offset the drag from a jump in imports.

Headlines: Airbus delivers first A350 to Japan after landmark deal
Description: Airbus delivered its first A350 aircraft to Japan Air Lines on Thursday, saying the specially tailored version would start operating on Japan's busy domestic routes.

Headlines: U.S. consumer confidence rebounds in June, but rising COVID-19 infections a worry
Description: U.S. consumer confidence grew more than expected in June, strengthening views that the economic downturn was likely over, though rising COVID-19 infections threatened to derail the budding recovery.

Headlines: Magna International to build hybrid transmissions for BMW
Description: Canadian auto-parts maker Magna International   said on Wednesday it would build dual-clutch and hybrid transmissions for German carmaker BMW  under a multi-year contract.

Headlines: Foxconn says it remains committed to Wisconsin investment project
Description: Taiwan's Foxconn said on Friday it remains committed to its contract to build a display plant and tech research facilities in Wisconsin, days after the U.S. state's governor said he wanted to renegotiate the deal.

Headlines: Airbus sees no major 2019 impact from possible U.S. tariffs
Description: Possible U.S. tariffs against Airbus aircraft and European parts are unlikely to have a major impact on the European planemaker's 2019 results, but disruption cannot be ruled out, its chief executive said.

Headlines: French finance minister welcomes Ghosn's release from jail
Description: French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire welcomed on Wednesday the release of former Renault boss Carlos Ghosn from jail in Japan.

Headlines: U.S. business asks British PM May: how bad can Brexit get?
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May was reminded of how worried businesses are about Brexit on Wednesday when a rallying speech to executives in New York was met with a single stark question from the floor - just how bad can things get?

Headlines: For central banks, hope for precision fades amid pandemic uncertainty
Description: Central bankers who have spent a generation researching how their words influence the economy and honing the craft of "forward guidance" are now effectively tongue-tied by a health crisis that has no clear destination yet to guide households and investors toward.

Headlines: Bayer buys BlueRock in $600 million bet on stem cell therapies
Description: German drugmaker Bayer  is paying up to $600 million for full control of cell therapy developer BlueRock Therapeutics, stepping up investment in a promising new medical area to revive its drug development pipeline.

Headlines: U.S. new home sales drop to more than 2-1/2-year low
Description: Sales of new U.S. single-family homes tumbled to a more than 2-1/2-year low in October amid sharp declines in all four regions, further evidence that higher mortgage rates were hurting the housing market.

Headlines: Sears chairman's takeover proposal faces moment of truth
Description: Negotiations between Sears Holdings Corp Chairman Eddie Lampert and the bankrupt U.S. department store operator approached a resolution late on Tuesday as the billionaire hedge fund manager faced the choice of improving his $5 billion offer for the company or ending his takeover plans, people familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: U.S. shale company Whiting becomes first major bankruptcy of oil-price crash
Description: Whiting Petroleum Corp filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy, the U.S. shale producer said on Wednesday, the first publicly traded casualty of crashing crude oil prices that are expected to bite into record U.S. output.

Headlines: Trump says U.S. economy strong despite 'destructive actions' by Fed
Description: President Donald Trump on Thursday said the U.S. economy was very strong despite what he said were "unnecessary and destructive actions" taken by the U.S. Federal Reserve, his latest attack on the nation's independent central bank.

Headlines: BMW sees 5-10 percent sales growth in China despite tariffs
Description: BMW  expects China sales to rise between 5 and 10 percent this year, despite the introduction of 40 percent import tariffs on vehicles imported from the United States since July.

Headlines: Wall Street falls on dour economic data, corporate earnings
Description: U.S. stocks fell on Wednesday as dismal economic data and first-quarter earnings reports compounded concerns over the extent of damage from the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Defunct startup Sidecar sues Uber: 'hell-bent on stifling competition'
Description: Defunct startup Sidecar Technologies Inc, which pioneered on-demand ride-hailing, is suing Uber Technologies Inc [UBER.UL], alleging it engaged in predatory pricing and anticompetitive practices that ultimately put Sidecar out of business.

Headlines: U.S. senator Cotton cautions Britain over Huawei cooperation
Description: U.S. Republican Senator Tom Cotton cautioned Britain on Wednesday that a decision to allow China's Huawei a role in 5G networks could hurt military cooperation and be an issue in trade talks.

Headlines: Fed staff float plan to end term-repo after April, minutes show
Description: Senior Federal Reserve staff proposed ending longer-term loans to banks after April as part of a broader blueprint laying out how the central bank could scale back the support provided to money markets, the minutes from the January policy meeting showed.

Headlines: Facebook suspends 200 apps over data misuse investigation
Description: Facebook Inc  has so far suspended around 200 apps in the first stage of its review into apps that had access to large quantities of user data, in a response to a scandal around political consultancy Cambridge Analytica.

Headlines: U.S.-based engineers' body lifts curbs on Huawei employees
Description: The Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE) said on Monday curbs on employees of Huawei Technologies and its subsidiaries have been lifted, and they would be allowed to participate in a peer review process for its research papers.

Headlines: British airline Flybe collapses as coronavirus deals final blow
Description: Britain's Flybe collapsed on Thursday after a plunge in travel demand, making the long-struggling regional airline one of the first big corporate casualties of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: JetBlue to become carbon neutral in 2020
Description: JetBlue Airways Corp on Monday said it plans to become carbon neutral on all domestic flights by July 2020 and would use an alternative fuel source for flights leaving from San Francisco amid rising pressure to cut greenhouse emissions.

Headlines: Dollar nudges up on hopes for U.S.-China trade deal
Description: The dollar rose against a basket of major currencies on Monday on traders' bets that China and the United States are moving closer to a trade deal that would end sparring between the world's two biggest economies.

Headlines: IATA says face masks should be worn on flights in future
Description: The body representing global airlines says that it is recommending the wearing of masks on flights to prevent the spread of coronavirus when flying restarts.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs CEO says sovereign balance sheets look risky
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc Chief Executive Lloyd Blankfein said on Thursday sovereign country balance sheets look risky to him as deficits become a larger percentage of their gross domestic product.

Headlines: Toyota names new finance chief in executive shake-up
Description: Toyota Motor Corp  named Kenta Kon as its next chief financial officer on Tuesday and said it would scrap executive vice president (EVP) roles as part of a drive to streamline the company's structure, improve production systems and cut costs.

Headlines: California settles decades-long lawsuit over lead paint, but outcome is bittersweet
Description: When Californian counties and cities first sued paint makers in 2000, they wanted the companies to pay billions to remove dangerous old lead paint from hundreds of thousands of homes.

Headlines: Blackstone waves off concerns over Saudi funding
Description: Blackstone Group LP , the U.S. buyout firm which is relying on Saudi Arabia to provide half the money for its planned $40 billion infrastructure fund, waved off concerns about funding on Thursday even as controversy rages over the disappearance of a Saudi journalist that has frayed relations between Wall Street and the oil-rich kingdom.

Headlines: Wall Street tumbles on renewed U.S.-China trade jitters
Description: U.S. stocks fell on Wednesday on renewed uncertainty regarding the U.S. stance on Chinese investments in American technology companies, reversing gains earlier in the session.

Headlines: KKR to take Envision private for $5.57 billion in healthcare push
Description: KKR & Co  said on Monday it will buy Envision Healthcare Corp , one of biggest U.S. providers of physicians to hospitals, in a deal valued at $5.57 billion as it builds up its healthcare portfolio.

Headlines: Tech, media shares find new home in sector overhaul
Description: Alphabet Inc, Facebook Inc, Netflix Inc and others will be in focus on Sept. 24 when they are moved out of the tech and consumer discretionary sectors into a deepened pool of communication and media stocks.

Headlines: Explainer: U.S.-China trade talks - where they are and what's at stake
Description: Senior U.S. and Chinese officials are meeting in Washington on   Thursday and Friday in an attempt to settle their ongoing trade war, but a lasting peace seems elusive.

Headlines: Rolls-Royce, preparing to cut thousands of jobs, says engine problem has spread
Description: Britain's Rolls-Royce  said a costly compressor problem that had grounded Boeing planes had now been found in a different type of engine, compounding pressures on a group that is due to cut more than 4,000 jobs this week.

Headlines: Trump says U.S., China to announce new venue to ink trade deal soon
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday the United States and China would soon announce a new site where he and Chinese President Xi Jinping will sign a "Phase One" trade deal after Chile canceled a planned summit set for mid-November.

Headlines: Fed officials see past misses as trouble for any new inflation approach
Description: The Federal Reserve is discussing whether a better way to get the U.S. economy to hit the central bank's inflation target is to tolerate much higher price increases in some years to counter the weaker ones.

Headlines: Geely's Volvo Cars sales soar 40% in May vs month-ago as virus curbs ease
Description: Volvo Cars, owned by China's Geely Holding, said on Wednesday it sold 40% more cars in May than in April, as restrictions to contain the spread of the COVID-19 pandemic started to ease in several markets.

Headlines: Buy now, pay whenever? Lockdown lift for online shopping loans
Description: Browsing online during lockdown, Jessica Friend spotted a pair of Ray-Ban sunglasses she liked, but the price tag made the 30-year-old Ohio resident think twice.

Headlines: Airline industry crisis deepens as coronavirus kills demand
Description: The crisis for airlines deepened on Thursday as Lufthansa , which has grounded most of its fleet, warned the industry may not survive coronavirus pandemic without government aid to offset nosediving demand.

Headlines: Staying close to home, Infineon to build new chip plant in Austria
Description: Germany's Infineon Technologies  plans to build a 1.6 billion euro ($1.9 billion) chip facility in Austria, in a major strategic bet on Europe at a time of growing trade and political uncertainty in Asia.

Headlines: Deere names CEO John May chairman
Description: Farm equipment maker Deere & Co  on Monday named Chief Executive Officer John May chairman, effective May 1.

Headlines: Toshiba Memory chief shrugs off price concerns, sticks with IPO plans
Description: The chief executive of Toshiba Memory Corp, the world's No. 2 producer of NAND flash memory chips, on Wednesday brushed aside concerns about falling memory chip prices and reaffirmed the company's plan to go public in two to three years.

Headlines: Singapore and Malaysia to reopen business travel next month
Description: Singapore and Malaysia are to resume essential business and official travel between their countries, they said on Tuesday, letting people cross their border for the first time since most movements were suspended because of the coronavirus in March.

Headlines: German prosecutors intensify Deutsche Bank client investigation: source
Description: German prosecutors are escalating a money laundering inquiry involving Deutsche Bank , including planned raids on wealthy former clients, a person with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Cost to insure Bristol-Myers debt jumps as leverage balloons
Description: The cost to insure Bristol-Myers Squibb  debt hit its highest point since May 2010 on Thursday, following the announcement that the U.S. pharmaceutical company would acquire rival Celgene Corp  in a deal worth about $74 billion.

Headlines: French carmaker Renault names Luca de Meo as new CEO
Description: French carmaker Renault  on Tuesday named former Volkswagen's  Seat brand executive Luca de Meo as its new chief executive, as Renault moves to create a new management in the post-Ghosn era and shore up its alliance with Nissan .

Headlines: Air France-KLM says not involved in Malaysia Airlines sale talks
Description: Air France-KLM  said on Tuesday it had previously held talks with the owners of Malaysia Airlines but was not engaged in current efforts to find new investors for the carrier.

Headlines: EBay revenue misses as weak U.S. sporting season hits StubHub
Description: EBay Inc  missed analysts' estimates for second-quarter revenue on Wednesday, as its online ticket marketplace StubHub had a disappointing quarter, leading the e-commerce website to forecast underwhelming third-quarter results.

Headlines: Exclusive: Nissan shakes off virus woes in China sales with rebound in April - sources
Description: Nissan Motor Co's  vehicle sales in China this month almost recovered to the prior year's level after a coronavirus-related 45% plunge in March, two sources with knowledge of the Japanese automaker's preliminary data said.

Headlines: 3M taps regional suppliers to meet soaring demand for masks
Description: Diversified manufacturer 3M Co  has avoided major supply chain disruptions from the coronavirus outbreak by sourcing materials for its protective face masks from regional suppliers instead of far-flung locations, a company official told Reuters.

Headlines: Fed's Quarles defends decision to let banks maintain dividends
Description: A senior Federal Reserve official on Tuesday defended before Congress the central bank's decision to allow lenders to continue issuing dividends, even as the regulator seeks permission from lawmakers to further relax capital rules.

Headlines: JPMorgan confirms winning bid to take majority stake in China fund JV
Description: JPMorgan  confirmed it had won an auction to hold a majority equity stake in its Chinese asset management joint venture (JV), becoming the first foreign firm to move closer to taking control of an onshore funds business under new rules.

Headlines: In Portugal, trust in China is the art of the deal
Description: Utility company EDP may balk at the meager 5 percent premium offered for its shares by China Three Gorges (CT) but the battle for Portugal's biggest business has largely played out already.

Headlines: Merkel unaware of any pressure exerted by China over Huawei
Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Wednesday she had not been told about the Chinese authorities making any threats of retaliation if Germany were to exclude Huawei from its 5G rollout.

Headlines: Investors raise cash buffers as gloom gathers over global economy: BAML survey
Description: Investors cut equity exposure this month as they grew more wary that economic growth may slow, but kept a long-standing preference for mega-cap tech stocks, Bank of America Merrill Lynch's monthly survey indicated on Tuesday.

Headlines: Nissan ex-boss Ghosn entered Lebanon legally: security directorate
Description: Nissan ex-boss Carlos Ghosn entered Lebanon legally and will not face any legal consequences, Lebanon's General Directorate of General Security said on Tuesday, according to the state news agency NNA.

Headlines: Pennsylvania joins states opposed to merger of T-Mobile, Sprint
Description: Pennsylvania is joining more than a dozen states that have filed a lawsuit aimed at stopping T-Mobile US's $26 billion purchase of Sprint, New York Attorney General Letitia James said in a statement on Wednesday.

Headlines: Renault to name new leaders as scandal-hit Ghosn bows out
Description: Renault's  board was meeting on Thursday to appoint new leadership, after Chairman and Chief Executive Carlos Ghosn resigned in the wake of a financial scandal that has rocked the French carmaker and its alliance with Japan's Nissan .

Headlines: Twitter says user data meant for security purposes may have been used for advertising
Description: Twitter Inc said on Tuesday email addresses and phone numbers uploaded by users to meet its security requirements may have been 'inadvertently' used for advertising purposes.

Headlines: Honda back to work in China's Wuhan with temperature checks and masks
Description: Temperature checkpoints and posters telling workers to keep more than a metre apart at Japanese automaker Honda Motor Co's reopened plant in the Chinese city of Wuhan show how the coronavirus has created a new normal on the factory floor.

Headlines: China does not need U.S. soybeans for state reserves: Sinograin official
Description: China, the world's top soybean buyer, can fully meet the needs of its state soybean reserves without importing from the United States, an official with the state stockpiler told state TV on Thursday.

Headlines: Trump defends trade and tariff policies at Tampa rally
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump defended his trade policies on Tuesday in a speech in Florida and said American farmers hurt by retaliatory tariffs from China were bearing up, in a sign he is feeling some political heat on the issue.

Headlines: World Bank's Georgieva approved as new IMF chief
Description: Bulgarian economist Kristalina Georgieva was confirmed on Wednesday as managing director of the International Monetary Fund, the IMF said, becoming the first person from an emerging economy to head the global lender.

Headlines: Daimler, BMW to invest 1 billion euros in venture to rival Uber
Description: German carmakers Daimler and BMW unveiled a joint ride-hailing, parking and electric car charging business on Friday to compete with mobility services provided by Uber and other tech firms.

Headlines: Tesla urges tariff exemption for Chinese-made car computer 'brain'
Description: Tesla Inc has asked the Trump administration to exempt the Chinese-made car computer "brain" of its new Model 3 sedan from 25 percent tariffs imposed in August, saying they threaten the electric carmaker's bottom line.

Headlines: Target reduces store hours to restock, clean amid virus outbreak
Description: Target Corp  said on Tuesday it would reduce store hours for cleaning and restocking, as more consumers shop at its outlets for essentials amid the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: EU asks WTO to certify it has removed Airbus subsidies
Description: The European Union has asked the World Trade Organization to certify that it has complied with WTO rulings on its subsidies for planemaker Airbus, attempting to forestall billions of dollars of U.S. sanctions, a document published by the WTO showed on Monday.

Headlines: Tech rally helps Wall Street push higher, Nasdaq has record close
Description: Wall Street's three major indexes rose on Monday, led by a rally in tech stocks, pushing the Nasdaq to a record closing high as investors bet on a continuation of strong economic growth, while falling oil prices weighed on the energy sector.

Headlines: Explainer: How does Texas have the power to curb the state's oil output?
Description: Texas oil and gas regulators in coming days are poised to decide whether to order larger producers in the state to shut in 20% of their output, wading into global oil politics as the coronavirus crisis slashes demand for oil .

Headlines: United to resume India flights from September as Pakistan reopens airspace
Description: United Airlines Holdings Inc  said on Wednesday it would restart daily nonstop service between New York/Newark, New Delhi and Mumbai from Sept. 6, after Pakistan lifted airspace restrictions.

Headlines: Japanese automakers' sales fall in South Korea amid consumer boycott
Description: Japanese automakers posted sharper sales falls in South Korea in August, industry data showed on Wednesday, hit by a consumer boycott of Japanese vehicles amid a worsening diplomatic row between the countries.

Headlines: Toyota, Subaru team up to develop electric SUV in battle against costs
Description: Toyota Motor Corp and Subaru Corp on Thursday said they plan to jointly develop a battery-electric sport-utility vehicle (SUV) on a platform produced together as they seek to split the cost of producing the lower-emissions car.

Headlines: 'Maddening' U.S. shutdown hangs over airlines even as profits beat
Description: Three major U.S. airlines said on Thursday the U.S. government partial shutdown had not yet had a major financial impact but a tipping point might be near.

Headlines: Muslims in Indonesia divided over Friday prayers amid coronavirus fears
Description: While many Muslims in Indonesia's capital accepted advice to avoid religious gatherings and prayed at home on Friday elsewhere in the world's most populous Muslim country, people ignored the risk of coronavirus and crowded into their mosques.

Headlines: U.S. slaps French goods with 25% duties in digital tax row, but delays effective date
Description: The Trump administration on Friday announced additional duties of 25% on French cosmetics, handbags and other imports valued at $1.3 billion in response to France's digital services tax, but would hold off on implementing the move for up to 180 days.

Headlines: Factbox: Apple, Google, Amazon take aim at Trump visa ban
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump has suspended the entry of some foreign workers in a bid to boost domestic hiring, sparking opposition from corporate America and tech sector executives including Google's Sundar Pichai and Tesla's Elon Musk.

Headlines: U.S. says Centra Tech co-founders indicted for cryptocurrency fraud
Description: U.S. prosecutors on Monday announced the indictment of three co-founders of a cryptocurrency start-up once promoted by the boxer Floyd Mayweather, accusing them of fraudulently raising more than $25 million from investors in an initial coin offering.

Headlines: Ford working to relocate truck parts production after supplier fire
Description: Ford Motor Co is working with a key supplier to shift some F-150 truck parts production from Michigan to Ontario after a May 2 fire caused Ford to halt production of its fullsize pickups, according to sources.

Headlines: General Electric pulls out of Nigeria rail concession
Description: General Electric Co  has pulled out of a long-term concession deal with the Nigerian government to maintain and operate narrow-gauge rail lines in the West African country, a procurement process adviser told Reuters on Wednesday.

Headlines: Stocks rebound further as markets await $2 trillion U.S. stimulus boost
Description: The dollar slid and global equity markets marched higher on Wednesday for a second day of gains, on optimism $2 trillion in U.S. fiscal stimulus will dampen the economic shock the coronavirus pandemic has started to inflict.U.S. senators will vote Wednesday. Top aides to Republican President Donald Trump and senior Republican and Democrat senators agreed on the unprecedented bill after five days of marathon talks.

Headlines: World food prices fall sharply in April because of coronavirus: U.N.
Description: World food prices fell for a third consecutive month in April, hit by the economic and logistical impact of the coronavirus pandemic, the United Nations food agency said on Thursday.

Headlines: Coronavirus shows U.S. too dependent on cheap medical imports, USTR says
Description: (This Mar 30 story adds missing word "from" in last paragraph.)

Headlines: U.S. auto showrooms need more electric cars, environmental group says
Description: Environmental group the Sierra Club on Tuesday urged automakers and dealerships to help cut U.S. carbon emissions and fight the climate crisis by making more electric vehicle available in U.S. showrooms.

Headlines: S&P 500 beating Nasdaq for fourth day as investors shift focus
Description: The S&P 500 index on Wednesday was on track to beat the technology-heavy Nasdaq Composite for a fourth straight session, a feat scored only twice since Wall Street launched its massive recovery last March.

Headlines: Trump attacks Ford Motor for not backing fuel economy rollback
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump stepped up a series of attacks on automakers on Wednesday for not backing his administration's plan to roll back Obama-era fuel efficiency rules, singling out Ford Motor Co  in particular for backing a deal with California for stricter fuel economy standards.

Headlines: Suriname confirms first coronavirus case, authorities will close borders
Description: Suriname on Friday confirmed its first case of coronavirus infection in a person who traveled to the South American country last week from the Netherlands, the vice president told the national assembly.

Headlines: U.S. agency accuses Walmart of pregnancy discrimination in lawsuit
Description: The U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity Commission on Friday filed a lawsuit accusing Walmart Inc of forcing pregnant workers at a Wisconsin warehouse to go on unpaid leave and denying their requests to take on easier duties.

Headlines: Dozens of expensive private schools received millions in U.S. pandemic loans
Description: At least six dozen expensive private schools, including one where former President Barack Obama's children studied, got between $42 million and $104.25 million in loans under a U.S. program meant to help small businesses weather the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Chipotle slumps 9 percent after Ohio outlet linked to food poisoning complaints
Description: More than 100 people said they had fallen sick after eating at a Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc  restaurant in Ohio, sending shares of the burrito chain down as much as 9 percent on Tuesday.

Headlines: HSBC battles entrenched locals, past mistakes in U.S. credit card push
Description: HSBC's push into credit cards and personal loans in the United States will be no easy task as the bank faces entrenched domestic rivals and the legacy of a previous disastrous foray into U.S. lending.

Headlines: France's Le Maire favors car industry professional as next Renault CEO
Description: French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said on Sunday that the search for a new CEO for Renault  was still on and that he favored selecting a professional from the automobile sector.

Headlines: U.S. services sector growth slows; employment drops: ISM
Description: U.S. services sector activity slowed to a more than 3-1/2-year low in March, with industries reporting a moderation in new orders and decline in employment amid the coronavirus pandemic, which has brought the country to sudden stop.

Headlines: Exclusive: China central bank sees benchmark rate cut as last resort, may use other tools - sources
Description: China's central bank is not yet ready to cut benchmark interest rates to spur the slowing economy, despite cooling inflation and a stronger yuan, which have fanned market expectations of such a move, policy sources told Reuters.

Headlines: China auto group cuts 2019 sales forecast to a 5% drop
Description: China's biggest auto industry association has cut its sales forecast for this year due to slowing economic growth, and now expects sales to fall for the second year running.

Headlines: Pfizer settles New York probe into 'deceptive' copay coupons
Description: Pfizer Inc on Thursday settled charges by New York's attorney general that it misled consumers in its drug copayment coupon program into thinking they would pay far less to fill  prescriptions than they ended up having to shell out.

Headlines: Goldman to formally name David Solomon next CEO early this week - NYT
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc is expected to name its president, David Solomon, its next chief executive officer early this week, the New York Times reported https://www.nytimes.com/2018/07/15/business/goldman-sachs-david-solomon-lloyd-blankfein.html on Sunday.

Headlines: National Enquirer owner defends reporting on Amazon's Bezos
Description: The owner of U.S. tabloid newspaper the National Enquirer pushed back on Friday against accusations of "extortion and blackmail" from Amazon.com Inc Chief Executive Jeff Bezos, saying its reporting on an extramarital relationship involving the world's richest man was lawful and it would investigate his claims.

Headlines: Uber plans smaller, more cautious self-driving car launch
Description: Uber Technologies Inc's  is plotting the return of its self-driving cars, but the company known for its hard-charging style is taking a much more conservative approach as it tries to recover from a fatal accident that upended its autonomous vehicle program.

Headlines: European trade policy seen going greener after EU parliament vote
Description: The rise of the Greens, the "Greta effect" of a young Swedish climate activist and the entry of French President Emmanuel Macron's party into the European Parliament are likely to result in a more defensive and climate-oriented EU trade policy.

Headlines: Timeline: Main events in Tesla's history as a public company
Description: Here are some of the key events in Tesla Inc's  turbulent history as a public company.

Headlines: NBA's Silver sees win-win in bidding war for Fox
Description: NBA Commissioner Adam Silver said he expected the league to benefit from a battle between Comcast Corp  and Walt Disney Co.  for Twenty-First Century Fox Inc , regardless of which suitor pulls ahead.

Headlines: WeWork debacle has unicorn investors seeking cover
Description: In the months since office-sharing startup WeWork's botched public debut, mid- and late-stage investors in big start-ups have been pushing for more safeguards in case their firms fail to go public or sell shares at a lower valuation than pre-IPO financing rounds.

Headlines: German court throws out Qualcomm's latest patent case against Apple
Description: A patent lawsuit filed by Qualcomm Inc against Apple Inc was thrown out by a German court on Tuesday, in a reversal for the U.S. chipmaker after it won a recent court ban on the sale of some iPhones in the country.

Headlines: Burst of social unrest tests emerging market risk models
Description: A wave of social unrest across developing countries this year has caught many investors off-guard and is challenging models designed to gauge political risk for investors, prompting some to pull money out.

Headlines: Oil surges on tanker attacks; stocks rise on Fed rate cut expectations
Description: Oil futures rose on Thursday after attacks on two tankers off the coast of Iran, while the U.S. Treasury yield curve steepened and stocks rose following economic data seen as strengthening the case for the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates this year.

Headlines: Blackstone takes majority stake in 'Bumble' parent, values firm at about $3 billion
Description: Blackstone Group Inc  is taking a majority stake in MagicLab, the parent company of dating app "Bumble" and "Badoo", valuing the company at about $3 billion, the private equity firm said in a statement on Friday.

Headlines: Cloud, services fuel IBM's profit beat, robust outlook; shares jump
Description: IBM Corp  beat Wall Street quarterly earnings estimates and also forecast 2019 profit above expectations on Tuesday, in the latest indication that Chief Executive Officer Ginni Rometty's efforts to turn around the technology services company were gaining traction.

Headlines: Amazon, Volkswagen agree strategic partnership for 'industry cloud': report
Description: German carmaker Volkswagen and Amazon.com Inc have agreed on a strategic partnership to create a kind of "industry cloud", for which details will soon be announced, Germany's Sueddeutsche newspaper reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: Massive mining waste dams could pose deadly risks, say investors
Description: A global inquiry into how mining companies store billions of tonnes of waste in huge dams, launched after a collapse in Brazil killed hundreds, shows about a tenth of the structures have had stability issues, investors said on Thursday.

Headlines: Bleak jobs data keeps dollar at one-week high
Description: The dollar hit a one-week high on Thursday as investors fled to safe-haven assets following the release of weekly U.S. jobless data which showed a record 22 million Americans have sought unemployment benefits in the last month, erasing nearly all job gains since the Great Recession.

Headlines: Cheniere Energy drops lawsuit against Tellurian chairman, vice chairman
Description: Tellurian Inc  on Thursday said Cheniere Energy Inc  has dismissed all claims against its Chairman Charif Souki and Vice Chairman Martin Houston.

Headlines: Democrat wants FCC to open T-Mobile, Sprint settlement for comment
Description: U.S. Representative David Cicilline urged Federal Communications Commission Chairman Ajit Pai on Thursday to give the public the chance to comment on a draft order that would grant agency approval to the $26 billion merger of T-Mobile US Inc and Sprint Corp.

Headlines: Bombardier eyes higher sales from retrofitting trains
Description: Canada's Bombardier Inc sees higher sales from modernizing existing rail cars as the company works to further diversify its largest division as measured in revenue, a spokesman said this month.

Headlines: Mexico's state-run Pemex posts steep 2019 loss in blow to president's revival plan
Description: Petroleos Mexicanos posted a $18.3 billion net loss for 2019 on Thursday, nearly doubling the previous year's loss and dealing a major blow to the Mexican president's quest to revive the heavily-indebted state oil company.

Headlines: Glenview's Robbins says talk of Amazon's entering pharma is overblown
Description: Glenview Capital Management Chief Executive Larry Robbins said on Monday at the Sohn Investment Conference in New York that he still likes a trio of stocks he already owns, citing CVS Health Corp , McKesson Corp  and Express Scripts Holdings .

Headlines: Uber files appeal against licence loss in UK city of Brighton
Description: Uber [UBER.UL] submitted an appeal on Friday against the decision by the southern coastal English city of Brighton to strip the taxi app of its licence for not being "fit and proper" over data concerns and the use of drivers from outside the area.

Headlines: Deutsche, Commerzbank favor merger over holding company structure: sources
Description: Deutsche Bank and Commerzbank favor a straightforward merger over more complex ways to structure a deal, three people close to the matter said.

Headlines: Hurt in past by false dawns, Chinese businessman is wary of bets on North Korea opening up
Description: Property speculators in China may be betting that Tuesday's U.S.-North Korea summit will unlock riches across the border but Chinese construction machinery dealer Wang Chenglin is far from convinced.

Headlines: U.S. court deals setback to FCC push to revamp media ownership rules
Description: The Federal Communications Commission suffered a setback on Monday in a long-running legal battle when a federal appeals court struck down its latest effort to loosen U.S. media ownership rules.

Headlines: Hyundai, Kia sue four big U.S. railroads over fuel surcharges
Description: Hyundai Motor Co  and its Kia affiliate have sued the four largest U.S. railroads, accusing them of violating U.S. antitrust law by conspiring to drive up shipping costs though coordinated fuel surcharges.

Headlines: U.S. securities law can cover cryptocurrencies, judge rules
Description: U.S. securities law can be used to prosecute fraud cases over cryptocurrency offerings, a New York federal judge ruled on Tuesday in what appeared to be the first court decision to address the issue.

Headlines: Amazon and Netflix push Wall Street higher
Description: Amazon.com Inc  and Netflix  fueled a second straight session of gains on Wall Street on Monday, as the resumption of U.S.-China trade talks helped ease concerns that have pummeled the market in recent months.

Headlines: Oilfield services firm ProPetro cuts almost 150 workers: sources
Description: ProPetro Holding Corp  this month cut about 150 workers, people familiar with the matter said on Monday, the latest sign of growing trouble in the oilfield services sector as U.S. shale producers reduce drilling.

Headlines: Amazon founder Bezos' divorce final with $38 billion settlement: report
Description: Amazon.com Inc  founder Jeff Bezos' divorce from his wife of 25 years, MacKenzie Bezos, was finalized by a Seattle-area judge on Friday, paving the way for her to receive $38.3 billion worth of Amazon stock, Bloomberg reported.

Headlines: Amazon spends company record on U.S. lobbying in 2018: filing
Description: Amazon.com Inc  spent $14.19 million on lobbying the U.S. government in 2018, according to a regulatory filing, beating its year-ago record, as large U.S. technology companies pushed back on issues such as privacy, immigration and new tariffs.

Headlines: China Daily changes its report, now says China will respond to U.S. tariffs
Description: China's official English-language newspaper the China Daily on Friday changed a report from earlier in the day, now saying that  the Chinese government will take action to respond to newly-imposed United States tariffs.

Headlines: SEC to review corporate democracy rules risking investor clash
Description: The U.S. securities regulator is set to review this month rules on corporate democracy, setting it up for a clash with investors who worry the agency will side with companies to diminish voting rights on charged issues like climate change and gun violence.

Headlines: Wall Street drops on U.S. trade tensions with EU, IMF global outlook
Description: Trade-sensitive industrials dragged Wall Street lower on Tuesday as tensions over tariffs between the United States and its European trading partners went from simmer to boil and the IMF lowered its global growth outlook.

Headlines: Fox tops estimates as 'Deadpool 2,' cable earnings drive gains
Description: Twenty-First Century Fox Inc's quarterly profit and revenue topped Wall Street targets on Wednesday, thanks to the popularity of edgy superhero movie "Deadpool 2" and as the company's cable unit earned higher fees from distributors.

Headlines: Thyssenkrupp's Merz stays on as CEO to handle overhaul
Description: Martina Merz, who took over as interim chief executive of Thyssenkrupp , will remain in the job until 2023 after successfully selling the group's elevator unit in a landmark deal last month, the conglomerate said on Friday.

Headlines: EU strikes deal forcing Netflix, Amazon to fund European content
Description: EU lawmakers and member states on Thursday struck a preliminary deal that will allow countries to force online streaming services including Netflix  and Amazon's  video service to help fund European films and TV shows.

Headlines: Japan Inc to chase casino stakes as key law passes: industry insiders
