Description: The United States' closest allies attacked the Trump administration on Friday for imposing tariffs on steel and aluminum imports and mounted challenges with the world's top trade body, fouling the mood at a G7 finance leaders meeting.

Headlines: Samsung eyes young buyers with gaming, music-friendly Galaxy Note 9
Description: Samsung Electronics Co Ltd  unveiled the Galaxy Note 9 "phablet" in New York on Thursday in a key product launch that it hopes will attract younger customers with stepped-up features and services for gamers and music-lovers.

Headlines: Mercedes Benz to hire 600 contractors in Brazil as economy recovers
Description: Mercedes Benz's  Brazil operation will hire some 600 contractors in 2019 on year-long contracts to work on commercial vehicles, adding to a workforce of 10,000, the company said on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. probes 553,000 Nissan Rogue SUVs for unintended emergency braking
Description: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) has opened a preliminary investigation into 553,000 Nissan Rogue sport utility vehicles after reports of their automatic emergency braking systems engaging without warning or an obstruction, the agency said on Thursday.

Headlines: Apple working on games subscription service for gadgets: Bloomberg
Description: Apple Inc, which later on Monday is expected to unveil a television and movie streaming service, is also working on a games subscription service for its App Store, Bloomberg reported on Monday, citing people with knowledge of the plans.

Headlines: Great Wall may consider building cars in Europe once sales hit 50,000 a year: chairman
Description: China's Great Wall Motor  may consider building car manufacturing facilities in the European Union once its sales there hit 50,000 units a year, its chairman said, as part of a push to seek growth in overseas markets.

Headlines: Tiffany sticks to 2019 targets, helped by e-commerce; shares rebound
Description: Luxury retailer Tiffany & Co said Friday it expected earnings growth to resume in the second half of the year, helped by a healthy e-commerce business, a forecast that allowed investors to look past slightly disappointing quarterly sales.

Headlines: Sharp to buy Toshiba PC business, issue $1.8 billion in new shares
Description: Japan's Sharp Corp  said it will buy Toshiba Corp's  personal computer business and issue $1.8 billion in new shares to buy back preferred stock from banks, highlighting a swift recovery under the control of Foxconn.

Headlines: Mexico, U.S. business groups urge Trump to back down on tariff threat
Description: Mexico's president and the top U.S. business lobbying group called on President Donald Trump to back down from a threat to impose punitive tariffs on Mexican imports, in a dispute over migration that could shock Mexico's economy.

Headlines: Dow cuts 2019 spending forecast on U.S-China trade tensions
Description: Dow Inc  forecast current-quarter revenue below analysts' expectations on Thursday and cut 2019 spending as chemical companies grapple with U.S.-China trade dispute and an oversupply of chemicals used to make plastics.

Headlines: Instant View: Fed holds rates steady
Description: The Federal Reserve held interest rates steady on Wednesday but said it would be patient in lifting borrowing costs further this year as it pointed to rising uncertainty about the U.S. economic outlook.

Headlines: SoftBank-backed Paytm raises $1 billion in fresh funding
Description: Indian digital payments company Paytm said on Monday it has raised fresh funds from a group of investors including existing backers SoftBank's  Vision Fund and China's Ant Financial Services in a deal valuing the firm at $16 billion.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler does not see delay in PSA merger, FIOM union says
Description: Fiat Chrysler did not mention any possible delay in the merger process with France's PSA during a call with unions on Tuesday, metal workers' union FIOM said.

Headlines: Trump on WTO case: 'This case going on for years, a nice victory!'
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday hailed a "nice victory" after the World Trade Organization gave Washington a green light to impose tariffs on $7.5 billion worth of EU goods annually as punishment for illegal aircraft subsidies.

Headlines: U.S. factory activity contracts in March; orders tumble to 11-year low: ISM
Description: U.S. manufacturing activity contracted less than expected in March, but disruptions caused by the coronavirus pandemic pushed new orders received by factories to an 11-year low, reinforcing economists' views that the economy was in recession.

Headlines: Malaysia says Goldman Sachs failed to disclose key facts in 1MDB bond sales
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc  made untrue statements and omitted key facts in offering circulars for the bonds it sold for Malaysian state fund 1MDB, the Malaysian government said in criminal charges against the U.S. bank.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs CEO apologises for ex-banker's role in 1MDB scandal
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc Chief Executive Officer David Solomon on Wednesday apologised to the Malaysian people for former banker Tim Leissner's role in the sovereign wealth fund 1MDB scandal, but said the bank had conducted due diligence before every transaction.

Headlines: Put on probation, Uber wins London license to avoid ban
Description: Uber Technologies Inc won a probationary license to operate in London on Tuesday in a partial victory for its new chief executive after it made changes to ease strained relations with city authorities.

Headlines: Anadarko to negotiate sale to Occidental 'superior' to Chevron deal
Description: Anadarko Petroleum Corp said on Monday it would negotiate with Occidental Petroleum Corp over its $38 billion cash-and-stock bid, after determining it could get a better deal than its agreed $33 billion sale to Chevron Corp.

Headlines: Forever 21 snapped up by mall owners, Authentic Brands
Description: Forever 21 has a new lease on life after Simon Property Group Inc , Brookfield Property Partners LP  and Authentic Brands Group agreed to acquire the bankrupt teen fashion retailer.

Headlines: BlackRock makes two new investment stewardship hires: sources
Description: BlackRock Inc, the world's largest asset manager, has hired Tanya Levy-Odom and Shannon Nelson for its investment stewardship team that engages with companies on corporate governance, according to their LinkedIn profiles and sources with knowledge of the moves.

Headlines: Germany approves new powers to block foreign takeovers in healthcare
Description: Germany gave itself new powers to veto hostile foreign takeover bids for healthcare companies on Wednesday, a measure designed to ensure a continuous supply of essential products during the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Nestle falls behind as millennials warm up to frozen meals
Description: At Nestle's $50 million research center outside Cleveland, food technicians and packaging experts set out three years ago to remake its frozen food lineup and appeal more to busy, health-conscious adults in their 20s and 30s.

Headlines: 'Let's get going': UK tells businesses to prepare for Brexit crunch
Description: Britain is urging businesses and individuals to prepare for the Dec. 31 end of the Brexit transition period with an information campaign titled: "The UK's new start: let's get going."

Headlines: California regulator approves PG&E's Chapter 11 reorganization plan
Description: PG&E Corp said on Thursday its Chapter 11 reorganization plan has been confirmed by a California power regulator, bringing the power provider one step closer to emerge from bankruptcy and participate in a state-backed wildfire fund.

Headlines: Trump says U.S. may make a trade deal with China at some point
Description: President Donald Trump on Tuesday left the door open for China to negotiate an end to the trade war between Washington and Beijing, a day after imposing new tariffs on nearly $200 billion Chinese imports and threatening more if China retaliates.

Headlines: Analyst View: After U.S. oil futures crash, what next?
Description: A historic rout in oil markets sent U.S. crude prices plummeting to as much as minus $40 a barrel as traders rushed to get rid of unwanted stocks with storage capacity already overflowing amid a coronavirus-induced demand collapse.

Headlines: Institutional investors tell Big Pharma to cooperate on coronavirus
Description: Institutional investors in 15 major pharmaceutical companies have called on the drugmakers to set aside rivalries and short-term interests and cooperate on finding solutions to the coronavirus.

Headlines: German prosecutors probe Wirecard management board
Description: Munich prosecutors on Friday said they had searched Wirecard's  headquarters and opened proceedings against the payment company's entire management board as part of a market manipulation probe initiated by Germany's financial regulator BaFin.

Headlines: JPMorgan takes action against traders for using WhatsApp at work: Bloomberg News
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co, the largest U.S. bank, has taken action against more than a dozen traders for using WhatsApp at work, firing one and cutting bonuses for the rest, Bloomberg news reported on Wednesday, citing people with knowledge of the matter.

Headlines: GM did not heed call to keep Oshawa, Ontario plant open: union boss
Description: The head of Canada's auto union blasted General Motors Co on Tuesday for pushing ahead with plans to phase out work at its Oshawa, Ontario, assembly plant despite calls by workers and politicians in Canada to find a new vehicle to build there.

Headlines: Scoot over Microsoft: Apple again the most valuable U.S. company
Description: Apple won back its crown as the most valuable publicly listed U.S. company on Wednesday, ending the session with a market capitalization above recent leaders Microsoft and Amazon.com.

Headlines: EU will assess court rulings on Starbucks, Fiat tax cases: Vestager
Description: The European Commission will study the rulings of the European Union's second-highest court on tax disputes with Starbucks  and Fiat Chrysler Automobiles , the competition chief Margrethe Vestager said on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. lawmakers urge Trump administration to restore India's trade privileges
Description: Forty-four members of the U.S. Congress have urged President Donald Trump's trade representative to restore trade concessions to India, saying the withdrawal of the privilege had led to retaliatory tariffs from New Delhi which were hurting U.S. industry.

Headlines: Oil rises, but ends wild week lower as coronavirus slashes fuel demand
Description: Oil prices rose on Friday, bringing an end to another week of losses that featured the U.S. contract plunging to minus $40 a barrel, as global production cuts could not keep pace with the collapse in demand caused by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Time to buy stocks again, market mavens say
Description: BlackRock, Credit Suisse and some other big banks reckon it is time to get back into equities after markets rallied this week following massive government and central bank stimulus packages to fight fallout from the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Wall Street gives thumbs down to potential shortened trading day
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin's suggestion on Tuesday that the country's stock exchanges might shorten their trading hours did not go over well with investors reeling from Wall Street's recent plunge sparked by growing fears about the coronavirus.

Headlines: Sears, chairman, lenders seek bankruptcy loan breakthrough: sources
Description: Sears Holdings Corp is in discussions with Chairman Eddie Lampert and lenders on a deal to expand a bankruptcy financing package that would help it avoid liquidation, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Probe into Facebook's data breach broadens: Washington Post
Description: A federal investigation into Facebook Inc's data breach with political consultancy Cambridge Analytica has broadened  focus on the actions and statements of the tech giant, the Washington Post reported on Monday, citing people familiar with the inquiries.

Headlines: Huawei Canada executive leaves post as scrutiny of company grows
Description: One of Huawei Canada's top executives on Friday disclosed he was leaving his post after more than seven years with the Chinese telecommunications equipment maker, which is facing heightened scrutiny over security issues from Canada and its allies.

Headlines: Hyundai union head fears GM-like crisis; says electric cars destroy jobs
Description: Hyundai Motor's  union chief warned its workers may face a similar crisis to the one hitting General Motors'  South Korean unit as sales in key markets slide, adding that electric cars were 'evil' and will destroy jobs.

Headlines: U.S. goods trade deficit widens sharply in December
Description: The U.S. goods trade deficit widened sharply in December as slowing global demand and a strong dollar weighed on exports, another sign that economic growth slowed in the fourth quarter.

Headlines: Protest fears stalk Hong Kong businesses as China threat looms
Description: Walking a tightrope between anti-government protests and  political masters in Beijing, many Hong Kong firms are opting to toe the Communist Party line to avoid potential repercussions having seen what happened at Cathay Pacific Airways.

Headlines: Peugeot's UK Vauxhall to cut more jobs at Ellesmere Port car plant
Description: Carmaker Vauxhall, which is owned by Peugeot parent company PSA , is to shed an extra 241 jobs from its Ellesmere Port car plant in the latest cuts at the site, deepening union concerns over the future of the factory.

Headlines: German carmakers to invest 60 billion euros in electric cars and automation: VDA
Description: Germany's car industry is to invest nearly 60 billion euros ($68 billion) over the next three years on electric cars and automated driving, the head of the VDA car industry association said ahead of the Geneva motor show.

Headlines: China's Xiaomi says plans to launch more than 10 5G phones next year
Description: Chinese smartphone maker Xiaomi Corp plans to launch more than 10 5G phones in 2020, CEO Lei Jun said on Sunday, speaking at the World Internet conference in the eastern Chinese town of Wuzhen.

Headlines: Explainer: No one really knows how many Americans need unemployment benefits
Description: Another 1.9 million people filed for unemployment benefits for the first time last week, according to data released by the Labor Department on Thursday, marking 11 straight weeks in which millions of Americans have filed claims for jobless benefits.

Headlines: Apple cuts current-quarter production plan for new iPhones by 10 percent: Nikkei
Description: Apple Inc , which slashed its quarterly sales forecast last week, has reduced planned production for its three new iPhone models by about 10 percent for the January-March quarter, the Nikkei Asian Review reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: NMC Health removes CEO amid investigation of UAE firm's finances
Description: NMC Health  has removed Chief Executive Prasanth Manghat with immediate effect and granted its finance chief extended sick leave, as more details emerge from an investigation into the UAE healthcare firm's finances.

Headlines: U.S. factory orders barely rise; shipments fall further
Description: New orders for U.S.-made goods rose less than expected in January and shipments fell for a fourth straight month, offering more evidence of a slowdown in manufacturing activity.

Headlines: New York court subpoenas Etihad, Fitch in $1.2 billion debt battle
Description: A New York court has sent subpoenas to Etihad and ratings agency Fitch this week seeking a document at the centre of a battle over $1.2 billion in debt issued by the Abu Dhabi carrier and airlines it partly owned, according to legal documents reviewed by Reuters.

Headlines: U.S. restricts exports to Chinese semiconductor firm Fujian Jinhua
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's administration took action on Monday to cut off a Chinese state-backed chipmaker from U.S. suppliers amid allegations the firm stole intellectual property from U.S. semiconductor company Micron Technology Inc .

Headlines: HSBC forex trading costs cut sharply by blockchain - executive
Description: HSBC has reduced the cost of settling foreign exchange trades by a quarter through its blockchain-based system, an executive overseeing the project told Reuters, offering a glimpse of the savings the technology could offer banks.

Headlines: Southwest CEO on coronavirus: "We could discount prices tomorrow and it wouldn't do any good"
Description: Southwest Airlines  Chief Executive Gary Kelly said on Thursday that the airline was not running dramatic fare sales in response to a drop-off in demand due to the spreading coronavirus.

Headlines: Australian retail shareholder group says to vote against AMP pay proposals
Description: Australia's most prominent retail shareholder group said on Wednesday it will vote against AMP Ltd's executive pay proposals for a second straight year, adding to pressure on the board of the country's largest listed wealth manager.

Headlines: China considers removal of U.S. poultry import restrictions: Xinhua
Description: China is considering the removal of restrictions on poultry imports from the United States, state-owned Xinhua News Agency reported on Thursday.

Headlines: In swipe at Trump, China tells U.N. tariffs could plunge world into recession
Description: The Chinese government's top diplomat said on Friday that tariffs and trade disputes could plunge the world into recession and Beijing was committed to resolving them in a "calm, rational and cooperative manner."

Headlines: Fed officials say trade tensions could threaten growth
Description: The recent ratcheting up of U.S.-China trade tensions is creating uncertainties for businesses and could threaten economic growth, four Federal Reserve policymakers said on Thursday.

Headlines: Elite U.S. school MIT cuts ties with Chinese tech firms Huawei, ZTE
Description: The Massachusetts Institute of Technology has severed ties with Huawei Technologies and ZTE Corp as U.S. authorities investigate the Chinese firms for alleged sanctions violations, the school said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Farm machinery makers, Brazil banks working on private financing - Deere
Description: Agricultural machine manufacturers are working with banks in Brazil to avoid a repeat of slumping sales when public financing is expected to run out next year, the head of the local unit of  U.S. tractor maker Deere & Co told Reuters on Thursday.

Headlines: Disney earnings miss forecasts as costs rise for its streaming future
Description: Walt Disney Co  reported a steeper earnings decline than Wall Street expected on Tuesday as the company poured money into its ambitious plunge into streaming media and began folding in assets purchased from Twenty-First Century Fox.

Headlines: Factbox: Financial wrongdoing allegations against Carlos Ghosn
Description: Carlos Ghosn, the ousted boss of the Renault-Nissan carmaking alliance who was awaiting trial in Japan, flew into Lebanon on Monday evening, France's Les Echos newspaper reported.

Headlines: China says it does not want U.S. trade frictions to escalate
Description: China's Commerce Ministry said on Thursday that the country does not want an escalation of trade frictions with the United States, and that some specific progress was made in the latest round of talks that concluded over the weekend.

Headlines: BlackRock expands in Paris with new hires ahead of Brexit, source says
Description: BlackRock  has increased its staff in Paris and is seeking to set up an alternative investment management business there, a source close to the company said on Monday, in another sign of the French capital's increasing post-Brexit appeal.

Headlines: United slashes New York-area flights due to coronavirus
Description: United Airlines  said late Saturday it will drastically reduce flights to two New York City airports amid the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Japanese billionaire Maezawa in $9 million 'social experiment' giveaway
Description: Japanese fashion tycoon Yusaku Maezawa is giving away $9 million to his Twitter followers in what he says is a "social experiment" to see if the payment boosts their happiness.

Headlines: Google challenges record $5 billion EU antitrust fine
Description: Alphabet unit Google  on Tuesday challenged a record 4.34-billion euro ($5 billion) fine imposed by European Union antitrust regulators three months ago for using its popular Android mobile operating system to thwart rivals.

Headlines: Mercedes to recall 4,419 vehicles in Russia: watchdog
Description: Automaker Mercedes-Benz  will recall 4,419 of its C-class and GLC-class vehicles in Russia due to a possible fault with the driver's airbag, Russia's standards agency said on Monday.

Headlines: Moody's outlook revision reignites SoftBank spat
Description: Credit-rating firm Moody's Investors Service on Friday revised its outlook for SoftBank Group Corp to "negative" from "ratings under review", three months after making a two-notch downgrade that caused a public spat with the tech conglomerate.

Headlines: Amazon pledges $2 billion venture capital fund to invest in clean energy
Description: Amazon.com Inc  said on Tuesday it will launch a $2 billion venture capital fund that will focus on technology investments to reduce the impact of climate change and support sustainable development.

Headlines: Chinese importers scoop up Brazilian soybeans amid U.S. trade uncertainty
Description: Chinese buyers scooped up at least 20 cargoes of Brazilian soybeans last week due to uncertainty over a trade deal with the United States that sent them rushing to lock in supplies, traders said on Monday.

Headlines: Trump's coronavirus stimulus is still evolving. Here's what it should include, experts say
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said he will ask Congress for a payroll tax cut and other "very major" stimulus moves on Tuesday to ease the economic pain of the coronavirus, but the details remain unclear.

Headlines: Credit Suisse also spied on Greenpeace: newspaper
Description: Credit Suisse , which has faced a scandal related to spying on senior executives, also conducted espionage against Greenpeace, Swiss newspaper SonntagsZeitung reported.

Headlines: Oil pares losses after U.S. exits Iran deal, dollar off 2018 highs
Description: Crude prices pared losses that earlier on Tuesday ran as deep as 4 percent after U.S. President Donald Trump said the United States will withdraw from the Iran nuclear deal, while the dollar edged off fresh 2018 highs.

Headlines: Baillie Gifford willing to invest more in Tesla: the Times
Description: Baillie Gifford & Co, one of the top shareholders of Tesla Inc , has said it would be willing to inject more cash into the electric carmaker, the Times reported http://bit.ly/2PwSpuu on Monday.

Headlines: Bitcoin volatility sinks to lowest in nearly two years
Description: Bitcoin has experienced one of its worst annual price performances of its short 10-year-old life but also appears to have become more stable in the process.

Headlines: Toymaker Lego wins court case against Chinese copycats
Description: Lego has won another case against imitators in China where copies of its colorful plastic toy bricks and figures have been a recurrent problem, the Danish toymaker said on Monday.

Headlines: Credit Suisse CEO will not attend Saudi investment conference: source
Description: The chief executive of Swiss bank Credit Suisse  will not attend a Saudi investment conference this month, a source familiar with the situation told Reuters on Tuesday.

Headlines: JPMorgan's Dimon urges infrastructure, mortgage reform to spur U.S. growth
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co chief executive Jamie Dimon on Thursday called for reforms to U.S. public policy on education, infrastructure and mortgages to repair what he called the "fraying" American dream.

Headlines: Telecom network maker Nokia wins $2.3 billion frame deals in China
Description: Finnish mobile telecom network maker Nokia announced on Wednesday that it had signed frame deals with China Mobile, China Telecom and China Unicom worth more than 2 billion euros ($2.3 billion).

Headlines: Jaguar-Land Rover parent warns of profit hit from coronavirus outbreak
Description: The coronavirus outbreak in China could hit profits at luxury car brands Jaguar and Land Rover, parent Tata Motors  said on Thursday, the latest company to warn of an impact from the epidemic that has killed 170 people and forced businesses to suspend operations.

Headlines: Deutsche Boerse chief says plans to fulfil his term as CEO
Description: Deutsche Boerse  Chief Executive Theodor Weimer said on Tuesday that he planned to complete his term through the end of 2024 at the helm of the stock exchange operator.

Headlines: UniCredit shares fall at open after report Mustier vying for HSBC top job
Description: Shares in Italy's biggest bank UniCredit fell more than 1% at open on Friday following reports Chief Executive Jean Pierre Mustier is being considered for the top job at rival HSBC .

Headlines: AMD revenue forecast disappoints on weak console demand
Description: Advanced Micro Devices Inc's  first-quarter revenue estimate came in largely below analysts' estimates due to waning demand from gaming console makers, even as its data center and PC chips business tracked a recovery in the chip industry.

Headlines: Stronger together: Fiat Chrysler and Peugeot plan world's No.4 carmaker
Description: Fiat Chrysler  and Peugeot owner PSA  plan to join forces in a 50-50 share merger to create the world's fourth-largest automaker, seeking scale to cope with costly new technologies and slowing global demand.

Headlines: Trump wants California to let automaker Tesla reopen assembly plant
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday urged that Tesla Inc  be allowed to reopen its electric vehicle assembly plant in California, joining CEO Elon Musk's bid to defy county officials who have ordered it to remain closed.

Headlines: Khazanah, Temasek to sell part of joint Singapore property for about $1.2 billion
Description: A joint venture between Malaysia sovereign wealth fund Khazanah and Singapore state investor Temasek is selling the office and retail units of its DUO property development in Singapore, it said late on Monday.

Headlines: OAG says United, Delta, Lufthansa to bear brunt of U.S. travel curbs
Description: U.S. travel restrictions on passengers arriving from Europe's border-free Schengen area will affect passengers arriving on 6,747 flights over the next four weeks or 11% of all international flights, flight data provider OAG said.

Headlines: Factbox: Financial wrongdoing allegations against Carlos Ghosn
Description: Carlos Ghosn, the ousted boss of the Renault-Nissan carmaking alliance who fled house arrest in Japan last week, denies the allegations of financial misconduct made against him.

Headlines: Resurgent Boeing 737 MAX could trigger jet surplus, analyst warns
Description: Airlines struggling to cope with the grounding of the 737 MAX could face a markedly different problem when Boeing Co's  best-selling jet is cleared to re-enter service: a switch to concerns about aircraft oversupply, carriers have been warned.

Headlines: Facebook's Instagram launches Snapchat-like 'Threads' app
Description: Facebook Inc said on Thursday it was launching a separate camera-first messaging app, "Threads", for its photo-sharing platform Instagram, stepping up the company's social media war with smaller rival Snapchat.

Headlines: LVMH expects pandemic to dampen sales for some time yet
Description: The fallout from the coronavirus crisis will weigh on LVMH's  earnings for some time yet, though there were some signs of recovery this month, executives at the world's biggest luxury goods group said on Tuesday.

Headlines: MUFG reports first quarterly loss in decade on writedown at Indonesian unit
Description: Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group Inc (MUFG) , Japan's largest lender by assets, reported a net loss in the third quarter, for the first time in nearly a decade, as its banking unit booked a one-off charge on an Indonesian subsidiary.

Headlines: U.S. import prices post biggest drop in six months
Description: U.S. import prices fell by the most in six months in February as the cost of petroleum products dropped, and economists said they could decline further because of the coronavirus pandemic and an oil price war between Saudi Arabia and Russia.

Headlines: Hertz awards over $16 million in retention bonus to key executives
Description: U.S. car rental company Hertz Global Holdings  said on Tuesday it has paid about $16.2 million in retention bonuses to a range of key executives at the director level and above, days after the company filed for bankruptcy protection.

Headlines: Alibaba launches $13.4 billion Hong Kong listing to fund expansion
Description: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba Group launched the share sale for its Hong Kong listing on Wednesday, braving unrest in the global financial hub to try to raise up to $13.4 billion to fund its expansion plans.

Headlines: Buffett says Apple content plan hard to predict, touts airline safety
Description: Warren Buffett on Thursday said he could not predict the success of Apple Inc's new suite of services but was confident the public would benefit as content providers vie for their wallets.

Headlines: Walmart Brasil to ditch e-commerce, focus on brick and mortar
Description: Walmart Brasil will close down its e-commerce operation in Latin America's biggest retail market to focus on brick and mortar locations, converting underperforming hypermarkets into wholesale stores.

Headlines: Johnson & Johnson to buy surgical robotics firm Auris for $3.4 billion
Description: Johnson & Johnson said on Wednesday it would buy Auris Health Inc for $3.4 billion in cash, gaining access to the privately held company's surgical robotic scope used in respiratory procedures and the detection of lung cancer.

Headlines: Wells Fargo and Barclays back fintech company OpenFin
Description: Financial services software startup OpenFin has raised $17 million in a funding round led by Wells Fargo & Co with participation from Barclays, the company said on Thursday.

Headlines: BMW's hybrid cars to switch to electric only mode in polluted cities
Description: BMW's new hybrid cars will automatically switch off their combustion engines in heavily polluted inner city areas and use pure electric driving mode as a way to cut vehicle emissions, the carmaker said on Tuesday.

Headlines: BMW Korea apologizes as 27 vehicles catch fire over January-July
Description: BMW's  South Korean unit apologized over a spate of engine fires, estimated by the country's transport ministry at 27 over January to July, that has prompted a government probe and a major backlash from consumers.

Headlines: Citron's Andrew Left closes Wayfair short bet after long wait
Description: This week's sharp stock sell-off helped activist short-seller Andrew Left profitably close a long-held bet against online retailer Wayfair  on Friday.

Headlines: Trump says he thinks U.S. will be able to do trade deal with China
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday he thinks the United States will be able to strike a deal with China, as Chinese Vice Premier Liu He visits Washington for trade talks in a bid to ease tensions between the two economies.

Headlines: U.S. probe of Google's online ad dominance would appease long suffering rivals, publishers
Description: Ad tech firms and publishers have had to stay in the good graces of Google or risk insolvency.

Headlines: Last man standing: lonely Fed tightening spurs dollar surge
Description: As speculation about interest rate rises and policy 'normalization' in the euro zone, Japan, Britain and China falls away rapidly, the U.S. Federal Reserve's now lonely monetary tightening has suddenly supercharged the dollar.

Headlines: Indexes hit closing records amid further trade deal optimism
Description: All three major U.S. stock indexes posted record closing highs on Monday, extending a recent run of gains on further hopes of a U.S.-China trade deal.

Headlines: Papa John's set to appoint Arby's President Lynch as CEO: Bloomberg
Description: Papa John's International Inc  is set to name Rob Lynch as the pizza chain's new chief executive officer, Bloomberg reported late on Monday, barely 19 months after Steve Ritchie took over as top executive following a bitter board dispute.

Headlines: Record-setting rally resumes as Mnuchin says trade deal to be signed
Description: Wall Street's major indexes resumed their rally with fresh records on Thursday as U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said an initial U.S.-China trade deal would be signed in early January.

Headlines: Verizon raises 2020 capital expenditure in 5G push
Description: Verizon Communications Inc on Thursday raised its full-year capital expenditure as it accelerates its transition to 5G network.

Headlines: SoftBank's Son unveils $5.5 billion buyback, laments share price
Description: Japan's SoftBank Group Corp announced a $5.5 billion share buyback on Wednesday as it reported a 60 percent increase in quarterly operating profit buoyed by rising valuations for its technology investments.

Headlines: GE lifts forecast but warns Boeing grounding may cost $1.4 billion
Description: General Electric Co  raised its 2019 forecast on Wednesday, but disclosed more than $1 billion in potential costs from Boeing's grounded 737 MAX jetliner, puncturing an early share rally.

Headlines: Uber offer for Grubhub fans worries over delivery fees charged to restaurants
Description: The possibility that Uber Technologies Inc , which runs Uber Eats, could acquire Grubhub Inc  is reigniting some restaurants' worries over the commissions charged to eateries by the third-party delivery companies.

Headlines: U.S. business formation tanks as coronavirus shuts economy
Description: Applications to start new U.S. businesses tumbled last week, the latest indication that stringent measures to control the spread of the novel coronavirus had brought the economy to its knees.

Headlines: Domino's pulls long-term forecast, says international sales declining
Description: Domino's Pizza Inc  on Thursday pulled its long-term forecast and said international comparable sales fell 3.2% in the first three weeks of the current quarter as stores remain shut due to the coronavirus pandemic, sending its shares down about 5%.

Headlines: Ahold says Stop & Shop strike will hurt 2019 margins
Description: Dutch supermarket group Ahold, warned on Tuesday that a strike at its Stop & Shop chain in the United States would hurt its underlying 2019 profit margin.

Headlines: FCC report found no 'favoritism' on proposed Sinclair deal
Description: The U.S. Federal Communications Commission's inspector general said there was no evidence of impropriety relating to the proposed, and now defunct, merger of Sinclair Broadcast Group  and Tribune Media Co , concluding FCC Chairman Ajit Pai had not shown bias in favor of the deal.

Headlines: Huawei calls for swift end to case of executive arrested in Canada
Description: China's Huawei Technologies wants a quick resolution of the case of its former finance chief Meng Wanzhou, who is accused of violating U.S. sanctions on Iran and has been detained in Canada, its chairman said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Airbus urges talks to settle long-running trade dispute
Description: Airbus  on Wednesday urged talks to reduce trade tensions after the World Trade Organization gave the United States approval to impose tariffs on $7.5 billion worth of European goods over illegal EU subsidies handed to Airbus.

Headlines: Ultimate frontier market? Amid thaw, Chinese eye North Korea real estate
Description: Chinese property speculators are starting to bet on a rapid improvement in relations between North Korea and the rest of the world, pushing up prices in the border city of Dandong and even spurring buying interest in the world's most isolated country.

Headlines: Boeing communications chief resigns over decades-old article on women in combat
Description: Boeing Co's  communications chief Niel Golightly abruptly resigned on Thursday, following an employee's complaint over an article the former U.S. military pilot wrote 33 years ago arguing women should not serve in combat.

Headlines: A Florida toy importer braces for retail upheaval
Description: Most U.S. states have begun to reopen their economies, but Jay Foreman, chief executive of Basic Fun, said he's more worried than ever.

Headlines: Ford to stop building Focus cars in Argentina in 2019
Description: Ford Motor Co  said on Monday it plans to stop building its Focus compact cars in Argentina in May 2019 as it seeks to stem losses from its operations in South America.

Headlines: Honda says has enough cash but may issue bonds if new coronavirus waves hit
Description: Honda Motor Co  has enough cash on hand, equivalent to almost two months of sales, to weather the downturn caused by the coronavirus pandemic, but may issue bonds to raise funds if there is second or third wave of infections, a senior managing director at the company, Kohei Takeuchi said on Tuesday.

Headlines: NBCUniversal says abortion laws would 'strongly impact' decision on where it films
Description: Comcast Corp's NBCUniversal said if anti-abortion laws in various U.S. states are upheld, it would "strongly impact" where it produces films and television shows in the future.

Headlines: Flattened yield curve reason to be nervous, but U.S. economy solid: Fed's Evans
Description: Chicago Federal Reserve Bank President Charles Evans said on Monday it was understandable for markets to be nervous when the yield curve flattened, though he was still confident about the U.S. economic growth outlook.

Headlines: U.S. consumer confidence ebbs, house prices surge
Description: U.S. consumer confidence fell from more than a 17-year high in March amid stock market volatility, but households remained upbeat about labor market conditions, which could help to support consumer spending.

Headlines: Outside panel to review Samsung heir Lee's case: Seoul prosecutors
Description: An outside panel will weigh the validity of an investigation into Samsung Group heir Jay Y. Lee over a 2015 merger and alleged accounting fraud, the Seoul Central District Prosecutors' Office said on Thursday.

Headlines: GSK to develop plant-based COVID-19 vaccine with Canada's Medicago
Description: The world's largest vaccine-maker GSK has put its vaccine booster technology to work in a potential new COVID-19 shot, to be developed with a Canadian biopharmaceutical company backed by tobacco company Philip Morris.

Headlines: Mastercard says coronavirus to hit first-quarter revenue
Description: (This February 24 story corrects to say revenue to be hit between "2 and 3 percentage points" not "2% and 3%" in first paragraph)

Headlines: Pret A Manger to not make June quarter rent in full as virus crisis drags on
Description: Sandwich and coffee shop chain Pret A Manger said on Thursday it would not make its June quarter rent in full as it continued to lose tens of millions of pounds each month because of the coronavirus crisis, confirming a report by the Financial Times.

Headlines: Trump ratchets up pressure on China, threatens tariff hikes
Description: President Donald Trump dramatically increased pressure on China on Sunday to reach a trade deal, saying he would hike U.S. tariffs on $200 billion worth of Chinese goods this week and target hundreds of billions more soon.

Headlines: Volkswagen says restart of some China plants postponed until February 17
Description: Volkswagen  has postponed restarting production at most China plants in its joint venture with SAIC Motor  and the Tianjin plant in its JV with FAW Group until Feb. 17 amid the coronavirus epidemic.

Headlines: Exclusive: Qatar, Exxon to proceed with $10 billion Texas LNG project - sources
Description: Qatar Petroleum and Exxon Mobil Corp are expected to announce plans next week to proceed with a $10 billion project that will expand a liquefied natural gas (LNG) export facility in Texas, three people familiar with the transaction said.

Headlines: Rolex backs Ellison's SailGP with long-term partnership
Description: Swiss watchmaker Rolex raised its aquatic profile on Monday in a long-term partnership with SailGP, a new $1 million winner-takes-all series backed by Oracle  boss Larry Ellison.

Headlines: U.S. FDA says some data testing Novartis' $2 million gene therapy was manipulated
Description: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration said on Tuesday that some data from early testing of Novartis' more than $2 million gene therapy Zolgensma was manipulated, but the agency  believes the treatment should remain on the market.

Headlines: 'Rhetoric' masks lack of progress on gender diversity in finance: UK watchdog
Description: The number of women in senior roles at financial services firms in Britain has flatlined since 2005 despite diversity "rhetoric" from industry, according to research from the Financial Conduct Authority.

Headlines: PayPal to acquire fraud prevention company Simility for $120 million
Description: PayPal Holdings Inc  has agreed to acquire fraud prevention technology company Simility for $120 million in cash, it said on Thursday.

Headlines: Facebook's damage limitation drive hits trouble in Germany
Description: Facebook's attempt to limit fallout from a massive data breach hit trouble in Germany on Friday as a privacy watchdog opened a case against the social network and politicians accused its bosses of evasion.

Headlines: Gap's Old Navy plans to nearly double its store count after split
Description: Gap Inc's  Old Navy brand plans to nearly double its store count in North America as the apparel retailer readies itself to split from the parent company next year.

Headlines: U.S. Justice Department probes Musk statement on taking Tesla private
Description: Tesla Inc said on Tuesday the U.S. Department of Justice was investigating Chief Executive Elon Musk's public statements in August that he was considering taking the electric car maker private, the latest and biggest threat to Musk's leadership.

Headlines: Wall Street sidesteps Musk lockdown rant as Tesla numbers improve
Description: Wall Street brokerages gave a resounding thumbs-up to Tesla Inc's  first-quarter numbers on Thursday, lauding the electric carmaker's improved gross margins and sending its shares 8% higher in trading before the opening bell.

Headlines: Richemont teams up with designer Alber Elbaz for fashion venture
Description: Richemont  said on Friday that it was teaming up with former Lanvin designer Alber Elbaz for a new venture at a time when luxury goods groups are vying to make star hires.

Headlines: U.S. consumers put economy on moderate growth path in third quarter
Description: U.S. economic growth nudged up in the third quarter and the economy appears to have maintained the moderate pace of expansion as the year ended, supported by a strong labor market.

Headlines: Stocks, oil tumble on fears virus to hurt China's economy
Description: Global equity markets tumbled on Thursday as the death toll from China's coronavirus outbreak hit 170, pummeling oil prices and inverting a closely watched bond indicator as investors worried about the  world's second-largest economy.

Headlines: Lululemon soars on menswear, online push; inches into Nike turf
Description: Shares of yoga-pants specialists Lululemon Athletica Inc rose 15 percent on Thursday, with several Wall Street analysts raising their price targets for the company after a blockbuster fourth quarter.

Headlines: OPEC+ likely to extend oil supply cuts until June: sources
Description: OPEC and its allies are likely to extend existing oil output cuts when they meet next month until mid-2020, with non-OPEC oil producer Russia supporting Saudi Arabia's push for stable oil prices amid the listing of state oil giant Saudi Aramco.

Headlines: Exclusive: Campbell Soup steps up CEO search, COO a contender - sources
Description: Campbell Soup Co's  board is drawing up a list of CEO candidates, with Chief Operating Officer Luca Mignini emerging as the top internal contender, as the company seeks to fend off a proxy challenge from Daniel Loeb's hedge fund, Third Point LLC, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Exclusive: After U.S. sanctions, Venezuela seeks to collect some oil payments via Rosneft
Description: (This April 18 story corrects to make clear Reuters could not determine payments were made under the proposed arrangement, removes reference to Evrofinance Mosnarbank and clarifies that experts see no violation of sanctions)

Headlines: Renault shares slump as profit warning deepens carmaker's problems
Description: A profit warning sent Renault's  shares as much as 15% lower on Friday, capping a turbulent year for the French carmaker since the arrest of long-time boss Carlos Ghosn and adding to signs of a sharp global auto industry slowdown.

Headlines: Trump says global oil production cut should help industry recover
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday the OPEC+ group of oil producers is looking to cut output by 20 million barrels per day (bpd), a figure that appeared to include a wider group of producers, including the United States.

Headlines: Russia's Novak says all producers favor nine-month oil output deal extension
Description: Russian Energy Minister Alexander Novak said on Monday that all OPEC and non-OPEC countries favored extending their global oil output deal by nine months under the same terms agreed in December.

Headlines: Tesla cuts jobs as it looks to make Model 3 more affordable
Description: Tesla Inc said on Friday it would cut thousands of jobs to rein in costs as it plans to increase production of lower-priced versions of its crucial Model 3 sedan, sending its shares down as much as 10 percent.

Headlines: Exclusive: Mexico set to impose 20 percent tariff on U.S. pork legs - sources
Description: Mexico will impose a 20 percent tariff on U.S. pork imports, two industry officials with direct knowledge of the plan told Reuters on Monday, for the first time providing details of the country's retaliatory measures to U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs on steel and aluminum.

Headlines: Trump: Wall Street Journal story on China trade deal 'completely wrong'
Description: President Donald Trump on Friday said a Wall Street Journal story on a U.S. trade deal with China is completely wrong.

Headlines: Huawei fights to keep U.S. funds flowing to its rural mobile customers
Description: China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd, the world's biggest telecoms equipment maker, argued on Wednesday that Washington should scrap plans to prohibit wireless companies from using U.S. government funds to buy Huawei gear for their networks.

Headlines: J.Crew CEO James Brett steps down after short tenure
Description: J.Crew Group Inc, known for its preppy men's and women's clothing, said on Saturday that its Chief Executive Officer James Brett is leaving the company, effective immediately.

Headlines: Tech stocks battered after disappointing Amazon and Alphabet results
Description: So-called FANG stocks and other tech shares sank in extended trade on Thursday following disappointing quarterly reports from Amazon.com Inc  and Alphabet Inc .

Headlines: Russia says Denmark has not asked for help in Danske case
Description: Danish and Estonian financial crime agencies have not asked Russia to help investigate a massive money laundering scandal at Danske Bank involving Russian and other account holders, Russia's financial monitoring service told Reuters on Wednesday.

Headlines: Trump aide says Canada's Trudeau overreacting to trade dispute
Description: Trade frictions between the United States and Canada are a "family quarrel," President Donald Trump's economic adviser said on Sunday, brushing aside concerns expressed by Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau as an overreaction.

Headlines: Saudi's PIF invests more than $1 billion in electric carmaker Lucid Motors
Description: Saudi Arabia's Public Investment Fund (PIF) has agreed to invest more than $1 billion in Lucid Motors, adding to the emerging competition facing U.S. electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc .

Headlines: China has picked up its 'game' on trade with U.S., Trump adviser says
Description: The U.S. trade deal with China is not only fully intact, but Beijing has actually stepped forward in a number of areas in a constructive way, a top White House adviser said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Trump says he told Fed's Powell U.S. interest rates are too high
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said he complained to Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell about high U.S. interest rates in a meeting they held at the White House on Monday morning.

Headlines: Swedbank says its anti-money laundering procedures not being investigated
Description: Sweden's Swedbank  said on Thursday that there were no ongoing investigations into its anti-money laundering procedures, a day after its shares slumped on worries about cross-border transactions by banks in Estonia.

Headlines: Exclusive: As Citgo profit rises, pressure to restore dividend grows - sources
Description: Citgo Petroleum Corp's directors are unlikely to bow to pressure this week to resume dividend payments, two sources close to the discussions said, as the refiner cannot yet help Venezuela's interim government ease creditors' claims against its parent PDVSA that also are threatening its assets.

Headlines: Starbucks to launch Beyond Meat plant-based breakfast sandwich in Canada
Description: Starbucks Corp  said on Wednesday its Canadian stores will start selling a Beyond Meat Inc  plant-based breakfast sandwich next week, the first time the world's biggest coffee chain will offer an imitation meat product.

Headlines: SAP goal remains to triple market cap, but gives no timeframe
Description: SAP, Germany's most valuable public company, remains committed to tripling its market capitalization, but Chief Executive Bill McDermott declined to specify a timeframe on Thursday.

Headlines: Doomed with Democrats, Trump's budget boosts Pentagon, targets safety net
Description: President Donald Trump called on Monday for spending more U.S. taxpayer money on the military and a U.S.-Mexico border wall, while overhauling social safety-net programs in a budget plan likely to die in Congress but live on in his 2020 re-election campaign.

Headlines: Tempered expectations of Fed rate cut sink stocks globally
Description: A strong U.S. jobs report that tempered expectations of an aggressive interest rate cut by the Federal Reserve later this month and weak economic data in Germany helped push global stock indices lower on Friday after hitting record highs earlier this week.

Headlines: We will work it out: Trump calls trade dispute with France "minor"
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday he was sure "a minor dispute" with France on trade could be worked out after he threatened to impose duties of up to 100% on imports of champagne, handbags and other French products.

Headlines: After escaping Japan, Ghosn feels Lebanese crisis
Description: Carlos Ghosn's daring escape from Japan to Lebanon may have cast light on his wealth and influence, but in Beirut the ex-Nissan boss can only get a few hundred dollars a week from the bank because of the country's deep financial crisis.

Headlines: Cut in China tariffs on cars a 'litmus test' for trade talks: Kudlow
Description: White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Tuesday that a reduction in Chinese tariffs on U.S. cars and agricultural and energy commodities would be a "litmus test" for whether U.S.-China trade talks are on track to succeed.

Headlines: German carmakers join American farmers on front line of U.S.-China trade war
Description: An increasingly shrill exchange of words between the United States and China that is threatening to trigger a global trade war has claimed another victim - Germany's auto sector.

Headlines: Credit Suisse gets approval to take majority stake in China JV
Description: Credit Suisse  has received regulatory approval to take a majority stake in its Chinese investment banking joint venture, the bank said in a statement on Friday.

Headlines: French court backs workers in Amazon row over virus measures
Description: A French court on Friday rejected Amazon's  appeal against a ruling that restricts what it can deliver during the coronavirus crisis, handing a victory to unions that had criticised the U.S. e-commerce giant's safety measures.

Headlines: Nasdaq falls as U.S. lawmakers grill Facebook, Twitter executives
Description: The Nasdaq fell more than 1 percent on Wednesday, dented by technology stocks after Facebook Inc  and Twitter Inc  executives defended their companies before skeptical U.S. lawmakers.

Headlines: Exclusive: Schlumberger names new top executives to oversee corporate overhaul
Description: Schlumberger, the world's largest oilfield services firm, will reshuffle top executives and operations in coming months to deal with this year's historic decline in the oil industry, according to a memo to employees.

Headlines: FCA, France reach tentative agreement on Renault merger: sources
Description: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV has reached a tentative agreement with France on the terms of its proposed merger with Renault, two sources told Reuters, as the French carmaker's board met to consider the bid late on Wednesday.

Headlines: Trump and Xi to meet after defiant China hits U.S. with new tariffs
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday he would meet Chinese President Xi Jinping next month as the trade war between the world's two largest economies intensified, sending shivers through global markets.

Headlines: Cable operator Charter edges past quarterly revenue estimates
Description: Cable operator Charter Communications Inc edged past analysts' estimates for first-quarter revenue on Tuesday, as the company attracted more customers for its internet services, offsetting a drop in video subscribers.

Headlines: WPP shares slump to lowest since 2012 as sales slide
Description: WPP  shares plunged to their lowest level in nearly eight years on Thursday after a sharp slowdown in fourth-quarter trading derailed the latest recovery attempt at the world's biggest advertising company.

Headlines: Drug firms offer to settle U.S. opioid suits with $50 billion package: sources
Description: Five drugmakers and distributors are offering $22 billion in cash as well as drugs and services they value at $28 billion to resolve lawsuits alleging the industry fueled the U.S. opioid crisis, two sources familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Philadelphia Energy Solutions seen selling RIN credits in months before bankruptcy: sources
Description: Philadelphia Energy Solutions has been seen selling biofuel credits, called Renewable Identification Numbers (RINs), in the months leading up to filing for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection, market sources said.

Headlines: Activist fund Argyle asks Toshiba to exit TEC business to boost margins
Description: Hong Kong-based activist fund Argyle Street Management asked Japan's Toshiba Corp  on Thursday to exit more non-core businesses such as office machinery company Toshiba TEC  to bolster margins of the once-mighty conglomerate.

Headlines: Uber widens taxi app to Japan's Tokyo but ride-sharing still barred
Description: Uber Technologies  launched a ride-hailing smartphone application in Tokyo on Friday in partnership with three domestic taxi firms, even as strict regulations block its popular ride-sharing service in Japan.

Headlines: Indian police allege fraud by GVK chairman, others at Mumbai airport
Description: India's federal police have filed a criminal complaint against the chairman of conglomerate GVK Group and others for alleged fraud in the development of Mumbai's international airport that resulted in the government losing more than $92 million.

Headlines: Walmart to invest $1.2 billion in China to upgrade logistics
Description: Walmart Inc  plans to invest 8 billion yuan ($1.2 billion) in China over the next 10 years to upgrade logistics, the U.S. retail giant said on its social media account on Monday.

Headlines: Repo is Wall Street's big year-end worry. Why?
Description: The $2.2 trillion repurchase agreement market - part of the inner workings of the U.S. financial system - is facing what could be another strain as the year comes to a close. That could have wider implications than just Wall Street.

Headlines: All three Detroit automakers had workers test positive for COVID-19 since plants reopened
Description: In the week since U.S. auto factories reopened after coronavirus lockdowns, workers at all three Detroit automakers have tested positive for COVID-19 but only Ford Motor Co has temporarily closed plants.

Headlines: Exclusive: White House mulls new year executive order to bar Huawei, ZTE purchases
Description: President Donald Trump is considering an executive order in the new year to declare a national emergency that would bar U.S. companies from using telecommunications equipment made by China's Huawei and ZTE, three sources familiar with the situation told Reuters.

Headlines: Explainer: Who pays Trump's tariffs - China and other exporters or U.S. customers?
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Sunday he would raise tariffs to 25 percent from 10 percent on $200 billion of Chinese goods.

Headlines: Exclusive: Fearing data privacy issues, Google cuts some Android phone data for wireless carriers
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google has shut down a service it provided to wireless carriers globally that showed them weak spots in their network coverage, people familiar with the matter told Reuters, because of Google's concerns that sharing data from users of its Android phone system might attract the scrutiny of users and regulators.

Headlines: Disney hikes bid for Fox assets to $71.3 billion, tops Comcast
Description: Walt Disney Co raised its bid for the bulk of Twenty-First Century Fox Inc's film and television assets to $71.3 billion on Wednesday, sweetening its deal with cash as it looks to upend Comcast Corp's $65 billion offer.

Headlines: VW CEO says anti-pollution rules may hit profits, car sales
Description: Volkswagen Group's  Chief Executive Herbert Diess warned that new anti-pollution tests pose a risk to the carmaker's profit targets.

Headlines: Turkey says U.S. trade sanctions could destabilize region, lira slide continues
Description: Turkey warned on Monday that U.S. trade sanctions against it could destabilize the Middle East and ultimately bolster terrorism and the refugee crisis, underscoring the regional impact of Ankara's deepening rift with Washington.

Headlines: Mexico's auto industry restart gathers steam as lockdown eases
Description: Mexico's auto industry reopening picked up pace on Tuesday, with Fiat Chrysler  and BMW AG  joining peers in gradually dusting off operations even as the wait for approvals slowed the return of some companies.

Headlines: Flood of trades sends Uber to record low as insiders allowed to sell
Description: Uber Technologies Inc's  stock dropped 3% to a record low in its busiest trading session since the ride-hailing company's Wall Street debut as employees and early investors on Wednesday became free to sell their shares.

Headlines: Facebook cuts ties to data brokers in blow to targeted ads
Description: Facebook Inc said on Wednesday it would end its partnerships with several large data brokers who help advertisers target people on the social network, a step that follows a scandal over how Facebook handles personal information.

Headlines: Ethiopian Airlines questions Boeing's 'aggressive' software
Description: An Ethiopian Airlines executive questioned whether Boeing had told pilots enough about "aggressive" software that pushes a plane's nose down, a focus of investigation into a deadly crash in Ethiopia this month.

Headlines: Canada welcomes oil cut deal, says it is committed to achieving price certainty
Description: Canada on Sunday formally welcomed a deal by OPEC and allies to cut oil output by a record amount, saying Ottawa was committed to achieving price certainty and economic stability.

Headlines: PG&E unable to strike deal over renewable power contracts: court documents
Description: PG&E Corp was unable to reach a deal with NextEra Energy Inc and other companies with which it has billions of dollars in power contracts in a jurisdictional dispute over the bankrupt utility's ability to walk away from or amend those agreements, according to court documents.

Headlines: Saudi Arabia says no talks on new oil deal, Moscow suggests larger OPEC+
Description: Saudi Arabia said on Friday it was not in talks with Russia to balance oil markets despite rising pressure from Washington to stop a price rout amid the coronavirus pandemic and an attempt by Moscow to fix a rift with the de facto OPEC leader.

Headlines: Explainer: Maple syrup or Vegemite? - UK looks to Canada and Australia for EU deal template
Description: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson has pitched two models for his country's trade ties with the European Union after Brexit: a deal based on the EU's accord with Canada, or the basic terms the bloc has with Australia.

Headlines: Factbox: Trump's coronavirus reopening guidelines
Description: President Donald Trump rolled out his guidelines for how the United States can reopen businesses and schools shut down by the coronavirus Thursday evening.

Headlines: Pfizer to cut around 2 percent of jobs through early next year
Description: U.S. drugmaker Pfizer Inc  plans to reduce its global headcount by around 2 percent through voluntary retirements and layoffs this year and early next year, as it looks to streamline its corporate structure and eliminate some managerial roles and responsibilities.

Headlines: Boeing opens first 737 plant in China amid U.S.-Sino trade war
Description: Boeing Co  opened its first 737 completion plant in China on Saturday, a strategic investment aimed at building a sales lead over arch-rival Airbus  in one of the world's top travel markets that has been overshadowed by the U.S-China trade war.

Headlines: WestJet founder to start new U.S. budget airline: report
Description: WestJet Airlines Ltd  and JetBlue Airways Corp  founder David Neeleman is planning to launch a new budget airline in the United States, with $100 million in startup capital, according to a report from the Airline Weekly.

Headlines: Former top U.S. general Dunford joining Lockheed Martin's board
Description: The former top U.S. military official, General Joseph Dunford, has been elected to the board of Lockheed Martin Corp , the Pentagon's largest weapons supplier, the company said on Friday.

Headlines: Wall Street ends choppy session higher as strength in banks offsets virus woes
Description: Wall Street's main indexes closed higher in choppy trading on Thursday, with bank stocks soaring ahead of annual stress test results and helping to offset investor jitters over alarming increases in new coronavirus cases.

Headlines: U.S. trade deficit jumps to six-month high in August
Description: The U.S. trade deficit increased to a six-month high in August as exports dropped further amid declining soybean shipments and imports hit a record high, suggesting that trade could weigh on economic growth in the third quarter.

Headlines: OECD seeing less corporate opposition to digital era tax revamp
Description: A global effort to revamp international tax rules for the digital era is receiving less corporate push-back than past attempts, the OECD's head of tax policy said on Tuesday.

Headlines: AirAsia shares plunge after Airbus bribery allegations
Description: Shares of Malaysia's AirAsia Group  and unit AirAsia X  fell on Monday, after allegations by Britain's Serious Fraud Office that Airbus  paid a bribe of $50 million to win plane orders from Asia's largest budget airline group.

Headlines: Ryanair could see job losses if flights grounded beyond May: CEO
Description: Ryanair  may see job losses if flights remain grounded due to coronavirus restrictions on travel beyond May, Chief Executive Michael O'Leary said on Friday.

Headlines: Samsung BioLogics' listing under review after regulator says it breached accounting rules
Description: South Korea's top financial regulator said Samsung BioLogics Co Ltd  had intentionally breached accounting rules ahead of its 2016 listing, leading to a suspension in trading of the biotech firm's shares and a review of its listing status.

Headlines: Brazil's offshore oil workers chilled by coronavirus outbreaks
Description: On Friday, May 1, two workers on the PXA-1 offshore platform  owned by Brazil's state-run oil company Petrobras checked into the facility's infirmary complaining of headaches and fever-like symptoms.

Headlines: Tiffany profit tops estimates, Hong Kong and tourism hit sales
Description: Luxury jeweler Tiffany & Co  on Wednesday reported quarterly earnings that beat estimates on a drop in marketing costs even as sales were hurt by lower spending by Chinese tourists in the United States and political unrest in Hong Kong.

Headlines: Dutch court to question ING and ex-CEO Hamers in money laundering case
Description: A Dutch court on Wednesday said it wanted to question the Dutch bank ING  and its former chief executive Ralph Hamers, now heading for UBS, to determine whether to reopen a case that led to ING being fined for lax prevention of money laundering.

Headlines: Huawei, Chinese chip makers keep factories humming despite virus outbreak
Description: Some technology firms in China have maintained operations to manufacture parts and products despite government calls in various cities and provinces for companies to halt work to help stop the spread of a new coronavirus.

Headlines: Embraer secures $600 mln loan as commercial aviation chief departs
Description: Embraer SA  said on Monday it had secured a $600 million loan, partly backed by Brazil's government, at the same time as a key executive departed the planemaker weeks after a potentially transformational deal with Boeing Co  fell apart.

Headlines: China's top diplomat says Beijing willing to buy more U.S. products
Description: China's top diplomat said on Thursday that China was willing to buy more U.S. products, and said trade talks would yield results if both sides "take more enthusiastic measures" to show goodwill and reduce "pessimistic language" in their trade dispute.

Headlines: Facebook hires former UK deputy prime minister as head of global affairs
Description: Facebook Inc  has hired former British Deputy Prime Minister Nick Clegg to lead its global affairs and communications team, as the social network deals with a number of scandals related to privacy, fake news and election meddling.

Headlines: Trump tariff war with China sends U.S. retailers on buying binge
Description: In the nearly 40 years she has spent in trade, Amy Magnus has never seen retailers hoarding so much inventory.

Headlines: Fed's Kaplan says he has had concerns on risks since October
Description: The Federal Reserve is doing the right thing by keeping interest rates on hold and should do so for months, not weeks, as it assesses downside risks, Dallas Federal Reserve Bank president Robert Kaplan said on Friday, adding that this has been his view since late last year.

Headlines: Watchdog orders Deutsche Bank to re-examine 20,000 risky customers by June
Description: Germany's financial markets watchdog is requiring Deutsche Bank to re-examine the files of about 20,000 risky clients by the end of June as part of its "know your customer" process, a person familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Japanese bank predicts years of gloom for tourist hub Osaka
Description: Tetsuya Kan, head of a major regional bank in Osaka, said it will take two more years for the western Japan prefecture to recover from the damage caused by COVID-19, which has crushed the city's once thriving tourism and retail sectors.

Headlines: Airline SAS cancels 8% of scheduled March flights: NRK
Description: Scandinavian airline SAS has canceled 2,000 of the flights it had scheduled for March, equating to 8% of the total, the company told Norwegian broadcaster NRK on Monday.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. willing to talk trade with China, no session set yet - official
Description: The United States is willing to negotiate with China on trade, but only if talks are serious, as previous attempts produced little progress, a senior U.S. official told Reuters late on Thursday as trade tensions between the two nations escalated.

Headlines: Winter storms, U.S. shutdown boost demand for private jets
Description: Harsh winter weather and the partial U.S. government shutdown boosted demand for private jets in January, according to three business aviation companies that recently reported an uptick last month in deep-pocketed travelers seeking alternatives to commercial flying.

Headlines: Viacom will buy Pluto TV streaming service for $340 million
Description: Viacom Inc  said on Tuesday it will buy Pluto TV, a free video streaming TV service, for $340 million in cash to expand its advanced advertising business.

Headlines: Exclusive: WeWork considers dramatic valuation cut in IPO
Description: WeWork owner The We Company may seek a valuation in its upcoming initial public offering of between $10 billion and $12 billion, a dramatic discount to the $47 billion valuation it achieved in January, people familiar with the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: NatWest presses ahead with more job cuts in face of coronavirus crisis
Description: British state-backed lender NatWest  is pressing ahead with further job cuts, axing more than 30 jobs in its digital ventures arm despite rivals halting redundancies during the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Smart home tech makes inroads into China's emerging elderly care market
Description: Charging elderly clients just 1 yuan or about 15 cents a day, little-known Lanchuang Network Technology Corp has embarked on one of the most ambitious undertakings in aged care by a private sector firm in China.

Headlines: UK gambling stocks drop after U.S. DOJ reverses opinion on internet betting
Description: Shares of British betting companies, which have been pushing into the United States market because of tighter regulations at home, fell after the U.S.Department of Justice called for wider restrictions on all gambling on the internet.

Headlines: Blood but not much treasure: Vivendi's European media crusade
Description: French tycoon Vincent Bollore's stated goal to create a southern European media empire faces defeat in Italy, despite pumping 5 billion euros ($5.9 billion) into his biggest foreign conquest, raising questions over whether the strategy ever existed.

Headlines: Boeing drops Embraer name from Brazil commercial jet division
Description: Boeing Co on Thursday said that after taking over Brazilian planemaker Embraer SA's passenger jet unit, it will call the division Boeing Brasil - Commercial, dropping one of Brazil's most iconic company names.

Headlines: Disney says Walt Disney World reopening is on track for Saturday
Description: Walt Disney Co  will stick to its plans to reopen its Walt Disney World theme parks in Orlando, Florida, to a limited number of guests on Saturday, the company said in a statement on Tuesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Deutsche Bank braced for continued Fed restrictions on U.S. business - sources
Description: Deutsche Bank AG executives expect U.S. regulators to continue to impose restrictions on its Wall Street investment bank even if it passes an annual health check, three sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Exclusive: New documents link Huawei to suspected front companies in Iran, Syria
Description: The U.S. case against the chief financial officer of China's Huawei Technologies, who was arrested in Canada last month, centers on the company's suspected ties to two obscure companies. One is a telecom equipment seller that operated in Tehran; the other is that firm's owner, a holding company registered in Mauritius.

Headlines: N.Y. Fed lowers U.S. Q3, Q4 GDP growth view
Description: U.S. gross domestic product is expanding at a 2.27 percent clip in the third quarter, slower than the 2.47 percent pace calculated a week ago, the New York Federal Reserve's Nowcast model showed on Friday.

Headlines: Factbox: Latest on the spread of the coronavirus around the world
Description: Leaders of the Group of 20 major economies pledged to inject $5 trillion in fiscal spending into the global economy to blunt the economic impact of the coronavirus and "do whatever it takes to overcome the pandemic."

Headlines: Kone open to co-shareholding with Thyssenkrupp in elevator deal: Bloomberg
Description: Finland's Kone  is open to a co-shareholding structure in a potential deal to merge with Thyssenkrupp's  elevator division, its chief executive told Bloomberg News.

Headlines: London loses top spot to New York in financial survey due to Brexit
Description: New York has overtaken London as the world's most attractive financial center, a survey said on Wednesday, as Britain's decision to leave the EU prompts banks to shift jobs out of the city to keep access to Europe's single market.

Headlines: China retains anti-dumping tariffs on U.S. distillers grains ahead of Trump-Xi talks
Description: China's Ministry of Commerce said on Wednesday it will maintain anti-dumping and anti-subsidy tariffs on imports of U.S. distillers grains (DDGs), a by-product of ethanol production used in animal feed, after closing a review launched in April.

Headlines: Credit Suisse hails cost discipline as net profit jumps 45%
Description: Credit Suisse  posted its highest quarterly earnings in four years on Wednesday, hailing frugal cost management as paying off in a tough environment.

Headlines: Lockheed sees potential exports of 200 F-16 jets from proposed Indian plant
Description: Lockheed Martin  sees a potential export market of more than $20 billion for its F-16 fighter aircraft from an assembly line in India it has offered to set up in order to win a large Indian military order, a top executive said.

Headlines: U.S. home refinancing falls to lowest since December 2000: MBA
Description: U.S. mortgage refinancing activity declined to its lowest level in more than 17-1/2 years last week as home borrowing costs rose, the Mortgage Bankers Association said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank stumbles to big loss on road to reinvention
Description: Deutsche Bank  reported a bigger than forecast quarterly loss of 3.15 billion euros ($3.5 billion), underlining the challenges faced by Chief Executive Christian Sewing as he  attempts to turn around the struggling business.

Headlines: U.S. Paycheck Protection hit some of its mark, but missed the most vulnerable
Description: The Paycheck Protection Program appears to have thrown a critical safety net under U.S. middle and upper-middle-wage jobs, but it faltered when it comes to lower-paying positions and the industries hit hardest by the coronavirus pandemic, according to a Reuters analysis of loan details.

Headlines: China warns its companies on U.S. travel, rebuffs trade criticism
Description: China warned its companies operating in the United States on Tuesday they could face harassment from U.S. law enforcement agencies, as it also rebuffed U.S. criticism of a trade white paper as "singing the same old tune".

Headlines: Peru to sign MoU to join China's Belt and Road club in coming days: Chinese ambassador
Description: Peru will sign a memorandum of understanding to join China's Belt and Road infrastructure initiative in coming days, China's ambassador said on Wednesday, despite recent warnings from the United States about the Beijing's rise in Latin America.

Headlines: U.S. tax refunds down nearly 9 percent vs year ago: IRS data
Description: The average U.S. tax refund under President Donald Trump's tax overhaul is down nearly 9 percent so far in this year's tax filing season, according to Internal Revenue Service data released on Thursday.

Headlines: Blackstone, Kirkbi launch sale of insulation maker Armacell: sources
Description: Buyout group Blackstone  and Danish family investor Kirkbi are launching the sale of German insulation foam maker Armacell in a potential 1.3-1.5 billion euro ($1.43-$1.65 billion) deal, people close to the matter said.

Headlines: Slowing economy keeping U.S. inflation under wraps
Description: U.S. consumer prices rose for the first time in four months in February, but the pace of the increase was modest, resulting in the smallest annual gain in nearly 2-1/2 years.

Headlines: U.S. corporate bond, IPO markets heat up as recession fears persist
Description: Corporate America appears to be rushing to get the most out of the decade-long bull market in stocks and bonds before a possible recession and election-year stock market volatility slam the IPO and credit windows shut.

Headlines: British retailer Asda's customers fear economic depression
Description: British supermarket group Asda got a sales boost in the first quarter from consumers stocking up before the coronavirus lockdown but it also highlighted that 90% of its shoppers now fear an economic depression.

Headlines: Bankrupt Philadelphia refinery expects second insurance payment
Description: Insurers of Philadelphia Energy Solutions (PES) have indicated they will make a second payment of $15 million from its property policy in connection to the June fire and subsequent shutdown of the plant, court documents showed.

Headlines: China fund managers slash ZTE valuation after U.S. sanction
Description: Chinese funds have slashed valuations of ZTE Corp after the United States banned American companies from selling components to the telecoms equipment maker for seven years, a move ZTE said threatened its very survival.

Headlines: Exclusive: Sanofi considers job cuts as CEO seeks to reduce costs - sources
Description: Sanofi  is considering cutting hundreds of jobs and will discuss potential steps with staff representatives over the coming days, five sources said on Thursday, the latest move by the French drugmaker's chief executive Paul Hudson to cut costs.

Headlines: Occidental Petroleum plans to close Anadarko deal soon after August 8 vote
Description: Occidental Petroleum Corp plans to quickly complete its $38 billion purchase of Anadarko Petroleum after the latter's Aug. 8 shareholder vote, the company said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. judge rules against Expedia in United Airlines fare listings lawsuit
Description: A federal judge in Manhattan on Friday rejected Expedia Inc's request for an injunction that would have required United Airlines to continue providing fare data for flights after Sept. 30, when the companies' contract ends.

Headlines: China's auto sales in 2019 to roughly match 2018: industry association
Description: China, the world's biggest car market, expects to sell 28 million vehicles in 2019, roughly level with 2018, its Association of Automobile Manufacturers said on Thursday.
