Headlines: Mexico says timetable slipped slightly for U.S. to ratify trade deal
Description: The timetable towards ratification of a new North American trade deal has slipped slightly but the pact could still pass the U.S. Congress by year end, a senior Mexican trade official said on Thursday.

Headlines: Southeast Asia wary of China's Belt and Road project, skeptical of U.S.: survey
Description: Southeast Asian countries should be cautious in negotiating with China on its flagship Belt and Road Initiative (BRI) to avoid being trapped in unsustainable debt, 70 percent of respondents said in a policy survey released on Monday.

Headlines: Mnuchin says U.S. eyes productive trade meetings in China
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Thursday he and U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer looked forward to "productive meetings" as they arrived in Beijing leading a delegation for trade talks with China.

Headlines: U.S. payroll protection program: What has changed in round two?
Description: The Small Business Administration on Monday began allowing lenders to process $310 billion in funds for the second round of its program to help cover payroll costs of small businesses hurt by the novel coronavirus disruption.

Headlines: Primark commits to paying for 370 million pounds of orders during coronavirus crisis
Description: Fashion retailer Primark has committed to paysuppliers for370 million pounds ($461 million) of orders, though all its stores are closed due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Investors warm to Europe as Biden lead, virus fears rattle Wall Street
Description: European stocks look poised to make up ground on Wall Street in the second half of 2020 as Joe Biden consolidates his lead over Donald Trump ahead of the November U.S. presidential election and a surge of new COVID-19 cases threatens the U.S. economic recovery.

Headlines: FCA sets $14 million annual target compensation for CEO Manley: filing
Description: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV (FCA) has set an annual compensation target for Chief Executive Officer Mike Manley consisting of pay, cash and equity bonuses of $14 million, the automaker said in a regulatory filing on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. cannot shut down economy again, Treasury's Mnuchin says
Description: The United States cannot let the coronavirus shut down its economy again, U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Thursday, adding that more than $1 trillion in rescue funds will flow into the economy over the next month.

Headlines: FTC staff recommends approval of Roche deal for Spark: report
Description: The Federal Trade Commission staff reviewing Roche's  plan to buy U.S.-based gene therapy specialist Spark Therapeutics  for $4.3 billion recommended that the deal be approved without requiring any asset sales, the Capitol Forum reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Oil dives over 5% as U.S. crude stocks hit record, COVID cases mount
Description: Oil prices tumbled over 5%, or more than $2 a barrel on Wednesday, after U.S. crude storage hit another record and coronavirus cases rebounded in countries like Germany and surged in heavily populated areas of the United States.

Headlines: Brazil's Embraer snags $1.1 billion order from United Airlines
Description: Embraer SA  has signed a firm order with United Airlines  for twenty-five 70-seat E175 jets, the Brazilian planemaker said on Monday, providing a boost to the company shortly after JetBlue Airways Corp  opted to replace its fleet of Embraer jets with ones made by Airbus SE .

Headlines: Rising interest rates pinch U.S. auto sales, consumer confidence
Description: U.S. auto sales rose slightly in October, hit by rising interest rates and higher vehicle prices, and No.2 carmaker Ford Motor Co.  warned of slipping consumer confidence, indicating sales volumes would continue to moderate in 2018.

Headlines: U.S. consumer spending could see one-two punch from stocks drop, coronavirus
Description: The coronavirus outbreak has yet to spread meaningfully to U.S. shores, but fears of it alone have already eviscerated some $2 trillion of American stock market value, setting off a market rout that could stymie consumer spending - even before other economic effects of the disease are felt.

Headlines: Wells Fargo sees total expenses dropping by $3 billion by 2020: CFO
Description: Wells Fargo & Co's chief financial officer said on Friday the bank expects to reduce total expenses by about $3 billion by 2020.

Headlines: Lufthansa to firm up details of staff shake-up by end-August: board member
Description: German airline Lufthansa  will firm up details of its planned staff shake-up by the end of August, management board member Bettina Volkens told German weekly WirtschaftsWoche.

Headlines: Exclusive: Airbus faces new jet delays at Hamburg plant - sources
Description: For two years Airbus faced a shortage of engines and had to slow jet deliveries. Now engines are arriving fast - but fresh snags mean a Hamburg plant that assembles best-selling jets is having trouble absorbing them, industry sources said.

Headlines: Google rival wants more details about Google's Android proposal
Description: Czech search engine Seznam urged Google on Friday to disclose more details about its plan to boost rival search apps in Android smartphones, saying it continued to lose users due to what it said were Google's anti-competitive practices.

Headlines: Toyota plans to recall 1 million hybrid models over wiring issue
Description: Toyota Motor Corp  said on Wednesday it planned to recall around 1.03 million vehicles, including its gasoline-hybrid Prius model, in Japan, North America, Europe and other regions due to an issue with the engine wire harness which can pose a fire risk.

Headlines: GM delays resumption of second shift at 3 North American truck plants -source
Description: General Motors Co  is delaying the resumption of second shifts at truck assembly plants in Michigan, Indiana and Mexico because of a lack of parts from Mexico, a person briefed on the matter said.

Headlines: Citigroup profit beats estimates on gains in consumer lending
Description: Citigroup Inc topped expectations for quarterly profit on Monday as a tight lid on costs and strength in consumer lending helped the third-largest U.S. bank counter weakness in its trading business.

Headlines: China retreats from U.S. sorghum probe amid global market havoc
Description: China dropped its anti-dumping probe into imports of U.S. sorghum on Friday, beating a hasty retreat from a dispute that wreaked havoc across the global grain market and raised concerns about rising costs and financial damage at home.

Headlines: Chinese sportswear firms reject allegations of improper accounting
Description: ANTA Sports Products Ltd  and three other Chinese sportswear firms have hit back at a research report that has questioned their accounting practices, saying the allegations were groundless.

Headlines: U.S. negotiating multibillion-dollar fine with Facebook: report
Description: The U.S. government and Facebook Inc are negotiating a settlement over the company's privacy lapses that could require the online social network to pay a multibillion-dollar fine, the Washington Post reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Website that allowed Huawei phones to install Google apps taken down
Description: A China-based website that allowed for manual installation of Google's Android apps on Huawei's newly launched Mate 30 devices went offline on Wednesday after a security researcher highlighted the "backdoor" to sidestep a U.S. ban.

Headlines: Hyundai signs development deal with another electric vehicle startup
Description: Korean automaker Hyundai Motor Co broadened its future transportation portfolio with an agreement to jointly develop electric vehicles with California startup Canoo, the companies said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Volkswagen pulls out of Iran, according to U.S. official: Bloomberg
Description: Volkswagen AG  will end almost of all its operations in Iran, Bloomberg reported on Wednesday, citing a U.S. official who led the discussions with the carmaker.

Headlines: U.S. economic growth in 2018 misses Trump's 3 percent target
Description: The U.S. economy fell short of the Trump administration's 3 percent annual growth target in 2018 despite $1.5 trillion in tax cuts and a government spending blitz, and economists say growth will only slow from here.

Headlines: ACWA considers supporting solar panel manufacturing in Saudi
Description: ACWA Power is considering supporting the manufacturing of solar panels in Saudi Arabia, its chief executive said, as the power and water plants developer seeks to facilitate Saudi Arabia's plans to develop its renewable power industry.

Headlines: Morocco's Centrale Danone workers protest job losses due to boycott
Description: Workers at Morocco's Centrale Danone, a subsidiary of French group Danone , staged a sit-in in Rabat late on Tuesday over losing their jobs as a consumer boycott now in its second month pressures the company.

Headlines: Trump to meet heads of Boeing, Lockheed, Northrop at Arizona air base
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump is scheduled to meet the chief executives of the biggest U.S. defense companies at Luke Air Force Base in Arizona on Friday to discuss how they can source more parts and materials domestically, people familiar with the meeting said on Friday.

Headlines: North America to weigh on Under Armour's 2019 revenue growth, shares slide
Description: Sportswear maker Under Armour Inc  on Wednesday forecast 2019 revenue growth and profit below Wall Street estimates on expectations of flat sales in North America, triggering a 11 percent drop in its shares.

Headlines: Apple, Qualcomm spar over CEOs' comments on settlement talks
Description: Qualcomm Inc  has responded to comments made by Apple Inc  Chief Executive Tim Cook in an interview, in which he said there had been no recent settlement talks between the iPhone maker and chip supplier in their global legal battle, calling Cook's remarks "misleading."

Headlines: Tesla hikes prices for Model 3, other cars in China amid weaker yuan
Description: U.S. electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc  had raised prices for some vehicles in China as the yuan trades at its weakest levels in more than a decade.

Headlines: Pfizer profit misses estimates as revenue falls; plans no 2020 share repurchases
Description: Pfizer Inc  on Tuesday reported quarterly profit that fell short of Wall Street expectations for the first time in at least two years, and the drugmaker said it will no longer rely on share repurchases to help drive growth.

Headlines: China says U.S. policies are causing existential damage to the WTO
Description: China said on Monday U.S. policies are threatening the existence of the World Trade Organization, setting out a string of grievances in a WTO "reform proposal" published by the WTO on its website.

Headlines: Uber wins appeal in Brazil, court says drivers are not employees
Description: A Brazilian higher court for labor ruled on Wednesday that there was no employment relationship between Uber and its drivers, siding with the ride-hailing company against a Sao Paulo driver.

Headlines: Tesla cuts price for China-made Model 3 cars by 10% to qualify for subsidies
Description: U.S. electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc  said in Friday it has cut the starting price for China-made Model 3 sedans by 10% to qualify for subsidies in the world's biggest auto market.

Headlines: Seeking to avoid EU tariffs, Washington state House passes bill to drop Boeing tax break
Description: Washington state's House of Representatives passed a measure on Wednesday night that removes a key tax break for Boeing Co  and other aerospace firms, in a bid to head off possible European tariffs on U.S. goods and ease a transatlantic trade dispute over aircraft subsidies.

Headlines: Trump says he thinks Mexico wants a deal, tariff threat stands
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday he thinks Mexico wants to make a deal in the neighbors' immigration dispute, but that he will go ahead with tariffs on Mexican goods if it does not do more to control migration.

Headlines: Carmakers near CO2 cliff-edge in electrification race
Description: Time is running out for European carmakers, which have waited until the last minute to try to meet ambitious EU emissions targets and face billions in fines if they fail to comply.

Headlines: Exclusive: Sudan needs up to $5 billion in budget support to prevent collapse
Description: Sudan needs up to $5 billion in budget support to avert economic collapse and launch reforms after the ouster of veteran ruler Omar al-Bashir, its finance minister told Reuters.

Headlines: Exclusive: Novelis must offer concessions or face EU veto to $2.6 billion Aleris deal - sources
Description: U.S. aluminum maker Novelis [NVLXC.UL] must offer concessions to European Union competition authorities by Aug. 9 to gain approval for its $2.6 billion takeover of aluminum processor Aleris [TXPACA.UL], sources close to the matter said.

Headlines: Southwest Airlines expands daily service to Hawaii
Description: U.S. budget-friendly carrier Southwest Airlines Co will add another daily flight to Hawaii from January 2020, the company said on Thursday, as it counts on leisure travel from the West Coast to boost its growth.

Headlines: U.S. retirees try to keep cool as stocks tumble
Description: Nancy Farrington, a retiree who turns 75 next month, admits to being in a constant state of anxiety over the biggest December stock market rout since Herbert Hoover was president.

Headlines: Foreign investment bill targeting China heads for Senate panel vote
Description: A bill aimed at tightening oversight of foreign investment in the United States because of concern about China's acquisition of critical technology is headed for a vote this month in the U.S. Senate Banking Committee, the panel said on Friday.

Headlines: Gulfstream expects market growth in 2019 on new business jets: president
Description: Gulfstream Aerospace expects growth in both sales opportunities and deliveries next year, as the U.S. business jet maker brings two new large-cabin corporate planes to market, company President Mark Burns said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Bitcoin plummets to a six-month low on China crackdown
Description: Bitcoin slumped to a six-month low on Friday after China's central bank launched a fresh crackdown on cryptocurrencies, warning of the risks entailed in issuing or trading them.

Headlines: U.S. East Coast refiners look to Texas crude for discounted oil
Description: U.S. East Coast refiners are shipping more shale oil from the Gulf Coast thanks to heavy discounts for West Texas crude and are also looking to bring more via rail, but supply bottlenecks are making it difficult to secure more barrels.

Headlines: Oil tumbles on oversupply concerns, sinking world stocks
Description: Oil prices plunged on Friday on concerns about oversupply, sending world stock markets lower as lagging energy shares weighed down Wall Street.

Headlines: China says hopes U.S. stops wrong tariff action, vows to retaliate if new levies imposed
Description: China said on Thursday it hopes the United States will stop its wrong tariff action, adding that any new tariffs would lead to escalation.

Headlines: Iraqi PM discusses oil price stability with Saudi king: statement
Description: Iraqi Prime Minister Adel Abdul Mahdi and Saudi Arabia's King Salman discussed coordination over stabilizing oil prices in a phone call on Monday, Abdul Mahdi's office said.

Headlines: Huawei CFO house arrest contrasts with Canadians detained in China
Description: Huawei Chief Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou described her house arrest in Vancouver as "restricted to a limited space" even as she spent her past six months in a six-bedroom, multi-million dollar Canadian home.

Headlines: Volkswagen says it is not interested in buying a Tesla stake
Description: Volkswagen  on Thursday denied a media report which suggested that the German carmaker was interested in buying a stake in United States electric car manufacturer Tesla.

Headlines: Fed's Evans says he's optimistic on inflation, wants rate hikes
Description: Chicago Federal Reserve Bank President Charles Evans, one of the Fed's most dovish policymakers, said Saturday that he is optimistic inflation will reach the Fed's 2 percent goal and that slow, gradual rate increases will be appropriate.

Headlines: Berkshire will shut some businesses, stay cautious in coronavirus 'typhoon,' Munger tells WSJ
Description: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc  will close some smaller businesses and is positioning itself conservatively as it rides out the coronavirus pandemic, Berkshire Vice Chairman Charlie Munger said in an article published on Friday.

Headlines: White House sees minimal impact on U.S. economy from China's coronavirus
Description: The White House's economic adviser on Friday said that President Donald Trump's administration does not expect the coronavirus in China will have a major effect on the U.S. economy.

Headlines: Fed's Evans says above-target inflation 'essential' in future
Description: Chicago Federal Reserve Bank President Charles Evans on Thursday suggested that "extraordinary accommodation" and a period of elevated inflation will be integral to the U.S. central bank's approach to fighting the next severe economic downturn.

Headlines: Trade war turns Canada's G7 summit into six-plus-Trump
Description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau this week plays host to a summit of the Group of Seven leading industrialized nations with six of the seven members outraged at the United States over a slew of recent moves by President Donald Trump.

Headlines: Hyundai to decide hydrogen fuel-cell factory location this year - exec
Description: Hyundai Motor Co  and its affiliates are ready to decide the location of a new hydrogen fuel-cell system factory this year, which could be in South Korea or overseas, an executive said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. airlines receive extra $9.5 billion in payroll support: U.S. Treasury
Description: The U.S. Treasury Department said on Saturday it has released $9.5 billion in additional funds from the Payroll Support Program to U.S. air carriers, bringing to $12.4 billion the total provided to the airline sector hit hard by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Macron worried attack on Saudi oil may hurt moves to ease U.S.-Iran crisis: diplomats
Description: An attack on Saudi oil installations that halted half the kingdom's output could harm French diplomacy meant to avert feared U.S.-Iranian conflict, diplomats said after President Emmanuel Macron's top envoy held talks in Saudi Arabia.

Headlines: Associated Press closes D.C. office after journalist shows coronavirus symptoms
Description: The Associated Press is temporarily closing its office from Friday in Washington, D.C. after one of its staff journalists, who had direct contact with a possible coronavirus patient, showed some symptoms of illness, the AP reported.

Headlines: U.S. tariffs on China may simply widen door to other countries
Description: In attempting to punish China for its trade practices, President Donald Trump may open the door for other countries to grab U.S. market share, including Mexico and Japan, which he has also targeted with sharp trade rhetoric.

Headlines: T-Mobile beats phone subscriber estimates as lockdown creates demand surge
Description: T-Mobile US Inc  said on Wednesday it added more monthly bill paying phone subscribers than expected in the first quarter, thanks to a surge in demand for cheaper phone services as people work from home amid coronavirus lockdowns.

Headlines: Total beats quarterly forecasts despite low oil price, raises payout
Description: Total  beat forecasts on Thursday by keeping net adjusted fourth-quarter profit steady at $3.2 billion despite low oil prices and fulfilled a pledge to boost dividends, lifting the French energy firm's shares.

Headlines: With record profits on Wall Street, small bonuses will annoy bankers: experts
Description: Most Wall Street banks announced their fourth quarter profits beat industry expectations last week. But by the end of this week, bank sources and compensation experts told Reuters, most of their staff will be underwhelmed by their bonuses.

Headlines: Tesla supplier agrees to buy GM's South Korean plant for EV manufacturing
Description: A South Korean supplier of Tesla Inc said on Friday it had agreed to buy a shuttered auto factory from General Motors' local unit to start contract manufacturing of electric vehicles.

Headlines: Nissan's South Korean unit planning voluntary redundancies: source
Description: Nissan Motor Co's  South Korean unit plans to seek applications for voluntary redundancy, a person with knowledge of the matter said on Friday, as the automaker's shares sank to their lowest in more than a decade.

Headlines: SAS cancels more flights as parties in pilot strike meet for talks
Description: Scandinavian airlines SAS said it would cancel more flights on Thursday as parties involved in a pilot strike held talks on Wednesday to try to resolve a six-day dispute that has left hundreds of thousands of passengers stranded.

Headlines: U.S. business inventories unchanged; sales surge
Description: U.S. business inventories were unchanged in March as sales increased by the most in more than two years, which could ease concerns of a broad build-up in inventories in the economy.

Headlines: Wirecard ex-COO Marsalek's entry into Philippines was faked, minister says
Description: Immigration records showing Wirecard's former chief operating officer Jan Marsalek arrived in the Philippines on June 23 and departed for China the next day were falsified, Philippines Justice Secretary Menardo Guevarra said on Saturday.

Headlines: Glencore says cobalt contract "non-performance" hits outlook for marketing earnings
Description: Mining and trading giant Glencore  said on Monday some customers had reneged on contracts for cobalt, a key metal for electric car batteries, contributing to a cut in earnings guidance for its marketing arm.

Headlines: VW to shift centre of software development to Audi
Description: Volkswagen  will shift leadership for software development to the company's premium Audi division in Ingolstadt, Bavaria, Herbert Diess, chief executive of the multi-brand group said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Activist investor Peltz says GE CEO Culp is doing a good job
Description: Lawrence Culp has held the top job at General Electric  for nearly one year and on Thursday one of the industrial conglomerate's biggest shareholders, activist investor Nelson Peltz, gave him a shout-out for being "fantastic."

Headlines: Uber, Lyft scrap mandatory arbitration for sexual assault claims
Description: Ride-hailing companies Uber Technologies Inc [UBER.UL] and Lyft Inc scrapped mandatory arbitration to settle sexual harassment or assault claims, giving victims several options to pursue their claims including public lawsuits.

Headlines: Explainer: How the U.S. Congress could challenge Trump tariffs on Mexico
Description: If President Donald Trump follows through on his threat to impose across-the-board tariffs on Mexican goods entering the United States, the U.S. Congress will likely try to halt the action with legislation that would face formidable hurdles to enactment.

Headlines: Italy says closely watching LSE/Refinitiv deal due to implications for Milan bourse
Description: Italian Economy Minister Roberto Gualtieri said on Monday the government is closely watching the merger between the London Stock Exchange (LSE) and Refinitiv, and its implications for the Italian bourse owned by LSE.

Headlines: Qantas cancels order for 8 Airbus A380s amid doubts on jet's future
Description: Australia's Qantas Airways Ltd said on Thursday it formally canceled a longstanding order for eight Airbus SE  A380 superjumbo jets.

Headlines: Air China to buy 20 A350-900 wide-body aircraft from Airbus
Description: Air China Ltd , China's flagship carrier, will buy 20 A350-900 jets from Airbus SE , both companies said, bolstering the European planemaker's order book for wide-body jets against Boeing Co  amid Sino-U.S. trade tensions.

Headlines: U.S. senators move to tighten sanctions on delayed Russia-to-Germany gas pipeline
Description: U.S. senators announced a bill on Thursday expanding sanctions on Russia's Nord Stream 2 natural gas pipeline and targeting the project Washington says will boost Moscow's economic and political influence in Germany and other European countries.

Headlines: Bitcoin goes through third 'halving', falls vs U.S. dollar
Description: Bitcoin slid on Monday in volatile trading, after it went through a technical adjustment that reduced the rate at which new coins are created, but the outlook remained upbeat as the increase in supply slows down.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank chief dismisses takeover speculation
Description: Deutsche Bank  is not at risk of a takeover, its chief executive told a German weekly paper after its shares fell to a record low on Friday in the wake of a two-day raid related to money laundering allegations.

Headlines: Exclusive: United States sets sights on China in new electric vehicle push
Description: U.S. government officials plan to meet with executives from automakers and lithium miners in early May as part of a first-of-its-kind effort to launch a national electric vehicle supply chain strategy, according to three sources familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Southwest flight cancellations nearly double as 737 MAX crisis deepens
Description: Southwest Airlines Co  said on Tuesday it was cancelling nearly double the number of flights through April than it has done since the Boeing 737 MAX grounding last March amid uncertainty over when the aircraft will fly again.

Headlines: U.S. air travel regulator calls for focus on safety as deadly crash anniversary nears
Description: The head of the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) on Monday made a broad appeal for the airline industry to focus on safety, one day before the first anniversary of a deadly crash involving Lion Air and a Boeing 737 MAX plane that cost hundreds of lives.

Headlines: Ghosn's Renault lieutenant drew extra salary via holding: documents
Description: One of Renault  boss Carlos Ghosn's senior executives received an additional six-figure salary unknown to the carmaker's board via the Dutch joint venture overseeing its alliance with Nissan , according to sources and documents seen by Reuters.

Headlines: With Iran squeezed out, U.S. oil takes on new rivals in Europe
Description: When the global oil trading industry gathered for its biggest annual meeting in Asia in September last year, U.S. oil producing companies came well prepared.

Headlines: Uber denies report it in talks with Germany's Wirecard
Description: Ride hailing company Uber denied a German magazine report on Thursday that it was considering hiring Wirecard as its main payments partner to replace Dutch platform Adyen.

Headlines: Instant View: U.S. jobless claims balloon to record on coronavirus impact
Description: The number of Americans filing claims for unemployment benefits shot to record of more than 3 million last week as strict measures to contain the coronavirus pandemic ground the country to a sudden halt, unleashing a wave of layoffs that likely brought an end to the longest employment boom in U.S. history.[]

Headlines: Exclusive: RWE CFO maps out planned expansion in renewables, U.S. in focus
Description: German utility RWE expects to spend heavily in the U.S. green energy market as it maps out its future as a global renewables champion after its pending asset swap with peer E.ON.

Headlines: EU antitrust regulators raise concerns about Facebook's Libra currency: sources
Description: EU antitrust regulators want to know whether Facebook's  proposed Libra cryptocurrency and its use of consumer data pose possible anti-competitive constraints, people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Electric Mercedes opens German assault on Tesla
Description: Mercedes-Benz is set to unveil its much-anticipated electric SUV on Tuesday, marking the start of a German onslaught against Tesla's  dominance of the fast-growing market for premium battery cars.

Headlines: Far-flung job offers pose tough choices for GM Ohio workers
Description: General Motors Co built the final Chevrolet Cruze small car at its Lordstown, Ohio, assembly plant on March 6, despite demands from President Donald Trump, Ohio political leaders and the United Auto Workers union not to close the plant and leave nearly 1,500 workers laid off.

Headlines: Airbus sales chief says no need to cut production of A330neo
Description: Airbus  sees enough demand for its wide-bodied A330neo passenger jet to keep production stable, Chief Commercial Officer Christian Scherer told Reuters on Wednesday.

Headlines: Elon Musk ducks out of one Los Angeles tunnel but pursues another
Description: Billionaire entrepreneur Elon Musk has scrapped plans for a high-speed passenger tunnel under the West side of Los Angeles but is moving ahead with a similar proposal across town designed to whisk baseball fans to and from Dodger Stadium.

Headlines: Tourists find silver lining in Turkey's lira crash
Description: Visitors to Turkey flocked to its high-end shops to snap up bargains on Monday, their purchasing power buoyed by a currency crisis as the country's lira sank to a record low beyond 7 per dollar.

Headlines: Lockheed martin wins $495 million U.S. defense contract: Pentagon
Description: Lockheed Martin Corp  has been awarded a $495 million modification to a contract for Trident II (D5) missile production and deployed systems support, the Pentagon said on Monday.

Headlines: Daimler to launch electric compact SUV in 2021: CEO
Description: Daimler plans to launch an electric compact sport utility vehicle in 2021 which will be called the Mercedes EQB, the German carmaker's CEO said on Tuesday.

Headlines: EU trade chief sees possible extension to May 18 deadline for U.S. car tariffs: newspaper
Description: European Trade Commissioner Cecilia Malmstroem expects U.S. President Donald Trump to delay a May 18 deadline for U.S. tariffs on cars imported from the European union, according to an interview published in the Sueddeutsche newspaper on Monday.

Headlines: German conservative lawmakers back compromise on 5G: sources
Description: Lawmakers from German Chancellor Angela Merkel's ruling conservatives have backed a position paper on 5G mobile networks that recommends tougher rules on foreign vendors while stopping short of banning China's Huawei, sources said.

Headlines: Norway's Wideroe says may increase Embraer jet order
Description: Scandinavia's largest regional airline said on Thursday it aims to increase its order for E2 jets after it received the first of three new-generation aircraft from Brazil's Embraer to become its inaugural operator.

Headlines: U.S. regulator permits China's ZTE to submit more evidence
Description: The U.S. Commerce Department has granted ZTE Corp's   request to submit more evidence after the agency banned American companies from selling to the Chinese technology firm, a senior Commerce official said on Saturday.

Headlines: Wall Street advances on trade hopes, deal to avert government shutdown
Description: Wall Street rallied on Tuesday as investors were heartened by a tentative congressional spending deal to avoid another partial federal government shutdown and by optimism surrounding U.S.-China trade negotiations.

Headlines: Uber, distracted backup driver cited by NTSB in fatal self-driving crash
Description: A U.S. safety agency on Tuesday faulted Uber for inadequate attention to safety and decisions in the company's autonomous vehicle development in an investigation into the first-ever death involving a self-driving vehicle, which also cited the vehicle's distracted back-up driver.

Headlines: UK prosecutor seeks to restore criminal case against Barclays
Description: The UK Serious Fraud Office (SFO) said on Tuesday it was seeking to resurrect a high-profile prosecution of Barclays  over undisclosed payments to Qatari investors during the credit crisis two months after a London court dismissed its case.

Headlines: Exclusive: Promising thousands of U.S. jobs, Foxconn offshored 155 to Mexico
Description: Foxconn has offshored more than 150 U.S. jobs to Mexico, according to the Labor Department, even as it struggles to meet job-creation targets promised as part of a massive new factory championed by President Donald Trump.

Headlines: U.S. ethanol producers seek pricing reform as markets plunge, ADM sells
Description: U.S. ethanol producers stung by collapsing prices are seeking changes to the way benchmark values for the biofuel are established, arguing the current system used by exchanges is vulnerable to manipulation, according to sources.

Headlines: U.S. senator says Trump administration mulling use of oil reserve to help crude producers
Description: U.S. Senator John Thune said on Wednesday he believes the Trump administration is evaluating use of the Strategic Petroleum Reserve, and other measures, to help oil producers deal with the plunge in crude prices due to the coronavirus and a price war between Saudi Arabia and Russia.

Headlines: Offshore yuan falls more than 0.5 percent after U.S. announces new tariffs
Description: The offshore yuan fell more than 0.5 percent in early trade on Wednesday after Washington announced a plan to slap tariffs on $200 billion of imports from China, escalating tensions between the world's two biggest economies.

Headlines: Major airlines urge U.S. Treasury to disburse assistance quickly
Description: Major U.S. airlines asked the U.S. Treasury to move quickly to release up to $58 billion in government grants and loans and recommended a formula to divide up the money.

Headlines: Boeing board meets as company considers 737 MAX production changes
Description: Boeing Co is considering whether to cut or halt production of its grounded 737 MAX after the Federal Aviation Administration said last week it would not approve the plane's return to service before 2020, a person briefed on the matter said on Sunday.

Headlines: Lowe's to get rid of Mexico stores in further restructuring
Description: Lowe's Cos Inc said on Tuesday it was looking to shed its retail operations in Mexico and two of its smaller U.S. businesses as the country's second-biggest home improvement chain strives to compete with rivals including Home Depot.

Headlines: Vivendi shareholders approve dividend of 0.60 euro per share
Description: Vivendi's  shareholders approved on Monday the payment of a dividend of 0.60 euro per share for the fiscal year 2019, with 99.52% of shareholder votes supporting the plan.

Headlines: Apple CEO's handling of trade war has helped buoy shares, investors say
Description: When Apple Inc  reports results on Wednesday, Wall Street expects flat fiscal fourth-quarter sales and lower full-year revenue compared with the prior year, mostly because of declining iPhone sales. Yet Apple's stock price has hit all-time highs in recent weeks, and its price-to-forward-earnings valuation is higher than it has been since 2010.

Headlines: Toshiba should sell stake in ex-chip unit at IPO, says HK activist fund in letter
Description: A Hong Kong-based activist investor in Toshiba Corp  has asked the Japanese conglomerate to sell its entire stake in Kioxia Holdings when the flash memory chip firm is listed in an IPO that could raise up to $32 billion, according to a letter reviewed by Reuters.

Headlines: Facebook to create 500 jobs in new London engineering center
Description: Facebook will create 500 new tech jobs in London by the end of 2019, including 100 roles in artificial intelligence, with many working on systems to detect and remove malicious content, fake accounts and harmful behavior, it said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S.'s Pompeo: Nations should rethink use of China's Huawei amid coronavirus
Description: U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo on Friday said China's role in the global coronavirus pandemic is likely to force countries to rethink their telecommunications infrastructure, including the adoption of China-based Huawei's 5G networks.

Headlines: ECB making 'substantial' inflation progress: Praet
Description: Europe's economic slowdown came sooner than expected and factors holding back growth may persist in the near term but the European Central Bank is still making "substantial" progress in lifting inflation, ECB Chief Economist Peter Praet said.

Headlines: AT&T legal win could spur another jumbo bond; more M&As
Description: NEW YORK (IFR) - AT&T's court victory on Tuesday will likely mean the company will have to return to the bond market to fund its US$85bn acquisition of Time Warner, investors told IFR.

Headlines: Tightrope Thiam: comeback CEO stung by a spying scandal
Description: Tidjane Thiam is unlikely to quietly retire after his abrupt exit as chief executive of Credit Suisse, some of those who have worked with him predict.

Headlines: Airbus pulls anniversary book over fraud probe concerns: sources
Description: Airbus has halted sales of a new book that the planemaker had commissioned for its 50th anniversary to avoid hampering the manufacturer's attempts to win a settlement in a bribery probe, two people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Tech leads Wall Street's advance after strong jobs data
Description: Wall Street stocks rose on Friday after the latest monthly jobs report pointed to strength in the U.S. economy and geopolitical tensions eased.

Headlines: China accuses U.S. officials of misleading public on trade war
Description: China on Friday accused U.S. officials of lying to the public about their trade war, as rising tensions between the world's two largest economies kept financial markets in a state of unease.

Headlines: American Airlines waives change fees as United braces for new flight cancellations
Description: American Airlines Group Inc  said on Sunday it was waiving change fees on all newly purchased tickets amid declining air travel demand because of the new coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: WeWork delays IPO after frosty investor response
Description: WeWork owner The We Company has postponed its initial public offering (IPO), walking away from preparations to launch it this month after a lackluster response from investors to its plans.

Headlines: GE wins $631 million U.S. defense contract: Pentagon
Description: General Electric Co  has been awarded a $631 million contract for repair, replacement and program support of engine components used on the F/A-18 E/F and EA 18G aircraft, the Pentagon said in a statement on Tuesday.

Headlines: Hyundai Motor's union votes to strike after wage talks fail
Description: Hyundai Motor's  unionized workers in South Korea voted on Tuesday to strike over stalled wage talks, adding to the woes of the automaker that is bracing for potential new U.S. tariffs amid falling profits.

Headlines: Google to invest $550 million in China e-commerce giant JD.com
Description: Google will invest $550 million in Chinese e-commerce powerhouse JD.com, part of the U.S. internet company's efforts to expand its presence in fast-growing Asian markets and battle rivals including Amazon.com.

Headlines: China-U.S. trade frictions must be resolved via talks: Chinese official
Description: Trade frictions between China and the United States must be resolved through negotiations, Vice Finance Minister Zhu Guangyao said on Wednesday, while adding that Beijing will continue to hit back if Washington wants to keep up the fight.

Headlines: Stocks rally at start of second quarter on manufacturing data, trade hopes
Description: Global stocks rallied on Monday, kicking off the second quarter on a strong note, as investors cheered upbeat factory activity data in China and the United States and signs of progress on the U.S.-China trade front.

Headlines: Britain gives De La Rue more time to appeal blue passport 'snub'
Description: Britain has given De La Rue  an extra two weeks to challenge the decision to award the contract to make new, blue passports after Brexit to a European company.

Headlines: Aston Martin shares open flat at 19 pounds per share in London debut
Description: Shares in luxury carmaker Aston Martin  opened flat at the offer price of 19 pounds ($24.70) per share in its London debut on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. transport chief said economic issues not a factor in 737 MAX's safety review
Description: The economic impact of Boeing Co's  planned halt of 737 MAX production will not be considered by U.S. regulators in their ongoing review of when to end the grounding of a plane involved in two major fatal crashes, U.S. Transportation Secretary Elaine Chao said on Friday.

Headlines: Dish results beat estimates, shares jump 14.5 percent
Description: Dish Network Corp  reported better-than-expected quarterly profit and revenue on Friday, as the company lost fewer satellite TV subscribers than expected and said it was on track to build the first phase of its wireless network.

Headlines: Morgan Stanley deputy chief financial officer to retire
Description: Morgan Stanley's Deputy Chief Financial Officer Paul Wirth will retire after 15 years with the bank, according to a memo sent to employees seen by Reuters on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. senator urges criminal probe of Amazon.com 'predatory data practices'
Description: Senator Josh Hawley urged the Justice Department on Tuesday to open a criminal probe of Amazon.com Inc, saying the online retailer was building a monopoly using "predatory data practices" on vendors using its platform.

Headlines: Ford to gradually resume operations, production at Mexican plants
Description: Ford Motor Co  will gradually resume operations and production at several of its Mexican plants, the automaker said on Wednesday, as the sector begins to come back online as coronavirus contingencies are relaxed.

Headlines: Spotify revenue beats but adds fewer-than-expected paid subscribers
Description: Spotify Technology SA's  lighter-than-expected number of new paid subscribers drove shares as much as 5% lower in trading before the bell, overshadowing revenue, gross margins and user engagement successes in the second quarter.

Headlines: Factbox: Spielberg, Oprah to make shows for Apple's new streaming service
Description: Apple Inc unveiled an all new Apple TV app and a streaming service called Apple TV+ at an event on Monday at its California headquarters.

Headlines: Renault board did not consider replacing Ghosn: interim chairman
Description: Renault's board did not consider replacing Chief Executive Carlos Ghosn when it met on Thursday, interim chairman Philippe Lagayette said in a statement issued by the carmaker.

Headlines: Deutsche received information requests from authorities in Danske case
Description: Deutsche Bank  said on Wednesday that it received several requests for information from regulators and law enforcement agencies around the world relating to the Dankse  case.

Headlines: Oil climbs 5% on U.S. jobless drop, OPEC+ meeting hopes
Description: Oil prices rose on Friday after an unexpected fall in the May U.S. jobless rate and OPEC's decision to bring forward to Saturday discussions on whether to extend record production cuts.

Headlines: China says will 'fight back firmly' if U.S. publishes additional tariffs
Description: China will fight back firmly with "qualitative" and "quantitative" measures if the United States publishes an additional list of tariffs on Chinese goods, the commerce ministry said, accusing the U.S. of initiating a trade war.

Headlines: Factbox: Meet McDonald's new CEO: Chris Kempczinski
Description: McDonald's Corp  head of U.S. operations, Chris Kempczinski, replaced Steve Easterbrook as chief executive officer of the world's largest fast-food chain on Sunday.

Headlines: Oil gains on Saudi output cuts; rally limited by U.S. output
Description: Oil prices rose almost 2 percent on Wednesday after top exporter Saudi Arabia said it would cut crude exports and deliver an even deeper cut to its production, but swelling U.S. crude inventories limited the day's gains.

Headlines: Airbus, Boeing executives say too early to gauge coronavirus impact on aircraft demand
Description: Executives from planemakers Airbus  and Boeing  said on Tuesday that it was too early to say whether the outbreak of a new coronavirus would affect demand for aircraft.

Headlines: U.S. surfboard makers not so stoked about China tariffs
Description: President Donald Trump's decision to slap 10% tariffs on  imported surfboards convinced surf executive Sue Bowers to move  factory jobs out of China - but not back to the United States, which was one goal of Trump's tariffs.

Headlines: Ryanair's Lauda airline shuts down Vienna base
Description: Ryanair's  Austrian carrier Lauda said on Friday it was closing down its Vienna base after failing to reach an agreement with unions on pay, and had already relocated many of its 15 planes to other bases.

Headlines: Wirecard signs cooperation agreement with SoftBank's Brightstar
Description: Wirecard has signed a memorandum of understanding with SoftBank's Brightstar and anticipates "significant transaction volume" out of the deal, the German fintech announced on Monday.

Headlines: Siemens, Alstom sweeten EU antitrust concessions, maybe too late
Description: Siemens and Alstom on Friday beefed up concessions aimed at allaying EU antitrust concerns about their rail merger deal, a person familiar with the matter said, in a belated and possibly futile move to stave off an EU veto against the deal.

Headlines: New trade pact leaves most U.S. industry at mercy of Mexico's courts
Description: The new North American trade agreement ends key legal protections for many U.S. businesses operating in Mexico, leaving their operations exposed to a risk they had avoided under the old trade deal: Mexico's court system.

Headlines: Vodafone holds off deploying Huawei in core network due to security row
Description: Vodafone, the world's second largest mobile operator, said it was "pausing" the deployment of Huawei equipment in its core networks until Western governments give the Chinese firm full security clearance.

Headlines: Boeing 737 MAX may not return to service until August: IATA head
Description: Boeing Co's 737 MAX is unlikely to return to service before August, the head of the International Air Transport Association (IATA) said on Wednesday, adding that the final say on the timing rested with regulators.

Headlines: Shareholder calls for separation of J&J's CEO and chairman roles
Description: Trillium Asset Management LLC has called for the separation of Johnson & Johnson's  chairman and chief executive officer roles, currently held by Alex Gorsky, according to a regulatory filing https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/200406/000020040620000014/a2020jnjproxy.htm by the healthcare conglomerate on Monday.

Headlines: Trump: U.S. had 'very good talk' with China; in-person talks may follow
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday that U.S. Treasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin had a very good talk with his Chinese counterpart, amid signals from China that officials could soon meet face-to-face in their bid to end a yearlong trade war.

Headlines: U.S. sets preliminary duties of up to 222% on Chinese ceramic tile
Description: The U.S. Commerce Department said on Tuesday that it found that imports of ceramic tile from China are unfairly subsidized and it imposed preliminary duties on them ranging from about 104% to 222%.

Headlines: Hyundai sees Russia auto market growth slowing in 2019
Description: South Korea-based carmaker Hyundai Motor Co.  expects growth in the Russian auto market to slow sharply next year, the head of its Russian branch said on Monday.

Headlines: U.S.-China trade deal not falling apart: White House adviser
Description: The U.S.-China "Phase 1" trade deal reached in January is not falling apart and the two countries are still working to implement it, the White House's top economic adviser said on Friday, but President Donald Trump added that he was not "thrilled" with the agreement.

Headlines: Ferrari joins European auto lobby ACEA four years after spin-off
Description: Italian luxury carmaker Ferrari  has become the latest manufacturer to join the European carmakers' association (ACEA), the auto lobby said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Elevator sale in focus in competitive process: Thyssenkrupp CFO
Description: A sale of Thyssenkrupp's  elevator division is currently in focus, the group's finance chief said on Thursday, adding an ongoing auction was "very competitive".

Headlines: Chile government approves construction of Walmart distribution center
Description: The Chilean government said on Wednesday it had approved the construction of a distribution center for Walmart  in its capital Santiago, an investment of about $180 million.

Headlines: Buffett calls for more accountability for corporate directors
Description: Warren Buffett on Saturday called on corporate America to make their boards of directors more accountable to shareholders and less beholden to chief executive officers, perhaps by reducing their pay and requiring that they buy more stock.

Headlines: What stood out in the February U.S. jobs report
Description: Headline U.S. job growth hit the brakes in February, registering the smallest gain since September 2017 and the third-smallest during the unprecedented run of 101 consecutive months of payrolls gains.

Headlines: SAP defends $8 billion Qualtrics deal
Description: Germany's SAP  hit back at suggestions that the German business software group is paying too much for Qualtrics, a U.S. company that specializes in tracking consumer sentiment online.

Headlines: Lilly to consider more acquisitions like $1.6 billion Armo buy
Description: Eli Lilly and Co  will consider more acquisitions similar to its $1.6 billion purchase of cancer drug developer Armo Biosciences earlier this year, the drugmaker's chief financial officer said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Airbus deliveries climb in H1, sources say, leaving production challenge
Description: Airbus  deliveries rose about 28% in the first half to just under 390 aircraft, putting the planemaker on course to beat crisis-hit Boeing  in 2019 but handing it a record production task in the second half, industry sources said.

Headlines: U.S. sanctions slam Russian ruble, Turkey's lira tumbles
Description: New U.S. sanctions against Moscow drove down Russia's ruble, while worries that Turkey was sliding into a full-blown economic crisis battered the lira on Thursday, but global equity markets largely shrugged off the turmoil to edge higher.

Headlines: Trump says U.S. trade delegation to visit China in mid-February: Xinhua
Description: A U.S. trade delegation will visit China in mid-February for a new round of talks, President Donald Trump told Chinese Vice Premier Liu He, the official Xinhua news agency said on Friday.

Headlines: U.S., China putting trade war on hold, Treasury's Mnuchin says
Description: The U.S. trade war with China is "on hold" after the world's largest economies agreed to drop their tariff threats while they work on a wider trade agreement, U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Sunday.

Headlines: Door opens for UBS to take majority ownership of China JV
Description: UBS Group AG  may have moved a step closer towards becoming the first foreign bank to hold majority ownership of its Chinese investment banking operations, after two of its joint venture partners said they had put their stakes up for sale.

Headlines: Whirlpool to close Italian plant amid protests
Description: U.S.-listed white goods maker Whirlpool Corp  said on Tuesday it would close its plant in Naples on Nov. 1, despite a final attempt by the Italian government to keep the site open.

Headlines: Exclusive: Impossible Foods raises $300 million with investors eager for bite of meatless burgers
Description: Impossible Foods, which makes a meatless plant-based burger and is backed by celebrities like Serena Williams and Katy Perry, said on Monday it has raised $300 million in the latest round of funding ahead of a possible initial public offering.

Headlines: U.S. confirms small soybean sale to private Chinese buyer
Description: The U.S. Department of Agriculture on Thursday confirmed a private Chinese company bought 68,000 tonnes of soybeans in the week ended July 25, the first soybean purchase since Beijing offered to exempt five crushers from import tariffs imposed more than a year ago as part of a U.S.-China trade dispute.

Headlines: Shipping's financiers turning the tide on shipbreaking practices
Description: The shipping industry has long been criticized by campaigners for allowing vessels to be broken up on beaches, endangering workers and polluting the sea and sand.

Headlines: Why Canada's pot legalization won't stop black-market sales
Description: Jake Rowinski, a 20-year-old University of Toronto student, buys marijuana every week from one of the many self-described "medical" dispensaries in downtown Toronto.

Headlines: JPMorgan keeps Venezuela in emerging bond indexes: fund managers
Description: JPMorgan has retained dollar-denominated debt issued by Venezuela and its state-run oil company PDVSA in a key emerging market bond index as part of its monthly rebalancing, according to two fund managers.

Headlines: Huawei allegations driven by politics not evidence: U.N. telecoms chief
Description: U.S. security concerns about 5G mobile networks built by Chinese telecoms giant Huawei appear to be driven by politics and trade rather than any evidence, the head of the U.N. internet and telecoms agency said on Friday.

Headlines: Apple, in rare reversal, pulls plug on wireless charging mat
Description: Apple Inc on Friday said it is canceling the AirPower wireless charging mat that the company announced in 2017 on the same day as its iPhone X, a rare public retreat for the gadget maker known for splashy product launches.

Headlines: Campbell ends proxy fight with Third Point, adds directors
Description: Campbell Soup and Third Point LLC settled their proxy contest on Monday by adding two of the hedge fund's nominees to the U.S. food company's board and giving the activist investor a say in selecting Campbell's next CEO, the company said.

Headlines: Oil rally faces tidal wave of supply
Description: The oil market's two-year bull run is running into one of its biggest tests in months, facing a tidal wave of supply and growing worries about economic weakness sapping demand worldwide.

Headlines: On Japan Sea coast, small firm shows scars of China's economic woes
Description: In snow country along Japan's northern coast, a small manufacturer of precision moulds is feeling the pain of China's economic slowdown.

Headlines: Crowds form at Olympic torch event in Japan despite coronavirus caution
Description: An Olympic torch event in Japan drew hundreds of spectators on the day of the flame's arrival on Friday, creating the type of packed gathering the government and Tokyo 2020 organisers have warned against to prevent coronavirus from spreading further.

Headlines: KKR earnings slide 23% as weaker deal activity hits revenue
Description: Private equity firm KKR & Co  reported a 23% year-on-year drop in its quarterly after-tax distributable profit on Tuesday, as fee revenue slid amid a broader slowdown in asset sales by buyout firms.

Headlines: HSBC flips crime-spotting tool to scope new business
Description: British bank HSBC  has converted a financial crime-spotting algorithm it was forced to build in the wake of a money-laundering scandal into one that can scope out new business opportunities, bank executives said.

Headlines: Sky expands against backdrop of takeover battle finale
Description: Sky  posted double-digit earnings growth after it added another 500,000 customers in its latest financial year, showing why Comcast and Rupert Murdoch's Fox are slugging it out to buy the European pay-TV leader.

Headlines: Global stocks slide on dimming prospects for sharp U.S. rate cut
Description: Stocks around the world fell on Monday after strong U.S. job gains tempered expectations the Federal Reserve will deliver a large interest rate cut at the end of July.

Headlines: Brexit seen discussed at G20 next week: EU's Dombrovskis
Description: Britain's exit from the European Union is likely to be widely discussed at the meeting of the world's G20 financial leaders in Washington next week, the Vice President of the European Commission Valdis Dombrovskis said on Saturday.

Headlines: U.S. sues to force Altria to unwind investment in Juul
Description: The U.S. Federal Trade Commission said on Wednesday it had filed a complaint aimed at forcing Marlboro maker Altria Group to sell its investment in e-cigarette maker Juul Labs Inc.

Headlines: UK parliament tells Barclays CEO: explain emergency business loans delays
Description: The British parliament's treasury committee chairman has told the chief executive of Barclays  to explain delays to granting emergency loans to small businesses.

Headlines: Uber Eats goes local to find its niche in South African food fight
Description: A stone's throw from Nelson Mandela's former home in South Africa's Soweto township, Dumile Badela's restaurant is now more hectic and lucrative than ever, thanks to Uber Eats, his hungriest customer yet.

Headlines: Yum's KFC closes dining rooms at company-owned restaurants in Florida
Description: The fried chicken chain KFC has closed dining rooms in corporate-owned stores in Florida because of the escalation in coronavirus cases in the state, according to a letter seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Citigroup allows hedge fund ValueAct more access
Description: Citigroup Inc  will give ValueAct Capital more access to its books and board of directors, signaling that the bank and the activist hedge fund are deepening their relationship roughly a year after ValueAct first invested in Citi.

Headlines: China's 2018 trade surplus with U.S. highest on record going back to 2006
Description: China's trade surplus with the United States rose to $323.32 billion last year, the highest on record going back to 2006, Reuters calculations based on customs data showed on Monday.

Headlines: Cold Turkey: investor exodus tests Erdogan's economic experiment
Description: A run on the lira proved a pivotal moment for Turkey's financial markets in 2018, prompting action from Ankara that has tilted the economy inward and frightened off foreign investors.

Headlines: Sanofi weighing options for consumer healthcare unit: sources
Description: Sanofi  is considering a joint venture or outright sale among options for its consumer healthcare unit, sources told Reuters, as the French drugmaker prepares to present a new strategic plan next month.

Headlines: Exclusive: Trump vows 'no concessions' with Turkey over detained U.S. pastor
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday ruled out agreeing to any demands from Turkey to gain the release of a detained American pastor and said he was not concerned that his tough stance could end up hurting European and emerging market economies.

Headlines: Facebook expands offerings for video creators to cash in on views
Description: Facebook Inc  launched a matchmaking system Tuesday to cultivate partnerships between advertisers and video creators as the world's largest social media company tries to quickly parallel the variety of commercial opportunities offered by its video rival YouTube.

Headlines: U.S. plans in-person China trade talks next month: White House adviser
Description: The Trump administration is still planning for a round of in-person talks between U.S. and Chinese officials in September after a constructive exchange this week between deputy-level negotiators, White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. safety agency OKs advanced headlights for road use
Description: The U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration on Thursday said it was moving to allow advanced headlights known as "adaptive driving beams" to be used in vehicles on U.S. roads that could help prevent nighttime crashes.

Headlines: China's factory activity expands, but job losses quicken amid weak exports: Caixin PMI
Description: China's factory activity grew at a faster clip in June after the government lifted coronavirus lockdown measures and ramped up support steps, but the health crisis continues to pressure exports and jobs, a private business survey showed on Wednesday.

Headlines: GSK says very confident about consumer margin goal of at least 20 percent
Description: GlaxoSmithKline  reaffirmed its margin goal for its consumer healthcare business after agreeing to buy Novartis  out of their joint venture (JV) for $13 billion.

Headlines: Bankruptcy court approves Neiman Marcus' plea to access financing
Description: U.S. luxury department store chain Neiman Marcus Group said on Friday it received court approval to access $675 million of its debtor-in-possession financing, which will allow continuity of the company's business during Chapter 11 bankruptcy proceedings and enable it to pay employees and vendors.

Headlines: Fidelity Contrafund cuts value of WeWork stake by 35%
Description: Fidelity Investments cut the value of Contrafund's stake in WeWork Companies Inc by 35% in September amid turmoil surrounding the office-sharing startup's failed initial public offering (IPO).

Headlines: Traton says will be a strong contributor toward VW's cashflow target
Description: Volkswagen executive Andreas Renschler on Tuesday said the Traton trucks division will be a "strong contributor" toward parent company Volkswagen Group's 10 billion euro  ($11.4 billion) cashflow target for 2020.

Headlines: Kraft Heinz brings back former CFO after accounting missteps
Description: Kraft Heinz Co's  newly-appointed chief executive officer replaced finance chief David Knopf on Monday in what he said was a strategic decision, naming the more "seasoned" Paulo Basilio, after the company was forced to restate three years of results.

Headlines: Exclusive: Shell plans major restructuring around climate drive, CEO tells employees
Description: Royal Dutch Shell  will announce a major restructuring by the end of the year as the energy company prepares to accelerate its shift towards low-carbon, CEO Ben van Beurden told employees, a company source said.

Headlines: U.S. banks record $59.1 billion in profits in fourth-quarter of 2018
Description: The U.S. banking sector recorded $59.1 billion in profits in the fourth quarter of 2018, down slightly from the third quarter's record level but still up significantly from the prior year, according to data from the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation.

Headlines: UPS adding Sunday delivery next year, joining rival FedEx
Description: United Parcel Service Inc  next year will join rival FedEx Corp  in adding Sunday delivery services, efforts viewed as bids to fend off customer-turned-competitor Amazon.com Inc .

Headlines: Advertisers look to online ads for brand growth: Zenith
Description: Money spent on online advertising has risen rapidly, a leading forecaster said, despite talk about firms trimming digital ad budgets as they question the medium's effectiveness.

Headlines: SAP bullish on outlook as it beats path from back to front office
Description: Germany's SAP  announced upbeat results in the seasonally tough first quarter, saying it was gaining ground on competitors Salesforce  and Oracle  in the cloud and that its margin recovery was firmly on track.

Headlines: Southwest 737 MAX 8 passenger-less flight lands safely after declaring emergency: FAA
Description: A Southwest Airlines Co Boeing 737 MAX 8 aircraft without passengers and of the type that was grounded two weeks ago, landed safely on Tuesday after declaring an emergency over an engine-related problem leaving Orlando International Airport in Florida, the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration said.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank staffers cleared but bank fined in money laundering case
Description: Frankfurt prosecutors have dropped an investigation into two Deutsche Bank  employees accused of aiding tax evasion through a former Virgin Islands unit, although they have fined the lender for compliance lapses.

Headlines: Standard Life Aberdeen wins $133 billion Lloyds mandate dispute
Description: Standard Life Aberdeen said it has won a legal battle to stop Lloyds cancelling a 100 billion pound ($133 billion) investment management contract early, a decision which could cost the bank hundreds of millions of pounds in extra fees.

Headlines: Global airlines body raises alarm over bailout debts
Description: Heavy debts inherited from government bailouts and other fund-raising moves will delay the airline industry's recovery from the coronavirus crisis, a trade body said on Tuesday.

Headlines: China threatens corporate hit-list on eve of new tariffs on U.S. imports
Description: China threatened on Friday to unveil an unprecedented hit-list of "unreliable" foreign firms, groups and individuals that harm the interests of Chinese companies, as a slate of retaliatory tariffs on imported U.S. goods was set to kick in at midnight.

Headlines: Take Five: World markets themes for the week ahead
Description: Following are five big themes likely to dominate thinking of investors and traders in the coming week and the Reuters stories related to them:

Headlines: White House counsel asked FCC chair about Sinclair Tribune merger status
Description: White House counsel Don McGahn called the head of Federal Communications Commission in July to ask about the status of Sinclair Broadcast Group Incs  now abandoned $3.9 billion acquisition of Tribune Media Co .

Headlines: Police search Renault's headquarters near Paris as part of Ghosn probe
Description: Police are searching Renault's  corporate headquarters in Boulogne-Billancourt, which a judicial source said was related to an ongoing investigation into ex-Renault boss Carlos Ghosn and his use of Versailles for his 2016 wedding party.

Headlines: France's AMF watchdog fines Bloomberg 5 million over Vinci hoax
Description: France's markets watchdog AMF said on Monday it had fined U.S. news agency Bloomberg News 5 million euros ($5.5 million) for publishing a hoax press release relating to construction group Vinci  in November 2016.

Headlines: Factbox: Some rule changes now on go-slow due to U.S. shutdown
Description: The ongoing federal government shutdown is impeding efforts to advance several rule changes that aim to make life easier for financial institutions.

Headlines: Uber Freight launches in Germany, taking on local competition
Description: U.S. ride-hailing company Uber  is launching a freight platform in Germany, taking on local technology startups in a race to grab a share of Europe's $500 billion trucking market.

Headlines: Tencent Music hits low pitch after first earnings report exposes costs
Description: Chinese streaming firm Tencent Music Entertainment Group delivered its first earnings report as a public company, meeting market expectations but exposing soaring license and content production costs which pulled its shares down 6 percent.

Headlines: As oil rises, warnings emerge from U.S. retailers
Description: Worries about rising oil prices have begun to creep into U.S. retailers' earnings calls, and investors are raising concerns that those costs may slow discretionary spending among Americans and push down the performance of the retailers' shares.

Headlines: Germany will require all petrol stations to provide electric car charging
Description: Germany said it will oblige all petrol stations to offer electric car charging to help remove refuelling concerns and boost consumer demand for the vehicles as part of its 130 billion euro ($146 billion) economic recovery plan.

Headlines: Nissan to stop producing cars in Indonesia as part of reorganization plan
Description: Nissan Motor Co  said on Wednesday it would stop producing vehicles in Indonesia, consolidating its global production in the face of falling sales which have pummeled its profitability.

Headlines: Shares of SoftBank-backed OneConnect rise 5% in U.S. market debut
Description: Shares of OneConnect Financial Technology jumped 5% in their U.S. market debut on Friday, valuing the Chinese cloud tech firm at $3.79 billion.

Headlines: South Korea's due diligence on GM's local unit going 'smoothly': source
Description: South Korea's due diligence on General Motor's local unit is "going smoothly" as the U.S. automaker has submitted a number of documents to help the process, a source with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters on Tuesday.

Headlines: Avianca seeks to cut Airbus order as much as half: CEO
Description: Airline Avianca Holdings SA  will begin negotiations with Airbus  to reduce the 100 planes it had agreed to purchase in a 2015 deal to as few as 50, the chief executive of the Latin American company said.

Headlines: Explainer: Will China dump U.S. bonds as a trade weapon? Not so fast
Description: The trade war between Beijing and Washington has stoked concern in financial markets that China might opt to weaponize its holdings of more than $1.1 trillion worth of U.S. Treasuries in retaliation for the tariffs the Trump administration has imposed on Chinese imports.

Headlines: New Jersey jury finds J&J not liable in talc cancer trial; company settles three other cases
Description: A New Jersey jury on Wednesday cleared Johnson & Johnson of liability in a lawsuit brought by a man who said that asbestos in the company's talcum powder products caused his mesothelioma.

Headlines: Ahold ups stakes in U.S. grocery war with mini-'robot supermarkets'
Description: Grocery group Ahold Delhaize will roll out small, automated warehouses to speed order picking and cut delivery times, Reuters has learned, as it revamps its ecommerce business in response to rising competition in a fast-growing sector.

Headlines: Factbox: Tariff wars - duties imposed by Trump and U.S. trading partners
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump has rattled the world trade order by imposing unilateral tariffs to combat what he calls unfair trade practices by China, the European Union and other major trading partners of the United States.

Headlines: On eve of trial on Time Warner deal, AT&T, U.S. government lay out cases
Description: In a preview of arguments in a trial over AT&T's  deal to buy Time Warner Inc , government lawyers said on Tuesday the deal will raise prices for consumers while AT&T's lawyer argued the company has no reason to withhold programming from competitors as feared.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs unveils internal campaign on use of gender identity pronouns
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc  said on Friday it has launched an internal campaign to promote awareness about pronouns and how employees self-identify.

Headlines: Apple woos investors with China gain, market value nears $1 trillion
Description: Apple Inc shares  rose 4.4% on Wednesday, after the company calmed Wall Street nerves with an improvement in sales in China and as several brokerages predicted a boost from its services business and the launch of new iPhones in the second half of 2019.

Headlines: Elon Musk's tweets bring controversy, nearly 30 million followers
Description: Trial began in U.S. District Court in Los Angeles on Tuesday in a defamation lawsuit brought against Elon Musk by British cave diver Vernon Unsworth over three July 15, 2018 tweets by the Tesla chief executive, one calling him "pedo guy."

Headlines: LSE offers no concessions to avert deeper EU probe of Refinitiv deal: sources
Description: The London Stock Exchange  will not offer concessions to EU antitrust regulators reviewing its $27 billion bid for data and analytics company Refinitiv, two people familiar with the matter said, a move which will likely trigger a four-month probe.

Headlines: Delays at U.S.-Mexico border crossing hits autos, trucks still lining up
Description: Long delays at the U.S.-Mexico border crossing for goods destined for American plants and consumers are hitting the U.S. auto industry, and the gridlock reduced by half the number of northbound trucks that crossed the entry point last week.

Headlines: ECB Draghi: Euro area economy in period of 'protracted weakness'
Description: European Central Bank President Mario Draghi said on Thursday that the euro zone economy was in a period of "protracted" economic weakness, with inflation staying low and the balance of risks tilted toward the downside.

Headlines: Factbox: U.S. executives warn consumers will pay for Trump's tariffs
Description: Some executives from U.S. companies that sell clothing, food and other products warn that costs related to the latest round of tariffs on goods from China will be passed along to consumers in the form of higher prices.

Headlines: Exxon Mobil calls for tighter methane regulations
Description: Exxon Mobil on Tuesday called for tighter regulation of the greenhouse gas methane and offered up its own in-house rules as a model for companies and lawmakers worldwide.

Headlines: Symantec names three Starboard nominees to board
Description: Symantec Corp  said on Monday it named three nominees of Starboard Value LP to the Norton anti-virus software maker's board, barely a month after the activist investor took a stake in the company to push for a change.

Headlines: Tim Hortons China says Tencent has invested, did not disclose amount
Description: Tim Hortons China said Tuesday it received an investment from Chinese tech giant Tencent, as the Canadian coffee brewer seeks to expand in the Chinese market.

Headlines: Kroger set to place warehouse order with partner Ocado
Description: U.S. supermarket chain Kroger Co is expected to order the first three of 20 high-tech warehouses from online grocer Ocado by the end of the year under the terms of a breakthrough deal agreed in May.

Headlines: Oil prices slump as OPEC and Russia consider output boost
Description: Oil prices fell more than $2 per barrel on Friday as Saudi Arabia and Russia discussed easing production cuts that have helped push crude prices to their highest since 2014.

Headlines: White House official warns of negative shocks before rebound later in 2020
Description: Top Trump adminstration officials on Tuesday predicted a strong economic rebound in the fourth quarter as the coronavirus fades, but a senior White House adviser warned that near-term unemployment and GDP data will be a "very grave" negative shock.

Headlines: Southwest cancels about 40 flights for engine inspections
Description: Southwest Airlines Co  said it canceled about 40 flights on Sunday, or 1 percent of those scheduled, as it inspects engines after last weeks deadly accident in Pennsylvania.

Headlines: Factbox: Airbus and Boeing aircraft deals at Paris Airshow
Description: Following is a summary of commercial aircraft deals announced by Airbus and Boeing at the Paris Airshow.

Headlines: French fashion group Kering pledges to hire only over-18 models
Description: Kering, the French fashion group whose brands include Gucci and Saint Laurent, said it would only work with models aged over 18, as the fashion industry aims to tighten up its ethical guidelines.

Headlines: Exclusive: Indian steel firms seek higher duties on steel imports as prices drop
Description: Indian steel firms are putting pressure on the nation's government to impose higher duties on imports as trade disputes and a global economic slowdown divert surplus Asian steel stocks to India, industry executives and government sources said.

Headlines: Hard Rock International eyes bid for Greek tourist resort casino: paper
Description: Hard Rock International will bid for a casino license in a long-delayed tourist development in Athens and plans to spend more than 1 billion euros ($1.11 billion) on the project, the U.S. firm's chairman said in a newspaper interview.

Headlines: Timeline: GM reaches tentative labor deal with UAW union to end strike
Description: General Motors Co and the United Auto Workers union have reached a tentative agreement for a new labor deal to end a month-long nationwide strike by about 48,000 hourly workers, the union said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Airbus 2018 delivery goal questioned by analysts ahead of results
Description: Airbus  will have to equal a record final quarter for deliveries if the European planemaker is going to meet its overall 2018 targets following a series of production setbacks.

Headlines: Air France strike hits flights as French brace for rail stoppages
Description: Air France grounded just under a third of flights on Saturday as staff staged a walkout over pay, and travelers also braced for a fresh wave of train strikes starting later in the day, crippling much of France's transport network.

Headlines: U.S. gasoline demand recovery falters as refiners ramp up output
Description: A recovery in demand for gasoline in the United States, the world's largest market for the motor fuel, hit a plateau last week as coronavirus cases surged in some states, undercutting refiners' efforts to ramp up low fuel production.

Headlines: S&P 500 posts biggest drop since May after Fed cut, Powell comments
Description: The Dow and S&P 500 suffered their biggest daily percentage drops since May 31 on Wednesday after the Federal Reserve cut interest rates for the first time in a decade, but remarks by Fed Chair Jerome Powell dampened expectations for further cuts going forward.

Headlines: Underlying U.S. producer inflation boosted by services
Description: Underlying U.S. producer prices increased solidly for a second straight month in May, boosted by a surge in the cost of hotel accommodation and gains in portfolio management service fees.

Headlines: UK cyber security centre continuing work on Huawei, says PM's spokesman
Description: Britain's National Cyber Security Centre is continuing its work looking into Huawei, a spokesman for Prime Minister Boris Johnson said on Friday, responding to reports that culture minister Oliver Dowden would make a statement on Tuesday.

Headlines: Huawei first-quarter revenue growth slows sharply amid U.S. ban, virus headwinds
Description: Huawei Technologies' revenue growth slowed sharply in the first quarter but the world's top telecoms equipment supplier labeled the performance as "resilient" in light of pressure from the United States and the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Exclusive: India's Reliance seeks to sell Mideast crude cargoes in rare move
Description: India's Reliance Industries Ltd  is seeking to sell some April-loading crude cargoes in a rare move as it plans to cut crude processing after the coronavirus pandemic hit global fuel demand, four sources said on Friday.

Headlines: Facebook executive meets with U.S. lawmakers to discuss privacy
Description: With a multibillion-dollar settlement looming for Facebook over user privacy violations, Chief Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg met with U.S. lawmakers on Capitol Hill on Tuesday to discuss legislation to protect users of the social network, officials said.

Headlines: American Airlines suspending flights to Milan after U.S. travel warning
